abouts: ['Gutseriev is an owner of Hotel National, the hotel in Moscow where Trump stayed during his first visit to Russia in 1987.', 'Gutseriev writes lyrics for songs performed by famous Russian singers.  ']

name: Billionaires
title: Vice Chairman and Director
bios: ['Rupert Johnson Jr. is the vice chairman of Franklin Resources, a global investment management firm also called Franklin Templeton Investments.', 'He is the second largest shareholder in the firm with 19.2%, after his half brother Charles who chaired the company until 2013.', 'Their father, Rupert Sr., founded Franklin Distributors in 1947; the business grew and went public in 1983.', 'Rupert Jr. joined in 1965 and has been vice chairman since 1999. His nephew Gregory Johnson now serves as chairman and CEO.']
abouts: ['His father Rupert named the company after Benjamin Franklin who he believed epitomized the ideas of frugality and prudence in regard to saving and investing. ', 'Rupert pledged $100 million to his alma mater, Washington and Lee University, in 2007, $85 million of which has been designated for scholarships. ']

name: Billionaires
title: Cofounder and CEO
bios: ['Kalanick, who founded ride-hailing firm Uber in 2009, stepped down as CEO in June 2017 after a series of scandals rocked the company. ', 'In March 2018, Kalanick announced a new venture fund, 10100, which combines his nonprofit and for-profit investments. ', 'Kalanick is now CEO of City Storage Systems, a holding company focused on redeveloping distressed real estate.', 'Kalanick cofounded two tech startups before Uber: online file-exchange service Scour and file-sharing company RedSwoosh. ', 'Kalanick still owns an estimated 7% stake in privately-held Uber, which makes up the majority of his fortune.']
abouts: ['Kalanick dropped out of UCLA in 1998 to work on Scour full-time with some classmates. ', 'Scour was later sued by the Motion Picture Association of America and the Recording Industry Association of America before filing for bankruptcy in 2000.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Andrei Kozitsyn is CEO of  Ural Mining Metallurgical Company, one of the top Russian producers of such commodities as copper, zinc, coal and gold.', "Kozitsyn grew up in the Urals where he studied metallurgy and later went to work as a mechanic at Uralelectromed, now UMMC's main factory.", "Kozitsyn cofounded UMMC with Iskander Makhmudov, who is the group's president and his longtime partner. "]
abouts: ['A few months after he became president of a hockey club, Kozitsyn announced plans to build an ice arena with 15,000 seats in Ekaterinburg.', 'Kozitsyn founded Military Equipment Museum, which has 28 tanks and armored vehicles and 17 planes of WWII era.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['German-Chilean mogul Horst Paulmann is the founder of Cencosud, one of the largest retail conglomerates in Latin America.', 'The publicly-traded company has 140,000 employees and operations in Argentina, Brazil, Chile, Peru and Colombia; Paulmann owns a 53% stake.', 'As a teenager, Paulmann moved from his native Germany to Chile after World War II and opened his first supermarket in 1976.', "Cencosud has nearly 1,000 supermarkets and dozens of shopping centers, including Costanera Center in Chile, South America's largest mall. ", 'In January 2016 Chilean regulators accused Cencosud of price-fixing fresh chicken between 2008 and 2011. The company denied the allegations.  ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Julio Ponce Lerou owns a 29% stake in Sociedad de Quimica y Minera de Chile (SQM), a publicly-traded chemicals and mining company.', "He is a former son-in-law of the late Chilean dictator Augusto Pinochet, and SQM was privatized by Pinochet's government in the 1980s. ", "SQM is one of the world's largest miners of lithium, which is used in batteries for electric cars.", 'For almost 40 years Ponce headed SQM, which also mines and sells potassium nitrate and iodine -- chemicals used in fertilizers. ', 'He resigned as chairman of SQM in April 2015, citing personal reasons.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Rees-Jones started as a bankruptcy attorney, but wanted to make deals, not clean up after them. ', 'In 1984 he started Chief Oil & Gas and became a pioneer of the shale fracking boom. ', 'A lucky guy, he grossed $7 billion on 7 deals in 7 years. ', "Chief is the nation's biggest privately owned natural gas producer. "]
abouts: ['Dallas friends include President George Bush, Rex Tillerson, billionaire Kelcy Warren. ', 'The Rees-Jones Foundation has about $520 million in assets and has paid out more than $450 million in grants. ']

name: Billionaires
title: Entrepreneur
bios: ["Mark Scheinberg cofounded PokerStars with his father, Isai, and built it into the world's biggest online poker company before cashing out in 2014.", 'He helped launch PokerStars in 2001, at age 28, and benefited tremendously from the poker boom that soon swept the U.S. and the rest of world.', "In 2014 he sold PokerStars' parent company, Rational Group (which also owned Full Tilt Poker) to The Stars Group, then called Amaya, for $4.9 billion.", 'Scheinberg, who owned 75% of Rational Group at the time, pocketed more than $3 billion from the sale.', 'Scheinberg is investing some of the proceeds in Madrid, where he is helping restore seven historic buildings for commercial and residential use.']
abouts: ['Born in Israel, Scheinberg moved to a Toronto suburb as a teen and worked in hospitality and traveled to Asia and South America after one year of college.', "Scheinberg's Centro Canalejas complex in Madrid will be home to Spain's first ever Four Seasons hotel. His Thompson Toronto hotel in Canada is being renovated."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Jeff Skoll built his fortune as eBay's first full-time hire and president in 1995; he left eBay in 2001, three years after its IPO.", 'Skoll divides his time between his Skoll Foundation, which funds social entrepreneurs, and film production firm Participant Media.', 'The Skoll Foundation and Skoll Global Threats Fund have distributed about $600 million worldwide, aiming to reduce poverty, among other goals.', 'In March 2016 his Participant Media won its first best picture Academy Award for the film "Spotlight."', 'Skoll founded millennial-focused cable TV channel Pivot TV in 2013 but shut it down in late 2016.']
abouts: ['Skoll was born and raised in Canada and pumped gas to pay his way through the University of Toronto. He became a U.S. citizen in 2007.', 'He met eBay founder Pierre Omidyar while he was an MBA student at Stanford University.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Turkey's richest person, Murat Ulker runs Yildiz Holding. Its companies generates over $12 billion in annual revenue and produce more than 320 brands.", 'Products include biscuits, chocolate, cake, gum and candy, cooking oil and margarine, dairy, frozen food, bread, meat and non-alcoholic beverages.', "To establish a more global structure, he merged Godiva, United Biscuit, Ulker Biscuit and Demet's Candy under the roof of London-based Pladis Foods.", ' Eventually, Ulker is expected to take Pladis public on the London or New York exchange.', "Ulker's biggest deal to date: the $3.2 billion acquisition of United Biscuits of the U.K. in 2014."]
abouts: ["Many of the paintings in his extensive collection are exhibited at the company's Istanbul headquarters. ", "Acquired with United Biscuits, McVitie's is the brand most preferred by the British Royal Family for birthday and wedding cakes."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Daniel Ziff and his brothers Robert and Dirk inherited a fortune launched in 1927 when their grandfather cofounded publishing company Ziff Davis.', "Daniel's late father, William Jr., built up Ziff Davis, published PC Magazine and Car and Driver, and sold the company for $1.4 billion in 1994.", 'The brothers created the Ziff Brothers Investments and greatly expanded their inheritance with hedge funds in the U.S. and in London.', 'Ziff Brothers Investments ceased operations in 2014; the brothers are reportedly investing with employees formerly at their hedge funds.']
abouts: ["William Ziff Jr.'s wife, Ann Ziff, is the chairman of the Metropolitan Opera and donated $30 million to the organization in 2010."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Dirk Ziff and his brothers Robert and Daniel inherited a fortune launched in 1927 when their grandfather cofounded publishing company Ziff Davis.', "The brothers' late father built up Ziff Davis, publisher of PC Magazine and Car and Driver, and sold the company for $1.4 billion in 1994.", 'Through their Ziff Brothers Investments, which had hedge funds in the U.S. and in London, the brothers greatly expanded their inheritance.', 'In 2015, Dirk Ziff formed his own family office, Ziff Capital Partners.', 'The brothers are also reportedly investing with employees formerly at their hedge funds.']
abouts: ["William Ziff Jr.'s 62,200 square-foot estate in Manalapan, Florida, known as Gemini, has 33 bedrooms and 52 bathrooms, and is listed for sale at $138 million.", 'Dirk is married to a former Forbes Magazine reporter.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Like his brothers Dirk and Daniel, Robert Ziff, the middle billionaire child, owes his fortune to his grandfather's publishing company, Ziff Davis.", "The brothers' late father, William Jr., built up Ziff Davis, published PC Magazine and Car and Driver, and sold the company for $1.4 billion in 1994.", 'The brothers created the Ziff Brothers Investments and increased those proceeds by tenfold with hedge funds in the U.S. and in London until 2014.', 'Though their offices ceased operations, they are also reportedly investing with investors who were formerly at their hedge funds.']
abouts: ['Robert graduated magna cum laude from Harvard University in electrical and computer engineering, then finished Cornell Law School as the first in his class.', 'His older brother Dirk is married to a former Forbes Magazine reporter.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Juergen Blickle and his brother Rainer preside over SEW-Eurodrive, a manufacturer specializing in drive-automation and power-transmission solutions.', 'The company, acquired by their father, Ernst, in 1945, now employs more than 16,000 people and generates around $3 billion in annual revenue. \r\n', 'Its motor, gear and electronic components power conveyors, lifts and other applications in contexts ranging from auto assembly to commercial baking.', 'In the U.S., it operates a manufacturing plant in Lyman, S.C., and has five regional assembly centers and 60 technical sales offices.']
abouts: ["Juergen owns 50% of the company and Rainer, 44.9%. Just over 5% is held by Rainer's charitable foundation.", 'The brothers shun all publicity; not much is known about them.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Bernard Broermann is the founder of Asklepios Kliniken GmbH, one of the three largest operators of private hospitals in Germany. ', 'His first hospital opened in 1984, and the group now employs more than 45,000 people and has 150 hospitals worldwide.', 'Asklepios holds a 17.57% stake in rival Rhoen Klinikum AG and a majority stake in mediClin AG, a German operator of hospitals and clinics.', 'Broermann also owns three five-star luxury hotels in Germany.']
abouts: ['Broermann has an M.B.A. from Harvard University.', 'Before founding Asklepios he practiced as an accountant and lawyer.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Clive Calder became a billionaire in 2002, when he sold his music company Zomba Group to German mass media corporation Bertlesmann for $2.7 billion.', 'The crown jewel of his empire was Jive Records, the record label behind many of the first commercially successful hip hop artists.', 'The South Africa native founded Zomba in London in 1975, then opened an office in New York City in 1978.', 'Known for shunning the spotlight, Calder now lives in the Cayman Islands with his wife.', 'He frequently travels to parts of Africa for charity, and his ELMA Philanthropies works on improving childhood education and health on the continent. ']
abouts: ["Calder, born in Johannesburg, started out playing in a band at age 18 to support his mother and sister after his father's death. ", "He signed acts like Billy Ocean, Will Smith, R. Kelly, N' Sync (and later, Justin Timberlake), Backstreet Boys and Britney Spears. "]

name: Billionaires
title: Founder
bios: ['Stanley Druckenmiller made it big as a hedge fund manager for 30 years. He now manages his money through a family office.', 'Until 2000, he worked for George Soros. The duo famously bet against the British pound in 1992 and made massive profits.', 'He shut down his $12 billion hedge fund Duquesne Capital Management in August 2010, returning funds to clients.', "In the first half of 2017, he invested in Chinese billionaire Jack Ma's e-commerce titan, Alibaba, as well as Salesforce.com, Microsoft, and Facebook."]
abouts: ['At Bowdoin College, Druckenmiller reportedly ran a hot dog stand for extra cash and graduated magna cum laude.', ' A major donor to his alma mater, he has given more than $40 million to higher education institutions like Bowdoin, Brown and Stanford since 2014. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['In 1952, a 26-year-old Ted Lerner borrowed $250 from his wife to start a real estate company, selling homes for developers.', 'He sold some 22,000, then decided to become a builder. Now he owns 20 million square feet of commercial and retail space, plus hotels and apartments.', 'The Lerners are on the short list of developers vying to build a new headquarters for the FBI, which is currently on hold until Congress gets funding.', 'He also owns the Washington Nationals baseball team.', "The family donates to charities including Children's National Hospital in DC, George Washington University and Hebrew University in Jerusalem."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Li Shuirong chairs Zhejiang Rongsheng Holding Group, a producer of petrochemicals through its listed Rongsheng Petrochemical.', 'Li started his first business in 1989,  producing polyester fiber cloth.', 'Rongsheng today also produces coal chemicals and polyester products.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["As Genting chairman, Lim Kok Thay has fast expanded the group's global footprints in the gaming sector.", "Plans to open Resorts World Las Vegas in 2020 and launch the world's first 20th Century Fox movie-inspired theme park at Resorts World Genting in 2018.", "In February 2018, Lim's Empire Resorts Inc. opened $1.2 billion Resorts World Catskills, a casino, hotel and entertainment complex.", 'The NY complex will be the largest integrated commercial casino resort in the state, fitted with more than 150 table games and 2,150 slot machines.', "On the home front, a family feud over the empire's wealth and businesses, which include a palm-oil unit, has been making local headlines."]
abouts: ['His late father Lim Goh Tong arrived in Malaysia from Fujian, China, almost 50 years ago at age 19, with barely anything to his name.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Niels Peter Louis-Hansen is the deputy chairman of Coloplast, a large Danish health care company.', 'The company provides medical devices and services in the fields of colostomy, continence and urology; products include colostomy bags and catheters.', 'Hansen owns one-fifth of the public company and is its largest shareholder.', 'His late father, Aage Louis-Hansen, founded the business in 1957 and took it public in 1983.', 'He also holds a stake in fellow medical care device company Ambu, based right outside of Copenhagen.']
abouts: ["Coloplast was number 29 on FORBES' list of the world's most innovative companies in 2017.", 'Louis-Hansen also manages a foundation, named after his late parents, that funds cultural and scientific initiatives, and which owns 11% of Coloplast.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Fredrik Lundberg is CEO of L.E. Lundbergforetagen AB, founded by his father Lars in 1944 as a construction outfit.', 'Fredrik took over management of the firm in 1981.', "Today it's a diversified holding company with interests in property management and other investments.", 'Daughters Louise and Katarina, also billionaires, both sit on the board and each own a 14% stake in the group.', 'Through his holdings, Lundberg has a lot of say in several renowned Swedish firms, including Volvo, Ericsson and steelmaker SSAB.']
abouts: ['Lundberg moved his family to Switzerland in 1985 to avoid punitive taxes but later returned to Sweden.', 'Lundberg was once a junior curling world champion.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Gwendolyn Sontheim Meyer inherited an estimated 7% stake in food giant Cargill, the largest private company in America. ', 'The heiress spends most of her time on a farm in Rancho Santa Fe, Calif., training horses that compete in show jumping. ', 'Her great-grandfather, W.W. Cargill, the son of a Scottish sea captain, founded Cargill in Conover, Iowa in 1865. ', 'The family still owns roughly 90% of Cargill, which did $115 billion in 2018 sales across food, agriculture, financial and industrial divisions.']

name: Billionaires
title: Co-Chairman
bios: ['Chris Reyes and his brother Jude co-chair Reyes Holdings, a $30 billion (sales) food and beverage distribution company. ', 'The company started by their father with a small Schlitz beer distributor in South Carolina purchased for $740,000 in 1974. ', 'Divisions include food distributors Reinhardt Food and Martin Brower, beer distributor Reyes Beverage Group and bottler Great Lakes Coca-Cola.', 'In May 2017, Reyes announced that its soda distribution business would be expanding into California and Nevada. ', 'Reyes Beverage Group distributes 151 million cases of beer each year.']
abouts: ["Clients include Heineken, Lagunitas, McDonald's and Chick-fil-A.", "Chris Reyes serves on the board of directors of Chicago's Museum of Science and Industry and the Lurie Children's Hospital."]

name: Billionaires
title: Co-Chairman
bios: ['Together Jude Reyes and his brother Chris run Reyes Holdings, a $30 billion (sales) food and beverage distribution company. ', 'Their father started the company with a small Schlitz beer distributor in South Carolina purchased for $740,000 in 1974.', ' Divisions include food distributors Reinhardt Food and Martin Brower, beer distributor Reyes Beverage Group and bottler Great Lakes Coca-Cola. ', 'In May 2017, Reyes Holdings announced that its soda distribution business would be expanding into California and Nevada. ']
abouts: ['Reyes Beverage Group distributes 151 million cases of beer each year.', "Martin Brower delivers food to 16,000 McDonald's locations.\r\n"]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Alexandra Schoerghuber oversees private family investment company Schoerghuber Unternehmensgruppe as chairwoman of the group's supervisory board.", 'It has stakes in a brewery (co-owned with Heineken) and Arabella Hospitality, a hotel joint venture with Starwood of the U.S.', "The group also owns one of Germany's largest real estate companies, Bayerische Bau und Immobilien GmbH, which builds, owns and manages properties.", ' Its Productos del Mar Ventisqueros S.A., based in Puerto Montt, Chile, specializes in the cultivation and processing of salmon.', 'Alexandra is the widow of Stefan Schorghuber. He inherited a fortune built by his father, Joseph, and died unexpectedly in 2008, at age 47.']
abouts: ['The family is known for its support of modern art.', 'They also support underprivileged children and their families through the Schoerghuber Foundation. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Sheldon Solow risked everything in 1972 to build 9 West 57 Street in New York City, the tower that's known for its unobstructed views of Central Park.", 'Its current tenants include KKR, Apollo Global Management, Tiger Global Management and Chanel. \r\n', "Solow expects to complete construction by late 2018 of a high-end 42-story residential building overlooking Manhattan's East River.", 'Solow owns a handful of office buildings on 57th Street as well as residential properties around Sutton Place near the East River.', 'His son Stefan Soloviev (who uses an older spelling of the family name) now runs Solow Building Co. alongside his dad and is in line to take over.']
abouts: ['Solow has an art collection that includes pieces by Botticelli, Balthus, Matisse, and Kline.', 'Solow is the son of a bricklayer who immigrated from Russia and a homemaker from Brooklyn.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Lucio Tan is the founder and chairman of the $1.1 billion sales LT Group, which has interests in tobacco, spirits, banking and property development. ', 'Tan started as a chemical engineer at Far East University, where he mopped floors to put himself through college.', 'In 1982, Tan established Asia Brewery. Now a subsidiary of LT Group, the brewery was the only one then to compete with the market leader San Miguel.', 'In April 2017 President Duterte accused Tan of owing the Philippine government nearly $600 million in taxes. ']
abouts: ['Lucio Tan enjoys flying helicopters.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Majid Al Futtaim founded retailing and entertainment giant Majid Al Futtaim Holding, known as MAF, in 1992.', 'MAF owns and operates 12 hotels and 21 malls, including Mall of the Emirates in Dubai and the Mall of Egypt in Cairo.', 'It also has the exclusive license to operate hypermarkets for French company Carrefour across the Middle East, North Africa and Central Asia. ', 'His son Tariq sits on the board while non-family members manage the conglomerate, which publishes its revenues and profits annually.', 'The group had $8 billion in revenues and $760 million in profits in 2016.']
abouts: ['Mall of the Emirates boasts an indoor ski slope.', 'MAF owns the rights to the LEGO store and American Girl in the Middle East.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Nicknamed the Czech Donald Trump, Andre Babis was elected prime minister of the Czech Republic in December.', 'He was required to put his agribusiness firm, Agrofert, into trusts in early 2017 to comply with a Czech conflict-of-interest law. ', 'He swapped daily management of Agrofert for politics in 2013 and is the leader of the political party ANO (which means "Yes"). ', 'Babis got his start as a fertilizer trader. He also worked in Morocco, where he gained experience with foreign trade. ']
abouts: ['Babis owns a Michelin-starred restaurant, La Paloma, in the French Riviera.', 'His wife Monika oversees the Agrofert Foundation, one of biggest in the Czech Republic.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["The bulk of Dona Bertarelli's wealth comes from the 2007 sale of her family's biotech business Serono for over $13 billion. ", "In the 1990s Dona was Serono's executive director of public and professional affairs.", 'Her brother Ernesto is the richest man in Switzerland. They split ownership of most family assets. ', 'Dona is launching a luxury hospitality group, including a new eco-tourism destination in the Bahamas.']
abouts: ['Bertarelli became the fastest woman to sail around the world when her team raced for the Jules Verne Trophy in 2016.', 'She owns the Park Gstaad hotel, Five Seas Hotel in Cannes and Country Club Geneva.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Cai Kui cofounded real estate developer Longfor Properties with his ex-wife, Wu Yajun, one of China's richest women.", 'They divorced in 2012, and Cai no longer has an executive role at the company.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Georgia's richest man Bidzina Ivanishvili made his money in metals and banking in Russia then cashed out and moved back home in 2003. ", 'Ivanishvili was elected prime minister of Georgia in October 2012. ', "Thirteen months later he stepped down after his party won the presidential elections, saying he'd fulfilled his task. ", "He entrusted about $1 billion to Credit Suisse but more than $100 million of that sum was apparently stolen by the bank's manager Patrice  Lescaudron.", 'Lescaudron was found guilty in February 2018 and sentenced to five years in prison.  ']
abouts: ['Ivanishvili lives in a 108,000-square-foot compound in the mountains overlooking Tbilisi. He has a vast collection, including Dora Maar with Cat by Picasso.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Jeremy Jacobs is chairman of concessions juggernaut Delaware North, a private company that serves 500 million people per year across four continents. ', 'The business was founded in 1915 by his father, who began by selling popcorn and peanuts. The company now has annual revenue of about $3 billion.', 'Delaware North lost a major contract with Yosemite National Park in 2016, which has resulted in protracted litigation with rival Aramark.', "Jacobs is also the owner of the NHL's Boston Bruins and was inducted into the Hockey Hall of Fame in 2017."]
abouts: ['Jacobs owns a Florida restaurant with legendary golfer Jack Nicklaus, with whom he shares a birthday.', 'He pledged $30 million in 2015 to the University at Buffalo, his alma mater, which renamed its medical school after him. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['In 2012, Larsen cofounded Ripple with Mt. Gox founder Jed McCaleb to facilitate international payments for banks using blockchain technology.', 'Prior to that he cofounded online mortgage lender e-Loan in 1997 and in 2005 cofounded Prosper, a peer-to-peer lender.', 'Ripple counts Mitsubishi Financial, Bank of America and Santander among its 100-plus customers.', 'Larsen stepped down as Ripple CEO in December 2016; he stayed on as executive chairman.']
abouts: ['Ripple owns 61% of the total supply of its cryptocurrency, XRP.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Paper magnate Patrick Lee moved to Hong Kong as an orphan and started a packaging operation in 1994 to meet in-house demand for corrugated boxes. ', 'Today, Lee & Man Paper is an industrial-packaging behemoth in China.', 'Sons Raymond and Edmond run operations. Dad now spends his time mentoring students.']
abouts: ['In 2011 the industrialist was awarded the honorary degree of Doctor of Business Administration honoris causa by Lingnan University, Hong Kong. ', 'The recognition was given due to the support Lee and his family have given to promote liberal arts education.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Liang Wengen chairs Shanghai-listed construction equipment Sany Heavy Industry.', "Liang's UK-educated son Liang Zaizhong is a member of the board of directors at Sany Heavy Industry. ", "Sany's holding company was founded in Hunan Province in 1989 as a small welding materials factory."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Denis O'Brien runs and owns 94% of Digicel, a mobile phone network provider that operates in the Caribbean, Asia Pacific and Central America.", "Following the 2010 earthquake in Haiti he funded the restoration of Port-au-Prince's Iron Market and his Digicel Foundation built 150 schools. ", "O'Brien got his big break selling his Irish mobile outfit, Esat Telecom Group, to British Telecom Group in 2000 for $2.8 billion. ", 'He has investments in media, healthcare and the PGA Catalunya and Quinta do Lago resorts on the Iberian peninsula.']
abouts: ["O'Brien once sold horse pills. ", "O'Brien, whose mother was a political activist, cofounded the Front Line Defenders to protect and provide emergency support for human rights activists in danger. "]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Father and son Kapil & Rahul Bhatia get the bulk of their wealth from  InterGlobe Aviation, which owns budget carrier IndiGo, India's biggest airline.", 'IndiGo, which was cofounded with billionaire airline veteran Rakesh Gangwal in 2006, has  close to a 42% domestic market share. ', 'Today it has a fleet of 189 aircraft and flies to 57 destinations, including 9 overseas. ', "Rahul took charge as IndiGo's interim boss after the airline's long-time CEO resigned in April 2018.", 'The Bhatias sold some shares in InterGlobe Aviation in Dec 2017 to meet the minimum public float requirement of 25%.']
abouts: ["An electrical engineer, Rahul Bhatia's first business venture was in telecom but that never took off due to regulatory hurdles."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Jean-Pierre Cayard's father founded spirits group La Martiniquaise in 1934 and quickly established links with major retailers to expand the company.", "Jean-Pierre, now President, joined in 1970 and has turned it into one of France's largest spirits groups, with a portfolio of international brands.", 'Its "millionaire" brands include Porto Cruz, a leading Port; Label 5, a best-selling scotch whiskey brand; and Poliakov, France\'s top-selling vodka. ', 'The private company, which he owns, has 24 production sites and 27 subsidiaries throughout the world.', 'His wife, Edith, is the CEO of La Martiniquaise.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Chey Tae-won chairs the SK Group, South Korea's third largest conglomerate with interests in telecom, IT services, chemicals and energy, among others.", "The group's SK Telecom is South Korea's No. 1 mobile carrier; its SK Hynix is the country's second largest chip maker. ", 'In 2013 he was convicted and jailed on embezzlement charges but was pardoned by then-president Park Geun-hye and returned to his post in 2016.', 'Chey is a nephew of SK Group founder Chey Jong-gun, who started the conglomerate with a textile company called Sunkyong. ']
abouts: ['While in jail he authored a book on social enterprises. ', 'Chey filed for divorce from his wife, a daughter of a former South Korean president in July 2017. The matter has been taken to trial. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Beijing businessman Fang Wei has built a fortune by taking over struggling companies.', 'Fang-backed businesses include Fangda Carbon New Material and Fangda Special Steel.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Andrei Guriev is deputy chairman of PhosAgro, one of the world's largest producers of phosphate-based fertilizers.", 'A former communist committee leader in Moscow, Guriev became deputy director at financial holding company, Menatep Group, in 1990. ', "When his former boss, Mikhail Khodorkovsky, once Russia's richest person, went to jail, Guriev led a buyout to control Menatep subsidiary PhosAgro."]
abouts: ['Guriev owns Witanhurst estate, which is the second largest in London after Buckingham Palace.', "Guriev's son, also Andrei, is CEO of PhosAgro."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Hult dropped out of college to start a business in his dormitory's basement, organizing summer trips to help students learn English in the UK.", 'Today his company, EF Education First, run by his three oldest sons, offers educational travel, language training and degree programs in 53 countries.', 'It is the official supplier of language training for the Olympic games; for the 2016 games, EF says it helped teach English to 1 million Brazilians.', 'Himself severely dyslexic, Hult donates money to schools that focuses on innovative approaches to educating children with the learning disability.', 'He funds the Hult Prize, a partnership with former President Bill Clinton that awards $1 million in funding to the winners of a student competition.']
abouts: ['For his 70th birthday, Hult flew guests in chartered jets to Shanghai for a multi-day party, which included a performance by Janet Jackson.', 'Hult is friendly with the Swedish royal family and together with the Queen he founded the Mentor Foundation, which works to prevent substance abuse.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Ji Changqun chairs Fullshare Holdings, a real estate developer headquartered in the eastern China city of Nanjing.', "Ji received a master's degree majoring in business administration from Macau University of Science and Technology in June 2006."]

name: Billionaires
title: Founder
bios: ['Hedge fund manager Paul Tudor Jones II is known for his macro trades, particularly his bets on interest rates and currencies.', 'In 1980, he founded Tudor Investment Corporation, which had a long record of double-digit annualized returns.', 'In recent years, however, returns have not been as strong and the firm has suffered redemptions from clients and layoffs.', 'The firm has since lowered some of its fees, and refocused by incorporating some quantitative trading methods.', 'Tudor Investment still reportedly manages $7 billion in assets, and has offices in Connecticut, New York, Palm Beach, London, Singapore and Sydney. ']
abouts: ['Jones, who was a boxing champion in college, took up the sport after he failed to score a single point in sixth grade basketball. ', 'He is the founder of the Robin Hood Foundation, which is focused on fighting poverty in New York.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Born in the U.S., he has been a Hong Kong resident since 1960.', 'He cofounded Duty Free Shoppers (DFS) in Hong Kong with fellow American Charles Feeney and has co-owned it with LVMH since 1997.', 'Has three well-known daughters; Marie-Chantal, crown princess of Greece; Alexandra von Fürstenberg; and Pia Getty. ', 'He has donated millions to support the Hong Kong arts scene through the Asia Society, where he is a trustee emeritus.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Sergei Popov has cashed out of all his investments in recent years. ', 'He and former partner Andrei Melnichenko made a fortune managing finance and industrial group MDM. ', "They later created TMK, one of the world's largest oil and gas pipe manufacturers, with former billionaire Dmitry Pumpyansky.", "They sold out to Pumpyansky in 2006. That same year the partners started to divide up their assets, a process that wasn't complete until 2012.  ", 'In 2015 he sold MDM-bank to Binbank. Two years later it went bankrupt and came under the control of the Central Bank of the Russian Federation. \r\n  \r\n']
abouts: ['Popov is a founder of a private fund Agat, which develops a mentoring program, offering young businessmen a startup capital.', 'Popov hired a special PR-agency to help him stay out of the press. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['The richest grocer in Spain, Juan Roig is president and majority owner of supermarket giant Mercadona.', "Roig, his brother Fernando and wife Hortensia Herrero, also billionaires, bought the chain in 1981 from the Roigs' father when it had just 8 stores.\r\n", 'By 2006, Mercadona had opened its 1,000th store; it now has more than 1,600 locations. ', "Mercadona's 79,000 employees receive a 25% share of the company's pretax profits."]
abouts: ['Roig created an "innovation cluster" in Valencia, Spain, where he invests in young entrepreneurs. ', 'He is the largest shareholder of the Valencia Basket Club, a professional basketball team in his hometown.\r\n']

name: Billionaires
title: Co-Founder, Executive Vice President
bios: ['John Sall cofounded statistical software firm SAS with James Goodnight in 1976.', 'The two partners met at NC State, where Sall was studying graduate-level statistics and Goodnight was pursuing his Ph.D.', 'SAS reached $3.24 billion in revenue in 2017 and has more than 83,000 customers, including banks, government agencies and insurance companies.', 'SAS offers employees generous workplace perks, including an on-site health care center, pharmacy and daycare services. ']
abouts: ['Sall and Goodnight co-own a country club, hotel and spa in Cary, North Carolina.', 'Sall and his wife Ginger, along with Goodnight and his wife Ann, cofounded the Cary Academy in 1997, a private school for students in grades six through twelve.']

name: Billionaires
title: Chairman and CEO
employment: {'name': 'Hartz Mountain Industries, Inc.', 'title': 'Chairman and CEO', 'government': False}
bios: ["Leonard Stern joined his father Max's pet supply business in 1959. Seven years later he expanded into real estate, acquiring a New Jersey warehouse.", 'His Hartz Mountain firm owns over 42 million square feet of real estate, mostly in the New Jersey area. ', 'Stern sold the pet business for $350 million in 2000. He has also ventured into publishing, energy, capital management and carpet cleaning. ', "Most of Hartz's portfolio is in warehouses. It recently expanded beyond its New Jersey base to Atlanta, Baltimore and Charlotte, N.C.  ", "Many know his name thanks to his $30 million donation 30 years ago to New York University's business school, renamed in his honor. "]
abouts: ["Leonard's father Max Stern arrived in New York from Germany in 1926 with 5,000 canaries -- a friend's way to repay a loan. ", "In 2015, Stern's son Eddie was named Hartz's president and chief operating officer. He will eventually succeed his father as chairman and CEO."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['A politician turned entrepreneur, Ye Chenghai chairs Shenzhen Salubris Pharmaceuticals which makes cardiovascular, cancer and anti-infective drugs. \r\n', 'Ye was the mayor of Shenzhen in the 1980s.', "Ye's son Kevin is Salubris CEO; his daughter Ye Yujun is a board member. "]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Bamford and his family own JCB, a construction equipment manufacturer with $2.9 billion in revenues.', 'His father launched JCB in a garage in Uttoxeter, England, in 1945.', 'JCB sells products in 150 countries. Customers include the U.S. military.']
abouts: ['The brand is so ingrained in British culture that a JCB is to a backhoe what a Kleenex is to a tissue.', 'Bamford, who joined the House of Lords in 2013, was a vocal Brexit supporter.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Chu Mang Yee is a former government official who now chairs Hong Kong-listed real estate developer Hopson Development.', "Chu's daughter, Chu Kut Yung, is the company's vice chairman."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Juan Carlos Escotet is the founder of Caracas-based banking group Banesco. ', 'Banesco is operational in Panama, the Dominican Republic, Puerto Rico, Colombia and the United States.', 'In 2013, Banco Etcheverria, which Escotet bought for around $90 million in 2012, purchased Spanish bank Abanca for $1.3 billion.', 'Escotet began working as a messenger for Banco Union when he was 17 while studying economics. In 1986, he founded a brokerage.', 'He added banking services in 1991, and in 2001, he merged his bank with Banco Union.']
abouts: ['He has four grown sons, all of whom work with their father at Banesco.', 'Escotet is a runner and plays aquatic sports. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Fluxa Rossello is the executive chairman of Grupo Iberostar, one of Europe's largest hotel companies.", 'In 2017 Iberostar generated more than $2.9 billion in revenues; it has hotels in 30 countries and 27,100 employees.', 'The roots of the Iberostar Group date to the 19th century when the Fluxa family started a footwear business in Majorca, Spain.', 'In 1986 Miguel joined the family company, which was still small, and founded the first Iberostar hotels in Majorca and the Canary Islands. ', "In 2006 he sold the group's tour operator and travel agency divisions to the Carlyle Group for $950 million."]
abouts: ["His grandfather, Antonio Fluxa, set up the family's footwear business in 1877 and within a decade, it had 11 workshops and five leather factories."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Forrest started his first mining company, Anaconda Nickel (now called Minara Resources) in 1994.', 'Nine years later, he founded Fortescue Metals Group, which mines and ships iron ore to China.', "Once Australia's richest man, his net worth peaked at $12.7 billion in June 2008 when Fortescue shares hit an all-time high.", "He now also has farming interests to capitalize on China's growing appetite for meat and dairy products.\r\n"]
abouts: ['Known by his schoolboy nickname "Twiggy," Forrest was a onetime stockbroker and keen amateur boxer.', 'He once tried to make a living as an alpaca farmer and is a descendant of the first premier of the state of West Australia, Lord Forrest of Bunbury.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Paul Gauselmann has been called the "pope of the amusement business" in Germany. ', 'He began his career in 1957 working as an apprentice telecommunications inspector and mounted jukeboxes in his spare time.', 'In 1964 he founded the company that turned into Gauselmann Group. He opened the first Merkur amusement arcade in 1974. ', 'Today, Gauselmann Group has annual revenue of over $2 billion and employs more than 10,000 people. ', 'The company produces both AWP (amusement with prize) and SWP (skill with prize) machines and operates arcades throughout Europe.']
abouts: ['For his 65th birthday in 1999, Gauselmann created the Gauselmann-Foundation operating in youth welfare and work for the elderly.', 'Son Armin is a member of the management team and son Karsten is a member of the board of Gauselmann Group.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["With an 11% stake, Tamara Hughes Gustavson is Public Storage's largest shareholder. Her father, B. Wayne Hughes, cofounded the storage giant in 1972.", 'She joined the firm in 1983 and rose to vice president before leaving in 2003 to raise her children. She returned four years later as a board member.', "She also sits on the board of another of her father's companies, American Homes 4 Rent, a publicly-traded REIT focusing on single-family rental homes.", "She often donates to the HollyRod Foundation, which researches autism, Parkinson's and other diseases. ", 'Both her father and brother, B. Wayne Hughes Jr., are also billionaires.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Middle East retail magnate Micky Jagtiani drove a taxi in London before moving to Bahrain and starting a baby products shop in 1973. \r\n', 'He built it into the Dubai-headquarted Landmark Group, which his wife Renuka runs today as chairman and CEO. ', 'With estimated annual revenue of $6 billion, Landmark has 2,300 stores spread across 22 countries in the Middle East, Africa and India.']
abouts: ['Landmark suspended sales of all Trump-branded products in its stores after the U.S. president made anti-Muslim remarks during his election campaign.\r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Johan Johannson and his family own nearly 75% of NorgesGruppen, the Norwegian grocery store chain he inherited from his father and uncle.', 'His father still oversees the company as chairman of the board; Jahon has no role in running the business.', 'The company has been family run since it was founded in 1866.', 'Norgesgruppen has more than 1,850 grocery stores and 650 convenience stores and nearly 40% market share in Norway.']
abouts: ['In 2012 the company vowed to reduce sugar sales by 10% by promoting more healthy alternatives. Between 2012 and 2017, sales of fruits and vegetables were up 28%.', 'Johan Johannson is one of four competing Norwegian grocery billionaires; the others are Odd Reitan, Stein Erik Hagen and his daughter Caroline Hagen Kjos.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["He is the younger son of Hong Kong's richest billionaire Li Ka-Shing. He chairs Asia-based investment company Pacific Century Group.  ", 'Pacific Century Group is the majority owner of life insurance company FWD, which operates in Hong Kong and most of Southeast Asia. ', 'The group also has interests in businesses spanning financial services, technology and property. ', "Li established a communications and media empire with  PCCW, a Hong Kong-based company which controls the city's largest mobile phone operator HKT.", "In 2017, Hony Capital, Foxxconn and Singapore state investor Temasek Holdings invested $110 million in PCCW Media's internet video-streaming unit."]
abouts: ["Li started Star TV in 1991 with $400 million he received from his father. He then sold the company, which had a viewership of 50 million households, to Rupert Murdoch's News Corp.", "During his studies at Stanford, Li worked as a cashier at McDonald's and as a caddy at a golf course. He dropped out of university to start his own business. "]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['John Morris is founder and CEO of outdoor gear retailer Bass Pro Shops.', "Morris started the company in 1972 by selling fish tackle from the back of his father's liquor store in Springfield, Missouri.", "In 2017, he bought rival Cabela's for $5 billion, nearly doubling the size of Bass Pro Shops.", "His Bass Pro Group also owns the world's largest boat manufacturer by volume, White River Marine Group, which makes fishing and recreational boats.", 'A noted conservationist, Morris spent $300 million to build a 350,000 square-foot museum and aquarium in Missouri that opened in 2017.']
abouts: ['At 22 years old, Morris competed in the first national B.A.S.S. fishing tournament and came in 21st place.', 'His Big Cedar Lodge, a mountain resort in the Ozarks, hosts more than one million guests a year.']

name: Billionaires
title: Entrepreneur
bios: ['Theo Mueller is the sole owner of Theo Mueller Group, a diversified food enterprise grounded in dairy processing and effective product marketing.', 'Founded by his grandfather in Bavaria, the village dairy had only four employees  when Theo Mueller took the reins from his father in 1971.', 'He improved processing techniques and distribution infrastructure to turn it into the first dairy in Germany to offer fresh milk products nationwide.', ' Aside from dairy, Mueller Group comprises packing, logistics, vehicle maintenance, fruit processing, a fish restaurant chain and artisanal bakeries.', 'The Luxembourg-based company has 21 production plants in ten countries, employs 27,000 people and generates annual revenue of around $7 billion.']
abouts: ['In 1995, two armed men dressed up as policemen tried to kidnap Theo Mueller. He lashed around and escaped. In the afternoon, he was back at his office desk.', 'Mueller moved to Switzerland in 2003 to minimize the taxes his children would pay when inheriting the company.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Nitori's discount home furnishings chain, Nitori Holdings, posted its 18th consecutive year of increased profits in February 2017.", 'The company has expanded in urban markets like Tokyo and has about 450 stores across Japan.', "Nitori, the firm's chairman, founded the first store in 1967. He stepped down as president in 2016. ", 'The chain has stores outside Japan in China, Taiwan and the U.S. ', 'To earn money for college tuition and expenses, he worked collecting unpaid bar tabs and hustling pool, among other jobs.\r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Wolfgang Reimann and three of his siblings share ownership in the Luxembourg-based investment firm JAB Holding Company s.à.r.l (JAB).', "The brands associated with the Reimann fortune include Calvin Klein fragrances, Peet's Coffee, Krispy Kreme donuts and Panera Bread.", 'Wolfgang is a grandson of chemist Ludwig Reimann, who, in 1828, joined with Johann Adam Benckiser and his namesake chemical company.', 'JAB still holds 7.9% of multinational hygiene and home products giant Reckitt Benckiser.', 'Although it still has a controlling stake in Bally, JAB has been shifting its holdings away from luxury fashion brands in favor of coffee and food.']
abouts: ['Upon the death of their father in 1984, Wolfgang and eight other heirs each inherited 11.1% of JAB; five of them subsequently divested their stakes.', 'While neither Wolfgang nor the other co-owners of JAB are active in management, all are reportedly, in keeping with the family background, trained chemists.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Matthias Reimann-Andersen and three of his siblings share ownership in the Luxembourg-based investment firm JAB Holding Company s.à.r.l (JAB).', "The brands associated with the fortune include Calvin Klein fragrances, Peet's Coffee, Krispy Kreme donuts and Panera Bread.", 'Matthias is a grandson of chemist Ludwig Reimann, who, in 1828, joined with Johann Adam Benckiser and his namesake chemical company.', 'JAB still holds 7.9% of multinational hygiene and home products giant Reckitt Benckiser.', 'Although it still has a controlling stake in Bally, JAB has been shifting its holdings away from luxury fashion brands in favor of coffee and food.']
abouts: ['Matthias and eight other heirs each inherited 11.1% of JAB; five of them subsequently divested their stakes.', 'While neither Matthias nor the other co-owners of JAB are active in management, all are reportedly, in keeping with the family background, trained chemists.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Stefan Reimann-Andersen and three of his siblings share ownership in the Luxembourg-based investment firm JAB Holding Company s.à.r.l (JAB).', "The brands associated with the fortune include Calvin Klein fragrances, Peet's Coffee, Krispy Kreme donuts and Panera Bread.", 'Stefan is a grandson of chemist Ludwig Reimann, who, in 1828, joined with Johann Adam Benckiser and his namesake chemical company.', 'JAB still holds 7.9% of multinational hygiene and home products giant Reckitt Benckiser.', 'Although it still has a controlling stake in Bally, JAB has been shifting its holdings away from luxury fashion brands in favor of coffee and food.']
abouts: ['Stefan and eight other heirs each inherited 11.1% of JAB; five of them subsequently divested their stakes.', 'While neither Stefan nor the other co-owners of JAB are active in management, all are reportedly, in keeping with the family background, trained chemists.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Renate Reimann-Hass and three of her siblings share ownership in the Luxembourg-based investment firm JAB Holding Company s.à.r.l (JAB).', "The brands associated with the fortune include Calvin Klein fragrances, Peet's Coffee, Krispy Kreme donuts and Panera Bread.", 'Renate is a granddaughter of chemist Ludwig Reimann, who, in 1828, joined with Johann Adam Benckiser and his namesake chemical company.\r\n', 'JAB still holds 7.9% of multinational hygiene and home products giant Reckitt Benckiser.', 'Although it still has a controlling stake in Bally, JAB has been shifting its holdings away from luxury fashion brands in favor of coffee and food.']
abouts: ['Renate and eight other heirs each inherited 11.1% of JAB; five of them subsequently divested their stakes.', 'While neither Renate nor the other co-owners of JAB are active in management, all are reportedly, in keeping with the family background, trained chemists.']

name: Billionaires
title: Investor
bios: ['Robert Smith founded private equity firm Vista Equity Partners in 2000. It focuses exclusively on investing in software companies. ', 'With over $30 billion in assets, Vista is one of the best-performing private equity firms, posting annualized returns of 22% since inception. ', 'As a college student, Smith secured an internship at Bell Labs after calling the company every week for five months. ', 'An engineer by training, he worked at Kraft Foods and Goodyear Tire before getting his MBA at Columbia University. ', 'A Cornell grad, Smith pledged $50 million (personally and through a foundation) to the university in 2016.']
abouts: ['Smith is the first African-American to sign the Giving Pledge, a commitment to contribute the majority of his wealth to philanthropic causes. ', 'He gave $20 million to the National Museum of African American History in 2016.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Russ Weiner founded energy drink company Rockstar in 2001, striking gold by marketing an energy drink in a tall-boy can.', 'Weiner started Yachak Organic in late 2017 as a natural alternative to Rockstar. Profits will go to protect endangered species and the environment. ', 'The son of right-wing talk-radio star Michael Savage, Weiner ran for California State Assembly in 1998.', "Though he lost the race, Weiner caught the eye of his father's friend, Skyy Vodka founder Maurice Kanbar, who quickly hired him.", "When Kanbar rejected Weiner's idea for an energy drink, Weiner quit and launched Rockstar using a $50,000 mortgage on his Sausalito, Calif. condo."]
abouts: ["When the first Rockstar cans hit stores and bars in 2001, Weiner drove around San Francisco in an old limo on which he'd painted the Rockstar logo to promote it.", "Weiner once owned a 161-foot yacht named 'Rockstar' that was damaged by a Miami drawbridge."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Jerónimo Arango, along with his brothers, Manuel and Placido, sold their retail chain Cifra to Walmart in 1997 for a reported $1.2 billion in cash.', 'Jeronimo and his brothers founded the predecessor to Cifra in 1958.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Rahul Bajaj chairs the 92-year-old Bajaj Group, best known for motorcycle maker Bajaj Auto.', "Run by the patriarch's older son Rajiv, Bajaj Auto also makes Qute, a 4-wheel quadricycle.", "The group owns Bajaj Finserv, a thriving financial services company that is run by Rajul Bajaj's younger son Sanjiv. "]
abouts: ["The group's founder and Rahul Bajaj's grandfather, Jamnalal Bajaj, was a disciple of Mahatma Gandhi. ", "Rahul Bajaj's younger brother Shishir Bajaj, who split from the family in 2009, runs his separate businesses in sugar, consumer goods, real estate and energy."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Rainer Blickle and his brother Juergen preside over SEW-Eurodrive, a manufacturer specializing in drive-automation and power-transmission solutions.', 'The company, acquired by their father, Ernst, in 1945, now employs more than 16,000 people and generates around $3 billion in annual revenue.', 'Its motor, gear and electronic components power conveyors, lifts and other applications in contexts ranging from auto assembly to commercial baking.', 'In the U.S., it operates a manufacturing plant in Lyman, S.C., and has five regional assembly centers and 60 technical sales offices. \r\n']
abouts: ["Rainer owns 44.9% of the company and Juergen, 50%. Just over 5% is held by Rainer's charitable foundation.", 'The brothers shun all publicity; not much is known about them. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Rocco Commisso is the founder and CEO of cable company Mediacom, based in Chester, New York.', 'He previously worked as CFO at Cablevision Industries, which was acquired by Time Warner in 1995.', "That same year he founded Mediacom, when many in the industry were bearish on cable's future due to new regulations that were increasing competition.", 'Commisso immigrated to America from Italy in 1962 at age 12. He worked 40 hours per week to pay his way through Catholic high school.', 'He earned a full scholarship to Columbia University, which named its soccer stadium for him in 2013 in recognition of his donations to the school.']
abouts: ['Commisso was offered a tryout for the 1972 U.S. Olympic soccer team. He arrived out of shape and did not make the squad.', 'Commisso learned to play soccer in Italy on cement with a ball made out of old rags and underwear.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Giuseppe De'Longhi is chairman of De'Longhi SpA, which produces high-end coffee makers and espresso machines. ", "De'Longhi's son, Fabio, is CEO of the company, which had 2016 revenues of $2.3 billion. Its products are sold in 33 countries.", 'The company was founded in 1902 in Treviso, Italy as a small industrial manufacturing workshop. A century later, its headquarters remain in Treviso.', 'The company makes portable heaters, air conditioners, appliances for food preparation, cleaning tools and coffee machines.', 'In 2015, he sold his majority stake in Italian industrial heating company DelClima to Mitsubishi Electric for $551 million.']
abouts: ["In the late 2000s after portions of The Plaza Hotel in Manhattan were redesigned as luxury condominiums, De'Longhi was reportedly one of the first to buy a condo."]

name: Billionaires
title: Chairman and CEO
bios: ['Tilman Fertitta is the owner of the Houston Rockets. The NBA approved the $2.2 billion purchase by Fertitta in October 2017. ', "Fertitta also owns the Golden Nugget Casinos and Landry's, a Texas-based restaurant and entertainment company. ", "Landry's brands include Landry's Seafood House, Bubba Gump Shrimp Co. and Saltgrass Steak House.", " Fertitta took Landry's private in 2010 in a deal worth $1.4 billion. ", "Tilman and his wife Paige gave $20 million to the University of Houston in 2016 to rebuild the school's basketball arena. "]
abouts: ["Fertitta first learned the food business in Galveston, where he worked at his father's seafood restaurant after school.", 'Fertitta, a dropout from the University of Houston, is the president of its board of regents. \r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['The bulk of Nathan "Natie" Kirsh\'s fortune comes from Jetro Holdings, which owns restaurant supply stores Jetro Cash and Carry and Restaurant Depot.', 'Kirsh owns 70% of the company, which supplies wholesale goods to bodegas, small stores and restaurants.', 'Kirsh made his first fortune in his native Swaziland, where he launched a corn milling business in 1958.', 'He expanded into wholesale food distribution in apartheid South Africa, and then into supermarkets and commercial property development.']
abouts: ["He owns one of London's tallest skyscrapers, Tower 42, which is home to more than 50 international companies.", 'His charitable efforts focus on Swaziland, where he has supplied more than 12,000 people with starter capital for small businesses.']

name: Billionaires
title: Owner
bios: ['Terry Pegula made a fortune in fracking and has since turned it into a sports empire that includes the Buffalo Bills and Buffalo Sabres.', 'His oil and gas outfit, East Resources, sold the bulk of its assets to Royal Dutch Shell for $4.7 billion in 2010.', 'He bought the Sabres the next year for $189 million and in 2014 outbid groups led by Donald Trump and Bon Jovi to pick up the Bills for $1.4 billion.', 'A former math major, Pegula switched to petroleum engineering on a scholarship and joined Getty Oil after graduation.', 'He founded East Resources in 1983 with a $7,500 loan from friends and family to drill sand wells, and still has oil and gas interests in three states.', 'A Penn State alumnus, Pegula donated $102 million to the university to fund a new arena and launch a NCAA Division I hockey program.']
abouts: ['His daughter, Jessica Pegula, is a professional tennis player.', "He and wife Kim spent some $220 million to create HarborCenter, an entertainment complex near the Sabres' arena that features 2 ice rinks, a hotel and a restaurant."]

name: Billionaires
title: Chief Executive Officer
bios: ['Robert Pera is the founder and CEO of wireless equipment maker Ubiquiti Networks.', 'Ubiquiti, which had $865 million in fiscal 2017 revenues, sells wireless broadband systems with a focus on emerging markets.', 'He owns nearly 75% of the publicly-traded firm.', 'Pera started his career at Apple in 2003 but struck out on his own IN 2005 to found Ubiquiti.', 'He holds degrees in electrical engineering and Japanese from UC San Diego.']
abouts: ['Pera missed a year of high school because of a rare heart-valve infection. ', "Pera, who bought the NBA's Memphis Grizzlies in 2012, is the youngest controlling owner in the league."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Pham Nhat Vuong studied in Russia and started a popular instant noodle business in the Ukraine in the 1990s before moving back.', "Vuong chairs Vingroup, one of Vietnam's largest conglomerates with interests in real estate, retail and healthcare among others.", 'He turned some investments into non-profit ventures, including some in healthcare, education and sports. He also built a center of contemporary art. ', 'Kind Heart Foundation, his philanthopic arm, is the biggest foundation in Vietnam.\r\n']
abouts: ["Vuong's first business was a Vietnamese restaurant where he personally served customers. ", "Vuong plays soccer regularly with his company's team. He sponsors PVF, a center for young soccer talents."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Billionaire brothers Randall and Gary Rollins preside over Orkin, the biggest pest control company by revenues in North America.', 'The bug-killing business is booming: in April 2017, the company reported its 44th consecutive quarter of sales and earnings growth.', 'Of the 19 subsidiaries under the Atlanta-headquartered Rollins Inc. umbrella, exterminator Orkin is the best known.', 'The company was founded by their father and uncle, who bought several local radio stations and named  it Rollins Broadcasting. It went public in 1961.']
abouts: ['The name Orkin derives from Latvian immigrant Otto Orkin, a 14-year-old who in 1901 was selling poison door-to-door. Rollins bought Orkin in 1964 for $62 million. ', "Since 2010, Gary's children have been suing their father and uncle, alleging the elders have been blocking access to a web of trusts worth around $3 billion."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Randall Rollins is chairman of Rollins Inc.,the biggest pest control company by revenues in North America. His brother Gary is CEO.', 'Of the 19 subsidiaries under the Atlanta-headquartered Rollins Inc. umbrella, exterminator Orkin is the best known.', 'The bug-killing business is booming: in July 2017, the company reported its 45th consecutive quarter of sales and earnings growth.', "The firm was created by Rollins' father and uncle who bought several local radio stations and called it Rollins Broadcasting. It went public in 1961."]
abouts: ['The name Orkin derives from Latvian immigrant Otto Orkin, a 14-year-old who in 1901 was selling poison door-to-door. Rollins bought Orkin in 1964 for $62 million.', "Since 2010, his brother Gary's children have been suing Randall and Gary, alleging the elders have been blocking access to a web of trusts worth around $3 billion."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Alejandro Santo Domingo, public face of the Santo Domingo clan, sits on the board of beer giant Anheuser-Busch, in which he has a 1.7% stake. ', 'Santo Domingo was a key negotiator in the deals that led to the 2016 merger between Anheuser-Busch and SABMiller. ', 'A Harvard grad, Alejandro is a senior managing director of New York-based Quadrant Capital Advisors. ', 'He also sits on the board of Florida Crystals, the cane sugar refinery conglomerate, and is on the board of the Metropolitan Museum of Art.  ', 'His father, Julio Mario Santo Domingo, had a 15% stake in SABMiller when he died in 2011, which he passed down to his sons and grandchildren. ']
abouts: ['In May 2016 Santo Domingo married Lady Charlotte Wellesley, reportedly a direct descendant of the British general who vanquished Napoleon at Waterloo.', 'Alejandro studied history and was in Eliot House while at Harvard College. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Andres Santo Domingo inherited a part of his father Julio Mario Santo Domingo's massive stake in the beer giant SABMiller when he died in 2011. ", 'The bulk of his fortune is now in Anheuser-Busch InBev, following its $100 billion merger with SABMiller in 2016. ', 'Andres is of Colombian heritage but has grown up and lived in the United States for years. He graduated from Brown University in 2000. ', 'He sits on the board of Conservation International and the New York Public Library. ', 'His brother, Alejandro, is a director at Anheuser-Busch. His nephew and niece, Julio Mario III and Tatiana Casiraghi, are also billionaires. ']
abouts: ['Andres co-founded the vinyl-loving, rock-oriented record label Kemado Records, now re-branded as the Kemado Media Group, in 2002. ', 'His wife, Lauren, began her career at Vogue and remains a contributing editor. She founded Moda Operandi, an online retailer that sells fresh-off-the-runway designs.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Roger Wang heads real estate firm Golden Eagle International, which builds malls and office buildings in East China region.', 'The Chinese native grew up in Taiwan and came to the U.S. in pursuit of an M.B.A. in 1970.', 'He first got rich building condos around L.A. and returned to China in 1992 to start Golden Eagle.', "His firm's department store arm, Golden Eagle Retail Group, trades on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange."]
abouts: ['Wang once sold insurance and managed a drugstore and a furniture company.', 'His daughter Dorothy Wang is a reality TV star from Rich Kids of Beverly Hills and Famously Single.']

name: Billionaires
title: Owner
bios: ["Steve Bisciotti is the cofounder of Allegis Group, the world's largest private staffing firm.", 'He started the business with his cousin, and fellow billionaire, Jim Davis. Allegis now brings in $12.3 billion in annual revenue. ', 'Bisciotti, who was raised by a single mother in Baltimore, went to college at nearby Salisbury State University. ', 'He worked for a year in the staffing industry after college before launching his first company with Davis. ', "He owns the NFL's Baltimore Ravens, which most recently won a Super Bowl title in 2012. "]
abouts: ['Bisciotti and his cousin, Jim Davis, started Allegis in a basement office furnished with secondhand furniture from Goodwill.', 'Growing up, Bisciotti played football, basketball, and baseball; he also enjoys golfing and boating.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Austen Cargill II is one of 14 billionaire heirs to Cargill, the family business where he served as a vice president until retiring in 2001. ', 'His great-grandfather, W.W. Cargill, founded the business as a single grain warehouse on the end of an Iowa railroad line in 1865.', 'The family still owns roughly 90% of Cargill, which did $115 billion in 2018 sales across food, agriculture, financial and industrial divisions.', 'Before becoming a Cargill executive, Austen earned a Ph.D. and worked as a marine biologist for the company.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["James Cargill is one of 14 billionaire heirs to Cargill, America's largest private company.", 'His great-grandfather, W.W. Cargill, founded the business as a single grain warehouse on the end of an Iowa railroad line in 1865.', 'The family still owns roughly 90% of Cargill, which did $115 billion in 2018 sales across food, agriculture, financial and industrial divisions.', 'The Cargill-MacMillan family collects an estimated 18% of net profits as dividends every year.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['The country\'s third largest landowner, Archie Aldis "Red" Emmerson and his family own nearly 2 million acres.', 'His Sierra Pacific Industries is the largest private lumber production firm in the nation with 15 sawmills across California and Washington.', 'Red and his father Curly started SPI in 1949. It went public in 1969 but 4 years later Curly and Red bought out their partner and took it private. ', "Today, Red's sons George and Mark run the firm as president and chairman, respectively, though Red is still at the office nearly every day. "]
abouts: ['Red was kicked out of boarding school in 1946 for telling a friend that he should pin a condom on the bulletin board, which he did.', 'SPI has given scholarships to the children of its employees for nearly four decades.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Finland's richest person, Antti Herlin, is chairman of Kone Corporation, one of the world's biggest makers of elevators and escalators.", 'His grandfather initially invested in Kone in 1924, and Herlin served as CEO from 1996 to 2006.', "Kone's products appear around the world in such places as Shanghai Hongqiao International Airport and Makkah Clock Royal Tower hotel in Saudi Arabia.", 'During his tenure as CEO, he expanded Kone through a series of acquisitions and alliances, and was given control of the firm as reward by his father.', "Herlin holds shares in Finnish media firm Sanoma, owner of Finland's largest newspaper Helsingin Sanomat."]
abouts: ["After his father's death, three of his siblings sued him over his larger stake. The dispute was solved in 2005, leaving the sibling with stakes in spinoff Cargotec.", 'Kone has taken its R&D underground, In 2017 they expanded the elevator test facilities in Tytyri to reach 350 meters (1150 feet) inside a working limestone mine. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Sumet Jiaravanon has been executive chairman of Charoen Pokphand Group, Thailand's biggest conglomerate, since 1993.", 'He is the the older brother of Thai billionaire Dhanin Chearavanont, senior chairman of CP Group.', "Sumet is listed separately from Dhanin based on his ownership of close to a 13% stake in the family's vast assets. ", "He also chairs the family's Chinese arm Chia Tai Group. "]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Lars Larsen founded and owns JYSK, a bedding and home furnishings chain with more than 2,500 stores in 48 countries across Europe, Canada and Asia.', 'Capitalizing on the popularity of Scandinavian design, JYSK has been working to emphasize its Danish roots in store displays, particularly in China.', 'JYSK plans to open its first South American store in Chile in 2019.', 'Larsen grew up on a potato farm and apprenticed in a bedding store before opening his first warehouse in 1979.', 'His Lars Larsen Group also includes furniture stores Ilva and Boolia.']
abouts: ["In 2004 Larsen sent 2.4 million copies of his autobiography to every household in Denmark, becoming the country's most widely-read author.", 'Nicknamed "Duvet Larsen," he regularly appears in TV commercials for JYSK.  ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Marianne Liebmann is one of 14 billionaire heirs to Cargill, America's largest private company.", 'Her great-grandfather, W.W. Cargill, founded the business as a single grain warehouse on the end of an Iowa railroad line in 1865.', 'The family still owns roughly 90% of Cargill, which did $115 billion in 2018 sales across food, agriculture, financial and industrial divisions.', 'The Cargill-MacMillan family collects an estimated 18% of net profits as dividends every year.']

name: Billionaires
title: Cofounder
bios: ['Bobby Murphy cofounded social media app Snapchat, which debuted as Snap Inc. on the New York Stock Exchange in March 2017.', 'Snapchat lets users share disappearing messages or photos and videos with captions, masks and filters.', "Most of Snapchat's 191 million daily users are between the ages of 18 and 34.", "Murphy, Snap's Chief Technology Officer, built Snapchat with his Stanford University fraternity brother Evan Spiegel.", 'Snap launched video-capturing sunglasses called Spectacles in 2016. After initial buzz, the product failed to take off.']
abouts: ['In February 2017, Murphy and Spiegel created a foundation for education and the arts. They plan to donate up to 13,000,000 Class A shares to the nonprofit by 2027.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Russian immigrant Igor Olenicoff fled the Soviet Union with his family at age 15, and eventually built up a substantial real estate empire.', 'His Olen Properties owns 8 million square feet of office space and 12,000 residential units in California and four other U.S. states.', 'In 2007, Olenicoff pleaded guilty to lying on his tax return about keeping $200 million in offshore accounts, and agreed to pay $52 million in taxes']
abouts: ['The Tsarist-connected Olenicoff family fled to Iran during World War II, where Igor attended American missionary school.', 'When his family arrived in the U.S. in 1957, they had 4 suitcases and $800.']

name: Billionaires
title: Chairman
bios: ["Walter Scott Jr, lifelong friend of Warren Buffett, owes the bulk of his fortune to Berkshire Hathaway Energy, Buffett's massive utilities subsidiary.", 'In 2000, Scott and Buffett partnered to buy utility MidAmerican Energy, later renamed Berkshire Hathaway Energy, for $2 billion.', 'Scott still owns about 9% of Berkshire Hathaway Energy and serves on its board. He is also a director of Berkshire Hathaway.', 'He began his career at construction giant Peter Kiewit in his native Omaha, Nebraska, rising to the rank of CEO in 1979.', 'Scott pushed Kiewit into telecom, fiber optics and power plants before retiring from the company in 1998.']
abouts: ['He and Buffett, who competed against each other for girls in high school, once owned minority stakes in the Omaha Storm Chasers minor league baseball team.', 'In July 2016, one of the three University of Nebraska, Omaha campuses was renamed the Scott Campus in his honor.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Clemmie Spangler is the sole owner of National Gypsum, the largest private wallboard producer in the U.S., with more than $2 billion in annual sales.', "After Harvard Business School, Spangler worked at his father's construction business, then took over a bank and sold it for a profit.", 'He purchased the drywall company in 1995 while he was president of his alma mater, University of North Carolina.', 'National Gypsum now commands 23% of the domestic gypsum board market.']
abouts: ['During his free time, he repairs antique grandfather clocks in his workshop.', 'In 1972, he joined the Charlotte-Mecklenburg, NC, board of education and helped the district desegregate its school system.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Energy entrepreneur Wang Yusuo started in business after he failed to pass the country's tough college entrance examinations. \r\n", "Wang's ENN Group is a vertically integrated natural gas company with interests in China and overseas.", 'In March 2016, ENN bought nearly 12% of Australia-listed oil and gas producer Santos Limited for $750 million. \r\n', 'Wang also controls Shanghai-listed Beibu Gulf Tourism.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Swedish industrialist Carl Bennet controls three companies on the Stockholm stock exchange.', 'His holdings include business group Lifco and printing company Elanders.', 'He also controls medical products company Getinge, which Bennet and fellow investor Rune Andersson acquired from Electrolux in 1989.', 'They ran the company together for nearly a decade before parting ways.']
abouts: ["He has criticized Sweden's central-left government for not doing enough to battle youth unemployment in Sweden, and proposes a German-style apprentice system.", 'In 2014 Bennet reintroduced Lifco to the public market at 28 the price he paid for the company to take it private 14 years earlier.']

name: Billionaires
title: Chairman
bios: ['Arthur Blank and Bernie Marcus cofounded Home Depot in 1978 after being fired from their jobs at a regional hardware store.', "Blank stepped down as co-chairman of Home Depot in 2001 and the next year bought the NFL's Atlanta Falcons for $545 million (now worth $2.1 billion).", 'He brought pro soccer to Atlanta with his Major League Soccer team Atlanta United FC, which started playing in March 2017.', "In August 2017, both of Blanks' teams moved into their new $1.5 billion home, Mercedes-Benz Stadium, which is slated to host the 2019 Super Bowl.", 'In 2012, he signed the Giving Pledge and committed to give more than half of his wealth away.']
abouts: ['While an undergraduate at Babson College in the early 1960s, he started a landscaping and laundry pick-up service to cover his expenses.', 'Blank graduated from college in three years.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Jaran Chiaravanont is the eldest of four brothers of the clan behind Thai conglomerate Charoen Pokphand Group. \r\n', "Jaran, who started working in the family's livestock feeds business in the 1950s, used to manage the Charoen Pokphand shop.", "Jaran is listed separately from his younger billionaire sibling Dhanin Chearavanont based on his 12.76% stake in the family's vast assets."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Jack Dangermond founded Esri, the industry leader in GIS technology, a specialized software used for creating digital maps.', 'He founded the company in 1969 with $1,100 in personal savings.', 'Esri has about a 40% share of the global geographic information system market.\r\n']
abouts: ['Dangermond and his wife Laura go to work together every morning.', 'Esri, which the Dangermonds own, has gifted up to $1 billion of free GIS Software to all American K-12 schools. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Fan Hongwei chairs Hengli Petrochemical, a chemical fiber supplier.', "She is the wife of Chen Jianhua, the chairman of Hengli's holding company.     ", 'Hengli Petrochemical,  established in 2002, has manufacturing sites in the Chinese cities of Suzhou, Suqian and Nantong.', "Fan's daughter is a director of family-controlled, China OTC-traded Suzhou Wujijang Tongli Lake Travel."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Gandel owns half of the southern hemisphere's largest shopping mall, Chadstone, with more than 500 stores in eastern Melbourne. ", 'He also has a big stake in listed property trust Vicinity Centres, which owns the other half of Chadstone, plus other malls and outlets.', "He first got rich by expanding his Polish immigrant parents' clothing chain for women, Sussan, now owned by his niece, Naomi Milgrom. ", 'But he made most of his wealth from the shopping malls he bought from Myer department stores for $37 million in the 1980s. ', 'Gandel says the key to his success was the deregulation of shopping hours and shopping becoming a leisure activity.']
abouts: ["He maintains Gandel Philanthropy, one of Australia's largest charitable funds. "]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Jim Jannard founded sunglasses empire Oakley out of his car in 1975. His first product was a motorcycle grip that wicked sweat during long rides. ', 'It went public in 1995 and sold to Luxottica for $2.1 billion in 2007.', 'By then he was working on his next project, Red Digital, building high-resolution cameras that have shot movies like Avatar and The Hobbit.', "Now he's built the world's first holographic smartphone, which, he says, has the best mobile camera and will start shipping in October 2018."]
abouts: ['The USC pharmacy student dropped out in the 1960s when the dean told him he had to cut his hippie hair and shave his long beard. ', 'Jannard named Oakley after his beloved English Setter, Oakley Anne. He has funded a breeder in Washington for three decades.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Montri Jiaravanont is honorary chairman and director of the Charoen Pokphand Group, one of Thailand's sprawling conglomerates. \r\n", 'He is the older brother of Thai billionaire Dhanin Chearavanont. ', 'Montri was executive director for two years at listed CP Pokphand Co. \r\n', "He is listed separately from his better-known sibling based on his ownership of a 12.63% stake in the family's vast assets. "]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["He owns property management company Langham Estate, a swath of prime retail and office space in London's West End. ", 'He has built up his holdings to some 14 acres between the neighborhoods of Soho and Mayfair. ', 'His property empire stretches from Hong Kong and London to Geneva and Tokyo. ', 'Lee also has a stake in London-based Shaftesbury, a publicly traded real estate company.']
abouts: ['In 2015, Lee donated $118 million to his alma mater the Massachusetts Institute of Technology to establish a real estate entrepreneurship lab. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Pawan Munjal, son of late Brijmohan Lall Munjal, founder of Hero Group, who died in 2015 at age 92, runs motorcycle flagship Hero MotoCorp. ', "A former partner of Japan's Honda, Hero is the world's largest producer of 2-wheelers by volume having sold more than 80 million units to date.", 'After parting ways with Honda 7 years ago, Pawan has led a global expansion with factories in Colombia and Bangladesh. ', 'Hero has a research unit in Jaipur city that employs 500 engineers. ']
abouts: ["Munjal's younger sibling Sunil stepped down as Hero' s joint managing director in 2016 to run his own independent businesses.\r\n", 'His daughter Vasudha founded Choko La, a brand of premium chocolates.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Axel Oberwelland is an owner of the German candy company August Storck KG, whose brands include Werther's Original, Riesen and Toffifee.", 'August Storck (also known as August Oberwelland) founded the business in the Westphalia town of Werther in 1903.', 'At the time, sweets were typically sold unpackaged and without branding. He packaged his individually and gave them snappy names.', 'Today, Storck employs over 5,000 people and has products sold in more than 100 countries.', "Oberwelland became the fourth generation of his family to lead the company, after his father, Klaus, retired on Storck's 100th anniversary in 2003."]
abouts: ['In 1992, Klaus Oberwelland established the Stork Foundation to preserve endangered stork populations.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['The largest shareholder of Crown Resorts, which owns casinos in Australia and London, Packer stepped down from the board in March 2018.
