bios: ["Lynn's husband Charles Schusterman founded Samson Resources in 1971 and grew it until his death from leukemia in 2000.", 'She sold the company to a KKR-led group for $7.2 billion in 2011. ', 'Of the Samson proceeds, $2.3 billion went to the Charles & Lynn Schusterman Foundation, devoted to Jewish charities and early childhood ed. ']
abouts: ['Samson went bankrupt in 2015, burdened with too much debt as oil prices fell.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Mark Shoen owns roughly one-fifth of U-Haul parent company Amerco through a limited partnership called Willow Grove. ', 'Mark is also owner of one of the largest private self-storage operations in the U.S., which does business with U-Haul.\r\n', 'Mark keeps a very low profile but apparently remains on good terms with Joe, who still runs the business.', 'Mark sided with his brother Joe in a nasty family feud in which Joe wrested control of U-Haul away from their father.']
abouts: ['His parents, L.S. and Anna Mary Shoen, cofounded U-Haul, the truck- and trailer-rental company, in 1945. ', 'His father, L.S., committed suicide in 1999. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Investor Michal Solowow got his start  in the late 1980s with construction company Mitex, which he sold in 2002 to French investor Eiffage.', 'Solowow then plowed the proceeds into the nascent Polish stock market.', 'Over the past several years he has been taking his companies including building materials producers Barlinek and Rovese private.', 'His last main public asset is chemical group Synthos, which he is also planning to take private.', 'These days, Solowow is investing in technology startups. ']
abouts: ['A once avid race car driver, Solowow was a championship European rally racer.', 'Solowow gave up racing after his car overturned at a European rally in 2014; he came out unscathed.\r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['With billionaire brother Richard, Daniel Tsai leads Fubon Financial Holdings, a family company with interests in banking, insurance and securities.', 'The brothers are also investors in Taiwan Mobile, a mobile phone service provider, and momo.com, a home shopping and e-commerce business.', 'Cousins Tsai Hong-tu, Tsai Cheng-da and T.Y. Tsai are also billionaires.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['With billionaire brother Daniel, Richard Tsai leads Fubon Financial Holdings, a family company with interests in banking, insurance and securities.', 'The brothers are also investors in Taiwan Mobile, a mobile phone service provider, and momo.com, a home shopping and e-commerce business.', 'Cousins Tsai Hong-tu, Tsai Cheng-da and T.Y. Tsai are also billionaires.']

name: Billionaires
title: Entrepreneur
bios: ['Frank Wang is founder and CEO of DJI, a privately held drone company with more than $1 billion in sales. ', 'In May 2015 DJI raised $75 million from U.S. venture capital firm Accel Partners at a valuation of $8 billion. ', 'DJI is best known for its Phantom Drones, which retail for around $1,000.', 'Forbes estimates that Wang owns about 45% of the company.']
abouts: ['Frank Wang founded his company in 2006 from his dorm room at Hong Kong University of Science & Technology.', "Wang is the world's first drone billionaire. "]

name: Billionaires
title: CEO
bios: ['Meg Whitman is best known for taking eBay from $5.7 million to $8 billion in sales as CEO from 1998 to 2008.', 'She was CEO of Hewlett-Packard from 2011 to 2015, when she oversaw its split into HP Inc. and Hewlett Packard Enterprise.', "She stepped down as HPE's chief executive in February 2018 but remains on its board.", "In March 2018, Whitman became CEO of Jeffrey Katzenberg's mobile media startup, NewTV.", 'A former Hasbro and Walt Disney executive, she also sits on the boards of Procter & Gamble and Dropbox.']
abouts: ['Whitman ran for Governor of California in 2010 as a Republican; she lost, despite spending a reported $140 million of personal funds on her campaign.', 'Her husband, Griffith Harsh, is a renowned neurosurgeon, Stanford professor and Rhodes Scholar.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['John Catsimatidis is best known as the owner of New York City supermarket chain Gristedes. ', 'He also owns oil refinery United Refining in Pennsylvania, which he bought out of bankruptcy, and real estate in New York and beyond.', 'He moved with his family from Greece to New York when he was an infant and grew up in an apartment in Harlem.', 'He worked as a grocery clerk while attending New York University but dropped out for a chance to own a piece of the shop where he worked.', 'He opened his own grocery store in 1969 and had 10 Red Apple stores by age 25.']
abouts: ['Catsimatidis has a weekly talk radio show, the Cats Roundtable, during which he interviews people involved in politics.', 'He unsuccessfully ran for mayor of New York City in 2013.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Do Won and Jin Sook Chang are cofounders behind the $4 billion fast fashion darling Forever 21, with some 790 stores spanning 48 countries. ', 'In 1984, the Changs started the chain with a 900-square-foot store in Los Angeles and a mere $11,000 in savings. ', 'Capitalizing on wholesale close-outs, they bought merchandise for cheap and hit $700,000 in first year sales, prompting them to open a new store every 6 months. ', 'The pair immigrated to the U.S. from South Korea in 1981 with not much more than a high school education. ', 'Today their Ivy-league educated daughters, Linda and Esther, work alongside their mother in merchandising. ']
abouts: ['Do Won pumped gas, washed dishes and cleaned offices to make ends meet before starting Forever 21. ', "The Changs go to early morning prayer everyday and have the bible verse John 3:16 printed on the bottom of their company's shopping bags. "]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Cheng Cheung Ling is the vice chairlady and executive director of Hong Kong-listed pharmaceutical maker Sino Biopharmaceutical.', 'Cheng holds a MBA from the Guanghua School of Management of Peking University. ', "Cheng is the mother of Sino's chairman Theresa Tse and wife of CEO Tse Ping."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Barry Diller founded internet and media conglomerate IAC in 1995 where he's senior executive and chairman.", 'Diller is also chairman of travel tech company Expedia which spun off from IAC in 2005. He has a 3.4% stake in Expedia. ', 'Prior to founding IAC, he worked at ABC, Paramount and Fox and oversaw launches of hit TV shows including "Cheers" and "The Simpsons." ', 'Through a majority stake in the online company Match Group, IAC controls popular dating platforms like Tinder, OkCupid and Match.com. ', 'In 2011, Diller and Furstenberg donated $20 million through their family foundation to help complete the High Line Park in New York City.', 'He is married to designer Diane Von Furstenberg and owns an estimated third of her eponymous fashion company. ']
abouts: ['Diller never graduated from college and got a job in the mail room at William Morris talent agency. ', 'Diller is the owner of the EOS yacht, one of the largest private sailing yachts in the world. ']

name: Billionaires
title: Entrepreneur
bios: ['Tattooed entrepreneur Jack Dorsey has been CEO of both social media firm Twitter and small business payments company Square since 2015.', 'Dorsey cofounded Twitter in 2006 with Ev Williams, Biz Stone and Noah Glass, and was CEO until 2008. He returned in 2015.', 'Dorsey cofounded Square in 2009, then took it public in 2015.', 'Before gravitating to tech, Dorsey was a certified masseur and dabbled in fashion design.', 'In 2015, Dorsey gave one third of his Twitter shares to employees.']
abouts: ['Dorsey dropped out of college twice -- first from the University of Missouri-Rolla and later from New York University.', "Dorsey doesn't have an office or a desk at Square."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Yakir Gabay owns 40.3% of Frankfurt-listed German real estate company Aroundtown SA, where he serves as chairman of the advisory board. ', 'Aroundtown SA manages commercial real estate in Europe and has a 38% stake in Grand City Properties, which owns 86,000 apartments in Germany. ', "Originally from Israel, Gabay previously served as CEO of the underwriting company for Bank Leumi, one of Israel's largest banks. "]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Allan Goldman co-chairs America's most valuable family-run real estate portfolio with his younger sister Jane. ", "The two took over the business' leadership when their father Sol, a legendary real estate investor, died in 1987. ", 'Their Solil Management owns at least 400 properties across New York City, from retail and office space near Madison Avenue to uptown co-ops.', 'Several years ago, Allan stepped back from overseeing Solil Management on a day-to-day basis due to health issues. ']
abouts: ['Sol started buying up foreclosed properties for bargain prices in the 1950s. His trademark was all-cash deals whenever possible. ', "Today, each of Sol's four children have an equal 25% stake. "]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Jane Goldman is America's only female billionaire running a real estate firm. She heads up Solil Management, which she owns with her three siblings.", "The youngest daughter of Sol Goldman (d. 1987), once New York's biggest landlord, she oversees a portfolio that includes at least 400 properties.", 'Trophies include apartments on the Upper East Side and the block of land in Midtown Manhattan that includes the Olympic Tower and the Cartier Mansion.', 'The family also owns a 17% stake in the World Trade Center developments in lower Manhattan. ', 'Her brother Allan is co-chair but has taken a back seat in recent years. Her sisters Amy and Diane Kemper are senior advisers. ']
abouts: ['The New York City resident paid $31 million in 2015 for a Palm Beach estate originally owned by the Kennedys.', "The Goldman family name is all over Yale University, from the law library named after Jane's mother, Lilian, to a $10 million endowed professorship. "]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Real estate heiress Amy Goldman Fowler is one of four siblings who equally split ownership of Solil Management, which owns 400 properties. ', 'Amy is the second-youngest daughter of late patriarch Sol Goldman. His trademark was all-cash deals whenever possible. ', 'She worked in the real estate office when she was younger. Now her younger sister Jane runs it. ', 'She lives on a 200-acre farm in Rhinebeck, New York, and also has a home in Memphis. ']
abouts: ['Amy has a Ph.D. in clinical psychology. She is now best-known as a premier heirloom horticulturalist.', 'Her husband Dr. Cary Fowler helped start the climate change conscious Svalbard Global Seed Vault.']

name: Billionaires
title: Chairman
bios: ['Daryl Katz amassed a fortune in the pharmacy business, buying the Canadian rights to U.S. franchise Medicine Shoppe in 1991. \r\n', 'A few years later he snatched up struggling Canadian drugstore chain Rexall, then expanded to the U.S. market.', 'Katz, the son of a drug store owner,  has since sold off all of his pharmacy operations, pivoting his Katz Group to real estate and entertainment. ', "He has been co-developing a $2 billion, 25-acre complex in Edmonton's downtown that will include offices, condos and retail, among others.", "Katz also owns his native city's NHL team, the Edmonton Oilers. "]
abouts: ['Katz started off his career as a lawyer, then ran a chain of frozen yogurt stands after buying the Alberta franchise rights to Yogen Früz with other investors.', "He's the majority owner of conservative news website LifeZette, founded by Fox News host Laura Ingraham. "]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Real estate heiress Diane Kemper is one of four Goldman siblings who co-own Solil Management, which owns at least 400 properties in New York City. ', 'Trophies include retail and office space along Madison Avenue in midtown and high-end coops on the Upper East Side. ', 'Diane is the second-oldest child of late patriarch Sol Goldman, who started buying up foreclosed properties for bargain prices in the 1950s. ', 'Diane headed the residential leasing department for several decades. She scaled back due to health issues several years ago.', 'They also own a 17% stake in the World Trade Center developments in lower Manhattan. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Before joining mineral firm Kazakhmys in 1995, Vladimir Kim obtained academic credentials in civil engineering, economics and business administration.', 'He was named chairman in 2005, before Kazakhmys became the first Kazakh company to list on the London Stock Exchange.', 'In a 2014 restructuring, Kazakhmys de-merged into private company Kazakhmys Corp. and a separate public company, KAZ Minerals plc.', "Kim still has a stake in KAZ Minerals and a majority of Kazakhmys Corp., which inherited most of the group's mature mining (mostly copper) assets.", 'He stepped down as chairman of KAZ Minerals in 2013 but serves on its board as a non-executive director.']
abouts: ['He is a descendent of Koreans forced by Stalin to move to Kazakhstan.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Lai Meisong is the founder and chairman of Shanghai-based ZTO Express, an express delivery firm profiting from a boom in e-commerce in China.', 'ZTO listed on the New York Stock Exchange in October 2016.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Manuel Lao Hernandez is the founder of Cirsa, Spain's largest casino company, which owns and manages 152 casinos.", 'He started the business in 1978 and today Cirsa operates in nine countries in Latin America and Europe, with $1.8 billion in revenues.', 'His three children all work for the family business, which is based just outside of Barcelona.']
abouts: ['As a hobby, Lao Hernandez grows bonsai trees.', 'He has a foundation named after him that has organized a poker tournament in which people with disabilities compete to have a wish fulfilled.']

name: Billionaires
title: Chairman
bios: ["James Leprino owns the world's largest mozzarella cheese maker with $3.5 billion in estimated annual sales.", "His Leprino Foods exclusively sells to cheese to Domino's, Papa John's and Pizza Hut.", 'The company also makes cheese by-products like whey protein, lactose, and sweet whey powder used in baby formula and yogurt. ', 'It started in 1950 with his father, an Italian immigrant, who had a Denver corner store that sold specialties like fresh mozzarella balls.', 'Today, Leprino Foods has more than 50 patents. Those innovations are essentially how Leprino created the "pizza cheese" that Americans eat today.']
abouts: ["When Leprino Foods became the exclusive cheese supplier to Domino's in 1996, the contract was more of a handshake than a legal document at just one page long. ", 'Leprino Foods controls as much as 85% of the market for pizza cheese today. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Liang Xinjun is a former vice chairman and CEO of conglomerate Fosun International.', "Fosun's investments range from steelmaking to mining, tourism and pharmaceuticals.\r\n", 'Two other co-founders -- Guo Guangchang and Wang Qunbin -- are billionaires.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Tom Morris founded TJ Morris, which owns discount retailer Home Bargains, in 1976.', 'One of seven children of a Liverpool shopkeeper, he is the third generation of his family to run a retailer.', 'Morris, who closely guards his privacy, reportedly used a bank overdraft to start his business at the age of 21.', 'Home Bargains stocks everything from health and beauty products to candy and toys, often bought at a discount from brands trying to offload product.', 'There are nearly 450 Home Bargains stores throughout the United Kingdom, with plans to expand to as many as 1,000.']

name: Billionaires
title: Cofounder & chairman
bios: ["Vietnam's first self-made woman billionaire took her budget airline, VietJet Air, public in February 2017.", 'She launched the airline in 2011 and made a big splash early on with ads featuring bikini-clad flight attendants. \r\n', "The airline, which offers 300 flights a day, operates more than 40% of the nation's flights.", 'She also has investments in HD Bank and real estate including three beach resorts.']
abouts:
['Nguyen got the idea to launch a low-cost airline while she was a trader, when she predicted that demand for air travel in Vietnam would increase.
', 'After studying economics and finance in Soviet Russia in the 1980s, Nguyen got her start trading commodities in Eastern Europe and Asia. 

']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Low-profile Rajan Raheja hails from the sprawling Raheja property clan in Mumbai.\r\n', 'After a family spilt, he went on to build a separate diversified empire that includes interests in cement, batteries and cable television. \r\n', "Raheja's biggest asset is auto battery maker Exide Industries.", 'He also owns listed cable television unit Hathway Cable & Datacom.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Ren Jianhua chairs Shenzhen-listed kitchen appliance maker Hangzhou Robam Appliances, which started out as a small collective factory in 1979.', 'Ren borrowed $5.4 million at the end of 1998 to take control of the company.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Richard and Robert Sands' father, Marvin, founded a humble wine business in 1945 at age 21.", 'That small operation has ballooned into a publicly traded behemoth now called Constellation Brands, which generates over $7 billion in annual revenue.', 'The company is known for its relentless streak of acquisitions. Subsidiaries include Robert Mondavi wine and Svedka Vodka.', "Constellation also holds the rights to Grupo Modelo's U.S. beer business, including its Modelo and Corona labels.", 'Richard and Robert, along with their mother, Mickey, donated $61 million to the Rochester Area Community Foundation in 2016.']
abouts: ['In August 2018 Constellation Brands announced a $3.8 billion investment in Toronto-listed cannabis firm Canopy Growth, which had annual revenue of just $59 million.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Kerry Stokes took a winding path en route to earning a fortune with his Seven Group Holdings, which has many media, construction and mining assets.', 'Early in his life his mother gave him up for adoption, and he later dropped out of school at age 14.', 'He started his career selling Caterpillar tractors and trucks in Australia and eventually China, before moving into media with Seven Group.']
abouts: ['Stokes employs a team of people to manage his vast collection of paintings, sculptures and historic artifacts, many of which are on loan to art galleries worldwide.']

name: Billionaires
title: Entrepreneur, Personality
bios: ['Donald Trump became the first billionaire president in U.S. history in January 2017.', 'The core of his fortune is tied up in a half-dozen buildings in and around midtown Manhattan in New York City, where luxury real estate values have fallen recently.', 'Trump also owns golf courses and a winery and has licensed his name to companies around the world.', 'He got his start working for his father, Fred, who developed low-cost housing in Brooklyn and Queens.', 'Trump tapped his two eldest sons, Don Jr. and Eric, to run the family business while he is in office.']
abouts: ['Trump played basketball, football, soccer and baseball while he attended the New York Military Academy in Cornwall-on-Hudson, New York.', 'Trump attended Fordham University for two years while he was being groomed by his father to run the family real estate business; he later transferred to Wharton.']

name: Billionaires
title: Founder and Chairman
bios: ['Romesh Wadhwani is the chairman and CEO of Symphony Technology Group, which brings in $2.5 billion in annual revenues.', 'He combined 9 of his companies that were AI-focused into a new group called SymphonyAI in 2017.', 'After graduating from the Indian Institute of Technology, he went to Carnegie Mellon and received a Ph.D. in 1972 in electrical engineering. ', 'The serial entrepreneur later founded Aspect Development, which i2 Technologies acquired for $9.3 billion in stock in 1999.', 'He sits on the boards of the Kennedy Center and the Center for Strategic and International Studies.', 'He and his brother, Sunil, founded the Wadhwani Institute of Artificial Intelligence at the University of Mumbai in 2018, committing over $30 million.']
abouts: ['Born in present day Pakistan, Wadhwani was only a few days old when his parents fled to India as the British Indian Empire underwent partition.', 'Wadhwani announced in 2015 plans to commit up to $1 billion to fund entrepreneurship initiatives in India.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Wang Jian is president of BGI, one of Asia's largest genomics companies.", 'Wang worked as a senior research fellow at the University of Washington between 1990 and 1994.\r\n', "Wang Jian graduated from Central South University and holds a master's degree from Beijing University of Chinese Medicine.", 'After graduation, he performed postdoctoral research at the University of Texas and the University of Iowa from 1988 to 1990.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Cliff Asness is the co-founder of AQR Capital Management, a fast-growing money management firm that oversees $225 billion.  ', 'AQR stands for Applied Quantitative Research. It focuses on factor-based investing, offering products ranging from hedge funds to mutual funds. ', 'A Goldman Sachs veteran, Asness was once known for being in the hedge fund game. But AQR has moved away from hedge fund products in recent years. ', "Asness backed lawmakers who supported New York's marriage equality initiative and is a board member of the International Rescue Committee. "]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Anne Beaufour gets her fortune from her stake in Ipsen, France's third-largest pharmaceutical company. ", "Founded in 1929 by grandfather Henri Beaufour, the family's 76% share of Ipsen was split between 3 siblings when father Albert Beaufour died in 2000.", 'Anne and her brother Henri now control 57% of Ipsen, which reported 2016 revenues of more than $1.9 billion. ', 'Sister Veronica sold her 6% stake. ', "Anne holds a bachelor's degree in geology from the University of Paris Orsay."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Henri Beaufour's fortune come from his stake in Ipsen, France's third-largest pharmaceutical company. ", "Founded in 1929 by grandfather Henri Beaufour, the family's 76% share of Ipsen was split between 3 siblings when father Albert Beaufour died in 2000. ", 'Henri and his sister Anne now control 57% of Ipsen, which reported 2016 revenues of more than $1.9 billion.', 'Sister Veronica sold her 6% stake. ', "Henri holds a bachelor's degree from Georgetown University, where he remains a prominent donor."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Tom Benson, who started out working at a car dealership and ended up owning pro sports teams, died at age 90 on March 15, 2018.', "He owned the NFL's New Orleans Saints and NBA's New Orleans Pelicans, which he purchased in 1985 and 2012, respectively.", "In New Orleans he also owned a 26-story office building and Champions Square, an outdoor entertainment venue next to the Saints' Superdome arena.", 'Benson spent years locked in a dispute with his daughter and grandchildren over control of much of his fortune.', 'The nasty feud, in which family members claimed he was mentally incompetent to run the teams, ended in February 2017 with a confidential settlement.']
abouts: ['Benson was famous for doing the "Benson Boogie," a dance he performed while carrying a black and gold umbrella after Saints home victories.', 'There are currently two statues of Tom Benson: one next to the Superdome in New Orleans, and the other, revealed in 2017, next to the Pro Football Hall of Fame.']

name: Billionaires
title: Investor
bios: ["One of Facebook's first venture investors, Jim Breyer made much of his fortune investing in the social network. ", 'After 28 years at venture firm Accel Partners, Breyer now invests through his own Breyer Capital and is betting big on Artificial Intelligence.', 'The VC scored a new exit when S&P Global acquired artificial intelligence and analytics firm Kensho in March 2018 for $550 million.', 'He has invested in over 40 companies that have had successful IPOs or mergers including Etsy, Marvel Entertainment and Legendary Entertainment.    ', 'He currently serves on the board of Blackstone and 21st Century Fox.']
abouts: ['Breyer, whose parents fled Hungary, spent his early years living in a funeral home in New Haven because it was the cheapest place to live while his dad went to Yale. ', 'In 1982, Breyer sent his resume to Steve Jobs who forwarded it to the Director of Marketing. He was hired for the summer and part-time while he was at Stanford U.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Bulgheroni and his late brother Carlos (d. Sept. 2016) took over Argentine energy company Bridas Corp., founded by their father, in 1985.', "Bridas was created in 1948 to provide parts for the national oil company's pipeline network. ", "The Bulgheroni brothers sold a 50% stake in Bridas to China's state overseas oil company, CNOOC, for $3.1 billion in 2011.", 'In September 2017 they entered into a cash-free agreement with BP to form the largest privately-owned integrated energy company in Argentina.']
abouts: ['Bulgheroni owns sustainable wineries in Uruguay, Argentina, Australia, Italy, France and the United States.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Low profile Hasmukh Chudgar founded generics maker Intas Pharmaceuticals in 1977.', 'Chudgar has long handed over operations to his sons Nimish and Binish, who run the $1.8 billion (revenue) company.', ' Intas bought the Irish and UK assets of Israeli firm Teva Pharmaceuticals for $750 million in October 2016.']
abouts: ["Chudgar's third son Urmish heads the company's biopharma business and is a haematologist-oncologist.", 'In April 2017, private equity firm Capital International bought a 3% stake in Intas valuing the firm at $3.5 billion.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Ennio Doris is chairman of Banca Mediolanum, an Italian bank with more than $80 billion in assets. ', 'He got his big break after seeking out former prime minister (and billionaire) Silvio Berlusconi, to whom he pitched his financial service ideas. ', 'In 1982 the two founded Programma Italia and later restructured it into Mediolanum, offering life insurance, fund management and real estate loans. ', 'Doris reimbursed his clients for their losses in the Lehman Brothers collapse, costing Mediolanum approximately $220 million and a dividend cut. ', "For years he was the public face of the company's ad campaigns, a role that has more recently been delegated to his son Massimo, the CEO. "]
abouts: ['Doris was born into poverty and started out by selling insurance policies.']

name: Billionaires
title: Entrepreneur, Journalist
bios:
['Luis Frias is chairman of PagSeguro Digital, a payments company that went public on the New York Stock Exchange in 2018, raising over $2 billion.', "Frias' late father acquired one of Brazil's most popular daily newspapers in the 1960s, today known as Folha de S. Paulo. 
", "Group Folha became one of Brazil's largest media conglomerates; Frias joined in 1981, was appointed CEO in 1989 and chairman in 1991.
", 'In 1996, Frias founded UOL, a pioneering Brazilian Internet company, and one of the most visited websites in the country. 
', 'PagSeguro Digital is a subsidiary of UOL.
']
abouts: ['His brother, Otavio Frias Filho, is editorial director of Grupo Folha.\r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['In 1990, at age 51,Valentin Gapontsev founded IPG Photonics,which produces high-power fiber-optic lasers for cutting materials and telecommunications.', 'The NASDAQ-listed company is based in Oxford, Massachusetts, but operates all over the world; he owns a 23.2% stake. ', 'Gapontsev holds Russian and U.S. citizenships and lives in Worcester, Mass.  ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Martin Haefner's fortune largely stems from his stake in American IT management software maker CA Technologies.", "He inherited half of his father Walter's stake in the business when he died in June 2012, then the world's oldest billionaire at 101.", 'He also inherited part of car dealer AMAG, which sells brands including Volkswagen, Audi, Bentley and Porsche.', 'His sister, Eva Maria Bucher-Haefner, is also a billionaire and inherited equal stakes in CA Technologies and AMAG.', 'Martin co-owns the Bellerive Hotel in Lausanne, Switzerland, with his sister.']

name: Billionaires
title: Investor
bios: ["Activist investor Chris Hohn founded London-based hedge fund, the Children's Investment Fund, in 2003.", 'While other activist investors have struggled in recent years, TCI has boasted double digit net returns for three years in a row.', 'The son of a Jamaican car mechanic, Hohn attended Southamption University in the U.K. and got his MBA at Harvard.', "He worked at other hedge funds for nearly a decade, including a stint at Richard Perry's Perry Capital, before setting up his own. "]
abouts: ['Hohn paid his ex-wife, Jamie Cooper, over $500 million in a divorce settlement in 2014,  reportedly the largest ever in U.K. history at the time.', 'Hohn has steered over $2 billion to charity, earning himself knighthood in 2014.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['In 1961, Johnelle Hunt and her late husband, J.B. (d. 2006), sold their home and took out loans to start a rice hull packaging operation.', 'Eight years later, the couple bought five trucks and seven trailers to launch J.B. Hunt Transport Services. ', 'The Lowell, Ark. business went public in 1983 and is now one of the biggest transportation companies in the nation, with $7.2 billion in sales.', "Hunt, who stepped down as corporate secretary in 2008, remains the firm's largest individual shareholder with a 17% stake.", "In 2014, Hunt donated 6 acres of land to build the Walton Arts Center's Walmart Arkansas Music Pavilion, an outdoor amphitheater."]
abouts: ['A stay-at-home mom before 1961, Hunt first took on duties such as coordinating product shipping and bookkeeping.', 'Daughter of a poultry business owner, Hunt studied to be a teacher at University of Central Arkansas before leaving to marry J.B. \r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Investor with a Midas touch, Rakesh Jhunjhunwala is often referred to as India's Warren Buffett. ", 'Son of an income tax officer, Jhunjhunwala started dabbling in stocks while still in college. ', 'He began investing with $100 in 1985 when the Bombay Stock Exchange Index was at 150; it now trades over 36,000.', 'His most valuable holding is watch and jewellery maker Titan, worth close to $700 million.', "His privately owned stock trading firm Rare Enterprises, derives its name from the first two initials of his name and wife Rekha's name. "]
abouts: ['Jhunjhunwala calls himself an old-fashioned investor and shuns startups.', 'Movie buff, Jhunjhunwala has coproduced several Bollywood films.\r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Lu Xiangyang was working at the People's Bank of China in 1995 when he teamed up with his cousin Wang Chuanfu to launch battery and auto maker BYD.", 'Lu runs his own investment firm, Youngy Investment Holding Group.', "Wang, BYD's chairman, and Lu, the vice chairman, are today both billionaires from their holdings in the company."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["John Middleton made his fortune selling his family's storied tobacco business to Philip Morris-parent Altria for $2.9 billion in cash in 2007. ", 'The original business, John Middleton Inc., was founded as a small retail tobacco shop in Philadelphia in 1856 by his great-great-grandfather.', 'The company began manufacturing cigarettes in the 1950s and launched the Black & Mild cigar brand in 1980.', "Middleton bought out his relatives' stakes in the company in 2003 for about $200 million amid tobacco lawsuits that threatened to harm the business.", 'Middleton has a nearly 50% stake in the Philadelphia Phillies baseball team.']
abouts: ['His sister sued him, claiming he cheated her out of her inheritance. Middleton objected to the claims and reached a reported $22 million settlement.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['In 2017, Kazuo Okada was sued by his company, Universal Entertainment following an internal investigation after reports of alleged "fraudulent acts."  ', 'Okada could not be reached for a comment on the charges. ', 'Okada founded Universal Entertainment, which manufactures and sells pachinko machines and casino equipment, in 1969. ', 'Formerly known as Aruze Corporation, Universal Entertainment trades on the Japan Stock Exchange. ', 'An art enthusiast, Okada possesses art from Japan, China and Korea, which are displayed at The Okada Museum of Art in Hakone, Japan. ']
abouts: ['Okada dropped out of high school to enroll in an engineering vocational school, and later started repairing broken jukeboxes from America. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Jorge Perez runs Related Group of Florida, which claims to have developed more than 80,000 condos, mostly in Miami, since it was founded in 1979.', "As a young urban planner, Perez met developer Stephen Ross, which led to a partnership. Today Ross' affiliate Related Companies owns a 25% stake. ", 'They built affordable housing in the 1980s, then switched to high-end condo construction. ', 'Perez has started diversifying where he develops, branching out elsewhere in South Florida, as well as in Uruguay, Mexico and Argentina. ']
abouts: ['A son of Cuban parents, Perez grew up in Argentina and Colombia before moving to the U.S. for college.', 'In 2011 Perez pledged $35 million in cash and artwork to the Miami Art Museum, which then agreed to rename it after him. Nicknamed PAMM, it opened in 2013. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Former surgeon Prasert Prasarttong-Osoth cofounded Bangkok Dusit Medical Services, Thailand's largest private hospital operator, in 1972.", 'Bangkok Dusit has an upcoming $370 million luxury healthcare complex in Bangkok that will include a five-star hotel.\r\n', 'Prasert also also owns and runs regional airline, Bangkok Airways, which he took public in 2014. ']
abouts: ['PPTV, his digital TV channel, has the rights to broadcast matches of the English Premier League. ', 'Prasert comes from an old Bangkok family that was engaged in making and selling traditional medicines.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['One of 11 billionaire heirs to the Hyatt Hotels fortune, Jean "Gigi" Pritzker is now a movie producer based in Los Angeles. ', 'In 2015 she founded Madison Wells Media, a diversified media & entertainment company that includes a virtual reality division.', "Films that she has produced include 'Drive,' 'Rabbit Hole,' 'Ender's Game,' 'Mortdecai' and the Oscar-nominated 'Hell or High Water.'", 'Through her Pritzker Pucker Family Foundation, she donates to the arts, education and community-oriented nonprofits. ']
abouts: ['Her company, Madison Wells Media, is named for her great-grandfather who sold newspapers at the corner of Madison Avenue and Wells Street in Chicago.', 'While she was a student at Stanford University, Pritzker spent a year abroad in Nepal, where among other things she studied folktales.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Mochtar Riady is founder of $7.5 billion (revenue) Lippo Group, now run by sons James and Stephen.', 'Born in East Java, Riady opened a bicycle shop at age 22 and went on to build a successful banking career until the 1997 financial crisis.', "Today Lippo Group's interests include real estate, retail, healthcare, media and education.", "Riady's son Stephen runs Singapore property outfit OUE, which owns the iconic U.S. Bank Tower in downtown Los Angeles.", "Grandson John, who heads Lippo's e-commerce venture MatahariMall, is also overseeing a digital banking drive through their Bank Nobu."]
abouts: ['His daughter Rosy is married to Indonesian billionaire Tahir.', "The English version of  Riady's autobiography, 'My Life Story', was launched in 2016."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['A friend of President Vladimir Putin, Arkady Rotenberg was once his judo sparring partner.\r\n', 'Rotenberg was the target of U.S. and European sanctions in 2014.', 'The U.S. Treasury Department claimed that Putin awarded him and his brother billions of dollars in contracts with oil and gas giant Gazprom and for the Sochi winter Olympics.', 'After the sanctions, Arkady transferred some assets to his son Igor, including stakes in road construction company Mostotrest.', "Arkady still owns Stroygazmontazh Corporation (SGM Group), one of Russia's biggest construction contractors in the energy field."]
abouts: ['An ice hockey fan, Rotenberg apparently still plays with Putin and is chairman of the executive board of Russian Ice Hockey Federation.', 'Rotenberg holds an indirect stake in Sheremetyevo Airport near Moscow. ']

name: Billionaires
title: Entrepreneur
bios: ['Michael Rubin is the majority owner and CEO of Kynetic, which is the holding company for e-commerce retailers Fanatics, Rue La La and ShopRunner.', 'His flash-sales site, Rue La La, acquired longtime rival Gilt Groupe for an undisclosed price in June 2018.', 'In September 2017 SoftBank invested $1 billion in Fanatics, which sells sports merchandise. ', 'After dropping out of Villanova University, Rubin started GSI Commerce, which he sold to eBay for $2.4 billion in 2011.', "As part of the deal he paid $500 million for majority ownership of 3 assets eBay didn't want: Fanatics, Rue La La and ShopRunner.", 'He is in the process of working with rapper Meek Mill to launch the Criminal Justice Reform Foundation']
abouts: ["At age 15 Rubin founded ski-tuning shop Mike's Ski & Sport in his parents' basement.", 'Rubin owns minority stakes in the Philadelphia 76ers, the New Jersey Devils and the English Premier League soccer team Crystal Palace FC.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Richard and Robert Sands' father, Marvin, founded a humble wine business in 1945 at age 21.", 'That small operation has ballooned into a publicly traded behemoth now called Constellation Brands, which generates over $7 billion in annual revenue.', 'The company is known for its relentless streak of acquisitions. Subsidiaries include Robert Mondavi wine and Svedka Vodka.', "Constellation also holds the rights to Grupo Modelo's U.S. beer business, including its Modelo and Corona labels.", 'Richard and Robert, along with their mother, Mickey, donated $61 million to the Rochester Area Community Foundation in 2016.']
abouts: ['In August 2018 Constellation Brands announced a $3.8 billion investment in Toronto-listed cannabis firm Canopy Growth, which had annual revenue of just $59 million.']

name: Billionaires
title: Chairman Emeritus of the Board of Simon Property Group, Inc.
employment: {'name': 'Simon Property Group', 'uri': 'companies/simon-property-group', 'title': 'Chairman Emeritus of the Board of Simon Property Group, Inc.', 'government': False}
bios: ['In 1960, Herb Simon and his brother Melvin (d. 2009) founded the precursor to Simon Property Group. ', "Simon Property is now one of the world's largest REITs, with 179 shopping malls covering 153 million square feet across America, Europe and Asia.  \r\n", "Simon is chairman emeritus of the board; his nephew, David, who is Melvin's son, has been CEO since 1995.", 'Simon also owns the Indiana Pacers, which he bought with his brother. The NBA team is worth $880 million.  ', 'Simon sits on the board of the Cheesecake Factory.']
abouts: ['Simon was raised in a Bronx walk-up and is the son of a Jewish tailor who immigrated from Central Europe.', 'Simon is a father of eight and on his third marriage--this time to a former Miss Universe from Thailand.']

name: Billionaires
bios: [' Robert Toennies owns 50% of German food industry giant Toennies Lebensmittel, with annual revenue of around $7.5 billion.', 'Operating meat, convenience, ingredients and logistics divisions, the company specializes in pig, sow and beef cattle slaughtering and processing.', "Robert's father, Bernd, and uncle, Clemens, cofounded Toennies Lebensmittel in 1971. It employs around 12,500 people in Germany and Denmark.", 'Bernd died in 1994, at age 42, passing on his stake to Robert, who serves on the board of advisors of the holding company.', 'Clemens owns the other 50% of Toennies Lebensmittel.']
abouts: ['Robert fought in court with Clemens for several years. In 2017, they settled their dispute over ownership of stakes in the company. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Manuel Villar is the chairman of Starmalls, one of Philippines largest mall operators, and Vista \r\n& Landscapes, the country's largest homebuilder. ", 'As a child, Manuel helped his mom sell seafood in a Manila market.', "Villar's family-led Vista Land & Lifescapes plans to invest $35 million to build 10 new shopping malls before 2019. His son Paolo runs Vista.", 'The family-owned Golden Haven Memorial Park, a property developing affiliate of Vista Land, focuses on parks. It went public in June 2016. ', 'In December 2017, his company acquired Bria Homes, a developer of mass housing projects and condos, and changed its name to Golden Bria. ']
abouts: ['Villar has been involved in Philippines politics and held positions including congressman, speaker of the house of representatives, senator, and senate president. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Arizona Beverages cofounder Don Vultaggio has built his fortune one 99-cent tallboy can of iced tea at a time.', "He got his start in the 1970s selling beer and soda from the back of an old van in Brooklyn's toughest neighborhoods, where others refused to go.", 'In 1992 he went into iced tea, launching Arizona from a Brooklyn warehouse and quickly toppling the competition with taller cans and flashier labels.', 'Arizona sells some 3 billion containers of tea, juice, water and alcoholic drinks annually, including its popular green tea and Arnold Palmer lines.', 'In 2015 he was ordered to buy out his former friend and partner, John Ferolito, for about $1 billion to settle a lengthy, bitter shareholder dispute.']
abouts: ["Arizona's flamboyant, Southwest-themed packaging was inspired by his Queens home, which stood out thanks to white and turquoise stucco and a cactus garden out front.", 'Vultaggio often wallpapers offices himself and, on his birthday, throws a pajama party where he cooks pancakes and omelets for his entire 300-person office staff.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Wang Zhenhua is the chairman of property developer Future Land Development Holdings.\r\n', 'Future is headquartered in the eastern Chinese city of Changzhou. ', 'Wang first entered the property development business in 1993.', 'Wang received an EMBA degree from Cheung Kong Graduate School of Business in July 2005.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Wu Kaiting is chairman of Xiamen Intretech Inc. a supplier of electronics products including remote controls for family entertainment equipment. ', 'Intretech went public at the Shenzhen Stock Exchange on Jan. 15, 2018.', 'Wu owns a 55% stake in Intretech. ', 'Wu is the son of Wanlida Group founder Wu Huitian, a member of the Forbes China Rich list in 2008,Wu died in 2012.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Simon Xie is a cofounder of China e-commerce giant Alibaba Group.', 'Prior to joining Alibaba Group, he got an engineering degree from Shenyang University of Technology and did financial work at a state-run company.\r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios:
['Chuck Bundrant is the chairman and cofounder of Trident Seafoods, the largest vertically integrated seafood company in North America.
', 'Today the $2.6 billion (est. sales) harvests, processes and markets frozen and fresh seafood and has operations in China, Japan and Germany.
', 'The company sells Alaskan wild-caught salmon, cod and pollock at retailers like Costco and Safeway. 
', "Bundrant is credited with popularizing pollock, which was considered a trash fish. He sells it to chains like Long John Silver's and McDonald's.
", 'In the 1970s he partnered with two crab fishermen to create the Bilikin, the first boat to feature crab cookers and freezing equipment on board.
']
abouts: ['In 1961, 19-year-old Bundrant drove from Tennessee to Seattle with $80 in his pocket to start fishing.', 'Bundrant eventually made his way to Alaska and slept on the docks and worked on any fishing boat that would let him. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Cai Dongchen chairs CSPC Pharmaceutical Group. ', 'Cai holds a MBA degree from Nankai University.']

name: Billionaires
person: {'name': 'Jose and Francisco Jose Calderon Rojas', 'uri': 'jose-and-francisco-jose-calderon-rojas', 'imageExists': False}
personName: Jose and Francisco Jose Calderon Rojas
bios: ['José and Francisco Jose Calderon Rojas inherited their fortune from their father, who cofounded Coca-Cola bottler and convenience store company FEMSA.', 'Their stake in that company is close to 7%.', 'The Calderón brothers keep a very low profile, while FEMSA has been expanding its activities into creating a drugstore and restaurant chains.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Jason Chang chairs Taiwan's Advanced Semiconductor Engineering.", 'Along with his brother Richard, Jason is one of the main investors in commercial real estate developer Sino Horizon Holding.', "ASE is the world's largest provider of independent semiconductor assembling and test manufacturing services."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Smita Crishna-Godrej hails from the storied Godrej clan and has a one-fifth stake in the family assets.', 'Her brother Jamshyd runs consumer goods firm Godrej & Boyce. ', 'Her husband Vijay Crishna, a well-known theatre actor, and daughter Nyrika Holkar, work in the group. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Ding Shizhong is the chairman and CEO of Anta Sports, one of China's largest homegrown suppliers of sports shoes.", 'Ding is the younger brother of Anta CEO Ding Shijia, who is also a member of the 2016 Forbes China Rich List.\r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Feng Hailiang chairs the Zhejiang-based Hailiang Group; its businesses interests include copper smelting, real estate, education and agribusiness.', 'Feng started a trading company in 1985, followed by a copper products factory in 1989; the latter was the predecessor of Hailiang Group.']

name: Billionaires
title: Managing Member
bios: ['Gerald Ford has been buying distressed banks and turning them around since 1975, when he bought his first bank. ', 'His first big success was in 2002, when he and his billionaire friend Ronald Perelman sold Golden State Bancorp to Citigroup for $6 billion in stock. ', 'Ford has a 16% stake in publicly-traded banking firm Hilltop Holdings, which owns PlainsCapital Bank and property insurer National Lloyds Corp.', "Ford's son Jeremy Ford is co-CEO of Hilltop Holdings, and his son-in-law Corey Prestidge is general counsel and executive vice president of the firm.", 'Ford is the majority shareholder of Mechanics Bank in California, which trades over the counter and had assets of $5.6 billion in late 2017.']
abouts: ['Ford and his wife Kelli, own multi-million dollar ranches in Kentucky and New Mexico as well as homes in Dallas and the Hamptons.', 'Ford donated $15 million to his alma mater Southern Methodist University in 2013 and $20 million for a new football stadium at the school in 1997.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Philippe Foriel-Destezet founded his staffing company, Ecco, in 1964; by the 1980s it was France's largest supplier of temporary personnel.", "Foriel-Destezet merged the firm with Klaus Jacobs's Swiss firm Adia to create Adecco in 1996. ", 'He stepped down as co-chairman of Swiss staffing firm Adecco in 2005 and was made an honorary president in 2006.', 'Through his Luxembourg holding company, Akila Finance, he retains about 4% of the firm.', 'The company now employs more than 33,000 people full-time across 5,100 branches in over 60 countries. ']
abouts: ['Foriel-Destezet has donated to HEC Foundation in France, a 130-year old institution that gives scholarships and grants to students and professors at HEC Paris. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Adi Godrej chairs the $4.6 billion (revenue) Godrej Group, a 120-year-old consumer-goods giant. \r\n', 'The group was established by lawyer Ardeshir Godrej, who gave up his profession to make locks in 1897.', "Key group companies include Godrej Consumer Products, chaired by Adi Godrej's daughter Nisaba and Godrej Properties, run by his son Pirojsha. ", 'The family owns a vast parcel of land in suburban Mumbai that remains its biggest asset.']
abouts: ["Godrej launched the world's first soap made from vegetable oil in 1918.\r\n", "Godrej aerospace engines were used in India's mission to Mars in 2014."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Jamshyd Godrej is chairman and managing director of Godrej & Boyce, the privately held consumer durables arm of the Godrej Group.', 'The $1.6 billion (revenues) firm is best known for its appliances, furniture and security solutions.', "He is the cousin of the Godrej clan's billionaire patriarch, Adi Godrej.", "Jamshyd Godrej's son Navroze, who works with him at Godrej & Boyce, is being groomed to be his successor."]
abouts: ['A U.S.-trained mechanical engineer, Jamshyd is a keen sailor.', 'His sister Smita Crishna-Godrej is also a billionaire.\r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Nadir Godrej is the younger sibling of billionaire Adi Godrej and holds a one-fifth share in the assets of the Godrej Group.\r\n', 'With degrees from MIT, Stanford University and an MBA from Harvard Business School, he joined the family business more than four decades ago.', 'Today he oversees Godrej Industries as managing director and chairs agribusiness unit Godrej Agrovet. ']
abouts: ['Godrej has a flair for languages and poetry and often delivers public speeches in verse form. ', "He is a non-executive director at Mahindra & Mahindra and the Tata group's Indian Hotels. "]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Joseph Grendys runs Koch Foods, a poultry processor that slaughters, ships and sells chicken under its own brands and through private label products.', 'The $3.2 billion (estimated revenues) business makes buffalo wings and chicken strips for Walmart and nuggets for Burger King.', 'Grendys joined Koch in the mid-1980s after graduating from Loyola University, lured by a 50% equity offer from original owner Fred Koch.', 'At the time it was just a one-room shop with 13 employees, and its main business was taking bones out of chicken and cutting up the meat.', 'Grendys bought out his former boss in 1992 and vertically integrated the company by gobbling up smaller feed mills and slaughterhouses.']
abouts: ['Grendys still lives in the modest Chicago split-level home where he grew up.', 'In the summer of 2018, Koch Foods  donated more than 20,000 pounds of chicken to support\r\nthe Carr Fire relief efforts in northern California.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Hedda im Brahm-Droege and her husband Walter Droege founded Droege Group in 1988. It is one of the world's largest advisory and investment practices.", 'Droege Group has a hybrid business model, providing expertise to consulting clients and making "buy-and-build" investments, which is now its focus.', 'By providing capital, management resources and "value-add" know-how, it follows an "Entrepreneurship-as-a-Service" principle in engaging with clients.', 'Droege Group is active in 30 countries and generates around $12 billion in annual revenue.', 'Hedda owns 22% and is vice-chairwoman of the supervisory board. Walter, who serves as CEO and executive managing director, owns the rest.']
abouts: ['Hedda and her husband are avid collectors of contemporary art. ', 'They exhibit pieces by world-renowned artists like Gerhard Richter in their offices, with the aim of giving employees new perspectives on their work.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Ke Zunhong chairs Chengdu Kanghong Pharmaceutical, a maker of products used to treat the nervous system, eyes and digestion problems.', 'Ke once worked in the pharmacy department at a hospital in Chengdu, where Kanghong is headquartered.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Randal Kirk, a former practicing attorney, is the chief executive of biotech conglomerate Intrexon.', 'He achieved his first entrepreneurial success with an injectable drug and vaccine distributor, which eventually sold for $145 million.', 'Intrexon has made waves for its innovative products, like apples that never brown and a genetically modified species of salmon.', 'In June 2018 it announced a partnership with the Gates Foundation to develop a "self-limiting" strain of mosquitoes that will help combat malaria. ']
abouts: ["Kirk's father was a drill sergeant in the U.S. Air Force. ", 'Kirk previously lived on a farm in Virginia, where he was an avid falconer.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['In the early 1960s, Alicia Koplowitz inherited a stake in Spanish construction company Fomento de Construcciones y Contratas after her father died.', 'She sold her stake to sister Esther for $800 million in 1997 and put the money into diverse investments.', "Over the years she's invested in steelmaker Acerinox, electric utility Iberdrola, and Banco Sabadell. ", 'Koplowitz owns hotels in Italy and Miami, real estate in Washington, D.C. and Chicago, as well as a stake in Hospes, a Spanish luxury hotel chain.', 'Her charitable foundation sends Spanish fellows to study child psychiatry in England and the U.S. at Columbia University, Stanford and others.']
abouts: ["In 1969 when she was a teenager she married Alberto Cortina, six months after her sister Esther married Cortina's cousin, Alberto Alcocer. ", 'Koplowitz owns property in Madrid with Amancio Ortega, the Spanish billionaire known for fashion giant Zara.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Kwek Leng Beng is the executive chairman of Singapore's Hong Leong Group, founded by his father in 1941. ", "Kwek is also executive chairman of City Developments, the island state's second-largest property developer. ", 'Amid constraints at home, Kwek has been on an overseas expansion drive in recent years, acquiring assets in the UK, China and Australia.\r\n']
abouts: ["His cousin, Quek Leng Chan, also a billionaire, runs the Hong Leong Group's Malaysian operations.\r\n", 'In 1995, Kwek, together with Saudi billionaire Prince Alwaleed Bin Talal Alsaud, bought the Plaza Hotel in New York City from Donald Trump.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Known as the "Pastry King," Louis Le Duff founded the first Brioche Dorée bakery in Brittany, France with just $2,000 in 1976. ', 'His restaurants now feed 1 million customers every day across 80 countries.  ', "Groupe Le Duff's $2.1 billion in sales comes from 1,310 restaurant locations, including chains La Madeleine French eateries.", "Le Duff owned chain Bruegger's bagels until September 2017, when he sold it to Caribou Coffee Company."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Yusaku Maezawa founded Japan's largest online fashion mall, Zozotown.", "Zozotown's parent firm, Start Today, is listed on the Tokyo Stock Exchange; Maezawa owns about 38% of the company.", 'Maezawa got his start selling CDs and records of his favorite bands by mail from his home. ', 'He collects modern art and plans to build a museum in Chiba, east of Tokyo. ', 'In 2016 he purchased paintings by Jean-Michel Basquiat and Pablo Picasso, spending about $80 million. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Sergio Mantegazza has built a tour and travel empire from Globus, the company his father Antonio founded in 1928. ', 'Today, the travel group includes European river cruises and guided tours in the U.S., the UK, Canada, Australia, and South Africa.', "Mantegazza also owns a significant stake in his family's collection of residential and commercial Lugano real estate.", 'In 2014, he sold his flagging Monarch Airlines to Greybull Capital for £75 million.']
abouts: ['On his "Lady Marina" yacht, Mantegazza has played host to high profile guests that reportedly have included Tina Turner.', "Mantegazza's father got his start with a single gondola ferrying tourists around Lake Lugano."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Hans Melchers derives the lion's share of his fortune from a large stake in HAL Trust, an international investment company based in Monaco. ", 'In the late 1980s, Melchers purchased a chemical manufacturing company.', 'Melchers retired as CEO in 2002, and the company was renamed Melspring.  ']
abouts: ['A passionate fan of bridge, Melchers started his own professional team and provided  funding for the 2011 World Bridge Championship held in the Netherlands.', 'An art collector, Melchers has opened two museums in Netherlands, the first in 2015 and a second in a 14th century castle in 2017.']

name: Billionaires
title: Entrepreneur
bios: ['Erwin Franz Mueller owns an eponymous drugstore chain with over 750 stores across seven European countries.', 'The business dates to 1953, when Mueller opened a hairdressing shop in his home in Ulm, Germany.', 'It has maintained steady top-line growth despite a series of executive departures, reportedly in part due to disagreements with Mueller.', ' In 2016, German authorities stopped court proceedings against Mueller involving him having concealed assets in Swiss private bank J. Safra Sarasin.', 'Mueller sued the bank, and in 2017 a German court ruled that the bank had to pay him $50 million in compensation for incorrect investment advice.']
abouts: ['Mueller is believed to own about $1.2 billion of real estate assets, including a house and a golf course in Mallorca.', 'He married his second wife and former secretary, Anita, in 2006.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Rishad Naoroji is the low-profile cousin of Indian billionaire Adi Godrej and gets his fortune from a one-fifth share of the Godrej family assets.', 'He founded the Raptor Research and Conservation Foundation to focus on the conservation of Asian birds of prey. ', 'The wildlife enthusiast and photographer has never been involved in the business.', 'He also sits on the governing council of the Bombay Natural History Society.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Husnu Ozyegin's Fiba Holding comprises his investments in financial services while non-finance related activities are under the roof of Fina Holding.", 'His Credit Europe Bank has assets of over $9 billion and more than three million customers in nine European and two Asian countries.', 'In Turkey, Ozyegin operates under the brand name Fibabanka. His financial lines of business also include leasing, factoring and insurance.', 'Fiba has investments in retail, real estate, health, renewable energy, ports and hotels. In 2016, Ozyegin bought the Kadikoy Sifa Hospital in Istanbul.', 'In 2017, aiming to secure financing for Turkish companies, Ozyegin cofounded investment bank DOME Group in London with billionaire Ferit Sahenk.']
abouts: ['Husnu Ozyegin came to the U.S. in 1962, at age 18 with just $100, to study civil engineering at Oregon State University. He received his MBA from Harvard.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Son of a rubber trader, Prajogo Pangestu got his start in the timber business in the late 1970s.', 'His company PT Barito Pacific Timber went public in 1993 and changed its name to Barito Pacific after cutting back on its timber business in 2007.', 'In 2007 Barito Pacific acquired 70% of petrochemical firm Chandra Asri, which also trades on the Indonesia Stock Exchange.', "In 2011 Chandra Asri merged with Tri Polyta Indonesia and became the country's largest integrated petrochemical producer.", 'Chandra Asri Petrochemical teamed with French tire manufacturer Michelin in 2015 to develop a synthetic rubber plant in Indonesia.']

name: Billionaires
title: Entrepreneur
bios: ['Jeff Rothschild owes his fortune to Facebook, which he joined in 2005 as the VP of infrastructure engineering.', 'After five years as the VP, Rothschild took on an advisory role, and left Facebook in June 2015.', 'His tech portfolio, however, is not limited to Facebook. He cofounded Veritas Software which merged with Symantec for $13.5 billion in stock in 2004.']
abouts: ['When Facebook hired Rothschild in 2005, it also hired its oldest executive at the time.', "He is the vice chairman of his alma mater Vanderbilt University's trustee board, and donated $20 million to the school just in 2016."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Thomas Siebel's software company C3IoT raised about $100 million from private equity investors in January 2018, at a $1.5 billion valuation.", 'The company, which was initially started as a clean energy firm, is chasing the lucrative Internet of Things market, adding IoT to its name in 2016.', 'Siebel was a salesman at Oracle. He left in 1990, built software firm Siebel Systems and sold it to Oracle for $5.8 billion in cash and stock in 2006.', 'In 2016 he donated $25 million to his alma mater, U. of I. Urbana-Champaign, to build an innovation-focused design center that will bear his name.']
abouts: ['Siebel was attacked by an elephant on a 2009 safari trip in Serengeti; he barely escaped death and has undergone 19 reconstructive surgeries.', 'Siebel owns a 90,000-acre ranch in Wolf Creek, Montana where he raises over 1,000 cattle and produces 500,000 pounds of beef annually.']

name: Billionaires
title: Investor
bios: ['Paul Singer founded his hedge fund firm, Elliott Management, in 1977 with just $1.3 million.', 'The firm now has some $34 billion in assets under management.', 'Elliott Management often takes activist positions, shaking up companies and even governments around the world.', 'In 2016 the hedge fund firm settled a 15-year battle with the government of Argentina over bond payments, earning a $2.4 billion profit.']
abouts: ['Singer is regarded for his political engagement, particularly in support of conservative causes. He has also backed LGBT rights and pro-Israel efforts.', 'Despite warning that Donald Trump\'s election could cause a "widespread global depression," he reportedly gave $1 million to Trump\'s inaugural committee.']

name: Billionaires
title: Chairman and CEO
employment: {'name': 'Hunter Douglas N.V.', 'title': 'Chairman and CEO', 'government': False, 'featuredExecutive': False}
bios: ['Blinds baron Ralph Sonnenberg is executive chairman of Netherlands-based Hunter Douglas Group.', 'His sons, Marko and David, were appointed as co-presidents and CEOs in 2015. ', "Sonnenberg's father founded the maker of window coverings and architectural products in 1919 as a machine-tool manufacturer.", 'Eventually the company developed the technology for the production of flexible aluminum slats for Venetian blinds.', "Sonnenberg and his sons own upwards of 80% of the company's stock."]
abouts: ["The company doesn't just supply homeowners. The world's tallest building, Dubai's Burj Khalifa tower, sports blinds and ceiling systems by Hunter Douglas.", 'The company was founded in Dusseldorf, Germany, but in 1933, founder Henry Sonnenberg put the entire facility onto 150 railroad cars and moved it all to Rotterdam.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Jon Stryker's grandfather founded Stryker Corp., which sold $12.4 billion in medical equipment and software in 2017.", 'He is president and founder of the Arcus Foundation, which supports the advancement of LGBT human rights and the conservation of great apes.', 'Stryker has given away $550 million in his lifetime. In June, he committed $20 million for scholarships at his alma mater Kalamazoo College.', "In 2016, he and his sister, Pat Stryker, gave $10 million to fund the nation's first memorial to the victims of racial terror lynchings."]
abouts: ['Stryker married his long-time partner Slobodan Randjelovic in December 2016.', 'A monkey species, Rhinopithecus strykeri, is named for him as a result of his efforts to protect monkeys and apes.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Austrian builder and investor Georg Stumpf started the Stumpf Group in 1994 with a $35,000 loan from his father.', 'Its biggest asset is M+W Group, a high-tech EPC construction firm based in Stuttgart, Germany that specializes in semiconductors.', 'He also built the Millennium Tower, the tallest building in Vienna, and sold it to German fund MCP in 2003.']
abouts: ['His villa in Vienna has a movie theater, an indoor swimming pool, and a garage that fits 40 cars.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Tsai Hong-tu chairs Cathay Financial Holdings, a financial services company that made his father Taiwan's wealthiest man before he died. ", 'His father, Tsai Wan-lin, died in 2004. ', 'Brothers Cheng-da and T.Y. are billionaires, as are their cousins Richard and Daniel Tsai.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['The son of a truck driver from Brooklyn, Vincent Viola started electronic-trading firm Virtu Financial in 2008 and took the company public in 2015. ', 'Virtu bought one of its speed-trading rivals, KCG Holdings Inc, for $1.4 billion and completed the merger in June 2017. ', 'Viola graduated from West Point in 1977 and New York Law School in 1983. ', 'Viola is the owner of the NHL Florida Panthers. ', 'In 2003 he founded the Combating Terrorism Center at West Point to provide education and research about global terrorism.']
abouts: ['Donald Trump appointed Viola to be Secretary of the Army in December 2016 but \r\nViola withdrew his nomination two months later citing business conflicts. \r\n', 'Vincent Viola was a former infantry officer who served in the 101st Airborne Division. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Real estate mogul Radovan Vitek got his start during Slovakia's voucher privatization in the 1990s.", 'He moved to the Czech Republic in 1997, where he took over a cooperative and turned the headquarters into a luxury hotel.', 'In 2017, his CPI Property Group acquired 11 shopping centers in the Czech Republic, Hungary, Poland and Romania.']
abouts: ['Besides a home in Prague, Vitek owns a 260-acre estate in Surrey, England that formerly belonged to ex-Beatle Ringo Starr.', "He also owns a house in the Swiss Alps and a villa on St. Bart's Island in the West Indies. "]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Wang Laichun chairs electronics manufacturer Luxshare Precision Industry, a producer of electronics connectors that counts Apple as a customer.', "She worked for 10 years for Taiwan billionaire Terry Gou's Hon Hai Precision Industry (also known as Foxconn).", 'She left in 1999 and in 2004 teamed up with her brother Laisheng to buy Luxshare; he is now vice chairman.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Wang Laisheng is vice chairman of Shenzhen-headquartered electronics manufacturer Luxshare Precision Industry.', 'Luxhare, whose products include connectors and wireless headphones, is a supplier to Apple. ', 'Wang started his own business in the mid-1980s, and later teamed up with sister Wang Laichun in 1999 to buy Luxshare.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Carlos Ardila Lülle built a fortune selling soda and got even richer by investing in bottling companies, radio and TV stations, and sugar refineries.', "He started his career working for his father-in-law's soda company, where he created an apple-flavored drink that quickly became a top seller. ", 'In 1973 he bought his first radio station and built Radio Canal Nacional by acquiring smaller stations.', 'When the Colombian government privatized television in 1998, he started RCN TV, now worth significantly more than his radio properties.', 'In 2012 he partnered with Rupert Murdoch to create MundoFox, a Spanish-language channel targeted at U.S. Hispanics; it shut down in 2016.']
abouts: ['Ardila Lülle had a brief stint in politics between 1970 and 1974 as a state senator from the Colombian Conservative Party.', 'He owns Colombian soccer team Atletico Nacional, which has won more championship titles in the Colombian soccer league (16) than any other team.']

name: Billionaires
title: Co-Chief Executive Officer and Co-founder
employment: {'name': 'Carlyle Group', 'title': 'Co-Chief Executive Officer and Co-founder', 'government': False}
bios: ['William Conway Jr. is one of three billionaire founders of private equity firm Carlyle Group.', 'Conway stepped down as co-CEO in January 2018 and now serves as co-executive chairman with cofounder and billionaire David Rubenstein.', 'The trio took Carlyle public on the Nasdaq exchange in 2012, and the firm now has about $210 billion in assets under management.  ', 'They used their Beltway connections--George H.W. Bush was among their advisers--to invest in defense-oriented companies. ', 'Before founding Carlyle he was the chief financial officer of telecom company MCI Communications. ', 'Conway is a big donor to poverty alleviation and education. His most recent pledges include $10 million to University of Maryland School of Nursing.']
abouts: ["Conway was owner of Merrywood, Jackie O's childhood home in McLean, Virginia, until 2005 when he sold the estate to former AOL CEO Steve Chase for $24.5 million.", 'Conway went to night school for his MBA at the University of Chicago Booth School.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Daniel D'Aniello is one of three billionaire founders of private equity firm Carlyle Group.", 'He stepped down as chairman in January 2018 and now serves as chairman emeritus of Carlyle, which has $210 billion in assets under management. ', "D'Aniello worked at Trans World Airlines, Pepsi and Marriott before joining William Conway and David Rubenstein to start Carlyle in 1987.", 'He attended Syracuse University on a scholarship, studying transportation economics, and later got his M.B.A. at Harvard.', "A Vietnam War veteran, D'Aniello contributed $20 million to Syracuse University's National Veterans Resource Center in 2018."]
abouts: ["At age 9, D'Aniello worked as a stock boy at his uncle's produce market. ", "D'Aniello was on the gymnastics team at Syracuse University. "]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Jim Davis is cofounder of Allegis Group, the world's largest privately-held staffing company. ", 'He founded Allegis (then called Aerotek) in 1983 with his cousin Steve Bisciotti, who is also a billionaire.', 'Allegis now has offices on four continents and boasts annual revenue north of $12 billion. ']
abouts: ["Davis is a minority owner of the MLB's St. Louis Cardinals. ", 'His private charitable foundation, the Davis Family Foundation, has more than $500 million in assets.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Ding Shijia is the deputy chairman of Anta Sports, one of China's largest homegrown sportswear and footwear brands.", 'Partnering with NBA stars including Kevin Garnett and Rajon Rondo has helped Anta over the years surpass once-larger rival Li Ning.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["John Dorrance is an heir to the Campbell's Soup fortune; his grandfather invented Campbell's formula for condensed soup.", "His relatives are still the company's largest shareholders, but he sold his stake in the mid-1990's and emigrated to Ireland.", "His move was presumably timed to avoid capital gains taxes when he sold his Campbell's stake.", 'The Irish government reportedly gave Dorrance citizenship when he spent $1.5 million planting trees.']

name: Billionaires
title: Cofounder
bios: ['Doris Fisher cofounded clothing retailer Gap in 1969 with her husband, Don (d. 2009), after the couple struggled to find jeans that fit him.', 'The couple raised $63,000 to open their first store, which sold jeans and music, in San Francisco.', "Doris Fisher served as the company's merchandiser from the day it opened until 2003 and sat on Gap's board until 2009.", 'The 1953 Stanford economics graduate cofounded the KIPP Foundation, which supports public charter schools, donating $15 million.', 'The Doris and Donald Fisher Fund has granted more than $60 million to the KIPP Foundation since its founding.']
abouts: ['Gap is short for "generation gap." The Fishers agreed on the name after Doris nixed her husband\'s original idea, "Pants and Discs."', "The Fishers amassed a $1 billion art collection, including works by Andy Warhol and Gerhard Richter, now on display in San Francisco's Museum of Modern Art."]

name: Billionaires
title: President
bios: ["John Fisher is the youngest of Gap founders Doris and Donald Fisher's three sons and the only brother who does not sit on Gap's board. ", "He is a majority owner of the Oakland A's baseball team and has smaller stakes in MLS' San Jose Earthquakes and the Scottish Glasgow Celtic F.C.", 'John is a founding partner of investment firm Sansome Partners and sits on the board of the Silicon Schools Fund.', 'John is a chairman of the Knowledge Is Power Program Foundation (KIPP), a non-profit network of public charter schools. ']
abouts: ["The three Fisher brothers attended Princeton University and went on to study at Stanford University's School of Business. "]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Caroline Hagen Kjos became chairman of her family's Canica AS holding company in 2014.", 'The Swiss resident also received a majority stake in Canica at at that time.', 'Her father, billionaire Stein Erik Hagen, founded discount supermarket Rimi with his father in the 1970s.', "It merged with Sweden's ICA group in 1998 and later with Dutch retailer Ahold; Hagen eventually sold his stake, forming Canica AS with the proceeds.", 'Canica AS now has a number of investments across Scandinavia, including goods manufacturer Orkla ASA and hardware store chain Jernia.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Kieu Hoang is vice chairman of Shanghai RAAS Blood Products Co.; he owns about 35% of the Shenzhen Stock Exchange-listed company.', 'Hoang was born poor in Vietnam and immigrated to the U.S. with his family in 1975 as the last of the American troops were pulling out of the country.', "He found his way into a job at Abbott Reference Laboratories, and became director of the company's blood plasma testing and manufacturing division. ", 'In 1980, Hoang founded a company called Rare Antibody Antigen Supply and began to acquire plasma centers in the U.S.', 'A collaboration with the Shanghai Blood Center in China in 1987 led Hoang to found Shanghai RAAS Blood Products in 1988.']
abouts: ['In 2014 Hoang bought a winery and vineyards from the Mondavi Family Estate in Napa Valley,  now called the Kieu Hoang Winery.', 'Hoang, who lives in Southern California, has donated some $1 million for poverty relief in Vietnam.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["The heart of Huang Shih Tsai's property empire is in booming Shenzhen, where real estate prices have remained strong.", 'His privately-held Greater China International Group owns the International Financial Center, a Hilton Hotel and GC Square, a commercial site.\r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['H. Wayne Huizenga hit it big in several industries, starting with garbage collection.', 'At 25, Huizenga started a waste pickup service, and within 5 years had consolidated 100 other pickup companies into giant Waste Management.', 'After taking Waste Management public in 1971, he bought and expanded Blockbuster Video before selling it to Viacom for $8.4 billion in 1994.', 'He also created waste disposal firm Republic Services, lodging firm Extended Stay America and car retailer AutoNation.', 'In 2015, Huizenga sold the U.S. operations of Swisher, a service to clean bathrooms at restaurants and shops, to hygiene firm Ecolab for $40 million.']
abouts: ['Huizenga got his start with $5,000 he borrowed from his father to buy a single garbage truck.', 'Aiming to build a sporting empire in Florida, he brought both baseball and hockey to the state as the initial owner of the Florida Marlins and Florida Panthers.']

name: Billionaires
title: Founder, CEO
bios: ['Osman Kibar is the founder and CEO of biotech firm Samumed.  ', 'Samumed said it raised $438 million in August 2018 to further its work developing drugs to reverse aging, claiming a valuation of $12.4 billion.', 'The names of investors in the round were not disclosed.', 'While getting a Ph.D. from the University of California, San Diego, he founded two companies, but did not have a management role in either.', 'He then founded Samumed in 2008 in a Pfizer incubator, but had a falling out with the drug giant; Samumed now operates independent of Pfizer.']
abouts: ['Kibar was born in Izmir, Turkey, on the Aegean Coast and met most of his fellow Samumed executives at boarding school in Istanbul. ', 'In 2006 Kibar won the first poker tournament he ever played in and a year later came in second out of 3,000 players at a World Series of Poker tournament.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Indian-born plastics tycoon, Aloke Lohia, is the younger brother of Sri Prakash Lohia, one of Indonesia's richest.", "The Bangkok resident runs $8.4 billion (revenue) Indorama Ventures, the world's largest producer of PET polymer by capacity. ", 'To expand its global footprint, Indorama has been on an acquisition spree with 16 acquisitions since 2014. ', "Bullish on his country of origin, Lohia has a joint venture with India's Dhunseri Petrochem to make polyester resin in eastern India. "]
abouts: ['Lohia has lunch with his wife, Suchitra, who works with him, nearly every day. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Taha Mikati is the cofounder, with his billionaire brother Najib, of Beirut-based holding company M1 Group. ', 'Its investments include stakes in South African telecom firm MTN, fashion retailer Pepe Jeans, and prime real estate in New York, London and Monaco.', "Mikati and his brother Najib founded Investcom in 1982, selling satellite phones at the height of Lebanon's civil war.", 'They expanded into Africa where they built cellphone towers in Ghana, Liberia, and Benin, among other countries. ', "In 2005, Investcom went public on the London Stock Exchange, and in 2009, South Africa's MTN bought the Mikatis' stake for $3.6 billion."]
abouts: ['Mikati bought a bunch of satellite phones and sold them to friends and associates in Beirut in the early 80s for $50,000 apiece.', 'His son Azmi is the CEO of M1 Group.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Philip Niarchos, the oldest son of the late shipping magnate Stavros Niarchos, inherited much of his father's art collection.", "The collection was purchased in 1957 for $3 million from actor Edward G. Robinson and includes some of the world's most recognizable pieces.", 'It is said to be the largest private collection of Van Gogh\'s work, notably his ear-less self portrait, and includes Picasso\'s iconic "Yo, Picasso." ', 'Since inheriting the collection, Philip has added post-war and contemporary works, including pieces by Andy Warhol and Maurizio Cattelan.']
abouts: ["Andy Warhol rendered CAT scans of Philip's head into a series of paintings called Phillip's Skull, completed in 1985. ", 'In 1982 Philip bought a self-portrait by Haitian-American artist Jean-Michel Basquiat for a then-record $3.3 million.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Stefan Olsson is a part owner of Stena Sphere, a privately held Swedish conglomerate. ', 'Interests include cruising, shipping, offshore drilling, property and metal recycling.', "Stena was founded in 1939 as a trading company by Stefan's father, Sten.", 'His brother Dan took over in 1983 and now owns 51% of the company. Stefan and his sister Madeleine Olsson Eriksson own 24.5% and 12.5%, respectively.', "The third generation in the family is finally getting involved, Madeleine's kids Gustav  and Marie each own 6%."]
abouts: ['London resident, Olsson is a catholic priest.', 'Olsson is a honorary director of the Royal Opera House in London, and often lends financial support to put up shows.']

name: Billionaires
title: President
bios: ['Sebastian Pinera was elected president of Chile in December 2017. He took office in March 2018. ', "Pinera previously served as Chile's president from 2010 until 2014. ", 'He made a fortune from credit card company Bancard, which he founded in 1976. ', 'He divested many assets over the years. After the 2010 election he unloaded his 26% stake in Chilean airline LAN for $1.5 billion.', 'He also sold TV channel Chilevision to Time Warner for a reported $150 million, and sold his share of popular soccer team Blanco & Negro. ']
