bios: ['John Whittaker runs The Peel Group, a large British conglomerate that holds stakes in property, media and infrastructure businesses.', 'Known as a visionary with a penchant for regeneration projects, Whittaker got his start in the 1970s acquiring cotton mills for their land.', "His group has developed several well-known buildings, including Manchester's MediaCityUK and Trafford Centre mall.", 'The Lancashire-native now lives on the Isle of Man, an island of the North-West coast of the UK.']
abouts: ['A devout catholic, Whittaker reportedly once considered joining the priesthood.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Wu Guangming is founder and chairman of China's Jiangsu Yuyue Medical Equipment & Supply.", 'The company is a supplier of blood pressure monitors and diagnostic equipment.', "Wu was born in a fisherman's family, and cofounded the predecessor of Yuyue with his father in 1990s."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Xu Qiming made his earliest money in eel farming at his China Xulong Group, one of China's largest eel exporters.", "Over the years Xu has built on his eel fortune with one of China's best private art collections.", 'SInce 2010, Xu has donated at least 6 pieces of art to the National Museum of China.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Zhang Xiaojuan is a cofounder of Shanghai-listed YTO Express Group, one of China's largest express delivery firms.\r\n", 'Zhang is classmate of fellow delivery billionaire, STO Chairman Chen Dejun.\r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Melih Abdulhayoglu's Comodo, which he founded in 1998 in the U.K., produces digital security products, notably SSL certificates for websites.", 'He moved the company to New Jersey in 2004.', 'According to research company W3Techs, Comodo controls 38.3% (6 points ahead of its closest competitor) of the $4 billion SSL market.', 'In November 2017, he sold 50% of Comodo to private equity firm Francisco Partners for an undisclosed sum.', 'Another Abdulhayoglu venture, eZLO, produces smart home automation technology that is compatible with Amazon Alexa.']
abouts: ['He earned his first money in 1989 by winning a patent prize of 5,000 British Pounds offered by the British government. ', 'His invention was a keyboard that could perform translations into multiple languages with one stroke.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Radhe Shyam Agarwal gets his wealth from a one-third stake in consumer goods company Emami, which he cofounded with his buddy Radhe Shyam Goenka.', "Emami's range of more than 300 products, including popular brands Zandu balm and antiseptic cream Boroplus, are sold through 4 million retail outlets. ", 'Agarwal also has interests in cement, edible oils and healthcare.\r\n']
abouts: ['Agarwal and Goenka were school friends who gave up corporate jobs to start Emami in 1974.', "Emami introduced India's first fairness cream for men in 2005."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Mohamed Al Fayed was born in Alexandria, Egypt and moved in the mid-1960s to the U.K., where he made his fortune. ', "He's best known for being the one-time owner of London department store Harrod's, which he sold to Qatar for a reported $2.4 billion in 2010.", 'He owns the storied Ritz Paris hotel. After a four-year renovation, it reopened in 2016. Suites are named after illustrious guests, like Coco Chanel.', 'In 2013, Al Fayed sold Fulham Football Club to U.S. auto parts billionaire Shahid Khan for a reported $300 million.\r\n']
abouts: ["Al Fayed's son Dodi died in a car crash with Princess Diana in 1997.", 'He owns a Scottish castle and a sprawling estate called Balnagown near Inverness, where guests can rent out cottages.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Faisal Bin Qassim Al Thani is the chairman of Al Faisal Holding, one of Qatar's biggest conglomerates, which he founded in 1964. ", 'It owns more than 20 hotels around the world, including the St. Regis in Washington, D.C. and Miami, and the W Hotel in London.', 'Al Faisal Holding also has a majority stake in publicly-traded Aamal, which owns real estate in Qatar and sells medical supplies and pharmaceuticals.', 'Al Thani started selling car parts in Doha at age 16. He became the sole distributor of Bridgestone tires in the 1960s.']
abouts: ['Al Thani is a distant relative of the Qatari royal family.', 'A museum in Doha houses his collection of more than 15,000 artifacts, including antique cars, ancient coins and Islamic art.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Bill Austin owns Starkey Hearing Technologies, the largest hearing aid manufacturer in the U.S. ', 'He bought, a hearing aid parts shop, which was then called Starkey Labs, for $13,000 in 1970. ', "It's been a tumultuous climb recently with Austin firing several top executives in 2015. ", 'That move unleashed a series of events that most recently resulted in the former company president being found guilty of federal fraud charges.', 'Austin spends much of his time traveling to developing countries for his Starkey Hearing Foundation, distributing hearing aids.']
abouts: ["Starkey's customers have reportedly included five U.S. presidents, two popes and singer Dolly Parton.", 'Starkey Hearing Foundation says it has donated some 1 million hearing aids around the world.']

name: Billionaires
title: Founder
bios: ["One of Wall Street's macro-trading legends, Louis Bacon cut his teeth as a commodities and currencies trader, earning big profits in the 1987 crash.", 'He created hedge fund Moore Capital in 1989 using trading profits and a small inheritance.', "Bacon's Moore Capital hedge fund manages $13.4 billion in assets and is not knocking out the kind of impressive returns that it used to score."]
abouts: ["Bacon's environmental preservation-focused Moore Charitable Trust was defrauded out of $25 million by jailed banker Andy Caspersen."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Property developer's son Achal Bakeri branched out into manufacturing in 1988 by borrowing $1,500 from his father. \r\n", "Today his Bombay Stock Exchange-listed Symphony is the world's biggest producer of air coolers selling 1.2 million units annually in 60 countries. \r\n", 'Symphony also owns Munters Keruilai, a Swedish-Chinese joint venture, which gives it a foothold in China and the Asean region. ']
abouts: ['Symphony air coolers are used in such places as the walkways at Heathrow airport, Wal-Mart stores and temples in India. ', "Bakeri's assets include a share in the family's real estate holdings in and around Ahmedabad city.\r\n"]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Othman Benjelloun is CEO of BMCE Bank of Africa, which has a presence in more than 20 African countries.', 'His father was a shareholder in RMA Watanya, a Moroccan insurance company; Benjelloun built it into a leading insurer.  ', 'Through his holding company FinanceCom, he has a stake in the Moroccan arm of French telecom firm Orange.']
abouts: ['He co-owns Ranch Adarouch, one of the biggest cattle breeders in Africa.', 'Benjelloun and his wife received the David Rockefeller Bridging Leadership Award for building schools in rural Morocco in 2016.']

name: Billionaires
title: Chairman and CEO
bios: ['William R. Berkley founded insurance firm W.R. Berkley with only $2,500 in 1967 while he was getting his MBA from Harvard.', 'His company, which went public in 1974, insures everything from mobile surgery units to jewels to fine art and has operations in 60 countries.', 'Berkley stepped down from CEO in 2015 but remains chairman; he owns 20% of the company, which generated more than $7 billion in sales in 2017.', 'His son, William Robert Berkley Jr., is the current CEO and president.']
abouts: ['Berkeley chairs the board of trustees of NYU, his alma mater.', 'He has historically been an active political donor, contributing to Democratic campaigns over the years.']

name: Billionaires
title: Investor
bios: ['Aneel Bhusri is CEO of business software firm Workday, which he cofounded with Dave Duffield, the founder of PeopleSoft.', 'Bhusri started his career in the early 1990s at business software firm PeopleSoft, where he rose to become vice chairman. ', "He also works as an advisory partner at venture capital firm Greylock Partners; he's been on the Forbes Midas List six times since 2008. ", 'He studied electrical engineering at Brown University and has an MBA from Stanford. ', "In May 2018, Bhusri joined the Giving Pledge, a commitment by the world's wealthiest people to dedicate the majority of their wealth to philanthropy."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['O. Francis Biondi cofounded hedge fund King Street Capital Management in 1995 with fellow First Boston alum Brian Higgins.', "He's a managing director for the firm, which has $19 billion in assets as of June 30, 2017.", 'King Street focuses on out-of-favor investments in stocks and bonds.']
abouts: ['Biondi and Higgins also run the King Street Charitable Trust, whose grant recipients include his alma mater Yale, Memorial Sloane Kettering and others.', "He's married to Jamie Nicholls, a former Forstmann Little partner and alum of Amherst College."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['John Bloor is one of the largest builders in the UK through his Bloor Homes and also owns Triumph Motorcycles, the iconic bike manufacturer.', 'He reportedly left school at age 15 and began an apprenticeship as a plasterer, then built his first house before turning 20.', 'Now the privately-held Bloor Homes puts up more than 2,000 homes every year.', 'In 1983 he bought the manufacturing rights for Triumph motorcycles.', 'He and son Nick have revamped the brand, which was made famous by riders like Marlon Brando, James Dean and Steve McQueen.']

name: Billionaires
title: Chairman and CEO
bios: ['When David Booth cofounded Dimensional Fund Advisors in 1981, he began a decades-long experiment in applying academic theory to real-world investing.', "His former professor Eugene Fama authored the efficient markets hypothesis, which argues that it's impossible to consistently beat the market.", "In light of Fama's research, Booth eschewed stock picking and focused on offering investors low-cost, passive mutual funds.", 'Dimensional now manages more than $580 billion in assets, most of which is steered via hand-vetted financial advisors.', 'In May 2018, Booth joined the Giving Pledge and committed to donate over half of his wealth to charity.']
abouts: ["Booth paid $4.3 million for James Naismith's original rules of basketball, written in 1891, which is now displayed at the University of Kansas.", 'In 2008, Booth donated $300 million to the University of Chicago, which is still the largest gift in its history.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Cai Wensheng is the founder and chairman of Meitu, a Chinese photo-touch-up app created to improve selfies.', ' Meitu also sells smartphones with large pixel cameras.', 'Cai is an angel investor in Chinese startups.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Although Ahmet Calik built his fortune on denim, selling to Diesel, Levi's, Gap and other Western brands, textiles are now ancillary.", 'With a footprint stretching from Turkey and the Middle East to Eastern Europe and Central Asia, Calik is active in construction, banking, telecom and mining.', 'Calik Holding has a partnership with Mitsubishi Corp. dating back to 1990s, when the companies began collaborating on plant construction in Central Asia.', 'In 2015, Mitsubishi acquired 4.5% of Calik Energy, which serves five cities in Turkey and has projects in such places as Turkmenistan, Libya, Georgia and Yemen.', 'Besides providing services to energy plants, the company has electricity and gas distribution businesses and a portfolio of power generation assets.']
abouts: ['Over a period of three years through 2021, Calik Holding will undertake energy and construction projects costing around $6 billion.\r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Michel Chalhoub started a business licensing foreign brands in Damascus, Syria in 1955. ', 'The firm initially began with the rights to sell just three French brands, Christofle, Baccarat and Jean Patou.', 'Today the Chalhoub Group, now based in Dubai and run by sons Anthony and Patrick, employs more than 12,000 people in 14 countries.', 'The company runs a network of 650 retail stores with brands including Chanel, Louis Vuitton and Christian Louboutin, across the Middle East. \r\n']
abouts: ['Chalhoub and his wife Widad, who were both passionate about French culture, decided to open the first Christofle boutique in Damascus together decades ago.', "Chalhoub is the owner of what's possibly the biggest shoe store in the world. Located in Dubai, Level Shoe District spans over 96,000 square feet.  \r\n"]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Chen Xiaoying is the sister of Chen Dejun, the billionaire chairman and co-founder with Xiaoying of China logistics firm STO.', "Chen Xiaoying's fortune comes from a stake in China express delivery firm STO where she was formally president."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Cho Jung-ho is the chairman of Meritz Financial Group. ', 'He is the youngest of the four sons of Cho Choong-hoon, the late founder of Hanjin Group, the parent company of Korean Air.  ', 'He worked for Korean Airlines in Europe and returned home in 1989 as a director with Hanjin Investment & Securities, as Meritz was then named. ']
abouts: ["Cho's father started out with a single truck and went on to build an empire based mostly on transportation. ", "He has outstripped his brothers in wealth and success; Meritz's value has multiplied since it broke away from the Hanjin Group in 2005. "]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Turgay Ciner (pronounced "jin-ner"), who worked as an errand boy in tea shops during high school, presides over a fortune built on soda ash.', "Soda ash is used in making glass, detergents and various industrial products. Ciner's Eti Soda has helped make Turkey the world's top producer.", 'In 2015, Ciner acquired a controlling interest in a huge soda ash facility in Green River, Wyoming; it trades publicly under the name Ciner Resources.', 'Ciner has tapped financing from the Industrial and Commercial Bank of China to expand soda ash production in Turkey and make big energy investments.', "Ciner's Silopi Electric, in Turkey's Southeastern Anatolia region, generates power from thermal plants fueled by coal extracted Ciner mines."]
abouts: ["Businesses controlled by Ciner, with total annual production capacity of seven million tons, comprise the world's largest producer of soda ash.", 'His brother and he imported automobiles from Germany and had a shop in Istanbul Talimhane, now site of the modern headquarters building of Ciner Publishing Holding.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Steve Conine is cofounder and co-chairman of online home goods retailer Wayfair.', 'He started the business in 2002 with Niraj Shah, a fellow billionaire. The two met as high school students at a summer program at Cornell University.', 'Wayfair, which now offers more than 10 million products, brought in sales of $4.7 billion in 2017, up 40% from the previous year.', 'Both Conine and Shah were named 2018 Cornell Entrepreneurs of the Year.']
abouts: ['Conine is a competitive mountain biker who has traveled the globe competing in races. ', "Conine's hobbies include woodworking, wake boarding, ice carving and stand-up paddle boarding."]

name: Billionaires
organization: Alimentation Couche Tard Inc. Cl A
title: Entrepreneur
employment: {'name': 'Alimentation Couche Tard Inc. Cl A', 'title': 'Vice President and Cofounder', 'government': False}
bios: ["Jacques D'Amours cofounded Canadian convenience store conglomerate Alimentation Couche-Tard in 1980.", "He retired as VP of administration in 2014, but remains on the company's board and is its second-largest shareholder.", 'Couche-Tard has ballooned by snatching up competitors, including Circle K in 2003 and Scandinavian giant Statoil Fuel & Retail in 2012.', 'In June 2017 the company bought Texas-based CST Brands for $4.4 billion, including debt.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Robert Defares presides over Amsterdam-based electronic trading firm IMC B.V., which he cofounded in 1989.', 'Defares is now the sole CEO of IMC after former Co-CEO Wiet H.M. Pot. left the board in  September 2017. ', 'Defares owns a majority stake in the firm, which has 532 employees and revenues of $591 million.', 'IMC is based in Amsterdam, with offices in Chicago, Hong Kong and Sydney. ', 'Defares studied economics at the Free University in Amsterdam.']

name: Billionaires
bios:
['Alexander Dzhaparidze started out buying outdated seismic facilities abroad in the 1990s and offering exploration services in Russia.
', 'Dzhaparidze founded service company Petroalliance, which he later sold to Schlumberger.', "He bought oil giant Lukoil's drilling subsidiary for $130 million in 2004 and turned it into Eurasia Drilling Company.
", 'In 2017 Eurasia Drilling announced that its shareholders agreed to sell 51% of the company to Schlumberger.
']
abouts: ['Dhaparidze collects ancient daggers. \r\n', "In 2016 Dhaparidze bought a yacht, which he renamed 'Here Comes the Sun' after The Beatles song."]

name: Billionaires
title: Co-founder and CEO
bios: ['Stephen Feinberg cofounded private equity firm Cerberus Capital Management in 1992.', "Under Feinberg's leadership, Cerberus has generated some excellent returns, and some abysmal PR.", 'The firm attracted negative attention in 2013 for its stake in Freedom Group, which manufactured the rifle used in the Sandy Hook massacre.', 'Cerberus has recently achieved more success with its investment in grocery chain Albertsons and its global real estate funds.', 'In May 2018, President Trump selected Feinberg to lead his intelligence advisory board. ']

name: Billionaires
title: Chairman
bios: ["Oil refiner Tesoro bought Paul Foster's Western Refining for $6.4 billion in 2017; the combined company was renamed Andeavor. ", 'In April 2018, Marathon announced it would buy Andeavor for $23.3 billion; the deal has not yet closed. ', 'As a teenager Paul Foster got his start in the oil fields, welding pipes, digging ditches, and cleaning tanks.', 'A graduate of Baylor University and a registered CPA, Foster handled the books for small oil refineries across the Southwest. ', 'He and partners took over bankrupt El Paso Refining in 1992. Five years later he bought out his partners.   ']
abouts: ['Foster is a vice chairman of the University of Texas System Board of Regents. ', 'He is a part owner of the El Paso Chihuahuas, a Triple-A baseball team, and is working towards bringing a new stadium to the city. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Mario Gabelli runs Gamco, a mutual fund and investment firm he founded in 1977.', "Gabelli's reputation for stock-picking took off in the 80s when he found success betting on the media and telecom sectors. ", 'In 1965 he graduated first in his class from the Fordham College of Business Administration.', "He was reportedly Wall Street's highest paid chief executive when he took home $85 million in 2013.", 'Gabelli gave at least $25 million to his alma mater Fordham, which named its undergraduate business college after the billionaire.']
abouts: ['A life-long contrarian, even as a schoolboy Gabelli refused to hide with classmates during air raid drills.', 'Gabelli bought his first stocks when he was 13 years old. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Marcos Galperin is founder and CEO of e-commerce platform MercadoLibre, the eBay of Latin America.', 'MercadoLibre, which operates in 18 Latin American countries and Portugal, went public in 2007 on the Nasdaq.', 'Galperin majored in economics and finance at the University of Pennsylvania and got an MBA from Stanford University.', 'He worked at Argentine oil company YPF for three years and as a summer intern at JPMorgan before starting MercadoLibre in 1999.']
abouts: ["eBay, once MercadoLibre's largest shareholder with 18%, sold its stake in 2016 for more than $1 billion.", "Galperin helped organize Argentina's first-ever presidential debate ahead of the country's 2015 elections."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Radhe Shyam Goenka gets his wealth from a one-third stake in consumer goods company Emami, which he cofounded with his buddy Radhe Shyam Agarwal.', "Emami's range of more than 300 products, including popular brands Zandu balm and antiseptic cream Boroplus, are sold through 4 million retail outlets.", 'Goenka also has interests in cement, edible oils and healthcare.']
abouts: ['Goenka and Agarwal were school friends who gave up corporate jobs to start Emami in 1974.', "Emami introduced India's first fairness cream for men in 2005."]

name: Billionaires
title: Chief Executive Officer
bios: ['Christopher "Kit" Goldsbury\'s fortune comes from selling salsa maker Pace Foods to Campbell Soup for $1.12 billion in 1994. ', "Goldsbury worked at Pace in 1969, two years after marrying founder David Pace's daughter Linda. He became president in 1977. ", 'The San Antonio billionaire is backing the revitalization of the downtown Pearl neighborhood through his private equity firm Silver Ventures. ']
abouts: ["Kit Goldsbury began working on the assembly line at Pace Foods in 1969, two years after marrying founder David Pace's daughter, Linda Pace. ", 'After Goldsbury and Linda separated in 1987, Goldsbury purchased her half for $95 million, a fraction for what he sold it for seven years later. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['The son of a Greek Cypriot shipping magnate, Stelios Haji-Ioannou gets the bulk of his fortune from his stake in budget airline easyJet.', 'Stelios founded easyJet in 1995 and now maintains ownership of the easy brand through his private company, easyGroup, based in London. ', 'He licenses the brand to such customers as easyHotel, easyCar and easyBus, all of which offer discounted value to customers.', 'In 2017, Stelios joined the Giving Pledge, in which he committed to donate a portion of his annual income each year to various charitable causes.']
abouts: ['His siblings, Clelia and Polys, are both billionaires and hold slightly smaller stakes in easyJet. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Ilkka Herlin is the great-grandson of famed Finnish business leader Harald Herlin, who invested in Kone Elevators in 1924.', "After his father's death in 2003, Ilkka and his siblings discovered the will had been rewritten leaving most of the ownership in Kone to their brother Antti.", 'Angered that they had never been informed, the siblings battled for control. The dispute ended in 2005, with Kone being split in two. ', 'Antti maintained control over the elevator business while his siblings were given stakes in Cargotec, producer of machinery for heavy duty ship cargo.', 'Niklas, one of the sibling, passed away in 2017. Three of the siblings are billionaires.']
abouts: ['Ilkka Herling has a PhD in History from the University of Helsingfors.', 'He is one of the founders of Baltic Sea Action Group, a trust for the conservation of the Baltic Sea, and is involved in project for carbon capture technology.']

name: Billionaires
title: Investor
bios: ['Brian Higgins is the cofounder of King Street Capital Management, a distressed-debt focused hedge fund.', "He started King Street in 1995 with fellow billionaire O. Francis Biondi, whom he met on First Boston's high-yield desk in the late 1980's.", 'King Street Capital Management managed $19 billion of assets as of June 30, 2017. ']
abouts: ["He and cofounder Francis Biondi manage the King Street Charitable Trust, which donates to medical research and Villanova, Higgins' alma mater, among others.", "Higgins and Biondi are known for shying away from publicity and don't hold investor days, during which investors meet the firm's asset managers."]

name: Billionaires
title: Cofounder and Chairman
bios: ['Stephen Jarislowsky made the bulk of his fortune at the helm of Jarislowsky Fraser, the investment management firm he founded in 1955.', "He stepped down as CEO in 2012 but remains chairman emeritus of the company he grew into one of Canada's largest money managers.", 'In February 2018, Jarislowsy Fraser announced that it was being acquired by Scotiabank for about $750 million.', 'His foundation has endowed over $230 million and has established 36 university chairs across Canada.', 'He owns a sizable art collection that is largely comprised of Canadian art, but also spans Chinese jade to French impressionism.']
abouts: ['Jarislowsky owns the 2,000-acre Marina Island in the Strait of Georgia near Vancouver.', 'A longtime supporter of business ethics and shareholder rights, he cofounded the Canadian Coalition for Good Governance in 2002 and sits on its board.']

name: Billionaires
title: Athlete
bios: ["Regarded by most as the NBA's greatest all-time player, Michael Jordan won six titles with the Chicago Bulls.", 'His total playing salary during his career totaled $90 million, but he has earned another $1.4 billion (pre-tax) from corporate partners.', 'Jordan bought a majority stake in the Charlotte Hornets in 2010 for a grossed-up value of $175 million.', 'The Hornets are now worth $1.05 billion with Jordan owning 90% of the team.', 'In addition to Nike, Jordan still has sponsorship deals with Hanes, Gatorade and Upper Deck 15 years after hanging up his hightops.']
abouts: ["Jordan was the NBA's highest-paid player only two seasons during his 15-year playing career.", "Jordan's first contract with Nike, signed in 1984, was worth $500,000 per year, plus royalties. Nike paid him more than $100 million last year."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Kasahara founded social networking site Mixi in 2004; it went public in 2006.  ', 'In 2013 Mixi was losing customers and investors as competitors raced ahead.', 'Kasahara stepped down as CEO but stayed on as chairman.', 'He refocused the business on mobile gaming, e-commerce, dating and apartment hunting.', "Mixi's popular Monster Strike game has been downloaded tens of millions of times. "]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Kim Taek-jin is the founder of NCSoft, South Korea's No. 2 online gaming company which he founded in 1997. ", ' He took the company public in 2003, and still serves as CEO.', 'NCSoft now provides online game services to more than 60 countries. ', 'He sold most of his NCSoft shares in 2012 and now has just under a 12% stake.', 'An avid sports fan, Kim founded the Korean professional baseball team NC Dinos in 2011. ']
abouts: ["While still a student at Seoul National University's College of Engineering, he developed software that helped users practice typing in Korean. ", "He worked for Hyundai Electronics' R&D Center in Boston and later became head of a division of Hyundai Electronics that launched South Korea's first Internet access."]

name: Billionaires
title: Founder
bios: ["After a stint at Goldman Sachs' risk arbitrage department, Edward Lampert founded hedge fund ESL Investments in 1988, betting on undervalued stocks.", 'He took over as CEO of struggling retail giant Sears Holdings (Sears, Kmart, Kenmore) in 2013 with hopes of a turnaround but failed miserably. ', 'Sears Holdings filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy in October 2018 and announced that it will close 142 Sears and Kmart stores. ', "Lampert's ESL Investments had promised Sears nearly $1 billion in loans in the first 10 months of 2017."]
abouts: ['Lampert was kidnapped in 2003. He was released by his captors after two days. ', 'A graduate of Yale University, he was a part of the secret society Skull and Bones, whose alumni include former presidents George H.W. Bush and George W. Bush. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Thomas Lau is chairman and CEO of Lifestyle International, a shopping-mall outfit whose Sogo flagship anchors the city's pricey Causeway Bay district.", 'He sits on the board of Shanghai Jiao Tong University.', 'His brother, Joseph, is also a billionaire. They both collect art.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Thai Lee is CEO of $8.5 billion (2017 sales) IT provider SHI International, which has 17,000-plus customers including Boeing and AT&T.', 'Born in Bangkok, Lee grew up in South Korea and moved to the U.S. for high school.', 'A Harvard MBA, she did stints at Procter & Gamble and American Express.', 'Lee and her now ex-husband paid less than $1 million for a software reseller in 1989, the predecessor to SHI.']
abouts: ["Lee's father, a prominent Korean economist, traveled the world promoting his country's postwar development plan.", 'Lee majored in both biology and economics, in part because her English was less than perfect and she wanted to avoid writing and speaking in class.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Lei Jufang chairs Tibet Cheezheng Tibetan Medicine,  best known for its pain-relief patches and cream.', 'Lei discovered the business that made her a billionaire on a leisure trip to Tibet seeking peace of mind.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Li Li chairs Shenzhen Hepalink Pharmaceutical, a supplier of heparin sodium (a blood thinner) to pharmaceutical firms such as Novartis.', 'Early on, Li worked in a meat-processing plant; his first pharmaceutical industry job was at heparin producer Chongqing Tongda.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Li Liufa chairs the Tianrui Group of China, whose business includes steel, tourism, cement and minerals.', 'Li worked at a fertilizer factory in Henan Province in the late 1970s before setting up his first business -- a small steel casting factory.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Liu Hanyuan leads China's Tongwei Group, one of the world's largest producers of aquafeed. \r\n", 'Liu worked at a government job in the hydropower bureau in Sichuan Province before he took the plunge as an entrepreneur in the fish food business. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Pier Luigi is an heir to the high end clothing company Loro Piana, which was founded in 1924 by his grandfather Pietro. ', 'He and his brother took the brand worldwide before selling an 80% stake to French luxury giant LVMH for $2.6 billion in 2013. ', 'Pier Luigi still has an estimated 8% stake in the clothing firm as part of the LVMH deal and serves as its deputy chairman. ', "As a hobby, he hosts the annual Loro Piana Superyacht Regatta, where his yacht, My Song, competes against the world's most recognized superyachts."]
abouts: ['The Loro Piana family began trading wool in the early 1800s. ', "The brand's women's jackets sell for as much as $9,900. "]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Red's first job was at 10 years old, selling peanuts for a nickel a bag. ", 'From his start selling Ford Edsels, "Red" built a network of 55 auto dealerships, now down to 8. ', 'He was a co-founder of radio giant Clear Channel, which was useful for running car ads. ', ' He owned a stake in Constellis, formerly known as Blackwater, which he sold 2016.']
abouts: ['Over the years McCombs has owned and sold the San Antonio Spurs, Denver Nuggets and Minnesota Vikings. He also invested in Formula One.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Gian Marco Moratti, chairman of Italy's largest oil refiner Saras, died February 26, 2018. He was 81 years old.", 'He and his brother Massimo inherited a controlling stake from their father Angelo, who founded the company in 1962.', 'The brothers took Saras public in 2006.']
abouts: ["Letizia Moratti, Moratti's wife, served as Milan's mayor for five years."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Manuel (Matty) Moroun owns Detroit's Ambassador Bridge, the largest border crossing between the U.S. and Canada.", 'He is CEO of holding company CenTra and other family-held transportation and logistics companies.', 'Moroun plans to invest $1 billion on a new span and is opposing U.S. and Canadian plans for a competing publicly-owned bridge. ', 'His son Matthew joined the business in 1995. \r\n']
abouts: ["In 1979, Moroun used his small trucking company's credit line to buy out Warren Buffett's 25% stake in the Ambassador Bridge for $30 million. ", "He wanted to be a doctor but after graduating from Notre Dame in 1949, he went to work at his father's gas station in Detroit."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Robert Mouawad inherited the family's eponymous high-end jewelry business that his grandfather founded in Beirut in 1890.", 'He turned over the business to his sons Fred, Alain and Pascal in 2010.', 'Mouawad boasts one of the most dazzling gem collections in the world, including the Kimberly Star, a 111.11-carat yellow pear-shaped diamond.', 'Robert Mouawad also owns extensive real estate and has developed luxury residences on a man-made island in Bahrain.']
abouts: ["Since 2003, Mouawad has teamed up with Victoria's Secret to create bejeweled bras for the lingerie maker's fashion shows. ", 'Mouawad has a private museum in a 110 year-old Beirut palace displaying his collection of Roman and Phoenician antiquities.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Marius Nacht wrote the original code for cybersecurity firm Check Point Software Technologies, which made him and cofounder Gil Shwed billionaires.', 'Between 2016 and 2017,  he sold nearly half his Check Point stake, netting an estimated $425 million, and now owns just under 7%. \r\n', 'In 2016, Nacht announced he was raising $100 million for a fund to invest in Israeli healthcare startups. ', 'Nacht has also invested in multiple early stage security startups, including LightCyber, SafeDK, Cyber Secdo and Rapid API.', 'He became vice chairman of Check Point in 2001. He was appointed non-executive chairman of the board in September 2015.']
abouts: ['Nacht is a veteran of Talpiot, an elite division of the Israeli army. ', 'He has degrees in physics and mathematics from Hebrew University of Jerusalem and in electric engineering and communications systems from Tel Aviv University.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Ni Zugen is chairman of home appliance maker Kingclean Electronic, which sells wares under the Lexy brand.', 'Ni worked for  a Suzhou-base vacuum cleaner factory before he founded his own business in 1994.']

name: Billionaires
bios:
['In 1988 Lirio Parisotto founded Videolar, a video and audiotape company, invested the profits in the stock market and built a fortune.  
', 'His portfolio runs the gamut from banking, electricity and mining to steel companies. He avoids IPOs and favors stocks that pay high dividends. 
', 'In addition, he owns bonds, real estate, and a majority of Videolar, which merged with Innova to manufacture and market petrochemical products.
', "Innova operates four high-tech industrial facilities: three in Brazil's Amazon region of Manaus and one in southern Brazil. 
"]
abouts: ['He has 11 siblings, holds a degree in medicine and also spent time in a monastery.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Karl-Johan Persson is the third generation of his family to head up fast fashion favorite, H&M.', 'He took the reins from his father, billionaire Stefan Persson, in 2009.', "Karl-Johan's grandfather, Erling Persson, founded H&M in 1947.", 'The company has since grown to a global retail power house with more than 4,350 stores in 64 countries.', "Persson's sister Charlotte Söderström, brother Tom Persson, and aunt Lottie Tham are also billionaires."]
abouts: ['Crown princess Victoria is the godmother to one of his children.', 'Karl-Johan is an active investor in unlisted Nordic tech companies, including online food grocer MatHem.se.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Tom Persson is third generation of the family that made its fortune from global cheap chic retailer H&M.', 'His grandfather, Erling Persson, founded the chain in 1947.', "Brother Karl-Johan is CEO and his father, Sweden's richest person Stefan Persson, is chairman.", "Tom's father, brother, sister Charlotte Söderström, and aunt Lottie Tham are all billionaires.", 'He lives in Stockholm and works in movie production.']
abouts: ['Persson is a graduate of the Met Film School in London.', "Persson's film company produced the award-winning Swedish movie Ravens (2017). Tom is credited as a producer."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Dmitry Pumpyansky got his start as a trader, then oversaw several metals plants in the Ural in the 1990s before taking over the Sinarsky Pipe Factory.', 'Pumpyansky teamed up with fellow billionaires Sergei Popov and Andrei Melnichenko to acquire pipe conglomerate TMK, and then bought them out in 2006.', "Making pipes became the source of Pumpyansky's wealth. His TMK is No.1 on the Russian market and a traditional supplier for Gazprom since 1998.", "In 2011 Pumpyansky's JV with Siemens won a $2.7 billion contract from Russian Railways to deliver modern trains called Lastochka (swallow bird).", 'His companies are also giving a facelift to a stadium that will host the 2018 World Cup in Ekaterinburg.']
abouts: ['Pumpyansky owns a gallery of modern art in Ekaterinburg, which exhibits some pieces from his own collection (mostly Russian artists).', 'Pumpyansky got PhD in economics, is the author of more than 70 scientific works and taught GR in the Higher School of Economics based in Moscow.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Ruan Shuilong is the largest shareholder in Zhejiang Longsheng Group, a supplier of specialty chemicals and a variety of dyes. \r\n', "Longsheng's predecessor organization was an insecticide factory founded in a commune set up in the eastern city of Shangyu in 1970."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Jean Salata is a Chilean citizen who has lived and worked in Hong Kong since 1989.', 'In 2000 he led a management buyout of Baring Private Equity Asia, where he is chief executive.', 'Before joining Baring in 1997 he held posts at Bain and AIG.']

name: Billionaires
title: COO
bios: ["Facebook's chief operating officer since 2008, Sandberg has helped dramatically boost revenues at the social network.", "She founded Lean In, a nonprofit named after her bestselling book, to support women's empowerment. ", 'Her second book, Option B, which focuses on grief and resilience, was released in April 2017.', 'She spent six years as a vice president at Google, where she developed its lucrative online advertising programs.', "One of the nation's most influential female executives, she has been thrust into defending Facebook's work battling election meddling."]
abouts: ["Sandberg's husband, SurveyMonkey CEO Dave Goldberg, died unexpectedly while on vacation in Mexico at age 47 in 2015.", 'Sandberg, armed with a Harvard M.B.A., began her career as chief of staff to then U.S. Treasury Secretary Larry Summers.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Niraj Shah is cofounder and CEO of online home goods retailer Wayfair.', 'He started the business in 2002 with Steve Conine, a fellow billionaire. The two met as high school students at a program at Cornell University.', 'The two founders ended up living in the same dorm their freshman year at Cornell and became good friends.', "Wayfair now sells more than 10 million products. The company's net revenue in 2017 was $4.7 billion, up 40% from the previous year.", 'Shah joined the board of the Federal Reserve Bank of Boston in 2017.']
abouts: ['In their final semester of college, Conine and Shah both enrolled in a class on entrepreneurism, which sparked a business plan that turned into their first company.', "The duo started Wayfair in a spare bedroom of Conine's house. They soon operated 250 websites selling everything from barstools to birdhouses"]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Shin Dong-guk is the founder of auto-parts manufacturer Hanyang Precision.', 'The bulk of his fortune however comes from his investment in pharmaceutical company, Hanmi, headed by a friend and fellow billionaire, Lim Sung-ki.', 'Outside of the Lim family, Shin is second largest shareholder of Hanmi Pharmaceuticals and Hanmi Science.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Ben Silbermann is the CEO of the photo bookmarking site Pinterest, which was valued at $12.3 billion after its latest fundraising round in June 2017. ', 'Silbermann, along with cofounders Evan Sharp and Paul Sciarra, launched the first desktop version of Pinterest in March 2010.  ', 'Pinterest lets users save and share image collections from recipes to hairstyles to crafts and home decor through their mobile phones or computers. \r\n']
abouts: ['Ben Silbermann grew up in Iowa and collected dried insects which he then would pin on cardboard. \r\n', 'After graduating from Yale, Silbermann spent three years as a consultant. He joined Google in 2006 but quit to focus on his startup, Cold Brew Labs. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Charlotte Söderström is the daughter of Sweden's richest person, Stefan Persson, chairman of global cheap chic retailer H&M, where she holds a stake.", 'Her grandfather Erling Persson founded the chain in 1947.', 'Her billionaire brother Karl-Johan Persson has served as CEO since 2009.', 'Brother Tom Persson and aunt Lottie Tham are also billionaires.', 'Söderström works on H&M sponsorships, and she runs a stud farm.']
abouts: ['She is reportedly the owner of the horse H&M All In, who won a silver medal at the 2016 Olympics.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Tom Steyer spent 26 years running hedge fund Farallon Capital; he sold his stake in 2012 and switched his focus to politics and the environment.', 'The San Francisco resident spent some $65 million to back select Democratic candidates and environmental causes in the 2016 election cycle.', 'Steyer is a passionate advocate of clean energy and founder of the environmental group NextGen Climate.', 'Steyer and his wife, Kat Taylor, have donated tens of millions of dollars to alma maters Stanford and Yale for "advanced energy" research.']
abouts: ['Steyer was captain of the soccer team at Yale University.', 'For years, Steyer wore the same dated red wool plaid tie nearly every work day; he told Forbes he had 8 ties of the same design.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Su Weizhong's wealth comes from his shareholding in Shenzhen-listed energy company CEFC Anhui International Holding.", 'He holds a degree from Southwest University.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Teoh is the founder and executive chairman of TPG Telecom. He emigrated from Malaysia in 1986.', 'A series of smart acquisitions transformed the company from a computer retailer into a major internet service provider in Australia.', "Teoh's purchases include a splurge on a mobile spectrum license to build Australia's fourth network.", 'Teoh owns more than a third of the company with his wife, Vicky, who helped him get started but is no longer involved. ', "Vicky and their four sons have launched more than a dozen startups. They've also started a property investment company."]
abouts: ['Famously publicity-shy, Teoh managed to avoid all media photographers until one staked out his Sydney home for three days in 2015.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Wang Jinshu is the chairman of China chemicals manufacturer Shandong Yuhuang Chemical. \r\n', "Wang is a member of the National People's Congress in China.\r\n"]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Wang Yaohai chairs Opple Lighting, one of China's largest lighting makers.", 'Wang cofounded Opple with his wife Ma Xiuhui, fellow billionaire, in 1996 in Zhongshan, a major lighting manufacturing center, with only six workers.\r\n', 'Today, Opple employs more than 5600 people and makes traditional lamps, electrical appliances and kitchen ceiling products.\r\n']

name: Billionaires
title: Director
bios: ["Campbell Soup Co. heir Charlotte Colket Weber served on the company's board from 1990 until 2014.", 'Her billionaire cousins, Bennett Dorrance and Mary Alice Dorrance Malone, are still directors.', 'Their grandfather, John T. Dorrance, invented the condensed soup formula that turned the company into a global soup giant.', 'Weber is a devoted equestrian and owns the Live Oak Stud Farm, a 4,500-acre horse farm and commercial cattle operation near Ocala, Florida.', "She is also an avid collector of Chinese art, a passion that reportedly began when her uncle gave her a rare porcelain K'ang-hsi frog in the 1970s."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Wei Ing-Chou and his three brothers,  Ying-Chiao, Yin-Chun and Yin-Heng, founded Cayman Islands-based Tingyi.', "Tingyi is now one of the largest suppliers of ready-to-drink tea and bottled water in China and supplies half of the country's instant noodle market. \r\n", "Ing-Chou is Tingyi's chairman; son Wei Hong-Ming, a member of Tingyi's board, is heir apparent.", "The family has investments in Taipei 101, Taiwan's tallest building, and the Dicos fried chicken chain."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Yin-Chun Wei and his three brothers founded Tingyi,  a successful producer of ready-to-drink tea and bottled water in China.', "Tingyi is also China's leading supplier of instant noodles.", "The family also owns Taipei 101, Taiwan's tallest building, and controls the Dicos fried chicken chain."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Wei Yin-Heng and his three brothers -- Ing-Chou, Yin-Chun and Ying-Chiao-- founded Cayman Islands-based Tingyi.', "Tingyi is now a big producer of ready-to-drink tea and bottled water in China; it also supplies half of the country's instant noodle market.", "The family also has investments in Taipei 101, Taiwan's tallest building, and Dicos fried chicken chain."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Wei Ying-Chiao and his three brothers -- Ing-Chou, Yin-Chun and Yin-Heng -- founded Cayman Islands-based Tingyi.', "Tingyi is now a big producer of ready-to-drink tea and bottled water in China; it also supplies half of the country's instant noodle market.", "The family has an investment in Taipei 101, Taiwan's tallest building, and the Dicos fried chicken chain."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Richard White founded software company WiseTech Global in 1994 to help logistics companies manage goods and information across supply chains.', "Since he took it public in 2016, WiseTech's share price has more than doubled, due to strong growth in revenue and profits and acquisitions worldwide.", "He is the company's chief executive, and retains a 55% stake.", "Touted as Australia's next Atlassian, Sydney-based WiseTech has more than 7,000 customers in 125 countries.", 'It uses its cloud-based logistics platform, CargoWise One, to automate dozens of steps.']
abouts: ['A former musician, refrigeration engineer and computer wholesaler, White has repaired guitars for top Australian rock bands like AC/DC and The Angels.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Allan Wong cofounded electronic toymaker VTech Holdings, which is also the world's largest manufacturer of cordless phones.", 'He is deputy chairman of the Bank of East Asia, and an independent non-executive director of China-Hongkong Photo Products Holdings.', 'Wong is also deputy chairman at sourcing and logistics giant Li & Fung and transport and property company MTR.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Wong Kwong Yu, also known as Huang Guangyu, is the founder of Hong Kong-listed appliance retailer Gome Electrical Appliances Holding.', 'Huang is serving a 14-year jail sentence received in 2010 for insider trading and bribery.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Wu Jianshu chairs Ningbo Tuopo Group, a supplier of vibration, acoustic and suspension products for the auto industry.', 'Its major customers include Audi and BMW.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Wu Xu chairs Chongqing Sincere Holding Group, one of the largest real estate developers in the central Chinese city of Chongqing.', 'Wu worked state-run construction businesses before taking the plunge himself as an entrepreneur.\r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Wu Xushun is cofounder and a director of Wuhu Shunrong Sanqi Interactive Entertainment Network Technology in China.', 'Wuhu Shunrong Auto Parts (Shenzhen-listed) acquired 60% of Sanqi Interactive Entertainment Shanghai Technology in 2014. \r\n', 'Following this acquisition, Wuhu Shunrong Auto Parts was rebranded as Wuhu Shunrong Sanqi Interactive Entertainment Network Technology. \r\n', 'Wu dropped out of school after he finished middle high school in 1963. He was once a government official in Xitan in Nanling County in Anhui Province.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Luis Enrique Yarur Rey is the chairman of Banco de Credito e Inversiones (BCI), a Chilean retail and commercial bank.', 'BCI has more than 300 branches throughout Chile and Florida, and even one in Antarctica. ', "The bank was founded by the Yarur family in 1937. Today it is one of Chile's largest banking institutions, with more than $45 billion in assets. ", 'In 2015, BCI purchased City National Bank of Florida for $947 million; it was the first time a Chilean bank purchased a U.S. financial institution. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Albert Yeung branched out from his father's watch shop to found leading Hong Kong retailer Emperor Watch & Jewellery. ", 'Emperor Group includes five listed Hong Kong companies.', 'The group concedes that its entertainment interests, notably Cantopop and film production, are more about publicity for the brand than for revenue.', "Emperor's real estate holdings focus on Hong Kong, Beijing and London."]
abouts: ['Yeung holds no corporate office in Emperor Group companies but is the controlling shareholder. ', 'Yeung counts actor Jackie Chan as a friend and investor.', 'Emperor Hotel in Macau features red-coated faux Coldstream Guards outside and, inside, real gold bars embedded in the lobby floor. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Yu Rong chairs Meinian Onehealth Healthcare Holdings, which offers health exams throughout China.', "Yu holds a doctor's degree of China Academy of Chinese Medical Sciences and an EMBA of China Europe International Business School."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Konstyantin Zhevago is CEO of Ukranian mining company Ferrexpo, which is listed on the London Stock Exchange; he owns a stake of just over 50%.', 'He became finance director of the bank Finance & Credit in 1992, eventually buying the business, which went bankrupt in 2015.', 'He took over the precursor to Ferrexpo, Poltava Iron Ore, in 1996 and took it public in 2007. ']
abouts: ['Zhevago is an avid soccer fan and owns the FC Vorskla team.', "Zhevago has been a member of Ukraine's parliament since 1998."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['A former tailor, Zhou Chengjian is founder of Shanghai Metersbonwe Fashion & Accessories, which designs and makes apparel and accessories. \r\n', 'Daughter Hu Jiajia became Metersbonwe chairman in November 2016.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Zhou Yaoting controls China's Hodo Group, which has interests in apparel, real estate and finance.\r\n", "Apparel maker Hongdou had its humble beginnings in 1957 when Zhou Yaoting's father founded the cotton processing operation with three employees. \r\n", 'Months after, local officials forced him to merge with two other businesses into what was in effect a government-controlled collective.', "The family over time bought back government shares, paving the way for new growth that has made the business one China's largest apparel makers."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Zhuang Kuilong chairs Xinfengming Group, a manufacturer of polyester and filament products.', 'Zhuang was reportedly a farmer before a joining a collective fiber factory.', 'Zhuang cofounded the predecessor business of Xinfengming in 2000 with 11 others including his wife Qu Fengqi.', 'Xinfengming listed on Shanghai Stock Exchange in April 2017.', "Son Zhuang Yaozhong is the company's president."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Jose Joao Abdalla Filho is the son of J. J. Abdalla, a Brazilian entrepreneur and politician who built a real estate and textile company.\r\n', 'In the 1950s, the group his father led became one the largest manufacturers of cement in the country, employing over 40,000 people.', 'Abdalla Filho used the money he inherited to open Banco Classico, which owns stakes in a number of Brazilian companies. \r\n', "His Banco Classico owns 5% of Eletrobras, Brazil's largest electric utility, and almost 7% of Cemig, an energy giant that owns over 200 companies."]
abouts: ['His late father J.J. Abdalla was a doctor, businessman, and politician. He became mayor of Birigui, a small town in the state of Sao Paulo, and a congressman.', 'A vast amount of land owned by the Abdallas in a central neighborhood in São Paulo was expropriated by the government in 1988.\r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Khalifa Bin Butti Al Muhairi is the chairman of KBBO Group, an Abu Dhabi-based group with investments in healthcare, money exchange and retail.', "He's a large shareholder in NMC Healthcare, a London-listed firm that bills itself as the largest private healthcare firm in the U.A.E. ", 'NMC, which runs hospitals and clinics in a dozen countries, was founded by B.R. Shetty, also a billionaire. Al Muhairi is a board member.', 'He also has stakes in money transfer firm UAE Exchange, which handles $26 billion in remittances annually, and U.K. money exchange firm Travelex.', 'He has partnered with billionaire Saeed Bin Butti Al Qebaisi to make investments through Infinite Investment and Centurion Partners. ']
abouts: ['After graduating from Suffolk University in Boston, he worked in finance at Abu Dhabi National Oil Company. ', 'In 2014, he partnered with U.S. investment and advisory firm Guggenheim Partners in Dubai to offer financial services to Middle Eastern companies.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Folorunsho Alakija is vice chair of Famfa Oil, a Nigerian oil exploration company with a stake in Agbami Oilfield, a prolific offshore asset.', "Famfa Oil's partners include Chevron and Petrobras. ", "Alakija's first company was a fashion label whose customers included the wife of former Nigerian president Ibrahim Babangida.", "The Nigerian government awarded Alakija's company an oil prospecting license in 1993, which was later converted to an oil mining lease. ", 'The Agbami field has been operating since 2008; Famfa Oil says it will likely operate through 2024. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Bill Alfond is one of four heirs who are billionaires thanks to Warren Buffett's purchase of the Dexter Shoe Company.", "Bill's father, Harold Alfond, bought an old mill in Maine in 1958 and turned it into a shoemaker that sold millions of boots and casual shoes a year.", ' In 1993 Harold sold the company to Buffett for about $420 million in Berkshire Hathaway stock, now worth billions due to the rising share price.', 'Bill and his two siblings, Ted and Susan, also share about 4% of Fenway Sports Group, which owns the Boston Red Sox and Liverpool FC.', "Bill's youngest sibling, Peter, died in July 2017 at age 65 from malaria, which he contracted during a trip to Africa. "]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Susan Alfond and her three siblings inherited a fortune created by their father, who started Dexter Shoe Company.', 'Her father, Harold Alfond, bought an old mill in Maine in 1958 and turned it into a shoemaker that sold millions of boots and casual shoes.', "In 1993 Harold sold the company to Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway for $420 million of stock; the shares are worth billions of dollars now. ", "Susan's youngest sibling, Peter, died in July 2017 at age 65 from malaria, which he contracted during a trip to Africa."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Ted Alfond is one of four heirs who are billionaires thanks to Warren Buffett's purchase of the Dexter Shoe Company.", "Ted's father, Harold Alfond, bought an old mill in Maine in 1958 and turned it into a shoemaker that sold millions of boots and casual shoes a year.", 'In 1993 Harold sold the company to Buffett for about $420 million in Berkshire Hathaway stock, now worth billions due to the rising share price. ', 'Ted and his two siblings, Bill and Susan, also share a roughly 4% stake in Fenway Sports Group, which owns the Boston Red Sox and Liverpool FC.', "Ted's youngest sibling, Peter, died in July 2017 at age 65 from malaria, which he contracted during a trip to Africa."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Son of a jewelry store owner and school dropout, Joy Alukkas went to the Middle East to open the family's first overseas store in 1987 in Abu Dhabi.", 'He broke off to launch his own Joyalukkas brand which now has 130 outlets spread across India and 13 other countries. ', 'His other interests include a money exchange, luxury aviation, malls, silks and real estate.', "Alukkas' son John Paul manages the group's international operations."]
abouts: ["In 1956 Alukkas' father, Varghese Alukkas, opened the first jewellery store in the family's native Thrissur town.\r\n", 'Joyalukkas uses Bollywood stars as brand ambassadors.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Russian entrepreneur Andrey Andreev is the ultimate matchmaker, helping build three successful online dating applications so far.', 'He founded Mamba (renamed Wamba) in 2004, a Russian online dating site that now has 31 million users in 15 countries. ', "Two years later he started Badoo, today the world's largest online dating site with over 377 million using 47 languages across 190 countries. ", "In 2014, he put up $10 million in seed money for a 79% stake in Bumble, America's fastest-growing dating-app company with 28 million users.", 'Andreev got his start in 1999 with SpyLog, a web-tracking business that helped webmasters track visitors to their sites.']
abouts: ["As a weekend hobby, Andreev would sometimes cook alongside head chef Olivier Limousin at two-Michelin-starred London restaurant L'Atelier de Joël Robuchon. "]

name: Billionaires
title: Chairman
bios: ['Carol Jenkins Barnett is the daughter of Publix supermarket founder George Jenkins and an heir to the Florida-based fortune.', 'She owns just under 5% of the business, which is the largest employee-owned company in the U.S.', "After 33 years on the Publix board, she stepped down in June 2016 following  a diagnosis of early onset Alzheimer's disease.", 'Publix, founded in 1930, employs 190,000 people in 1,190 stores across 7 states and has revenues of over $34 billion.', 'She started working for Publix at age 16.']

name: Billionaires
bio: Armed with a degree in economics, Oleg Boyko opened Moscow's first stores with credit card readers in the 1990s. His diversified company later traded food and electronics, imported fruits, and managed banks. He sold or restructured most of the group's assets during the 1995 banking crisis and moved into retail and the gambling industry. He owns 242 gambling spots in six countries, including Germany and Italy. His company Finstar's core investment is Europe's leading online consumer lender 4finance, which was picked up in 2011; it now operates in 16 countries, including the U.S. Finstar also has a stake in cosmetics retailer Rive Gauche and commercial real estate development company Finstroy. In 2016 Finstar also invested in European fintech companies Spotcap, Prestamor Prima and Viventor. Boyko, who was injured in an accident at a friend's home in 1996 and appears frequently in a scooter-style wheelchair, heads the Russian Committee for the Development of the Paralympics Movement, member of IWAS Development Committee.
bios: ["Oleg Boyko opened Moscow's first stores with credit card readers in the 1990s.", 'In 2002 Boyko invested in a Moscow chain of gambling venues and founded Ritzio Entertainment Group, which invested in casinos and gambling. ', 'Before casinos were banned in Russia, Ritzio Entertainment Group had been the biggest operator of gambling machines in the country.', 'When gambling was banned, Boyko sold his Russian gambling assets and moving into gambling in the European Union.', 'His biggest investment today is 4finance, a digital consumer finance company that operates in 18 countries.']
abouts: ['Boyko, who was injured in an accident in 1996 and often appears in a scooter-style wheelchair, is the main private sponsor of Russian Paralympics team. ', "He invests in movie-making. His projects include Roberto Rodriguez's Sin City II and Scarlett Johansson's Summer Crossing."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['She owns 30% of Grupo Breca, a Peruvian holding company with interests in agriculture, finance, hotels, mining and real estate.', "She inherited her fortune from her father, Fortunato Brescia Tassano (d.1951), who built a real estate company that capitalized on Lima's growth.", 'Her assets were managed by her brothers Mario and Pedro until they passed away in 2013 and 2014, respectively.', 'Grupo Breca owns Tasa, one of the largest producers of fish meal in the world. ']
abouts: ["Nonagenarian Brescia Cafferata never married and doesn't have any children.", 'Her father Fortunato, born in a poor family, married Catalina Cafferata Peñaranda, a mining heiress and a daughter of the Italian consul in the city of Huaraz.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Binod Chaudhary controls CG Corp Global and is Nepal's sole billionaire.", "His biggest asset is a controlling stake in Nepal's Nabil Bank, but CG's portfolio also includes foods, electronics, beer and hotels. \r\n", "Chaudhary's CG Foods, maker of the popular Wai Wai noodles, has overseas factories in India, Serbia, Saudia Arabia and Bangladesh. ", "CG's hotel assets consist of 29 owned and 70 managed properties, including a string of luxury hotels with India's Taj hotel chain. ", 'Chaudhary is a member of parliament representing the Nepali Congress.']
abouts: ["His late father opened Nepal's first department store. \r\n", 'Chaudhary skipped college to join the family trade at age 18.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Che Fengsheng started his career as a neurologist at military hospitals in the Chinese cities of Xi'an and Guangzhou.", "Che co-founded Sihuan Pharmaceutical Holdings in 2001, now one of China's largest homegrown drugmakers."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Chen Qingzhou chairs Hytera Communications, a manufacturer of radio communications equipment.\r\n', 'Early in his career, Chen worked at a mobile radio communications factory as a sales manager in Fujian Province. \r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Richard Desmond founded Northern & Shell, which published the Daily Express newspapers, OK! and Star magazines and operates UK's Health Lottery.", 'He was raised by his secretary mom in a garage apartment -- his parents divorced after his dad, an advertising executive, gambled away their savings.', "He started his first magazine, International Musician, at age 22 with a $60,000 loan, then became Penthouse's U.K. licensee. ", 'He expanded to titles like Asian Babes and Posh Housewives, then sold some holdings and went mass market, launching OK! and buying Express Newspapers.', "In February 2018 he agreed to sell N&S's publishing arm, including its newspaper and magazine titles, to rival Trinity Mirror for about $177 million."]
abouts: ['In 2003, Desmond created the band RD Crusaders with Roger Daltrey from The Who and other musicians.', "He quit school at age 14 to become a drummer, then dressed up in his older brother's suit to land a job selling newspaper ads over the phone a year later. "]

name: Billionaires
bios: [' Mohammed Dewji is the CEO of METL, a Tanzanian conglomerate founded by his father in the 1970s. ', 'METL is active in textile manufacturing, flour milling, beverages and edible oils in eastern, southern and central Africa. ', ' METL operates in at least six African countries and has ambitions to expand to several more. ', "Dewji, Tanzania's only billionaire, signed the Giving Pledge in 2016, promising to donate at least half his fortune to philanthropic causes."]
abouts: ["Dewji retired from Tanzania's parliament in early 2015 after completing two terms.", 'Dewji, who is known as Mo (short for Mohammed), launched Mo Cola several years ago to compete with Coca Cola.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Carl Douglas and his brother Eric joined their father Gustaf Douglas as billionaires after they inherited stakes in the family's investment company.", "The Douglas family is the largest shareholder of Latour AB, which holds stakes in Securitas AB and Assa Abloy, the world's largest lock producer.", 'Latour is also the main shareholder in AB Fagerhult, one of the leading European manufacturers of light fixtures and several other public companies.', 'Carl is a board member of Latour AB, and is vice chairman of Securitas and Assa Abloy.', 'The Douglas family is one of the largest land owners in Sweden.']
abouts: ['Douglas is an acclaimed underwater explorer and led the expedition in the Baltic Sea that discovered the warship Sword dating to 1676.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Eric Douglas and his brother Carl joined their father Gustaf Douglas as billionaires after inherited ownership in the family's investment company.", "The Douglas family is the largest shareholder of Latour AB, which holds stakes in Securitas AB and Assa Abloy, the world's largest lock producer.", 'Latour is also the main shareholder in AB Fagerhult, one of the leading European manufacturer of light fixtures and several other public companies.', 'Eric is a board member of Latour AB, chairman of the boards of Pod Investment AB and Sparbössan Fastigheter AB, and vice chairman of AB Fagerhult.', 'The Douglas family is one of the largest land owners in Sweden.']
abouts: ["The Douglas family earned its nobility via Robert Douglas, a Scottish immigrant who became general over the Swedish forces and fought in the Thirty Years' War. ", "Eric inherited the historical castle ruins Stjärnorp, built by his ancestor Robert Douglas in the 1650's."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Bulent Eczacibasi is the president of Eczacibasi Holding, which includes a building products division with 13 manufacturing facilities in Turkey and Europe.', 'It is a global exporter of ceramic and wall tiles, plus bathroom fixtures and accessories (brands include VitrA, Villeroy & Boch and Engers Keramik).', "Bulent's father, Dr. Nejat F. Eczacibasi, focused on pharmaceuticals before expanding into personal health care and other businesses.", 'Eczacibasi companies also operate in healthcare services and the production and distribution of medical products to hospitals.', "Other key sectors are consumer products, finance, IT, mining and real estate development. Eczacibasi is Turkey's leading producer of toilet paper."]
abouts: ['An avid art collector, Bulent heads the Istanbul Culture and Art Foundation and the Istanbul Modern Art Foundation, which includes the Istanbul Modern Art Museum.', 'In Turkish, Eczacibasi means "chief pharmacist," an honorary title and surname given to Bulent\'s grandfather, Suleyman Ferit Eczacibasi.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Faruk Eczacibasi and brother Bulent are partners in a conglomerate that includes a building products division with 13 production facilities in Turkey and Europe.', 'It is a global exporter of ceramic and wall tiles, plus bathroom fixtures and accessories (brands include VitrA, Villeroy & Boch and Engers Keramik).', "Faruk and Bulent's father, Dr. Nejat F. Eczacibasi, focused on pharmaceuticals before expanding into personal health care and other businesses.", 'Eczacibasi companies also operate in healthcare services and the production and distribution of medical products to hospitals.', "Other key sectors are consumer products, finance, IT, mining and real estate development. Eczacibasi is Turkey's leading producer of toilet paper."]
abouts: ["Faruk has an extensive modern art collection (assembled with his wife, Fusun), loves jazz and lives in Istanbul's historic peninsula of Galata.", "He is president of the Eczacibasi Sports Club, whose women's volleyball team won the Women's Club World Championship in 2015."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Martha Firestone Ford is the widow of William C. Ford (d. 2014), a grandson of Ford Motor founder Henry Ford.', "Martha Ford's paternal grandparents founded Firestone Tire and Rubber. ", "She inherited the NFL's Detroit Lions in after her husband died in 2014 and she swept out the team's top executives.\r\n", 'Her son William C. Ford, Jr., known as Bill, is executive chairman of Ford Motor. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Yasuhiro Fukushima was the founder of gaming software firm Enix, which merged with rival Square in 2003. ', 'The Tokyo-listed company made its mark with its Final Fantasy franchise and its Dragon Quest series.', 'He currently serves as the honorary chairman of Square Enix Holdings.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Reinold Geiger leads French cosmetics retailer L'Occitane, which brings beauty products inspired by the Provence region to consumers around the world.", "Since Geiger first invested in the company in 1994, he has overseen L'Occitane's global expansion to nearly 3,000 outlets in 90 countries.", "L'Occitane was the first French company to go public on the Hong Kong stock exchange when its shares debuted in 2010.", 'He owns a ski chalet in Meribel, a beach house on the Ile de Re in the Atlantic and a home in Trancoso, Brazil.']
abouts: ["He created the L'Occitane Foundation in 2006 with the goal of funding quality optometry services for 10 million people by 2020."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Saad Hariri was the prime minister of Lebanon from December 2016 through October 2020, and previously held the post between 2009 and 2011. ', "He's the son of the late billionaire Rafik Hariri, who was murdered in 2005 while serving as prime minister. ", 'Hariri inherited a stake in Saudi Oger, a construction company his father built into one of the biggest in Saudi Arabia. ', 'Saudi Oger reportedly shut down operations in July 2017 following a cutback in spending by the Saudi government and failed to pay wages to workers.', "Through Oger Telecom, Hariri owns a stake in Turk Telekom, Turkey's formerly state-owned telecom company. His cousin Mohammed Hariri is chairman. "]
abouts: ['Saudi Oger built the Ritz Carlton Hotel in Riyadh, where the Saudi government held scores of royal family members and businessmen accused of corruption.', 'In November 2017, Hariri was summoned to Riyadh and forced to resign as prime minister on TV. He later rescinded his resignation.']

name: Billionaires
title: Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer
employment: {'name': 'Urban Outfitters', 'uri': 'companies/urban-outfitters', 'title': 'Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer', 'salaryEst': False, 'salary': 1.0, 'government': False}
bios: ['Former hippie Richard Hayne opened his first apparel shop with his ex-wife in the mid-70s near the University of Pennsylvania with only $4,000. ', 'Today, Urban Outfitters is a nationwide chain with more than 200 locations and over $3 billion in revenue.', 'Hayne took Urban Outfitters public in 1993 and with his wife owns roughly a quarter of the company.', "Hayne became the company's CEO in 2012 after former CEO Glen Senk left to run New York-based jeweler and watchmaker David Yurman. ", 'His firm has been at the center of controversy over the years when its products have offended the LGBT community, Navajos, Irish Americans and Jews. ']
abouts: ['Hayne also owns the 700-acre Doe Run Dairy farm in Pennsylvania, which produces cheese.', 'In 1969, after graduating with a degree in anthropology from Lehigh University, Hayne did a stint volunteering with Eskimos in Alaska.\r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Ilona Herlin is the great-granddaughter of famed Finnish business leader Harald Herlin, who invested in Kone Elevators in 1924.', "After her father's death in 2003, Ilona and her siblings discovered the will had been rewritten leaving most of the ownership in Kone to brother Antti", 'Angered that they had never been informed, the siblings battled for control. The dispute ended in 2005, with Kone being split in two. ', 'Antti maintained control over the elevator business while his siblings were given stakes in Cargotec, producer of machinery for heavy duty ship cargo.', 'Niklas, one of the sibling, passed away in 2017. Three of the siblings are billionaires.']
abouts: ['Ilona is a linguist by training and an associate professor at Helsinki University. ', 'Her research, leading to calls for a simplification of the Finnish language, has sparked debate in academia.']

name: Billionaires
title: Artist
bios: ['Asok Kumar Hiranandani is the co-founder of the erstwhile Royal Brothers property group.', 'He separated from his older brother Raj Kumar in 2011 after dividing their property empire. ', 'His Royal Group, run by son Bobby, owns such trophies as the 215-room Sofitel Singapore Sentosa Resort and the So Softel Hotel in Singapore.', 'In 2017, they sold their iconic Intercontinental Hotel in Sydney for $112 million.']
abouts: ["Son Bobby's wedding celebration, held at their Sentosa resort in December 2016, drew more than 3,000 guests."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Indian property tycoon Niranjan Hiranandani cofounded Hiranandani Group with brother Surendra, who now runs his independent venture.', 'The brothers still own some assets jointly, mainly the Powai township in suburban Mumbai, which they built on a former quarry. \r\n', "They sold their commercial and retail assets in Powai to Canda's Brookfield Asset Management for $1 billion. ", 'Through his family office Nidar Group, Hiranandani is investing in energy infrastructure, building natural gas pipelines and gas storage terminals.']
abouts: ["Hiranandani's son Darshan, a graduate of the Rochester Institute of Technology, heads the energy venture.", 'His wife Kamal is involved in the group.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Huang Qiaoling, one of China's most successful theme park entrepreneurs, chairs Songcheng Performance Development. \r\n", 'Huang businesses operate 30 theme parks and 10 resorts.', 'Huang served in the army from 1975-80, and his early career was in the arts.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Huang Zhuangmian chairs logistic services firm Shenzhen Feima International Supply Chain.', 'Feima was founded in 1998 and trades on the Shenzhen Stock Exchange.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Hal Jackman and his family are the largest shareholders of E-L Financial Corporation, a Toronto investment and insurance holding company.', 'His father, former Parliament member Harry Jackman, built a financial services empire, which Hal continued to expand over his decades at the helm.', 'His son, Duncan, now runs the business as chief executive officer, president and chairman of E-L Financial.', "Jackman followed in his father's footsteps into politics, serving as the 25th lieutenant governor of Ontario from 1991 to 1997."]
abouts: ['Jackman was also chancellor of his alma mater, The University of Toronto, from 1997 to 2003.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Motorcycle tycoon Rahul Bajaj's nephew Anurang Jain started Endurance Technologies in 1985 to supply aluminum castings to his uncle's Bajaj Auto.\r\n", 'Jain owns 58% of Endurance, which supplies parts for two-wheelers and three-wheelers in India and car parts in Europe.', 'Endurance has 18 factories in India and 8 in Europe.', "The company's shares have soared since its listing in 2016."]
abouts: ["Jain's twin Tarang runs his own auto components firm called Varroc Engineering and is also a billionaire.\r\n", 'Their father Naresh Chandra chairs both the companies.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Scion of a Thai property clan, Keeree Kanjanapas is the founder and chairman of BTS Group Holdings, operator of Bangkok's famous Skytrain.\r\n", 'His U.K.-educated son, Kavin, has been running BTS since 2015.', 'In a recent foray into hotels, BTS acquired Vienna House in 2017 for $350 million, with a string of properties in Europe and Asia.\r\n', "Keeree's interests include media firm VGI  and a joint venture with SET-listed developer Sansiri to build condo towers along mass transit lines. "]
abouts: ['Before plunging into mass transit, Keeree built a sportswear business in Hong Kong, which owned a Puma franchise.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Kim Nam-jung is the vice president of Dongwon, best known as the makers behind South Korea's canned tunas. ", 'He is the younger son of Chairman Kim Jae-chul, who founded the business in 1969; his first overseas base was in Ghana in 1973. ', 'In addition to a wide range of packaged seafood, Dongwon provides outsourced meals, operates cold-storage facilities and has a logistics operation. ']
abouts: ['Nam-jung joined the business in a blue-collar position in 1996.', 'Dongwon acquired leading U.S. tuna brand StarKist in 2008. ']

name: Billionaires
title: Investor
bios: ['Investment legend Seth Klarman runs Boston-based firm Baupost. With $32 billion under management, Baupost is one of the largest hedge funds.', 'Klarman is seen as an expert in value investing. His book "Margin of Safety," a cult classic among investors, sells for as much as $3,000 on Amazon.', "An avid philanthropist, his foundation's assets hit $520 million as of the latest public filing. ", 'Once a major donor to the Republican Party, Klarman publicly denounced Trump in 2016, and has been contributing to the Democratic Party.']
abouts: ["In 2017, Klarman's horse, Cloud Computing, won the Preakness Stakes at Pimlico, the racetrack he grew up next to in Baltimore.", 'Klarman, whose philanthropic efforts focus on scientific research and promoting access to music learning, is also a major supporter of causes in Israel.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Alexander Klyachin owns one of the biggest Russian hotel chains, Azimut, which has more than 4,200 rooms altogether.\r\n', "Klyachin earned his fortune largely in Moscow's commercial real estate market and from buying out land from collective farmers. ", 'Another Klyachin company, KR Properties, turns factories and plants into business centers and loft projects while keeping their old age exterior.', 'He invests his income from real estate into energy: in 2013 he bought 26.7% stake in Exillon Energy, an oil producer in Komi region and West Siberia.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Yuriy Kosiuk heads MHP, Ukraine's biggest producer of poultry.", 'He studied food process engineering at Kiev Food Industry Institute and got his start importing furniture as well as gas from Turkmenistan. ', 'He then began trading grain after the collapse of the Soviet Union and eventually moved into poultry in 1998 with 10 employees.', 'Kosiuk took MHP public in 2008; he owns about 65% of the company, which trades in London. ']
abouts: ['Kosiuk pays himself handsomely through dividends and has used the cash to buy himself airplanes, a helicopter, a yacht and several cars, including a Lamborghini.  ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Bolivian-born Miguel Krigsner founded Grupo Boticario, Brazil's second-largest cosmetics company behind number one, Natura. ", 'Grupo Boticario operates in cities around Brazil and seven other countries. Krigsner owns nearly 80% of the $1.15 billion (revenues) firm. ', 'His brother-in-law Artur Grynbaum joined as a financial assistant and worked his way up to CEO of the group. He owns about 20% of the group. ', "In 1990 Krigsner create Foundation Boticario de Protecao a Natureza, which receives about 1% of Grupo Boticario's net income annually."]
abouts: ['His parents fled Nazi Germany to settle in Bolivia in the 1940s. Krigsner was born in Bolivia and moved to Brazil in 1961.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Lee Yin Yee is the founder and chairman of Xinyi Glass Holdings.', 'Xinyi Glass produces glass products for the automobile, construction and household good industries.', 'Early in his career, Lee was involved in auto-part trading.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Nicola Leibinger-Kammueller owns 26.7% of the world's largest manufacturer of machine tools, TRUMPF.", 'The company traces its roots to 1923 when Christian Trumpf acquired a machine shop in Stuttgart.', 'Nicola\'s father, Berthold Leibinger, joined the company in 1961 and developed the first contour "nibbling" machine tool with numerical control.', 'Christian Trumpf, who had no children, chose Berthold as his successor and handed over control of the company to him in 1972.', "After retiring from management in 2005, Berthold passed the company's ownership to his three children."]
abouts: ['Nicola, in addition to being active in various scientific, cultural and social institutions, is a board member at Siemens AG, Voith GmbH and Axel Springer SE.']
