name: Billionaires
bios: ['Li Weiwei, also known as Li Yifei, is vice chairman and general manager of Wuhu Shunrong Sanqi Interactive Entertainment Network Technology.', 'Li holds EMBA from Cheung Kong Graduate School of Business.', 'Li worked for several IT companies including Sina before he founded Sanqi in 2011.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Dubbed the "Elon Musk of China," William Li is the founder and chairman of Bitauto, a provider of web content for the auto industry. ', 'Li also founded Shanghai-headquartered electric car maker Nio, which began taking orders for its first electric SUV in December 2017.', 'Nio, which has raised $2.1 billion in funding, went public in Sept. 2018 at the New York Stock Exchange. ', "Li holds a bachelor's degree in sociology from Peking University."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Li Yihai chairs China's Jiminkexin Group, a pharmaceuticals industy supplier that is also involved in real estate and healthcare. \r\n", 'Li started his career in drug retailing in Beijing.\r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Li Yong is chairman of Shenzhen-listed energy company CEFC Anhui International Holding.', "He has a master's degree of economics from City University London."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Lin Ming-hsiung chairs Pxmart, one of Taiwan's largest supermarket chains.", 'Lin also controls real estate developer Yuanlih Construction and Hwatai Bank of Taipei.', 'Lin bought Pxmart from the government in 1998.  ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Lou Zhongfu is cofounder and honorary chair of Guangsha Holding Group, a private conglomerate headquartered in the eastern Chinese city of Hangzhou.', 'Lou was appointed the general manger of collectively-owned Dongyang Chengguan Construction Co., the predecessor business of Guangsha, back in 1984. \r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Known as the coal king, Singapore-born Low Tuck Kwong is the founder of Bayan Resources, a coal mining company in Indonesia.', 'Low also controls Singapore shipping firm Manhattan Resources.', "Low worked for his father's construction company in Singapore in his twenties and then moved to Indonesia in 1972 for better opportunities. ", 'Low thrived as a building contractor but hit the jackpot after buying his first mine in 1997.']
abouts: ['The animal lover has a zoo with gibbons, sun bears, dozens of peacocks and orangutans that are apparently rehabilitated for reintroduction into the wild.', 'After a failed effort to sell out, Low took his coal company Bayan Resources public in 2008.  ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Property developer P.N.C.Menon left Kerala in south India and migrated to Oman in 1976 to start an interior decorating business with a partner. ', 'Seeing an opportunity in real estate back home, Menon started Sobha Developers in 1995, in Bangalore, naming it after his wife.', 'Sobha Developers is run by son Ravi, an engineer from Purdue University, while Menon lives in Dubai.', "Sobha's Middle East operations span the UAE, Qatar, Oman and other Gulf countries. \r\n"]
abouts: ["Sobha has a $6.8 billion joint venture with the government of Umm al-Quwain to develop the UAE's least-known emirate into a tourist hot spot.  ", 'Menon and his wife have signed the Giving Pledge.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Thomas Meyer is CEO of Spanish retailer Desigual. ', 'Meyer started the brand in 1984 with a denim jacket created from a patchwork of worn blue jeans that he designed. ', 'The first store opened in Ibiza in 1986. There are now 500 in 33 countries around the world. ', 'Meyer sold a 10% stake in his company to French investment firm Eurazeo for nearly $400 million in 2014.']

name: Billionaires
title: Investor
bios: ['Together with brother David, Ezra Nahmad is an international megadealer of modern and impressionist art, which they trade mostly at auction.', 'The two own an inventory worth some $3 billion that they store in a duty-free warehouse next to the airport in Geneva, Switzerland. ', 'Their stockpile includes works by more than 30 blue chip artists, from Monet and Matisse to Renoir and Rothko. ', 'Among their holdings: 300 Picassos, worth at least $1 billion. ']
abouts: ["Ezra's son Hillel owns the Helly Nahmad gallery in London; his nephew, also named Hillel, owns a gallery by the same name in New York City. ", 'Though Ezra and David attend auctions together, Ezra keeps a low profile and never talks to the press, unlike his voluble brother.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Neilson is the ex-wife of billionaire Kerr Neilson and is also a billionaire. She's reported to have her own property portfolio.", 'She holds a stake in international equities manager Platinum Asset Management, founded in 1994 by her former husband.', "The Zimbabwe-born former graphic designer is founder and director of Sydney's White Rabbit Gallery.", "The gallery showcases one of the world's biggest collections of contemporary Chinese art post-2000.", 'She kickstarted another Sydney art gallery and a performance space called Phoenix.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Madeleine Olsson-Eriksson is a part owner of Stena Sphere, a privately held Swedish conglomerate. ', 'Interests include cruising, shipping, offshore drilling, property and metal recycling.', "Madeleine's father, Sten, founded Stena in 1939 as a trading company.", 'Her brother Dan took over in 1983 and now owns 51% of the company. Madeleine and her brother StefanSten Olsson own 12.5% and 24.5%, respectively.', "Madeleine's children, Gustav and Marie, each own 6%  and have seats on different boards in the company."]
abouts: ['She became the first of her family to go to college, earning a degree in medicine and pursuing a career as a gynecologist.', 'Aside from an 12.5% stake in Stena, she is also part owner of a clinic in Gothenburg.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Ou Zonghong is the founder and chairman of real estate developer Ronshine China.', 'Established in 2003, Shanghai-headquartered Ronshine focuses on residential properties.', 'Earlier in his career,  Ou set up a highway construction business in southern China.']

name: Billionaires
title: Entrepreneur
bios: ['Eren Ozmen is president and majority owner of private aerospace and defense company Sierra Nevada Corp.', 'Its Dream Chaser spaceplane has been selected by NASA to haul cargo to and from the International Space Station beginning in 2020.', 'Ozmen and her husband Fatih, both Turkish immigrants, bought Sierra Nevada in 1994 when it had just 20 employees.', 'They have orchestrated 19 acquisitions and turned Sierra Nevada into a multi-billion dollar contractor to the Department of Defense.', 'Sierra Nevada is best known for providing the military with souped-up planes, loaded with cameras, sensors, navigation gear and coms systems.']
abouts: ["Ozmen sold baklava and cleaned Sierra Nevada's office building to put herself through business school at the University of Nevada, Reno.", 'The couple used their house as collateral to get a loan and take control of the company in a management buyout.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Fatih Ozmen is CEO and co-owner of private defense and aerospace company Sierra Nevada Corp. ', 'Its Dream Chaser spaceplane has been tapped by NASA to ferry food, water, supplies and scientific experiments to the International Space Station.', "Ozmen immigrated from Turkey in the 1980s to pursue a master's degree in engineering at the University of Nevada, Reno.", 'He and his wife, Eren, bought SNC in 1994 when it had just 20 employees; it now has nearly 4,000 employees in 33 locations.', 'Sierra Nevada is best-known for providing souped-up military planes, loaded with cameras, sensors, coms systems and navigation gear, to the military.']
abouts: ['Ozmen was a former national cycling champion in Turkey.', 'The couple used their house as collateral to get a loan and take control of the company in a management buyout.']

name: Billionaires
title: Entrepreneur
bios: ['Jose Issac Peres founded Multiplan, one of the largest shopping mall operators in Brazil. Multiplan plans, develops, owns and manages shopping malls.  ', 'At age 22 while an economics student, he founded his first company, real estate developer Vepan, which he turned into publicly-traded Multiplan.', "He still owns almost one third of Multiplan's stock. ", "In 2014 Peres' Village Mall property in Rio de Janeiro became the site of Brazil's first official Apple Store. "]
abouts: ["Peres, a Rio de Janeiro native, is passionate about his hometown and refuses to move Multiplan's headquarters to Sao Paulo, Brazil's main financial main center."]

name: Billionaires
title: Chief Product Officer and Chairman
bios: ['Mark Pincus cofounded Zynga, an online social game maker known for popular apps Words With Friends, Mafia Wars and FarmVille.', 'A serial entrepreneur who made early investments in Facebook and Twitter, Pincus launched several successful websites before creating Zynga in 2007.', 'He made headlines in April 2012 when he sold off about 16.5 million Zynga shares in a move that was widely criticized.', "Pincus was able to sell while employees were forced to hold on to their shares during the stock's steep decline in the following months.", "Pincus has 2 Ivy League degrees: he graduated summa cum laude from Penn's Wharton School of Business and got an MBA from Harvard's Business School."]
abouts: ["Zynga is named after Pincus' late dog, Zinga, an American Bulldog. The company's red and white logo is a rendering of the bulldog.", 'In March 2017 his wife Alison, co-founder of One Kings Lane which sold to Bed Bath & Beyond for $30 million, filed for divorce and challenged their prenup agreement.']

name: Billionaires
title: Chairman and CEO
bios: ['Under Armour founder Kevin Plank built a popular sportswear brand as the underdog competitor to Nike.', "Noticing his football teammates' sweat-soaked shirts, Plank came up with a lightweight, sweat-wicking shirt using fabrics from women's undergarments.", "In the mid 1990s he sold his first shirts from his grandmother's basement, exaggerating to early customers to make the company sound bigger. ", "Plank, who is Under Armour's CEO, took the company public 2005; he owns a nearly 16% stake.", 'He is building a 4 million-square-foot headquarters for Under Armour in Baltimore as part of a larger development called Port Covington.  ']
abouts: ["Plank got kicked out of his high school after an alcohol-fueled brawl with Georgetown U football players; he later walked onto the U. of Maryland's football team.", "Plank served on Trump's manufacturing council but resigned in August 2017 after the president did not criticize neo-Nazi protestors in Charlottesville, Virginia. "]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Nicholas (Nick) Pritzker is a cousin of the late Jay Pritzker and his brothers Donald and Robert, who built the Hyatt hotel chain and other holdings.', "Pritzker spent many years leading Hyatt's new hotel development efforts but he has since sold most of his Hyatt stock.", 'He has shifted his attention and investment dollars to causes like clean energy, marijuana legalization and criminal justice reform.', 'He cofounded and cochairs Clean Energy Trust, which invests in clean energy companies in the Midwest. ']
abouts: ['In the 2016 election, Pritzker teamed up with Netflix CEO Reed Hastings to back repeal of the death penalty in California; voters did not approve the measure.', 'He also invests in life sciences, biotech and tech through family investment firm Tao Capital. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Que Wenbin's wealth comes mainly from a majority stake in Shenzhen-listed Hengkang Medical Group, a herbal medicine supplier. ", 'He also controls Sichuan Western Resources Holding, a Shanghai-listed non-ferrous metal company that operates in Gansu and Jiangxi.', "Que doesn't hold a title in either company.", 'Hengkang was formerly known as Gansu Duyiwei Biological Pharmaceutical.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['In 1967 Jorge Rodriguez Rodriguez and his brother Vito founded Jose Rodríguez Banda SA, a transport company that provided services for mining firms.', "In 1986 the brothers bought Gloria SA, Peru's largest evaporated milk producer.", 'Nestlé had owned a 60% stake but decided to sell after Alan García, then-president of Peru, said Gloria should be transferred to Peruvian farmers.', 'Today Rodriguez and his brother have stakes in food companies in Argentina, Bolivia, Colombia, Ecuador, Puerto Rico and Uruguay.', 'In 2014 they bought 51% of Soboce, the largest producer of cement in Bolivia, for $300 million; they already owned 47% of the company. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Saji is chairman of drinks powerhouse Suntory Holdings, which bought Beam, purveyor of Jim Beam and Maker's Mark bourbon, for $16 billion in 2014.", 'He stepped down as president in 2014, turning the reins over to a non-family member for first time since the business was founded in 1899.', 'Saji owns nearly 9% of Suntory Holdings, a closely held company. Its Suntory Beverage & Food unit trades on the Tokyo Stock Exchange.', "Saji's nephew Nobuhiro Torii, a great grandson of Suntory's founder, was promoted to COO and executive vice president of Suntory Holdings in 2016. "]

name: Billionaires
title: Founder
bios: ['Hedge fund billionaire, turned activist investor, Thomas Sandell runs Sandell Asset Management, which he founded in 1998. ', 'Hit hard by the great recession, the Swedish credit market specialist has built up his fortune twice.', 'Since 2013, Sandell has shifted tactics and engaged in loud proxy battles with firms like Bob Evans Farms and British transport group FirstGroup.', 'Sandell earned an MBA from Columbia University and in 1988 landed a spot at Bear Stearns.', "At Bear Stearns he worked with famed investment banker Ace Greenberg on such deals as Kirk Kerkorian's attempted buyout of Chrysler."]
abouts: ['Sandell is a former badminton champion in his native Sweden.', 'He privately invests in modern art, and owns pieces by Lichtenstein and Basquiat.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Eddy Kusnadi Sariaatmadja controls and runs three Indonesian TV channels, including SCTV, Indosiar and O Channel, through publicly-traded Emtek.', 'He has a majority stake in Emtek, which he founded in 1983 as the exclusive Compaq computer distributor in Indonesia.', 'His son Alvin Sariaatmadja is president director of Emtek, which is formally called \r\nPT Elang Mahkota Teknologi.', "In April 2017, Emtek announced a collaboration with Alibaba of China's payments affiliate Ant Financial to develop a payment system in Indonesia."]
abouts: ['In mid 2017, his media company Emtek hosted the Indonesian Diaspora Network Global event, featuring former U.S. President Barack Obama as a speaker. ', 'In 2016 Emtek subsidiary Creative Media Works paid about $200 million for a license to develop new features for BlackBerry Messenger, which is popular in Indonesia.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Octogenarian investment manager Fayez Sarofim is chairman and Co-Chief Investment Officer of money management firm Fayez Sarofim & Co.', 'Sarofim, nicknamed "The Sphinx," was one of the first investors in energy pipeline firm Kinder Morgan.', 'He received an M.B.A. from Harvard Business School before starting his own investment firm in 1958.', 'He sits on the board of the Memorial Sloan-Kettering Cancer Center as well as the Texas Heart Institute.']
abouts: ['He is the son of a wealthy Egyptian cotton farmer.', 'He made his fortune as a buy-and-hold specialist with long-term investments in Philip Morris, Coca-Cola, and Procter & Gamble.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Monika Schoeller and her brothers Stefan and Dieter von Holtzbrinck inherited publishing house Verlagsgruppe Holtzbrinck from their father, Georg.', "Originally founded as a book club in 1948, Holtzbrinck's businesses include Macmillan Publishers, S. Fischer Verlag and Holtzbrinck Digital.", 'In 2006, Dieter sold his shares to his siblings, leaving them each with 50% of the company.', 'Holtzbrinck Ventures was founded in 2000 as an investment arm of the publishing business and became independent in 2010.', 'HV has invested in many internet and e-commerce startups including Zalando, Groupon, HelloFresh and Rocket Internet.']
abouts: ['Schoeller sits on the board of S. Fischer Verlag, the original publisher of authors Thomas Mann, Franz Kafka and Hermann Hesse.', 'Active in the German Literature Archive, she donated to it the archive of S. Fischer Verlag.']

name: Billionaires
title: Entrepreneur
bios: ["Antonio Luiz Seabra founded Natura Cosmeticos in 1969 as Brazil's answer to Avon and built it into Brazil's largest beauty company.", 'Some 1.4 million "consultants" (mainly women) sell Natura products door-to-door across Brazil, six other Latin American countries and France.', "Natura Cosmeticos, which went public in 2004, bought bought UK Cosmetics chain The Body Shop from L'Oréal in 2017 for over $1 billion.", 'Seabra is co-chairman of the board of Natura and also owns Bresco, a Brazilian property-rental operation focused on warehouses, offices and hotels.', 'Media-shy Seabra reportedly owns an apartment on the banks of the river Seine in Paris as well as real estate in London.']
abouts: ['Seabra communicates directly to employees through motivational videos. He is known for quoting poetry and philosophy in business meetings.\r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Yuri Shefler is owner of S.P.I. Group, which produces and sells alcohol under 380 brands in 160 countries. ', 'Its best known brand is Stolichnaya vodka, which Shefler bought from state-owned VVO Soyuzplodoimport for $285,000 in 1997. ', "Russia's Supreme Court ruled the sale illegal in 2001, banning Shefler from selling the vodka inside its borders. ", 'In 2014, the Netherlands, Luxembourg and Belgium joined Russia in banning sales of Stolichnaya.', 'S.P.I. owns rum company Louisiana Spirits Company, tequila company Fabrica de Tequilas Finos in Mexico and wine producer Achaval Ferrer in Argentina.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Rajju Shroff is the founder of crop protection company UPL, owning over 26% of the company.', 'UPL is among the top ten agro-chemical companies in the world, with a product range that includes seeds, fungicides and crop protection chemicals.', 'UPL exports to more than 130 countries and has 33 factories across the world.', "Shroff's older son Jai is the company's chief executive officer and vice chairman."]
abouts: ['The company was started in 1969 to produce red phosphorous for industrial chemicals.', "UPL debuted on Forbes Asia's prestigious Fab 50 list in 2017."]

name: Billionaires
title: Founder
bios: ['Raised in Austria during Nazi-rule, Frank Stronach emigrated to Canada and founded auto parts manufacturer, Magna International, in 1957.', 'Stronach divested himself of all equity in Magna by 2013 and placed all his assets in multiple trusts for his kids, court filings show.', 'In November 2013, he moved to Austria to lead his populist right-wing political party, Team Stronach for Austria.', 'He quit politics in less than two months, moved back to Canada and started buying up Florida land for a big push into grass-fed beef.', 'He sued his daughter Belinda in October 2018, saying she mismanaged the family company, TSG, which has interests in horse tracks and gambling.', "Belinda, who is currently the president of TSG where she has the majority stake, denies Stronach's allegations."]
abouts: ['In January 2017 he held the inaugural Pegasus Cup, billed as "the world\'s richest Thoroughbred race" thanks to its $12 million purse, at Gulfstream Park.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Kevin Systrom launched photo-sharing mobile phone app Instagram in 2010.', 'Facebook bought Instagram for $1 billion in stock and cash in 2012, and Systrom stayed on to continue running it. He left Facebook in September 2018.', 'Systrom owned 40% of Instagram going into the deal, and got mostly Facebook stock.', 'Under Systrom as CEO, Instagram became a fast growing app, with 1 billion monthly users as of mid 2018.']
abouts: ['Systrom has convinced well known public figures to join the platform, including Pope Francis and singer Selena Gomez.', 'Known for wearing stylish suits, Systrom is a regular at fashion and cultural events, from the Met Gala to the Oscars.\r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Shanghai-born entrepreneur Tang Hsiang-chien, who was known as Hong Kong's textile king,  died in March 2018 at age 95. ", 'Tang made his first fortune manufacturing textiles and then had success with printed-circuit-board-maker Meadville. ', 'His son Henry served as financial secretary and then chief secretary of Hong Kong from 2003 to 2011 before running for chief executive in 2012. ', 'Henry lost after a series of controversies and scandals cut his support.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Tang Jianfang is the founder and controlling shareholder of Zhou Hei Ya International Holdings, a supplier of braised duck. ', "Tang's husband Zhou Fuyu is the company chairman.", 'The two founded their business and established the first store in 2002.', 'Zhou Hei Ya listed on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange in November 2016.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Ning Tang pioneered marketplace lending in China when he founded CreditEase, a peer-to-peer lending firm, in 2006.', 'The privately held fintech conglomerate also offers services like crowdfunding and online financial management.', 'CreditEase, which operates in 255 cities in China as well as around the world, listed its lending arm Yirendai on the New York Stock Exchange in 2015.', "Tang holds a bachelor's degree in economics from the University of the South in Sewanee, Tennessee."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Jim Thompson started his moving company, Crown Worldwide, in Japan in 1965, with $1,000. ', "Crown Worldwide is now one of the world's largest privately held relocation companies, with operations in 60 countries and more than 5,000 employees.", 'Crown Worldwide is also involved in document storage and fine-arts transportation.', "Thompson moved the company's headquarters to Hong Kong in 1978. He is a permanent resident of Hong Kong.", 'Thompson is a native of the U.S. state of New Jersey; he owns a country estate in Ireland, near the home of his ancestors.']
abouts: ['In his adopted home, Hong Kong, Thompson served as chairman of the American Chamber of Commerce in Hong Kong. ', 'Thompson celebrates his birthday with an annual tradition of doing a push-up for every year of his life.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Jonathan Tisch's late father Bob (d. 2005) started Loews Corporation with his brother Laurence as a New Jersey hotel venture in 1946.", 'Today, Loews is active in insurance, drilling rigs, natural gas pipelines, and hotels.', "Jonathan's mother Joan (d. 2017) was the largest individual shareholder (with 6%) of Loews, where Jonathan is co-chairman with his cousin Andrew.", 'His father Bob also bought a 50% stake in the New York Giants for $75 million in 1991.', "Jonathan's brother Steve is chairman and executive vice president of the Giants, which FORBES values at $3.3 billion."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Kenneth Tuchman is the founder and CEO of call center outsourcing giant TTEC, a public company operating on six continents.', "Tuchman's personal frustration with the way businesses approached customer service led him to found the company in 1982.", 'Today, he is the majority owner of the $1.5 billion (sales) company, which handles customer inquires via phone, messaging and social media.', 'Tuchman originally studied architecture at a junior college and dropped out to pursue his own business ventures.']
abouts: ['As a teenager, Tuchman sold millions of puka shell necklaces to retailers, becoming one of the largest shell importers from the Philippines.', "Most of Tuchman's international call centers are located in the Philippines."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Wim van der Leegte ran VDL Groep, one of Europe's largest privately held auto and bus manufacturers, for 50 years before retiring in November 2016.", "When he retired, his son Willem took over as president. Wim's other two children, Pieter and Jennifer, serve on the executive board. ", 'Van der Leegte owns a majority of the company; his children own the rest. ', 'His late father, Pieter van der Leegte, founded the company in 1953.']
abouts: ['Van der Leegte started working at the firm when he was just 19 years old while studying at a technical college; within three months he was running the company.', 'Van der Leegte owns a stud farm where he breeds and trains top show-jumping horses. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Shamsheer Vayalil, son-in-law of Gulf retailing billionaire M.A. Yusuff Ali, founded VPS Healthcare, a network of hospitals, clinics and pharmacies.', 'Born into a business family in Kerala state, he migrated to the Middle East after his medical studies and worked as a radiologist at a local hospital. ', 'Backed initially by his wealthy father-in-law, Vayalil started with one hospital in Abu Dhabi in 2007. ', 'VPS also owns the Rockland Hospital chain in Delhi and the VPS Lakeshore Hospital in Kochi. ', 'In late 2017, Vayalil took charge as vice-chairman and managing director of investment firm Amanat Holdings, after acquiring a 21% stake in it.']
abouts: ["Egyptian national Eman Ahmed, once billed as 'the world's heaviest woman', was treated free of cost at Vayalil's Burjeel Hospital until her death in September 2017.", 'Vayalil recently signed the Giving Pledge.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Civil engineer Thongma Vijitpongpun founded Pruksa in 1993 and built it intoThailand's biggest property developer of low-to-middle income housing.", 'Pruksa, which is known for its affordable prefab townhouses, went public in 2005.', 'In a 2016 restructuring, Thongma delisted Pruksa Real Estate and formed a new holding outfit, Pruksa Holding. \r\n']
abouts: ['As a youngster, he helped his father hawk fish-maw soup.', 'Thongma enjoys reading books on Buddhist philosophy.\r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Arkady Volozh is the principal founder and largest individual shareholder of publicly traded search engine Yandex, Russia's Google. ", 'He cofounded the business with Ilya Segalovich who died of cancer in 2013.', 'Volozh started working on search in 1989, which led to him establishing Arkadia Company in 1990, a company that developed search software.', 'His early achievements include the development of electronic search for use in patents, Russian classical literature and the Bible.', 'Volozh is head of the Department of Data Analysis at MIPT, one of the leading Russian universities.']
abouts: ['He cofounded several IT outfits, including InfiNet Wireless, a provider of wireless networking technology.', 'He also founded CompTek International, a distributor of network and telecom equipment in Russia.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Stefan von Holtzbrinck, his brother Dieter and sister Monika Schoeller inherited publishing house Verlagsgruppe Holtzbrinck from their father, Georg.', "Originally founded as a book club in 1948, Holtzbrinck's businesses include Macmillan Publishers, S. Fischer Verlag and Holtzbrinck Digital.", ' In 2006, Dieter sold his shares to his siblings, leaving them each with 50% of the company.', 'Holtzbrinck Ventures was founded in 2000 as an investment arm of the publishing business and became independent in 2010. ', 'HV has invested in many internet and e-commerce startups including Zalando, Groupon, HelloFresh and Rocket Internet.']
abouts: ['Stefan, who serves as CEO of the Holtzbrinck publishing group, is a lawyer by trade.', "Prior to joining his father's company, he apprenticed at Bloomsbury Publishing in London."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Wang Jiufang is the chairman of Ningbo-based developer Rongan Property, a real estate concern. \r\n', 'He shares his fortune with son Wang Congwei, a Rongan director and general manager.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Wong Hong King is the controlling shareholder of Hong Kong-listed LVGEM China Real Estate Investment. ', "LVGEM was founded in 1995. Wong's daughter is chairman and his son is executive director. "]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Ian Wood transformed a family-owned fishing business based in Aberdeen, Scotland into Wood Group, a multinational oil services company. ', 'He joined the firm in 1962, became CEO in 1967, and took the business public in 2002. He then served as chairman before retiring in 2012. ', 'Under his watch, Wood Group expanded its operations to over 50 countries and now has over 42,000 employees. ', 'Wood and his family have sold much of their stake in the company over the years, diversifying into other investments.']
abouts: ['Wood was knighted in 1994.', "He helped set up Opportunity North East, an economic development agency that aims to revitalize and diversify Aberdeen's oil-dependent economy."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Xiao Chunhong is the chairman of China real estate developer Homnicen Group.', 'The Guizhou real estate developer is also involved in hotel investment and management.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Jacky Xu runs and owns most of Trendy International, a popular apparel company with brands that include Ochirly and Five Plus.', 'L Capital, a private equity group backed by French luxury goods giant LVMH, bought a reported 10% of Trendy in 2011 for $200 million.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Zhang Hongwei chairs United Energy Group, an independent exploration and production company.', 'Zhang has 30 years of experience in management in China.', 'He is the father of Zhang Meiying, an executive director in the listing company.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Zhang Tao was the CEO of restaurant review site Dianping when it merged with Groupon-like Meituan in 2015. ', 'Zhang currently holds a stake in the combined business, which was valued at approximately $30 billion in 2017. ', 'Zhang received an MBA from Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania in 2002, and returned to China in 2003, when he set up Dianping.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['After a two year hiatus, Anu Aga regained her billionaire status on a jump in shares of engineering firm Thermax, in which she owns 62% of all shares.', 'Aga started working at Thermax in 1985 when it was run by her husband and took the helm in 1996 after he died of a heart attack. ', 'She stepped down as chairman in 2004, ceding the spot to her daughter Meher, a UK-trained chemical engineer who lets hired executives manage the firm.']
abouts: ['Aga cofounded Teach for India in 2008, a non-profit that recruits young people to teach for 2 years in schools for low-income kids. ', 'Aga is a nominated member of parliament.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Farkhad Akhmedov got his start selling Russian sables at the London commodity exchange. ', 'In 1987 he founded Tansley Trading, which supplied equipment to Russian gas producers. ', 'Six years later, he became a minority shareholder in Nortgas, an oil and gas company in Siberia.', 'In 1998 he bought out the 44% stake of another investor, Bechtel Energy, and became chairman. ', 'In 2012 he sold that stake for $1.4 billion. ']
abouts: ['Akhmedov has invested $55 million into a pomegranate juice factory in his native Azerbaijan, where his father worked during the Soviet era. ', 'In 2014 he bought the yacht Luna from Roman Abramovich.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Cousins Alberto Alcocer and Alberto Cortina married sisters Esther and Alicia Koplowitz, heiresses to one of the largest construction firms in Spain.', "The cousins, dubbed Los Albertos, ran their wives' Construcciones y Contratas firm from the early 1970s until 1989, when both marriages fell apart.", 'Alcocer and Cortina then moved into banking, running Banco Zaragozano. They sold their combined 40% stake to Barclays in 2004', 'Each of the cousins indirectly own stakes in Grupo Empresarial ENCE, the largest eucalyptus pulp producer in Europe.']
abouts: ['Alcocer owns several ranches in Cadiz and Toledo, Spain, along with houses in Paris and Madrid.', 'The Panama Papers revealed that Alcocer and his cousin Cortina had offshore accounts in the Central American tax haven country.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Bassam Alghanim inherited a stake in Alghanim Industries, a diversified company founded by his late father Yusuf and chaired by his brother Kutayba.', 'He is not involved in the business, which has a stake in Gulf Bank of Kuwait, sells GM and Honda cars, and owns a consumer electronics retailer.', 'Bassam and Kutayba, also a billionaire, have fought for years over the assets they inherited. An arbitration between the brothers is pending.']
abouts: ['Bassam Alghanim filed lawsuits against his brother in the U.S. and U.K., accusing him of hacking his email in 2008. ', 'He lives in Los Angeles and is the honorary consul of Saint Kitts and Nevis in California.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Kutayba Alghanim is the chairman of Alghanim Industries, which his late father Yusuf founded in 1932. His son Omar, who has a Harvard MBA, is CEO.', 'Alghanim sells GM and Ford cars in Kuwait, owns a consumer electronics retailer and Wendys restaurants in the Middle East, among other businesses.', 'Kutayba and billionaire brother Bassam fought for years over the division of assets they inherited. An arbitration to resolve the dispute is pending.']
abouts: ['After graduating from the University of California, Berkeley, Alghanim returned to Kuwait in 1970 and opened a store selling luxury furniture.', "In 2003, he turned his family's former summer residence in Lebanon into an orphanage and named it after his parents. "]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Alexandra Andresen, born in 1996, is the world's youngest billionaire at age 21.", 'She and her sister Katharina, one year her senior, each inherited 42% of the family-owned investment company Ferd.', "Andresen's father Johan still runs the company and controls 70% of the votes via a dual-class share structure.", 'Ferd runs hedge funds, is an active investor on the Nordic stock exchange, and has private equity investments.\r\n']
abouts: ['Alexandra is a three-time junior Norwegian champion in dressage riding.', 'The Andresen family has been a household name in Norway for over 100 years, primarily known for its tobacco brand, which they sold in 2005.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Katharina Andresen, born 1995, is the world's second youngest billionaire; only  her sister Alexandra is younger.", 'She and her sister, one year her junior,  each inherited 42% of the family-owned investment company Ferd.', "The sisters' father Johan still runs the company and controls 70% of the votes via a dual-class share structure.", 'Ferd runs hedge funds, is an active investor on the Nordic stock exchange, and has private equity investments.']
abouts: ['In 2017 Katharina was stopped by police at tony ski resort Hafjell and was found to be driving under the influence and was eventually fined $32,000. ', 'The Andresen family has been a household name in Norway for over 100 years, primarily known for its tobacco brand, which they sold in 2005.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Vasily Anisimov's development company Coalco has 44,000 acres of land near Moscow. ", 'Some of the land is a high end village called Akulinino where friends of President Vladimir Putin, like billionaire Arkady Rotenberg, have houses.', 'Anisimov made his first fortune in non-ferrous metals trading. \r\n', 'Later he became a partner of billionaires Alisher Usmanov and Andrei Skoch, before selling out to move into real estate.  ', 'Since 2010, Anisimov has headed the Russian Judo Federation. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Mori Arkin got his start in business in 1972 helping his father run a small Israeli pharmaceutical distribution company. ', 'The Arkins eventually moved into generic drug manufacturing, founding Agis Industries to do so.', 'In 2004, they sold Agis to U.S. pharmaceutical company Perrigo for $818 million in cash and stock. ', 'Still bullish on healthcare, he oversaw a January 2018 public offering on Nasdaq of Sol-Gel Technologies, a dermatology company. He owns over 65%.']
abouts: ['His two sons are involved in the family business; his daughter is serving in the Israel Defense Forses.', 'Arkin is an art history buff and enjoys composing music as a hobby.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Nigel Austin is the founder and majority owner of the Cotton On clothing and stationery group. Its brands include Cotton On, Supre, Factorie and Typo.', 'His company has grown rapidly in the past few years, expanding to 1,500 stores in 19 countries and estimated sales of $1.5 billion. ', 'About half of these stores are in Australia, while the other half are spread across countries including Singapore, South Africa and the U.S.', 'Founded in 1991, Austin started selling acid-washed denim jackets from the trunk of his car in his hometown southwest of Melbourne.', 'Now it sells inexpensive fashion basics, including T-shirts, leggings, sweatpants, shoes and underwear, as well as quirky stationery.']
abouts: ["Austin's late father, Grant Austin, ran a publicly traded clothing wholesale and import business called the Austin Group, where Austin would spend school holidays working.", 'In 1991 Austin set up his first store in a small space behind a butcher shop run by his grandfather and sourced merchandise from his father. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Descendant of the storied Bangur clan of Kolkata, Krishna Kumar Bangur chairs graphite electrodes-maker Graphite India.', 'The $507 million (revenue) company was set up in 1962 in collaboration with Great Lakes Carbon, an American firm.', "The company, which supplies leading steelmakers in India and overseas, is the world's third-largest producer of graphite electrodes. ", "It has lately benefitted from China's decision to replace polluting blast furnaces with electric arc furnaces to make steel. "]
abouts: ['Bangur joined the business at the age of 16.', "Graphite India has featured in Forbes Asia's list of Best Under A Billion companies."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Herb Chambers dominates the Massachusetts auto sales market, with $2.5 billion in revenues per year selling Hondas, Chevys, Cadillacs and Bentleys. ', "Chambers grew up in Boston's working-class Dorchester neighborhood, where he got his first job as a cart collector at the local supermarket. ", 'He later dropped out of high school during his senior year and joined the U.S. Navy. ', 'After returning, he borrowed $500 from his mother to start his first company, a copy distributor, which he sold for $80 million in 1983. ', 'Chambers then stumbled into the car sales business, purchasing a Cadillac dealership that had given him poor service. ']
abouts: ['An avowed car fanatic, he owns vintage Ferraris and a rare McLaren F1.', 'He rides his helicopter when commuting from Connecticut to his Somerville, MA headquarters.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['R.G. Chandramogan, who never went to college, started a tiny venture in 1970 to make ice cream.', "Today, his listed Hatsun Agro Product is India's largest private dairy company. ", 'Everyday Hatsun gets milk directly from 300,000 farmers spread across 13,000 villages.', 'Hatsun also exports dairy ingredients to more than 38 countries.']
abouts: ["Chandramogan's first ice creams were sold on pushcarts."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Chang Pyung-soon is Chairman of Kyowon Group, one of the biggest educational companies in Korea, which he founded in 1985. ', 'With education and training centers in bucolic settings throughout South Korea, Kyowon provides training programs to some 43,000 Kyowon staff members.', 'He has diversified and the company now has interests in educational travel programs, leisure activities, hotels and health foods. ']
abouts: ['His Kyowon Group also provides "lifestyle" products, including water purifiers and Oriental herb-based cosmetics.', 'Chang started out as a salesman. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Chao Teng-hsiung is the founder and largest shareholder of Farglory Land, one of Taiwan's largest real estate developers.", 'He also controls Farglory FTZ Investment Holding, Farglory Life Insurance and Farglory Hotel.', 'Son Frank took over as Farglory Land chairman in 2014 amid a corruption scandal involving Chao.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Chen Liying cofounded Yunda Express, one of China's biggest logistics companies, in Shanghai in 1999.", 'Yunda Express went public through a reverse merger on the Shenzhen Stock Exchange in December 2016.', 'Chen owns near 21% of the listed company Yunda Holding, and serves as vice chairman.\r\n', 'Husband Nie Tengyun is a fellow billionaire and chairman of Yunda Holding.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Chen Tianqiao is the founder, chairman and CEO of Shanda Investment Group, founded in 1999 by Chen and his family.', 'Chen is credited with having pioneered and built the online game industry and the online literature industry in China.', 'Chen stepped down as CEO of Shanda Interactive Entertainment in 2012 and then took the company private.', 'Chen and his wife Chrissy are active philanthropists, supporting research programs on brain science.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Henry Cheng succeeded his late father, Cheng Yu-tung, as chairman of family flagships Chow Tai Fook Jewellery Group and New World Development.', 'Cheng chairs at least seven companies in the family network and serves as a director of privately held family investment vehicles.', "Brother Peter Cheng oversees the family's mainland China property portfolio, which has an estimated value of $16 billion. ", "At least ten family members work in the family network of enterprises, including Henry Cheng's Harvard-educated children Adrian and Sonia. ", 'Adrian Cheng is an executive director at both flagship companies and Sonia Cheng is CEO of Rosewood Hotel Group, acquired by New World in 2011. ']
abouts: ["The late Cheng Yu-tung and his eldest child, Henry, are rare father and son winners of Hong Kong's Gold Bauhinia Medal for service to the city.", 'Henry Cheng purchased a 59.6-carat pink diamond for $71 million in 2017 and renamed it the CTF Pink Star as a tribute to his late father. ', "Chow Tai Fook's Hong Kong Stock Exchange code 1929 commemorates the year of the jewelry chain's founding in Guangzhou, China."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Chey Ki-won is the younger sister of SK Group Chairman Chey Tae-Won. ', 'Her 7.4% stake in SK Holdings accounts for her wealth.', "She chairs SK's Happiness Sharing Foundation, which conducts educational programs for poor children and sets up and runs social enterprises."]
abouts: ['Over ten years, her Happiness Sharing Foundation has provided 31 million lunch boxes to starving children. ', 'The foundation also invests in social entrepreneurship and has funded 17 social businesses to date. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Chi Yufeng chairs Shenzhen-listed online game firm Perfect World.', 'Chi holds an undergraduate degree in chemistry from prestigious Tsinghua University and a MBA from CEIBS. \r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['High school dropout Chua Thian Poh got his start making hooks and spikes for the logging industry. ', 'Chua went on to found luxury property developer Ho Bee Land, known for building high-end condos in Sentosa.', 'The company has a diversified portfolio that includes commercial property overseas, notably in London and Munich.', 'In June 2018, Ho Bee purchased a London office block for $850 million. ']
abouts: ["Chua is Singapore's non-resident ambassador to the Republic of Maldives.", 'In 2017, Chua donated $7 million to the National University of Singapore for a new community leadership center. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Chung Yong-jin is a grandson of Samsung Group founder, Lee Byung-Chull, and nephew of Samsung chairman Lee Kun-Hee.', "The bulk of his fortune comes from Samsung Electronics and E-Mart, Korea's largest discount retailer.", 'He serves as vice chair of Shinsegae Group, a retail conglomerate.']
abouts: ['Chung Yong-jin was married to top Korean actress Go Hyun-Jung before they split in 2003;  she lost full custody of their two children.', 'Chung, who has 65,000 Facebook followers, uses his own account to market his favorite E-mart products.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Ciputra, who goes by one name, is an Indonesian real estate developer. ', 'His Ciputra Development is one of the biggest property companies in the country with projects in 33 cities. ', 'A trained architect, he founded his Ciputra Group more than three decades ago.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Cousins Alberto Cortina and Alberto Alcocer married sisters Alicia and Esther Koplowitz, heiresses to one of the largest construction firms in Spain.', "The cousins, dubbed Los Albertos, ran their wives' Construcciones y Contratas firm from the early 1970s until 1989, when both marriages fell apart.", 'Alcocer and Cortina then moved into banking, running Banco Zaragozano. They sold their combined 40% stake to Barclays in 2004.', 'Each of the cousins owns stakes in Grupo Empresarial ENCE, the largest eucalyptus pulp producer in Europe.']
abouts: ['Cortina owns several ranches in Toledo, Spain, along with houses in Mallorca and Madrid.', 'The Panama Papers revealed that Cortina and his cousin Alcocer had offshore accounts in the Central American tax haven country. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Robert Coyiuto is the chairman and CEO of the privately held Prudential Guarantee & Assurance, one of the largest non-life insurance companies.', 'He also owns a 30% stake in the privately held National Grid and a stake in publicly listed Oriental Petroleum & Minerals. ', 'He owns PGA Cars, a Philippines-based distributor of luxury-car brands such as Audi and Bentley.']
abouts: ['His Coyiuto Foundation set up a biennial award in September 2014 for authors of biographies and autobiographies.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Maria del Pino y Calvo Sotelo inherited her stake in Spanish infrastructure giant Ferrovial S.A. from her late father.', "Her father founded Ferrovial in 1952; it manages airports and highways around the world including London's Heathrow Airport. ", 'She has been a member of the board of Ferrovial since 2006.', "She is also the chairman of the family's charitable foundation, Fundacion del Pino.", 'Her brother Rafael is the chairman and co-CEO of Ferrovial, which is listed on the Madrid stock market.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['K. Dinesh is a cofounder of Indian tech giant Infosys.', "Since stepping down from the company's board in 2011, he and his wife Asha have devoted themselves to philanthropy. ", 'They have funded a cancer center at the Narayana Health Hospital and a clinic, both on their ancestral land in Mysore city. ']
abouts: ["Dinesh's daughter Divya runs VedaEarth, a brand of herbal personal care products that combines ayurveda and aromatherapy.", 'A math grad, Dinesh also has a doctorate in literature.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Du Weimin is the chairman of Shenzhen Kangtai Biological Products. ', 'Kangtai researches, develops, manufactures and sells various vaccinations.', 'Du was born in 1963 in China, but is a resident of Hong Kong now.', 'Du holds a MBA from Jinan University.', 'Kangtai listed on the Shenzhen Stock Exchange in 2017. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Over the course of selling two boat-building companies, John Edson built a fortune of more than $1 billion.', 'An entrepreneur who loves the water, Edson first dipped his toe in business by selling used boats.', 'He purchased the brand name "Bayliner" for $100 in 1955 and started a company to build affordable plywood motorboats.', 'The business grew into a yacht-manufacturing powerhouse, and Edson flipped the firm to The Brunswick Corporation in 1986 for $425 million. ', 'Six years later, Edson bought another yacht maker, Westport Yards, which he sold in 2014 for an undisclosed amount. ']
abouts: ['John Edson worked a paper route and earned enough to build his first boat at age 13.', ' After selling Bayliner, Edson took a few years to cruise the world aboard his 161-foot boat Evviva (Italian for "long live").\r\n']

name: Billionaires
title: Founder & President
bios: ["David Einhorn is one of Wall Street's most closely watched investors due to his bold investment calls, both long and short.", 'Einhorn heads hedge fund Greenlight Capital, which has $7 billion in assets and has posted a 15.4% net return since inception in May 1996.', "During the financial crisis, he famously questioned Lehman Brothers' books, arguing that the investment bank was being evasive about its risks.", 'Notably he continues to lose money on bets against Amazon, Tesla and Netflix as part of a "bubble basket" of internet stocks.']
abouts: ["Einhorn first made a splash in the 2000's when he shorted a company called Allied Capital that ultimately imploded.", 'Einhorn\'s book about the hedge fund business, "Fooling Some Of The People All Of The Time," is a seminal tale of short-selling.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Bob Ell is the founder and executive chairman of Leda Holdings, which owns three shopping malls in Queensland and a fourth in Canberra. ', 'He also has large-scale residential land developments in Queensland and New South Wales, where he owns almost 15,000 housing lots. ', 'He started out in Sydney commercial and industrial property in the 1970s.', 'Ell briefly listed Leda Holdings before taking it private in 1990. He has developed more than $3 billion worth of property.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Gary Fegel was a senior partner at Glencore, one of the world's largest commodity trading outfits where he was responsible for the aluminum business.", 'Fegel, whose fortune came largely from Glencore, left the company in 2013 and started his own investment firm, GMF Capital. ', 'Through GMF, Fegel invests in private equity and alternative investments in real estate, healthcare and structured credits.', 'The company has offices in New York, Baltimore and Zurich.']
abouts: ['Fegel, his wife Yael who is a British lawyer, and their children split their time between Switzerland, London and New York.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Victor Fung's company, Li & Fung, operates as a middleman between global manufacturers and retailers in the U.S. and Europe.", "He chaired Li & Fung until his brother William took over in 2012; in 2020, William's son, Spencer, took the helm. ", "Victor's fortune has fallen dramatically since 2011 as brands take greater control of their supply chain by dealing with factories directly.", 'In May 2020 Li & Fung was privatized through a deal worth $930 million.']
abouts: ["Victor Fung's grandfather cofounded Li & Fung in 1906 by exporting porcelain and silk."]
qas: [{'question': 'Education', 'answer': 'Harvard University', 'hidden': False}, {'question': 'Education', 'answer': 'Massachusetts Institute of Technology', 'hidden': False}]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['William and his older brother, Victor, run Li & Feng, a middleman between Chinese manufacturers and retailers in the U.S. and Europe. ', "As the world's largest supplier of clothes and toys, the company is seen as a leader of the global retail sector. ", 'The company works with some 15,000 factories in over 40 countries.', "But as more brands have taken greater control of their supply chain by dealing with factories themselves, the brothers' fortune has fallen recently.", "The brothers' grandfather, Fung Pak-liu, founded Li & Fung with partner Li To-ming in 1906, exporting porcelain and silk."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Alan Gerry started building a cable TV network in upstate New York in 1956.', 'It became Cablevision Industries, which at its peak had 64 cable systems in 18 states. ', 'Gerry sold Cablevision Industries to Time Warner in 1996 for a reported $2.7 billion; he pocketed an estimated $900 million.', 'He used that money to start own venture capital firm, Granite Associates, in 1996 to invest in emerging communications technologies.', 'After a 17-year absence from cable, Gerry joined the advisory board of BCI Broadband in 2013.']
abouts: ['Gerry bought the site of the 1969 Woodstock festival and a decade later turned the location into the Bethel Woods Center for the Arts, an 800 acre cultural center.', 'Gerry initially got into cable to increase demand for TV sets--he owned a television repair shop.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Textile billionaire Balkrishan Goenka owns the Welspun Group in Mumbai, with interests in home linen, pipes and steel.', "Spurning his family's trading business, Goenka borrowed $100,000 from his father, took a bank loan and started Welspun in 1985 to make polyester yarn.\r\n", "He expanded into home linen, focusing on the export market, with customers such as Walmart and Macy's."]
abouts: ['His wife Dipali runs listed home textiles maker Welspun India, his biggest asset. ', 'Goenka has a passion for vintage cars.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Polys Haji-Ioannou is a billionaire thanks to his stake in his brother, Stelios', discount airline company EasyJet. ", 'Polys also owns a transport company, Polyar Tankers, which has around 20 tanks.', 'His father Loucas Haji-Ioannou, the self-styled "King of Tankers," purchased his first oil tanker in 1969.', 'Polys is based in Monaco but owns more than 50 properties around the world, in countries including Singapore, Greece and India.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Mehmet Hattat's companies operate in manufacturing, mining, energy and real estate.", 'At a complex of 11 factories, Hattat make parts and components for autos, commercial vehicles and companies in the aviation and defense industries.', 'Hattat makes Massey Ferguson and Ferrari tractors for the foreign market, as well as  tractors bearing the Hattat brand name.', 'Hattat is developing a project (hotel, shopping center, conference center and office space) on land he owns in the affluent Maslak area of Istanbul.', 'He plans on using coal from a mine he owns in Northern Turkey to fuel a nearby 1320 MW thermal power plant, in which he is an investor.']
abouts: ['He owns two vases from the Napoleonic era bearing the initials of Napoleon and his wife, Josephine.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Mergers and acquisitions maven J. Tomilson "Tom" Hill started off his career at investment bank First Boston, where he cofounded the M&A department.', 'Hill later became a partner at Lehman Brothers, where he befriended Blackstone cofounders Peter Peterson and Stephen Schwarzman. ', 'In 1993, after being ousted as co-CEO at Lehman, he joined Peterson and Schwarzman at Blackstone, their growing private equity firm.', 'After the M&A market cooled in the 1990s, Hill transitioned to hedge funds at Blackstone, taking over the hedge fund group in 2000.', "Under Hill, the group has grown into the world's largest investor in hedge funds, with $77 billion in assets."]
abouts: ["While at Lehman, Hill was involved in high profile deals such as Time Inc.'s $14 billion merger with Warner Communications, which created media behemoth Time Warner.", 'Hill is an avid art collector, with a collection that reportedly includes pieces by Andy Warhol and Francis Bacon.']

name: Billionaires
title: Chairman
bios: ['Eduardo Hochschild is Chairman of the Hochschild Group, a Peru-based mining and industrial group.', 'Eduardo joined the business, which his great uncle had started, as a mine safety assistant in 1987; he was appointed head of the mining group in 1998.', 'Today, Hochschild chairs both Hochschild Mining and Cementos Pacasmayo, which makes cement and other construction materials.', 'Based in Lima, Hochschild Mining trades on the London Stock Exchange and operates gold and silver mines in Peru, Chile and Argentina.', 'Cementos Pacasmayo trades on the Peruvian stock exchange and on the New York Stock Exchange, where it listed its shares in February 2012.']
abouts: ["His great uncle, Moritz Hochschild, who started the company in 1911, is called the 'Bolivian Oskar Schindler' for helping 9,000 European Jews come to S. America.", 'In 1998 Hochschild survived an attack by a gunman that claimed the life of his father Luis. Hochschild was kidnapped by the attackers, but released six days later.']

name: Billionaires
bios:
["Hoi Kin Hong chairs Powerlong, a real estate developer headquartered in China's southeast Fujian Province. 

", "Hoi's son Hoi Wa Fong runs Powerlong day-to-day as CEO. 
"]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Hur Young-in is chairman of the SPC Group, a holding company with interests in bakeries and fast-service restaurants. ', 'Known as South Korea\'s "Franchise King," his company now has 1,800 Baskin-Robbins and Dunkin\' Donut stores. ', 'The SPC Group also runs Pascucci (Italian café), The World Vine (wine), Jamba Juice (smoothies) and New York burger house Shake Shack in Korea. ']
abouts: ['His Paris Baguette, a bakery café franchise brand, now has more than 3,000 stores globally, mostly in South Korea. ', "Hur took over as CEO of his father's company, Samlip General Foods, famous for its Cream Bun, in 1981."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['George Joseph is the founder of Mercury General, an insurance provider with $1.7 billion in annual revenues.', 'After raising $2 million in capital, he started Mercury General in 1962 and offered cut-rate deals to safer-than-average drivers.', 'Raised in the midst of the Great Depression, Joseph was a flight navigator during World War II.', 'He graduated from Harvard with majors in math and physics in 1949.']
abouts: ['Joseph named the company after the Roman god Mercury, because he wanted the company to be nimble in business ventures.', "He is America's oldest billionaire."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Ronald Joyce, who cofounded Tim Hortons with former NHL player Tim Horton, died in early 2019 at the age of 88.', "Joyce sold the chain of doughnut shops to Wendy's for $600 million in 1995. ", 'The "Doughnut King" lost his father at age 3, and grew up in a home with no plumbing or electricity, later dropping out of high school to work. ', 'He bought a Tim Hortons coffee store in the 1960s after spotting a for-sale sign in the window.', "He became a full partner in the business, then bought Horton's shares from his wife after Horton died in a car accident in 1974. "]
abouts: ['After serving in the Royal Canadian Navy, Joyce worked as a policeman in Hamilton, Ontario, where he first got into the food business by buying a Dairy Queen shop. ', 'He wanted to open a second ice cream shop, but his application was rejected. He went for a Tim Hortons store instead.\r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['T.S. Kalyanaraman chairs Kalyan Jewellers, a gold jewelry chain with a presence in India, the UAE and Kuwait. ', 'The business has its origins in a century-old textile store established in south India by his grandfather, who hailed from a family of Hindu priests.', "Kalyanaraman worked in the family's textile trade from age 12 until 1993 when he started the jewelry chain. ", 'With revenues of $1.5 billion, the privately held company counts Warburg Pincus as a key investor. ']
abouts: ['Kalyan has more than 100 showrooms in India and overseas. ', 'He contributed $3 million to Habitat For Humanity India to build 2,000 homes for low-income families.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Veteran investment banker, Nimesh Kampani, qualified as an accountant and joined his family's stockbroking business in 1972. \r\n", 'He broke away to start a separate investment bank with a cousin whom he eventually bought out. ', 'Kampani listed his flagship, JM Financial, in 1992 and got investors such as IFC and later partnered with Morgan Stanley.', "After a decade, they parted ways with Kampani buying out Morgan Stanley's stake.", 'On turning 70 in 2016, Ambani handed over charge to his son Vishal, though he remains non-executive chairman.\r\n']
abouts: ['He has been the confidante of several business tycoons, even those who are arch rivals.', 'In 2009, Kampani spent nearly a year in exile to avoid being arrested when a company from whose board he had resigned in 1999, defaulted on loans.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Eugene Kaspersky graduated from the High School of KGB and began creating his first antiviral programs in the early 1990s. ', "Kaspersky became interested in computer security in 1989 when his computer was infected with the 'Cascade' virus. ", "The young engineer founded Kaspersky Lab in 1997, with Eugene heading the company's antivirus research.  ", 'Over 400 million users now use Kaspersky Lab products to protect their computers.']
abouts: ['Kaspersky is a Forbes contributor.', 'Kaspersky Lab is the official sponsor of Scuderia Ferrari, one of the most successful Formula One racing team. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Viktor Kharitonin created Pharmstandard together with Roman Abramovich and others by combining five factories bought from ICN Pharmaceuticals in 2003.\r\n', 'Kharitonin and his partner Egor Kulkov bought out their partners in 2008, a year after Pharmstandard went public in London. \r\n', 'In 2016 Kharitonin and Kulkov took Pharmstandard private, buying out the shares and delisting from the London Stock Exchange.']
abouts: ['In October 2014 Kharitonin became co-owner of Nurbugring in Germany, one of the oldest race tracks in Europe.', 'The Novosibirsk State University graduate got his start selling a variety of consumer goods.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Pyotr Kondrashev started out at the Silvinit fertilizer factory as a mining master in 1972.', "Kondrashev became the company's CEO in 1990 and later led its privatization.", "In 2010 he and his partners sold their stakes in Silvinit, Russia's second-largest producer of potassium fertilizer, for an estimated $3 billion.", "In 2014 he bought Solikamsk Magnesium Plant (SMZ), which produces 60% of Russia's rare earth metal magnesium."]
abouts: ['Kondrashev climbed Mount Kilimanjaro in 2009.', 'Kondrashev worked for 35 years at the Silvinit fertilizer factory.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Yuri Kovalchuk is friends with Russia's president Vladimir Putin; they met when Putin was deputy mayor of St. Petersburg. ", "They both had country houses in the Ozero dacha cooperative, and when Putin became president, many of the cooperative's members' careers improved.", 'Kovalchuck is now the largest shareholder of Rossiya Bank and has a large stake in Sogaz insurance company.', 'Kovalchuck also owns a stake in the fourth largest mobile operator in Russia, Tele2.']
abouts: ["After US sanctions against Kovalchuk's Rossiya Bank, Vladimir Putin moved his payroll account to the bank. ", "Kovalchuk's son Boris is CEO of InterRAO, a large state-owned energy company in Russia."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Kagemasa Kozuki is the founder and chairman of video game developer Konami Holdings.', 'The Tokyo-listed company has had success with free-to-play smartphone soccer games.', 'His company also produces gaming machines for casinos in the U.S. and elsewhere.', 'His son Takuya is the president and representative director of Konami Holdings.']
abouts: ['Kozuki got his start repairing jukeboxes and cathode ray tube televisions.']

name: Billionaires
title: Investor
bios: ['Michael Krasny founded Computer Discount Warehouse (CDW) in 1984 as an online store for IT products.', 'In 2007, his company was bought out by Madison Dearborn Partners for $7.3 billion and he maintained a low profile ever since. ', 'Krasny is an active donor to Jewish causes and medical research through his Circle of Service Foundation. ']
abouts: ['In March 2017, Krasny reportedly paid $4.35 million for what is now the highest-priced condominium on the 50th floor of Park Tower in Chicago. ', 'Krasny was a 28-year-old, unemployed college grad when he, after placing a $3 ad for his IBM personal computer on the paper, came up with the idea for CDW. \r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['James Leininger, known as "Doctor Jim," made his fortune founding medical devices company Kinetic Concepts (KCI), which focuses on wound care.', 'In November 2012, private equity firm Apax Partners led a $6.3 billion acquisition of the company. Leininger was the largest shareholder.', 'He also founded the Texas Public Policy Foundation in 1989 to support free-market policies and research.', 'He has mostly invested through his Medcare Investment Funds, which manages $1 billion in assets. ']
abouts: ['Leininger started KCI in a one-bedroom apartment in 1976.', 'Leininger has a small stake in the San Antonio Spurs. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Li Guoqiang is a founder and the CEO of Zhongsheng Group, one of China's largest automobile dealers.", 'Zhongsheng focuses on luxury and mid-to-high-end brands such as Mercedes-Benz, Lexus, Porsche and Land Rover.', 'Li and Huang Yi, chairman of Zhongsheng, established Zhongsheng Group in 1998.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Li Liangbin chairs Jiangxi Ganfeng Lithium, a supplier of lithium chloride and other lithium products.', "Ganfeng is headquartered in China's Jiangxi Province.", 'In 2000, Li bought the factory which became the predecessor business of Ganfeng.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Liu Ko-chen is CEO of industrial automation equipment and software supplier Advantec. ', 'Liu co-founded Advantech in 1983 at age 27 with two colleagues from HP Taiwan.', 'Advantech makes industrial computers; in recent years, it has been shifting to Internet and software products.', 'Liu shares his fortune with his wife Mary Chang. ']
abouts:
['An avid reader of management books, Liu is said to enjoy sharing books with staff, including Built to Last and Blue Ocean Strategy.', 'Before Advantech, he was an R&D engineer and later as a sales engineer for HP Taiwan in the Instrument Department.
']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Anatoly Lomakin started out trading chemicals and sharing an office with future billionaire Vladimir Potanin.', 'In 1992 he persuaded three of the largest post-Soviet producers of fertilizer--Silvinit, Uralkali and Byelaruskali--to unite. ', "In 2010 Lomakin and his partners sold their stakes in Silvinit, Russia's second-largest producer of potassium fertilizer, for roughly $3 billion.", 'Today Lomakin owns 50% of Investstoy, a company that invests in housing and residential property development.']
abouts: ["Anatoly Lomakin became a Yedinaya Rossiya party deputy in Russia's State Duma in 2012 but stepped down less than a year later, citing health problems. ", 'The only law that he voted for during his time in the Duma was one prohibiting the adoption of Russian children by U.S. citizens. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Ma Hong chairs Shenzhen-listed Dongguan Souyute Fashion, which sells casual clothing in China.', "Souyute has also made e-commerce-related investments including apparel brands such as Olrain and ThinMore that sell via Alibaba Group's Taobao store.", "Ma has been in the apparel retail business in China's Guangdong Province since 1987."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Gary Magness's late father, Bob, started cable giant TCI, then merged with AT&T in 1999 in a $48 billion deal.", 'He inherited half of the fortune (his late brother, Kim, got the rest) and now focuses on off-road racing, movie producing and philanthropy.', 'He collects vintage cars, owns cattle ranches in Colorado, a data center, fish and palm tree farms and invests in oil, gas and real estate.', 'His wife, Sarah Siegel-Magness, runs the couple\'s film company, Smokewood Entertainment, which produced the Oscar winning "Precious."\r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Youssef Mansour is chairman of Mansour Group, which was founded by his father Loutfy.', 'The Group has exclusive GM and Caterpillar dealerships in Egypt.', "He oversees the consumer goods division, which includes supermarket chain Metro, and sole distribution rights for L'Oreal in Egypt.", 'Younger brothers Mohamed and Yasseen are also billionaires.']
abouts: ["Former Egypt President Gamal Abdel Nasser nationalized his father's original cotton trading business.", 'Mansour is a founding member of the American Egyptian Chamber of Commerce.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Strive Masiyiwa overcame protracted government opposition to launch mobile phone network Econet Wireless Zimbabwe in his country of birth in 1998.', 'He owns just over 50% of the publicly-traded Econet Wireless Zimbabwe, which is one part of his larger Econet Group.', 'Masiyiwa also owns just over half of private company Liquid Telecom, which provides fiber optic and satellite services to telecom firms across Africa.', 'His other assets include stakes in mobile phone networks in Burundi and Lesotho, and investments in fintech and power distribution firms in Africa. ', 'He and his wife Tsitsi founded the Higherlife Foundation, which supports orphaned and poor children in Zimbabwe, South Africa, Burundi and Lesotho.']
abouts: ["After studying at university in Britain, Masiyiwa worked at ZPTC, Zimbabwe's phone company. ", 'He left ZPTC to start an engineering services firm, then sold it and founded Econet Wireless Zimbabwe, but had to battle the government in court for years.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Poland\'s "King of Shoes," Dariusz Milek created CCC, the second biggest footwear retailer in Europe.', 'The CCC chain, which went public in 2004, has 897 shops in 16 countries and is expanding in Russia.', "Milek was a member of Poland's national youth cycling team.", 'He now owns the CCC Cycling Group.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Nan Cunhui chairs Zhejiang Chint Electrics, a supplier of meters and power transmission equipment. \r\n', 'Nan is a standing committee member of the All-China Federation of Industry and Commerce and chairman of Zhejiang Federation of Industry and Commerce. ', 'He is also the president of Zhejiang Chamber of Commerce.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['A qualified chartered accountant, Dinesh Nandwana started Vakrangee as a small financial consultancy in 1990.', 'Nandwana got his first break in IT in 1993 when Vakrangee bagged a contract to provide the software required for issuing voter identity cards.', 'Today, Vakrangee specializes in providing a range of e-governance services through close to 38,000 outlets. ', 'The company also owns and operates 325 white label ATMs across the country. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Indonesian billionaire Eka Tjipta Widjaja's son, Oei Hong Leong, is a Singapore citizen and long-time resident of the island-state.  ", 'The bulk of his wealth is derived from a corporate bond portfolio and real estate assets.', 'In September 2017 he announced a $5 billion investment in One Belt One Net, his new company, that will build data centers in Singapore. ', 'He owns prime property in downtown Vancouver and plans to build a museum in the city.']
abouts: ['Oei is an avid collector of Buddhist art and has a private museum in Singapore with more than 50,000 items.', 'Oei had earlier sued Goldman Sachs for selling him lossmaking currency options.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Rubens Ometto Silveira Mello is the world's first ethanol billionaire. Cosan, his sugar giant, is listed on the New York Stock Exchange.", "The company's origins date to 1936, when Ometto's grandparents established a sugarcane mill in Sao Paulo. ", "After several takeovers, Cosan became one of the world's largest growers and processors of sugarcane and one of the largest producers of ethanol. ", 'Besides his Cosan shares, Ometto also holds a portfolio of real estate investments.']
abouts: ['His combativeness earned him the moniker "the tractor," in part because of the long legal fights in order to gain control of Cosan.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Ou Xueming is a former executive director and long-time executive of Country Gardens, one of China's largest real estate developers.", 'He resigned from the board in April 2017.']

name: Billionaires
title: Entrepreneur
bios: ['Markus "Notch" Persson made his fortune selling the rights to his game Minecraft to Microsoft in 2014.', 'Persson has  since been jetting around the world while programming new games in his spare time.', 'An avid social media user, Persson has been open about the downsides of instant success as he used Reddit to express loneliness.', 'In September 2014, after selling 15 million copies of Minecraft across gaming consoles, Persson sold out to Micosoft in a $2.5 billion cash deal.']
abouts: ['Persson bought a $70 million home in Beverly Hills in December 2014.', 'Persson is a member of high IQ society Mensa.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Viktor Pinchuk used his Ph.D. in pipe design to found Interpipe, producer of steel products, in 1990. ', 'Privately-owned Interpipe, which lost all of its business in Russia during its occupation of Crimea, is weighed down by heavy debts. ', 'Pinchuk owns Grand Buildings, a landmark historical building on Trafalgar Square in London.  ', "He is a son-in-law of Ukraine's former president Leonid Kuchma."]
abouts: ['Pinchuk sponsors an annual lunch on Ukraine at the World Economic Forum at Davos.', 'His PinchukArtCentre focuses on contemporary art and sponsors a nationwide prize for Ukrainian artists younger than 35. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Alberto Prada and his sisters, Miuccia and Marina, inherited a share of Prada, the handbag and fashion empire founded by their grandfather in 1913.', "Although Miuccia is the company's co-CEO and lead designer, Alberto is not involved in running the business.", 'A year after the siblings inherited their stakes in Prada, Miuccia married Patrizio Bertelli; the duo now oversee Prada together.', 'Alberto and Marina each hold an estimated 12% stake in the company, while Miuccia and Patrizio each own 28%.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Marina Prada and her siblings, Miuccia and Alberto, inherited a share of Prada, the handbag and fashion empire founded by their grandfather in 1913.', "Although Miuccia is the company's co-CEO and lead designer, Marina and Alberto are not involved in running the business.", 'A year after the siblings inherited their stakes in Prada, Miuccia married Patrizio Bertelli; the duo now oversee Prada together.', 'Marina and Alberto each hold an estimated 12% stake in the company, while Miuccia and Patrizio each own 28%.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Forrest Preston founded Life Care Centers of America in 1970 and has since made a fortune with facilities that house and care for the elderly.', 'The private firm raked in $3.1 billion in sales in 2016 from nursing homes, assisted living facilities and retirement living communities in 28 states.', 'Preston is the CEO and sole owner of the company, which is based in Cleveland, Tennessee.', 'In 2016, the company agreed to pay $145 million to settle a government lawsuit alleging that the firm had over-billed federal healthcare programs.\r\n']
abouts: ['Before founding the company, Preston sold vacuum cleaners, worked as an X-ray technician and ran a printing business with his brother.', 'His first facility, formerly called Garden Terrace Convalescent Center, is still open today in Cleveland, Tennessee.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Jerry Reinsdorf made a fortune in sports, buying Chicago teams in the 1980s and watching values skyrocket over the next three decades.', 'Reinsdorf led a group that bought the Chicago White Sox baseball team in 1981 for $19 million. He still owns an estimated 19% stake.', "He and investors bought a controlling stake in the NBA's Chicago Bulls for $9.2 million in 1985, one year after the team drafted Michael Jordan.", 'Six championships and 33 years later, the Bulls are worth $2.5 billion net of debt; Reinsdorf still owns an estimated 40%.', 'He made his first fortune in real estate, cofounding Balcor Company in 1973 and selling it nine years later to American Express.']
abouts: ['Reinsdorf and other investors paid $9.2 million for a stake in the Bulls, one year after the team drafted Michael Jordan; it is now worth $2.5 billion.', 'Reinsdorf reportedly got his start as a tax attorney for the IRS.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Fernando Roig owns a 9% stake in Spanish supermarket chain Mercadona. ', 'His billionaire brother Juan Roig is the majority shareholder of Mercadona, which was founded by their parents in 1977.', 'Juan and Fernando took over Mercadona with their sisters in 1981 when it was only an eight-store chain.', "Since then they have turned it into one of Europe's largest food retailers, with more than 1,600 supermarkets. ", 'The company distributes 25% of its pre-tax profits to its 79,000 employees.']
abouts: ["Fernando's sister-in-law, Hortensia Herrero (married to his brother Juan), also helped build Mercadona and is a billionaire. \r\n"]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Mumbai property tycoon Subhash Runwal chairs the Runwal Group, known for building middle class homes in the city's central suburbs. ", "It also owns several malls and counts the Singapore government's GIC as a key investor in that business. \r\n", 'A trained accountant, Runwal was born in a small town in Maharashtra and migrated to Mumbai at age 21. \r\n', 'He worked as an accountant for nearly a decade before taking the plunge into real estate in 1978. ']
abouts: ["Runwal's lives in a sea-front home in Mumbai  next to Bollywood star Shah Rukh Khan.", "Runwal's first job as an accountant got him a U.S. posting but he returned home in six months as he couldn't adjust to the lifestyle. "]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Yoshiyuki Sankai is president of robot maker Cyberdyne, which he founded in 2004. ', 'Its key product is the Robot Suit HAL (Hybrid Assistive Limb), whose robot limbs take over when our own fail due to age or physical impairment.', "Its HAL suits read electrical pulses in patients' nerves and offer the potential to restore muscle movement.", 'The company rents its HAL suits to hospitals and nursing homes.\r\n', 'In early 2016 the Japanese government approved national health insurance coverage for medical use of the suits.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Russia's youngest billionaire, Kirill Shamalov is the son of Rossiya Bank shareholder Nikolai Shamalov, a longtime friend of Putin. ", 'Shamalov studied law at Saint Petersburg State University and became vice president of Russian petrochemical company Sibur at age 26. ', "In 2014, he bought a stake in Sibur from billionaire Gennady Timchenko, a longtime friend of Putin's who was the target of U.S. sanctions. ", 'He later sold most of his stake but still held onto roughly 4% of Sibur.']
abouts: ["Kirill Shamalov was married to President Vladimir Putin's daughter, academic Katerina Tikhonova, according to sources. ", 'Their marriage was dissolved sometime in 2016 or 2017, which is around when Shamalov sold a 17% stake in Sibur.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Shin Dong-bin chairs the Lotte Group, South Korea's fifth largest conglomerate with interests in retail, chemicals, hotels and others. ", 'In February 2018, he was sentenced to 30 months in prison for a bribery case involving former president Park Geun-hye. He is appealing the sentence.', 'Shin was convicted of transferring $6.5 million to Choi Soon-sil, a confidante of Park, to win approval for duty-free shops. He pleaded not guilty.', 'Shin Dong-bin is the younger son of Shin Kyuk-ho, who founded Lotte as a confectionery manufacturer in Japan in 1948. ']
abouts: ['In 2011, he became embroiled in a bitter feud with his older brother, Shin Dong-Joo, for control of the group, a battle he won in 2016.', "Lotte started in post-war Japan with chewing gum as one of its first products. Today it is South Korea's largest retailer. "]

name: Billionaires
