bios: ['Evgeny Shvidler, who became an American citizen in 1994, is the best friend and a partner of Russian billionaire Roman Abramovich.', 'His core assets are the stake in Russian steelmaker Evraz and an investment in Norilsk Nickel.', 'Shvidler is executive chairman of Highland Gold Mining, where he has an 13% stake.', 'Shvidler was born in Moscow, Russia. He got an MBA from Fordham University in 1992 and worked for Deloitte & Touche in New York.']
abouts: ['His 370-foot yacht, Le Grand Bleu, was a gift from Abramovich.\r\n', 'Shvidler was the primary funder for the rebuilding of a Jewish school in England that is now called Beit Shvidler Primary School.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Hotelier Jasminder Singh's Edwardian Hotels group owns 12 high-end hotels in London and Manchester, including the May Fair.", 'Singh purchased his first hotel, The Edwardian, in 1975 for about $750,000.', "In 1993 he partnered with Radisson; 11 of the group's hotels are branded Radisson Blu Edwardian.", "The group's $400 million luxury development at Leicester Square, including the deepest hotel basement in London, will open in 2019.", "Singh's wife, Amrit, and son, Inderneel, both hold senior positions with the Edwardian group."]
abouts: ['Singh grew up in Tanzania and Kenya before moving to the UK and qualifying as an accountant.', "Singh's father took him to court in 2012 claiming part of his son's fortune under Sikh culture of sharing wealth among generations. The court ruled for Jasminder."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Martua Sitorus is a cofounder Singapore-listed Wilmar International, an agribusiness firm with a significant palm oil arm.', 'Sitorus stepped down as executive deputy chairman of Wilmar in April 2017 to become a non-executive director.', 'In August 2017, he sold some of his shares in Wilmar to U.S. agribusiness firm Archer Daniels Midland and now owns about a 2% stake.', 'His property arm Gamaland owns Gama Tower, one of the tallest buildings in Indonesia.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Peter Sperling stepped down as the Chairman of the Apollo Education Group when it was taken private in a $1.1 billion deal in Feb. 2017.', 'Sperling joined the company in 1983, nearly a decade after his father founded it.', 'The for profit education company became well-known for its online University of Phoenix network. ', 'His father John Sperling, former San Jose State University professor, founded the University of Phoenix in 1973.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Jerzy Starak chairs the supervisory board of Polpharma, one of Poland's largest drug manufacturers.", 'Polpharma specializes in pharmaceuticals used in cardiology, neurology and gastroenterology. ', 'A diversified investor, Starak also holds a stake in publicly traded agribusiness ZT Kruszwica and herbal product producer Herbapol.', 'Starak started with chemical company Comindex in the 1970s.']
abouts: ['His son, Piotr Wozniak-Starak, founded film studio Watchout Productions, which scored big with its feature, "Bogowie."']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Manny Stul took over a struggling company named Moose Toys 17 years ago. Sales have grown more than 7,000%.', 'Its Shopkins collectibles, inspired by grocery and department store items, with names like Milk Bud and Kris P. Lettuce, are some of their best known.', 'He made a fortune founding and selling a giftwares company. He then dabbled in various ventures like organic farming before investing in Moose Toys.']
abouts: ["Stul's parents were Polish Holocaust survivors. He was born in a German refugee camp before the family traveled to Australia after World War II.", 'Stul was named EY World Entrepreneur of the Year in 2016.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Su Rubo is a former executive director and long-time executive of Country Gardens, one of China's largest real estate developers.", 'He resigned from the board in April 2017.', 'He holds a degree in economic management from Jinan University.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Fuat Tosyali is CEO of steel and iron producer Tosyali Holding, which has 18 facilities spread over Turkey, Serbia and Algeria.', 'At age five, he began working with his father in a small workshop in Iskenderun, where they made sheet metal out of used tin cheese cans.', 'From sheet metal, they went on to bucket and stove production. The family began investing in Algeria in 2008.', "Including overseas operations, Tosyali is on track to become Turkey's largest iron and steel producer, with an 8.5 million ton capacity by 2019.", 'Fuat shares ownership in the business with younger brothers Ayhan and Fatih Tosyali.']
abouts: ['By the end of 2019, Tosyali Holding expects to have invested in excess of $6 billion in integrated production facilities located in Oran, Algeria.', 'Fuat Tosyali flies on his private jet to visit operations in Algeria every week.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Kenny Troutt founded long-distance phone company Excel Communications in 1988 and took the company public in 1996. ', 'In 1998, Troutt sold Excel Communications to Teleglobe in a $3.5 billion deal and reinvested the profits in stocks, bonds and horses. ', 'Avid horse racing fan, Troutt owns WinStar Farm in Versailles, Kentucky, breeder of Thoroughbreds including a Kentucky Derby winner.  ']
abouts: ['The son of a single mother who worked as a bartender, Troutt grew up in public housing in Mount Vernon, IL.', "For years, Troutt sponsored his sons' nationally competitive basketball teams, providing jerseys, equipment and even rides on his private jet to tournaments. "]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Rufino Vigil Gonzalez is a Mexican steel baron and chairman of specialty steel firm Industrias CH.', 'In 2001 Industrias CHi bought just under 83% of Grupo Simec, a steel smelter with factories in Guadalajara and Mexicali.', 'He owns about  67% of Industrias CH, which has operations in Mexico, Canada and the U.S.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Wang Jianfeng chairs Ningbo Joyson, a manufacturer of automotive accessories.', 'Wang is an avid photographer; his work was exhibited in the Ningbo Museum of Art in July 2015.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Wang Jing chairs Shanghai-listed Beijing Xinwei Telecom Technology Group, a supplier of telecommunications technologies. ', 'Wang has made a big splash in the past years with a bold plan to build a $50 billion canal across Nicaragua but progress has slowed in recent years. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Wang Qunbin is one of four co-founders and the president of the Fosun Group, a diversified investment company headquartered in Shanghai.', 'Wang holds a degree in genetic engineering from Fudan University in Shanghai.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Dan Wilks and his brother, Farris, sold their hydraulic fracturing and oilfield services company to the Singapore government in 2011 for $3.5 billion.', 'In the years since, the brothers have been buying up land, adding 672,000 acres of property across 5 states.', "They first founded Wilks Masonry in 1995, following in their stone mason father's footsteps.", 'In 2002 they launched into fracking with Frac Tech, building it into a large oil and natural gas outfit before selling the business nine years later.', "Since then, Dan and Farris have reinvested in oil and gas companies, including stakes in publicly traded firms such as Canada's Trican Well Services."]
abouts: ['Like his brother, Dan is a GOP financial backer, donating millions to Republican Super PACs during the 2016 election cycle.', 'The brothers reportedly spend four months a year in Montana, working on building homes on their  large ranches.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Farris and brother Dan Wilks got a combined $3.5 billion in 2011 selling their fracking and oilfield services company to the Singapore government.', "They've been buying up land since then, acquiring more than 672,000 acres of land in five different states across the West.", 'The brothers began their careers as stone masons, like their father, founding Wilks Masonry in 1995.', 'In 2002 they went into fracking, launching Frac Tech and growing it into an oil and natural gas giant before cashing out less than a decade later.', 'The brothers are also investing in oil and gas businesses, including Canadian oilfield services company Trican Well Service.']
abouts: ['Farris Wilks is the pastor of his own church, the Assembly of Yahweh Seventh Day Church, near Cisco, Texas.', 'He and his brother are GOP supporters, donating more than $10 million to GOP Super PACs during the 2016 election cycle.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Thomas Wu is chairman of Taishin Financial Holdings, a financial services firm based in Taipei.', "His father Wu Hu-So led one of Taiwan's first textile empires after World War II; it is now a financial powerhouse now by Wu's older brother Eugene.", 'Thomas went his own way years ago. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Yi Zheng chairs Hithink Royal Flush Information Network, a Shenzhen-listed financial data supplier.', "He cofounded his first IT company back in October 1994 and Hithink's predecessor business Shanghai Hexin in 2001.", 'He owns 36% of Hithink.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Yuan Fugen is the founder of Suzhou Dongshan Precision Manufacturing, a maker of precision metal plate and cast metal. ', 'Sons Yuan Yonggang and Yuan Yongfeng are chairman and general manager, respectively, of the company.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Dick Yuengling, fifth-generation owner of D.G. Yuengling & Son, turned his family's struggling brewery into one of America's largest beer makers.", 'When he bought out his father in 1985, the company was producing 137,000 barrels per year; now it pumps out some 2.8 million barrels annually.', 'After dropping out of Lycoming College, Yuengling joined the business but soon walked out following an argument with his father about modernization.', 'He spent 11 years running a beer distributorship peddling Yuengling and its competitors to local bars and stores before buying his father out in 1985.', 'He quickly upgraded his packaging, equipment and distributor network, then struck gold with Yuengling Lager, today responsible for about 85% of sales.']
abouts: ["Yuengling, America's oldest brewery, first opened its doors in Pottsville, Pennsylvania in 1829 and survived Prohibition by pivoting to ice cream and near beer.", 'Yuengling drives a dirty Toyota Camry and heads to work so early every morning he has to pick up the newspaper directly from the distributor.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Gavril Yushvaev has gotten rich betting on a wide assortment of businesses. ', "In the early 1990s Yushvaev cofounded Trinity, which owned Moscow dance club Metelitsa, one of the city's first casinos, and car dealerships.", 'He later invested in dairy and juice company Wimm-Bill-Dann, which went public in 2002. ', 'Yushvaev sold his 19.6% stake in Wimm-Bill-Dann to Pepsico for $1.1 billion in 2010. ', 'He has reportedly invested $500 million in European and U.S. tech start-ups including driver app Lyft and delivery service Delivery Hero.']
abouts: ['Wimm-Bill-Dann\'s prospectus for its 2002 IPO revealed that Yushvaev served nine years in a Soviet prison camp after being found guilty of a "violent crime" in 1980.', 'Yushvaev and Vladislav Doronin, an ex-boyfriend of supermodel Naomi Campbell, invested $300 million in a 4.3-million-square-foot Moscow real estate development.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Zeng Kaitian became a billionaire in 2015 when Sanqi Interactive Entertainment Shanghai Technology (cofounder) was bought by Wuhu Shunrong Auto Parts.\r\n', 'Sanqi Interactive owns web game platforms 37.com and 6711.com.', 'Wuhu Shunrong is now called Wuhu Shunrong Sanqi Interactive Entertainment.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Zhang Wanzhen chairs electronics components maker Chaozhou Three-Circle Group.', 'Zhang joined the workforce at age 16 after finishing junior high school.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Zhang Yubai chairs rice wine supplier Yanghe Group.', 'He was formally general manager and vice chairman of A-share listed Jiangsu Yanghe Brewery Joint-stock.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Changpeng Zhao, who goes by CZ, is founder and CEO of Binance, a cryptocurrency exchange that became the largest on the planet in just under 180 days.', "The 41-year-old Chinese-Canadian coder cut his teeth building high-frequency trading systems for Wall Street's flash boys.", 'Binance can process a blazing 1.4 million transactions a second and on a peak day in early 2018 processed 3.5 billion new orders, cancels and trades. ', 'Binance is minting money, with $200 million in profits in the last quarter of 2017. CZ owns a large chunk of the company, making him a billionaire. ']
abouts: ['He was born in Jiangsu, China. His father, a professor, was labeled a pro-bourgeois intellect and temporarily exiled shortly after CZ was born. ', "As a teenager in Vancouver, CZ pitched in to cover the household expenses, flipping burgers at McDonald's and working overnight shifts at a gas station. "]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Zhou Yifeng chairs Hongda Xingye Group, whose interests include industrial chemicals, coal and PVC packaging. \r\n', "Zhou, a member of China's National People's Congress, this year called for more attention to be given to soil preservation in the country."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Zhou Yongli chairs Yongli Group, a business with interests in trading, real estate and finance.', 'Yongli, headquartered in the eastern Chinese city of Shaoxing in Zhejiang Province, was established in December 1986.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Zhu Wenchen chairs Furen Pharmaceutical Group Industry, a pharmaceutical supplier.', 'Zhu cofounded the predecessor of Furen in 1997. \r\n', 'Zhu took control of Shanghai-listed Shanghai Minfeng Industrial Group in January 2006 and changed its name to Furen Pharmaceutical Group Industry.']

name: Billionaires
bio: His father Haci Mehmet Zorlu used to produce bed sheets on the weaving loom he had in his own home in Denizli Babadag, the textile capital of Turkey. With his older brother he learned how to weave fabrics when he was just a child. At a very young age he started selling the fabrics he produced himself and opened his first shop in Trabzon. Currently 28 thousand employees are working in the more than 60 companies where he is a shareowner. The Zorlu family operates in the sectors of electronics, energy, real estate, mining and textile, but has stopped its activities in the finance sector after selling 75% of Denizbank's shares in 2006 to the Belgian Dexia Bank for USD 2,4 billion. Following this sale they constructed the Zorlu Center consisting of 4 buildings comprising a hotel, Shopping Mall, residences and offices, in one of Istanbul's most valuable areas, Zincirlikuyu, with an investment of USD 2,5 billion. Zorlu Holding is one of Turkey's 5 largest corporations and one of its biggest exporters.
bios: ["Ahmet Nazif Zorlu presides over one of Turkey's biggest corporate groups, operating in textiles, real estate, energy, mining and consumer durables.", 'His father, Haci Mehmet Zorlu, laid the foundation for Zorlu Holding in 1953 by starting a business weaving bed sheets on a homemade loom.', 'In the 1960s, Ahmet and brother Zeki grew the retail side of the business, initiated contract manufacturing and launched the home textiles brand TAC.', "Zorlu entered the energy business in 1993 to power its textile production, then diversified further and became Turkey's leading exporter.", 'It makes Vestel-branded consumer electronics and appliances, and the domestic Venus smart phone.']
abouts: ['As a child, Ahmet started selling the fabrics he produced himself. He opened his first shop in Trabzon. He is a high school dropout.', 'He shuttles around Europe in a custom helicopter and owns a private island, Zeytin Adas (Olive Island), in the Aegean Sea off the Turkish coast.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Len Ainsworth founded Aristocrat Leisure, the world's second-biggest gaming-machine company, in 1953. He stepped aside in 1994 after a cancer scare.", "He gave his large stake in Aristocrat Leisure to his seven sons and ex-wife more than 20 years ago; he's entitled to some proceeds if they sell. ", 'He started a similar company, Ainsworth Game Technology, the following year at age 72.', 'He remains an executive director after selling his majority stake to Austrian gaming giant Novomatic.', 'He signed the giving pledge in March 2017.']

name: Billionaires
title: President
bios: ['Edmund Ansin inherited a real estate fortune and has added television stations to his portfolio.', 'In 1962 he and his father, Sidney, paid $3.4 million for Miami\'s WSVN, where he pioneered the "if it bleeds, it leads" style of TV journalism.', 'He took that approach to his native Boston market, where he operated NBC and CW affiliate stations.', "In 2016 NBC announced that it would end the 22-year affiliation with Ansins' WHDH TV in Boston in favor of its own channel, which started in 2017.", 'Ansin sued NBC parent Comcast, alleging a violation of contract and anti-trust laws, but a federal court dismissed the suit. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Markus Blocher is a billionaire thanks to two Swiss chemical companies, EMS-Chemie and Dottikon ES Holding.', 'Blocher got his start working at EMS-Chemie, the Swiss polymer and chemical manufacturer that his family has run for decades.', 'He received a stake in the firm when his father, Christoph Blocher, sold his shares to his children to take a seat on the Swiss federal council.', 'Markus eventually sold his shares in EMS-Chemie and took over Dottikon, its spinoff.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Serial investor Leonid Boguslavsky has made most of his fortune from venture capital investments.', 'One of his first investments was his bet on Russian search engine firm Yandex, on which he apparently made 400 times his initial money.  ', 'He was also an investor in Epam, RingCentral and Delivery Hero.', "He was a partner of Boris Berezovsky in a Russian-Italian joint venture LogoVAZ in the 1980's.  "]
abouts: ['Boguslavsky competed in his first triathlon at age 62.', 'In 2017 Boguslavsky cofounded Super League Triathlon.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Jorge Horacio Brito cofounded Banco Macro in 1976 and was a billionaire in 2017 and 2018; he died at age 68 in November 2020 in a helicopter crash.', 'He was a majority shareholder of agro-livestock firm Inversora Juramento, which owns more than 87,000 hectares and boasts 54,000 animals.', 'Other holdings included renewable energy company Genneia and real estate firm Vizora. ', "He had six children with wife, Marcela Carballo. His Banco Macro cofounder, Delfin Jorge Ezequiel Carballo, is Marcela's brother.", ' In November 2017 Brito took a leave of absence from Banco Macro amid a widening corruption probe into the business.']
abouts: ['In diplomatic cables, American officials described Brito as a close adviser to former Argentine President Nestor Kirchner. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Saket Burman is the sixth generation member of the storied Burman clan that founded Dabur, India's fourth largest consumer goods company. \r\n", 'He inherited a 12.4% stake and a board seat in Dabur from his father Siddharth Burman, who died in 2015. ', 'Other assets he owns include property and financial investments. ']
abouts: ['He is a member of Mumbai Angels, a group that backs startups. ', 'He shuttles between homes in Dubai, London and Delhi.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Steve Case cofounded investment firm Revolution, which has invested in over 50 companies.', 'His Rise of the Rest tour funds startups from non-coastal states, stopping in cities to a host pitch competition for a $100,000 investment.', 'Revolution has also invested in restaurant chain Sweetgreen, fantasy sports firm Draft Kings and wine retailer Vinfolio.', 'In 1985 Case helped found Quantum Computer Services. He became CEO in 1991 and changed its name to America Online (AOL).', 'AOL merged with Time Warner in 2001 in a $164 billion deal that was eventually deemed one of the worst mergers in history.']
abouts: ["Born and raised in Hawaii, Case attended Punahou School, where Barack Obama went to high school. He later served on Obama's Council on Jobs and Competitiveness.", "Steve and his wife, Jean -- who chairs the National Geographic Society's board -- signed the Giving Pledge in 2010."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Jeffrey Cheah is the executive chairman of Malaysian conglomerate Sunway. ', 'Over four decades, he transformed his obscure tin-mining company into a conglomerate with interests in hotels, education, healthcare & infrastructure.', 'His daughter, Sarena, and son, Evan, both work in the family business.', 'He plans to build five new hospitals over the next five years.']
abouts: ['He is an avid philanthropist who has disbursed thousands of scholarships in Malaysia over the years.', 'He started his career as an accountant for an auto assembly plant.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Bruce Cheng founded Taiwan Delta as a TV-parts maker in 1971; he built it into a supplier of switches and power suppliers to global brands like Dell.', "He stepped down as Delta's leader in 2012, the same year his son Ping became CEO.", "Apple is Delta's largest customer, accounting for 8% of its 2016 revenues."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Cheng Xianfeng is chairman of Yifan Pharmaceutical, a supplier of skin and healthcare ingredients as well as feed additives.', 'Yifan has approvals for the sale of more than 300 drugs across therapeutic areas such as gynecology, pediatrics and dermatology.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Slovakia's first billionaire, Ivan Chrenko went into the real estate business in the early 1990s. ", 'His company, HB Reavis, developed the first business centers in Bratislava and the top shopping mall, later sold. ', 'In one of the earliest big post-Brexit real estate deals in London in 2016,  HB Reavis, sold 33 Central to Wells Fargo for a reported $400 million. ', 'In Warsaw, it is constructing one of the tallest buildings in Europe. ', "He's invested more than $10 million in fast growing e-commerce cloud startup Exponea."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Politician-diplomat-businessman and Marcos era crony, Eduardo Cojuangco or "Danding," chairs powerful food and infrastructure conglomerate San Miguel. ', 'Protégé Ramon Ang bought his stake in 2012 and now controls operations. ', 'He also owns a private cement-manufacturing business and is invested in orchards, stud farms, and wineries in Australia.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['The "king of cashmere," designer Brunello Cucinelli dropped out of engineering school and used a $550 loan to launch a fashion line in 1978.', 'Inspired by brightly-colored wool sweaters, he set out to create a similar garment in cashmere.', 'Today his eponymous luxury brand is best known for those cashmere sweaters, but also sells dresses, suits, shoes, handbags and accessories.', 'Cucinelli took the $483 million (net sales) company public in 2012, listing its shares on the Italian stock exchange.', 'Since 1985 he has operated Brunello Cucinelli SpA from his headquarters in Solomeo, a medieval Italian hamlet that he has renovated for his employees.']
abouts: ['Cucinelli espouses a theory of "neohumanistic capitalism" in which he aims to share his company\'s profits and "humanize" his 1,500 workers.', 'He does not allow work after 5:30 pm and serves 90-minute homemade lunches prepared by the housewives of Solomeo.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Tech entrepreneur Darwin Deason sold his Affiliated Computer Services to Xerox in 2010 for $6.4 billion.', 'The day after he graduated high school, the Arkansas native moved to Tulsa, Oklahoma and got a job as a mail boy at Gulf Oil.', 'Deason eventually joined Dallas data-processing firm MTech; he became its CEO at age 29 after all but his division failed. He sold it in 1988.', 'Within days of sale, he started ACS to handle computer and other business process services for clients such as E-ZPass.', 'Deason is married to his fifth wife, Katerina, 27 years his junior. They split their time between Dallas, San Diego and their 205-foot yacht.']
abouts: ['Deason left his small town the day after he graduated high school, with $50 borrowed from his dad and a 1949 Pontiac.', "Deason grew up on an Arkansas farm; his family often didn't have a dollar to spare for the movies."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Andrea Della Valle and his brother, Diego, are billionaires thanks to their majority ownership of Italian luxury goods maker Tod's S.p.A.", 'He is the vice chairman of the global shoe- and purse-maker that his grandfather founded in the early 1900s as a small shoe factory.', 'The brothers also own stakes in Vespa-maker Piaggio, media conglomerate RCS MediaGroup, investment bank Mediobanca and soccer team ACF Fiorentina.', "Andrea was Fiorentina's chairman until 2009, helping turn the club around after its previous owner drove it into bankruptcy."]

name: Billionaires
title: CEO
bios: ['Jamie Dimon runs JPMorgan Chase, the largest bank in the U.S. in terms of assets.', 'He began his finance career at American Express in 1982 and later helped build the modern day Citigroup. ', 'The Harvard grad joined JPMorgan Chase in 2004; he became CEO and chairman soon after.', 'His move to unload $12 billion of subprime mortgages in 2006 buffered his bank against the 2008 crash. ', "Dimon was a rumored candidate for President Trump's treasury secretary pick and sat on his policy forum until it was disbanded in August 2017."]
abouts: ['His Greek grandfather worked at Bank of Athens and changed the family name from Papademetriou to Dimon. ', 'Dimon was diagnosed with throat cancer in 2014, took time off work in 2015 after receiving treatment and then returned to work full time.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Charles Dunstone is chairman of TalkTalk Telecom and former chairman of electronics retailer Dixons Carphone, both based in the UK.', 'In 1989, Dunstone started Carphone Warehouse in his apartment with $12,000 in savings. In 2014, Carphone merged with Dixons, an electronics retailer. ', 'The move was seen as a bet on the growth of the Internet of Things, the increasing web-connectivity of home appliances and electronics.', 'He also founded TalkTalk, a spin-off from Carphone Warehouse, in 2002.']
abouts: ['Outside of the office, he is an avid yachtsman and participates in sailing regattas around the globe.', 'Dunstone was knighted in 2012.']

name: Billionaires
title: Investor
bios: ["Bruce Flatt is one of the biggest and best investors you've likely never heard of.", 'Flatt runs Brookfield Asset Management, the $265 billion (assets) alternative manager with real estate, infrastructure and private equity operations.', 'He helped revive Brascan through a series of savvy real estate deals and became CEO in 2002, refashioning the firm into Brookfield Asset Management.', "His winning deals include buying Olympia & York in 1996 and London's Canary Wharf in 2015, and recapitalizing General Growth Properties in 2010."]
abouts: ['Flatt lives in a quiet Toronto neighborhood and often commutes by subway.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Fu Meicheng leads Shenzhen-listed Zhejiang Huace Film and TV, one of China's top film and television production businesses.\r\n", 'Fu started out in printing and advertising and then cofounded the predecessor of Zhejiang Huace Film and TV.\r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Soichiro Fukutake inherited and expanded Benesse Holdings, which provides education and other services, including senior care and language classes.', 'He now serves as an executive advisor to the company. His son Hideaki Fukutake is a board member.', "The company is listed on the Tokyo Stock Exchange; Fukutake's family owns a 15% stake. ", 'In 2014 Benesse purchased Tokyo-based Minerva, which runs 400 English-language schools for children.', 'The Fukutake Foundation supports art, science and regional Japanese culture. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Don Gao started manufacturing hand tools, built his own factory & won a huge order for angle grinders from US tool titan Black & Decker in the 1990s.', "After Black & Decker began making the grinders itself, Gao launched his own brand, Worx. His tool firm, Positec, is now one of China's largest.", "Positec's tools are sold at traditional retailers like Lowe's and Sears in the U.S., as well as online on Amazon and Taobao.", 'Gao also invests in real estate.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Gao Yunfeng chairs Han's Laser Technology Industry Group, a supplier of laser-based products for industrial applications. ", "Han's Laser Technology was founded by Gao in 1996.", 'Gao holds an undergraduate degree in aircraft design from Beihang University and an MBA from Peking University.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Anne Gittinger and her brother, Bruce Nordstrom, are the largest individual shareholders of fashion retailer Nordstrom Inc. ', 'The department store chain was founded by their grandfather in 1901.', 'Originally a shoe shop, Nordstrom now operates more than 300 stores across the US, Canada and Puerto Rico.']
abouts: ['Gittinger is a major supporter of the sports teams at the University of Washington, her alma mater.', 'Gittinger sits on the national board of Canine Companions for Independence, which provides service dogs to people with disabilities.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Clelia Haji-Ioannou is a billionaire, thanks to her stake in discount airline EasyJet founded by her brother Stelios.', 'Clelia owns over $40 million in real estate, mostly in Monaco, Cyprus, Athens and London.', 'She also claims to have a multi-million dollar art collection of pieces she has bought over the past 20 years. ']
abouts: ['Clelia\'s father Loucas Haji-Ioannou was the self-styled "King of Tankers," who made an early fortune in shipping. \r\n', 'Born in Athens, Clelia holds both Cypriot and British citizenship and sits on the board of the Cyprus Marine Environment Protection Association. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["John Hancock is the eldest child of Australia's richest woman, Gina Rinehart.", 'Together with his three sisters, he is the beneficiary of a trust that owns a large stake in mining giant Hancock Prospecting.', 'With two sisters, he launched a bitter legal battle in 2011 to remove his mother as a trustee.', 'He is a senior adviser at Lind Partners LLC. He also runs his own private investment fund.']
abouts: ['He changed his surname from Rinehart to Hancock at age 27, after his grandfather, mining mogul Lang Hancock.', 'Hancock finished school at the prestigious Phillips Academy in Andover, Massachusetts.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Ronnen Harary is the cofounder and co-CEO of Spin Master Corp., known for its popular kids' toys like Hatchimals, Air Hogs and Paw Patrol.  ", 'Harary started the company in 1994 with his childhood friend Anton Rabie.', 'Armed with $10,000, Rabie and Harary released Spin Master\'s first toy in 1994. It was called "Earth Buddy" and resembled a Chia Pet.', 'Spin Master had its IPO in 2015.  ', 'Spin Master is now a $1.2 billion (sales) company, which employs over 1,500 people in 16 countries.']
abouts: ['Rabie and Harary reportedly met at summer camp in Ontario when they were both 11 years old. ', "Spin Master made toys for the popular children's TV show, The Wiggles."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Ayman Hariri is a son of the late Rafik Hariri, Lebanon's prime minister, who was assassinated while in office in 2005.", "He inherited a stake in his father's Saudi-based construction company Saudi Oger, and sold it to his brother Saad in 2014. ", 'In 2017, he sold his 42% stake in family holding company GroupeMed, with interests in banking and real estate, for $535 million.', 'He invests in startups through New York-based firm Red Sea Ventures; among its investments was smart thermostat Nest, now part of Google.', "He's a cofounder and CEO of Vero, an ad-free social media platform that lets users share music, videos and photos."]
abouts: ['His brother Saad Hariri is the prime minister of Lebanon.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Fahd Hariri is the youngest son of the late billionaire Rafik Hariri, who was Lebanon's prime minister. He was assassinated while in office in 2005.", "In 2012, Fahd Hariri sold his shares in the family construction firm Saudi Oger to his brother Saad Hariri, who is now Lebanon's prime minister.", 'He has invested some of the proceeds in three Lebanese banks, including Bank Audi, and in real estate in New York and Paris.', 'He has also developed three residential buildings in Beirut.\r\n\r\n']
abouts: ["He's an avid collector of modern and contemporary European and American art. Collection includes Picasso, Louise Bourgeois and Lucian Freud. ", 'While an architecture student, he ran an interior design studio outside of Paris and sold furniture, some of which he designed, to clients in Saudi Arabia. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Surendra Hiranandani is the younger brother of billionaire Mumbai developer Niranjan Hiranandani.', 'He runs his independent outfit, the House of Hiranandani, which specializes in luxury residences. ', 'He still owns 50% in older projects that he built along with brother Niranjan, notably the Powai township in suburban Mumbai.', "The brothers sold their office and retail assets in Powai to Canada's Brookfield Asset Management for $1 billion. \r\n"]
abouts: ['Daughter Neha, a University of Virginia grad, and son Harsh, help him run the company.', 'He recently became a citizen of Cyprus.']

name: Billionaires
title: Founder
bios: ['Alan Howard runs Brevan Howard Asset Management, a European hedge fund specializing in macro trading that he cofounded in 2002. ', "The firm was once one of the world's top macro hedge funds, with assets under management peaking at $40 billion in 2013. ", "A recent streak of uninspiring returns has led to billions in withdrawals by investors, and the firm's assets have dwindled to under $10 billion. ", "Howard's main fund has posted negative returns in three of the past four years, dropping 5% in 2017."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Hu Keqin chairs the Reward Group, whose interests include chemicals, food, tourism and real estate. ', 'He shares ownership with his daughter Hu Jingzhu.', 'Privately held Reward is headquartered in Beijing. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Archie Hwang founded Hermes-Microvision in 1977 as a distributor of semiconductor equipment.', 'Hwang sold his semiconductor equipment supplier to ASML of the Netherlands for $3.1 billion in 2016.']

name: Billionaires
title: Entrepreneur
bios: ['Irwin Jacobs cofounded mobile chipmaker Qualcomm in 1985, but, since retiring from its board in 2012, has been focused on giving away his fortune.', 'The Giving Pledge signatory has donated $100 million to save the San Diego Symphony and $185 million to UC-San Diego.', "In 2013 he and his wife, Joan, pledged $133 million to create the Jacobs Technion-Cornell Innovation Institute on New York's Roosevelt Island.", 'He taught electrical engineering and computer science at MIT, then UCSD, before cofounding LINKABIT Corporation, which developed satellite systems.', 'He launched Qualcomm 17 years later and was CEO until 2005, overseeing the development of technologies that revolutionized wireless communication. ']
abouts: ["Jacobs has been a generous donor to Democratic candidates, including $2 million to Barack Obama's Super PAC, Priorities USA, in 2012.", 'In 2015 he hosted Obama at a fundraiser at his La Jolla home and was his guest at a state dinner with French president Francois Hollande.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Mitchell Jacobson began working for MSC Direct, an office and industrial equipment distributor founded by his father Sidney, in 1976.', ' In 1995, Jacobson took over as CEO of the Melville, N.Y.-based firm, which now distributes hundreds of products, from staplers to air conditioners.', 'Jacobson held the CEO position through 2005 and, since 2013, the non-executive chairman. With nearly 15% ownership, he is the largest shareholder.']
abouts: ["Jacobson's parents, who married six weeks after they met, poisoned themselves in 2005 after Sid was diagnosed with cancer. They had been married 59 years.", 'Mitchell has one sister, Marjorie Gershwind Fiverson, whose son Erik is currently the President and Chief executive at the company.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Rana Kapoor, former Bank of America executive, is now India's second-richest self-made banker after Uday Kotak by virtue of his 11% stake in Yes Bank. ", "Kapoor cofounded finance firm Rabo India Finance in a joint venture with the Netherland's Rabobank in 1998 but sold his stake five years later. ", 'Along with one partner, he bagged what was a rare banking licence to set up Yes Bank in 2004. ', "Today, it is India's fourth largest bank in the private sector with assets of $41 billion. "]
abouts: ['The bank and its board have been embroiled in a legal battle with the family of his late partner Ashok Kapur, who died in the terror attacks in Mumbai in 2008. ', 'His eldest daughter, Radha, has the India franchise for French handbag maker Longchamp.']

name: Billionaires
title: Entrepreneur
bios: ['Cofounder and CEO of Palantir Technologies, Alex Karp oversees the data-mining startup that received early backing from CIA investment arm In-Q-Tel.', 'The company does contract work for government agencies like the NYPD, and is reportedly the largest holder of real estate in Palo Alto.', 'In 2015, Palantir raised $880 million in venture funding that in turn valued the company at $20 billion.', ' Karp met Palantir cofounder and billionaire Facebook investor Peter Thiel while at Stanford Law School.', 'Karp managed money before starting Palantir in 2004, and occasionally teaches meditation classes at the company.']
abouts: ['In addition to his J.D. degree from Stanford, Karp holds a Ph.D. in neoclassical social theory from the Goethe University in Frankfurt, Germany.', "The rumors that Palantir helped track down bin Laden, and Palantir's failure to reject them, have reportedly led to a rocky relationship with the CIA."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Indian-born British citizen, Raghuvinder Kataria, chairs his Dubai investment firm Kataria Holdings.\r\n', "An early telecom investor, he sold a minority stake in Sunil Mittal's Bharti Airtel at the stock's peak, cashing in an estimated $500 million.", 'During the 2009 Dubai downturn, he bought 2 buildings in Emaar Square in the central business district for $205 million.']
abouts: ["He also has stakes in Danish technology firm Vopium, a Skype rival and India's Dhanlaxmi Bank. ", 'Kataria is a regular donor to the Al Jalila Foundation, a non-profit founded by Dubai ruler Sheikh Mohammed Bin Rashid Al Maktoum. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Pharma tycoon Habil Khorakiwala chairs Wockhardt, one of India's top makers of generic drugs.\r\n", "He founded Wockhardt in 1967 after breaking away from his family's storied retailing empire. ", 'The company, run by his son Murtaza, gets 62% of its $640 million revenue from overseas markets.']
abouts: ['Daughter Zahabiya oversees the hospital arm while another son heads the charitable foundation.\r\n', 'Khorakiwala has served as the honorary consul general of Sweden in India.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Sidney Kimmel founded apparel company Jones Group more than four decades ago. It sold brands including Stuart Weitzman and Nine West. ', 'In 2014, he sold the company for $2.2 billion to private equity firm Sycamore Partners. ', 'He owns production company Sidney Kimmel Entertainment, which produced the films Hell or High Water and The Kite Runner.', 'Kimmel donated $110 million to Thomas Jefferson University in 2014.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Koo Bon-neung is the chairman of Heesung Electronics, which makes display components for TVs, computers, tablets and smartphones. ', 'He is the younger brother of Koo Bon-moo, the late chairman of the LG Group, one of the top five conglomerates in South Korea. ', "In 2004 his son Koo Kwang-moo was adopted by his brother who lost his own son in a car accident. Kwang-moo is now LG's heir-apparent. "]
abouts: ['Koo is a former president of the Korea Baseball Organization. ', "He started his career in LG in 1976, as a manager for the company's branch in Chicago."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Andre Koo is the main shareholder of Chailease Holding, a leasing company that recently started operatin g in Malaysia, Vietnam and the Philippines.', 'Koo is the son of the late financier Jeffrey Koo, who died in 2012.', 'Koo operates Chailease independently from the rest of his family.']
abouts: ['A lobby is named after Koo at NYU Stern School of Business, where his father got his MBA and where Koo also got a degree. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Andrei Kosogov is a member of Alfa Group's supervisory board and in charge of  its investment units. ", 'Kosogov co-founded LetterOne international investment company in Luxembourg in 2013 and now sits on its board. ', "LetterOne invested in oil and gas company DEA, cellular companies Vimpelcom and Turkcell and Europe's largest health food chain Holland & Barrett."]
abouts: ['Born in Estonia when it was part of the Soviet Union, Kosogov graduated from Moscow Power Engineering Institute. ', 'In 1992 Mikhail Fridman hired Kosogov to oversee the establishment of a privatization investment fund. Months later he became chief executive of Alfa Capital.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Lee Ho-jin is a former chairman of Taekwang Industrial, a manufacturer that became synonymous with Korea's textile and petrochemical prowess.", 'He rose to chairman after his oldest brother, Lee Sik-jin, died. He has now stepped down and is struggling against liver cancer.', 'In 2011, he was sentenced to 54 months in prison for embezzling $128 million from the company but has been out on bail due to his illness. ']
abouts: ['Lee is credited for diversifying the group into media and entertainment.', 'His mother sold clothes in a Busan market and provided the seed money to start Taekwang, which began as a textile company. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Solomon Lew chairs Melbourne-based Premier Investments.', 'The company took the spotlight in 2017 by purchasing a 10.8% stake in struggling Australian department store Myer, sparking takeover speculation.', 'Lew family companies are major suppliers to the group. ', 'Premier Investments also owns the Smiggle stationery store franchise, aimed at children and teenagers, as it took over Just Group in 2008.']
abouts: ['Lew says he always had an entrepreneurial mindset, working in retail after school and during holidays before opening his first apparel business on his 18th birthday.', 'He was the first Australian to enter the World Retail Hall of Fame, in 2016, when he was inducted along with Jo Malone and Tommy Hilfiger.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Rodney Lewis grew up on the border in Laredo, Texas. Started Lewis Petro Properties in 1983 with one natural gas well.', 'He eventually acquired 500,000 acres in the Eagle Ford shale and became the fourth-biggest gas producer in Texas.', "He owns America's biggest fleet of air-worthy World War II fighter planes, including a P-38 dug out of a Greenland glacier and restored.", 'In 2004 Lewis was the first U.S. oilman to sign a contract to drill for Pemex in Mexico.']
abouts: ['Lewis beat esophageal cancer a decade ago, but lost his salivary glands.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Li Jiaquan chairs Lomon Group, a chemical supplier.', 'Li founded the predecessor company of Lomon in Sichuan Province in 1985.', "Li sold Lomon's titanium dioxide business to Shenzhen-listed Henan Billions Chemicals  for $1.3 billion in 2016."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Lin Fanlian is chairman of Order Group, whose interests include energy, real estate and finance.', 'Order is headquartered in the eastern Chinese city of Linyi in Shandong Province.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Lin Jianhua chairs Hangzhou First PV Material, a supplier of acetate film to the solar power industry.\r\n', 'Lin worked at a state-owned fertilizer factory in Zhejiang Province from 1982-1994, then set up Hangzhou First PV Material in 2003 with his wife.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Lin Tianfu chairs Guirenniao, an athletic footwear and apparel maker that went public on the Shanghai Stock Exchange in 2014.   \r\n', 'Lin launched his "Guirenniao" shoe brand in 2002 and mainly sells his products in second-tier Chinese cities.\r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Louise Lindh and her sister Katarina Martinson each own a 14% stake in their family's investment outfit L.E. Lundbergforetagen AB.", 'The company holds interests in property management and a variety of other investments, including a pulp and paper company.', 'Both sisters have board seats in the group companies along with their father Fredrik Lundberg.', 'The company was founded by their grandfather Lars in 1944 as a construction outfit. Fredrik took over management of the firm in 1981.', "Lindh runs the groups' real estate outfit."]
abouts: ['Through the holdings, the family has a lot of say in several renowned Swedish firms, including Volvo, Ericsson and steelmaker SSAB.', 'Louise spent most of her childhood in Switzerland to where the family had moved to avoid punitive taxes.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Liu Baolin chairs Jointown Pharmaceutical Group, an operator of pharmacies and wholesaler of pharmaceuticals and medical equipment.', 'Liu was born in a village in Yingcheng in 1953.', 'After finishing middle school during China\'s chaotic Cultural Revolution, he became a "barefoot doctor," minimally trained to work in rural areas. \r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['In 1960, Jose Llado Fernandez-Urrutia founded and chairs Tecnicas Reunidas, a construction company he built into a multibillion-dollar business.', 'He owns 37.19% of the Madrid-listed company, which has projects from refineries in Turkey and Russia to a water desalination plant in Australia.', "He served in Spain's government in the 1970s and as the country's ambassador to the United States from 1978 to 1982.", "He's also an art connoisseur, serving as a patron to Spain's Fundacion de Amigos del Museo del Prado since 1983 and Museo Reina Sofía since 2013."]
abouts: ['He holds a doctorate from University of Madrid in chemistry and industrial chemistry.']

name: Billionaires
title: Investor
bios: ['Lu Di was an early investor China drone maker DJI when it was founded in 2006.', "Today the Shenzhen-headquartered business is one world's largest drone makers. ", 'He\'s been called a "penny pincher" by DJI\'s CEO Frank Wang. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Cargill MacMillan III is one of 14 billionaire heirs to Cargill, the world's biggest agriculture business and America's largest private company. ", 'His great-great-grandfather, W.W. Cargill, founded the business as a single grain warehouse on the end of an Iowa railroad line in 1865.', 'The family still owns roughly 90% of Cargill, which did $115 billion in 2018 sales across food, agriculture, financial and industrial divisions.', 'The Cargill-MacMillan family collects an estimated 18% of net profits as dividends every year.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["John MacMillan is one of 14 billionaire heirs to Cargill, the world's biggest agriculture business and America's largest private company. ", 'His great-great-grandfather, W.W. Cargill, founded the business as a single grain warehouse on the end of an Iowa railroad line in 1865.', 'The family still owns roughly 90% of Cargill, which did $115 billion in 2018 sales across food, agriculture, financial and industrial divisions.', 'The Cargill-MacMillan family collects an estimated 18% of net profits as dividends every year.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Martha MacMillan is one of 14 billionaire heirs to Cargill, the world's biggest agriculture business and America's largest private company. \r\n", 'Her great-great-grandfather, W.W. Cargill, founded the business as a single grain warehouse on the end of an Iowa railroad line in 1865.', 'The family still owns roughly 90% of Cargill, which did $115 billion in 2018 sales across food, agriculture, financial and industrial divisions.', 'The Cargill-MacMillan family collects an estimated 18% of net profits as dividends every year.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["William MacMillan is one of 14 billionaire heirs to Cargill, the world's biggest agriculture business and America's largest private company. \r\n", 'His great-great-grandfather, W.W. Cargill, founded the business as a single grain warehouse on the end of an Iowa railroad line in 1865.', 'The family still owns roughly 90% of Cargill, which did $115 billion in 2018 sales across food, agriculture, financial and industrial divisions.', 'The Cargill-MacMillan family collects an estimated 18% of net profits as dividends every year.\r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Katarina Martinson and her sister Louise Lindh each own a 14% stake in their family's investment outfit L.E. Lundbergforetagen AB.", 'The company holds interests in property management and a variety of other investments, including a pulp and paper company.', 'Both sisters have board seats in the group companies along with their father Fredrik Lundberg.', 'The company was founded by their paternal grandfather Lars in 1944 as a construction outfit. Fredrik took over management of the firm in 1981.', 'Through the holdings, the family has a lot of say in several renowned Swedish firms, including Volvo, Ericsson and steelmaker SSAB.']
abouts: ['Reportedly spent roughly $15 million on a townhouse in central Stockholm, the most expensive house ever sold in Sweden.', 'Katarina has been proposed as Chairman for industrial group Indutrade. She is set to be the youngest Chairman of a company on the Stockholm stock exchange.']

name: Billionaires
title: Entrepreneur
bios: ['Craig Newmark is the founder of online marketplace Craigslist, which notches over 50 billion pageviews a month. ', 'The site brings in over $690 million in revenue, largely by charging for adult services ads, brokered apartments in NYC and job postings in 18 cities.', 'In 2015, he created Craig Newmark Philanthropies, a private foundation supporting veterans, journalism, women in tech, and voter protection.    ']
abouts: ['Craigslist started out as a newsletter about events in San Francisco.\r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Bruce Nordstrom and his sister, Anne Gittinger, are the largest individual shareholders of fashion retailer Nordstrom Inc. ', 'The department store chain was founded by their grandfather as a shoe store in 1901.', 'Nordstrom became president of the family company in 1963 and retired as chairman of the board in 2006.', 'During his tenure as chairman, revenues grew from $40 million to $8 billion.', 'Nordstrom Inc. now operates more than 300 stores across the US, Canada and Puerto Rico.']
abouts: ['Bruce Nordstrom started working at age 9 in the stockroom and on the sales floor of a Nordstrom store.', 'His sons, Peter, Erik and Blake, now serve as co-presidents of the clothing chain.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["The son of Quebecor's founder, Pierre Karl Péladeau is the largest shareholder in the media conglomerate.\r\n", "Péladeau spent 14 years as the company's CEO, running titles including Le Journal de Montréal, before stepping down to run for office.", 'He won and led the separatist Parti Québécois for nearly a year, before resigning in May 2016 due to a custody dispute with his estranged wife.', 'In February 2017, he returned as CEO of a very healthy Quebecor, as shares rose 70% during his political stint.\r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['David Penaloza Alanis is the son of David Penaloza Sandoval, the founder of construction and infrastructure company Grupo Tribasa.', 'Tribasa, known for building and operating toll roads, ran into financial problems after the peso 1994 crisis and was forced to renegotiate its debts.', 'The company began trading on the Mexican stock exchange again in 2005 and was renamed Promotora y Operadora de Infraestructura, or Pinfra, in 2006.', 'During the restructuring, Penaloza Alanis replaced his father at the helm and as its largest shareholder.', 'He owns about 30% of the company, which has 16 toll-road concessions throughout Mexico.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Andreas Pohl is CEO of Deutsche Vermoegensberatung (DVAG), the leading German company in offering mutual funds, consumer insurance and annuities.', 'His brother Reinfried and he inherited the DVAG empire from their father, Reinfried Pohl Sr., who died in 2014.', "The family's holding company, owned 50/50 by the brothers, holds 60% of DVAG with the remaining 40% held by Generali Deutschland Holding AG.", 'The DVAG founder supported a range of schools and organizations in his home city of Marburg, which has led some to refer to it as "Pohl City."', 'Andreas grew up in the company, attended openings of new branches with his father as a teenager, then sold insurances and later helped manage DVAG.']
abouts: ['Pohl is a vintage car aficionado and occasionally participates in vintage car races.', "He accompanies his daughter, an open water swimmer, while she attempts to cross the Ocean's Seven -- seven long-distance open-water swims around the world."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Reinfried Pohl Jr. is chief representative of DVAG, the leading German company offering mutual funds, consumer insurance and annuities.', 'His brother Andreas and he inherited the DVAG empire from their father, Reinfried Pohl Sr., who died in 2014.', "The family's holding company, owned 50/50 by the brothers, holds 60% of DVAG with the remaining 40% held by Generali Deutschland Holding AG.", 'Reinfried grew up in the company, attended openings of new branches with his father as a teenager, then sold insurances and later helped manage DVAG.', 'Magazine Der Spiegel once called DVAG "Germany\'s biggest doorstep brigade," saying they sold insurance contracts at inflated prices. ']
abouts: ['The DVAG founder supported a range of schools and organizations in his home city of Marburg, which has led some to refer to it as "Pohl City."', "Reinfried Jr.'s wife Ana, a physician, is a member of DVAG's supervisory board."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Mahendra Prasad is the founder of Indian generics maker Aristo Pharmaceuticals.', 'Aristo is among the top 20 pharma companies in India with a presence overseas in countries such as Vietnam, Sri Lanka and Myanmar. ', 'Prasad started a pharma venture in partnership with fellow billionaire Samprada Singh before setting up his own venture in 1971.']
abouts: ['Prasad is a long-standing member of parliament.', 'The low profile tycoon, referred to as King Mahendra, loves to travel and enjoys gardening and deep-sea diving. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Anton Rabie is the cofounder and co-CEO of Spin Master Corp., known for its popular kids' toys like Hatchimals, Air Hogs and Paw Patrol. ", 'Rabie started the company in 1994 with childhood friend Ronnen Harary. ', 'Armed with $10,000, Rabie and Harary released Spin Master\'s first toy in 1994. It was called "Earth Buddy" and resembled a Chia Pet.', 'Spin Master had its IPO in 2015.  ', 'Spin Master is now a $1.2 billion (sales) company, which employs over 1,500 people in 16 countries.']
abouts: ['Rabie and Harary reportedly met at summer camp in Ontario when they were both 11 years old. \r\n', "Spin Master made toys for the popular children's TV show, The Wiggles."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Bianca Rinehart is the eldest daughter of Australian mining magnate Gina Rinehart and is a trustee of the Hope Margaret Hancock Trust.', 'She replaced her mother as trustee in 2015, after a lengthy court battle.', "The trust owns 23.45% of Gina Rinehart's Hancock Prospecting, on behalf of her four children. ", 'She has a degree in hospitality and hotel management from Flinders University in Adelaide.']
abouts: ['She worked briefly at global miner Rio Tinto. Her job scope included driving a huge haul truck.', 'She slept with a hammer under her mattress after her grandfather, Lang Hancock, married his housekeeper, generating huge publicity.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Ginia Rinehart is the youngest child of Australian mining mogul Gina Rinehart.', 'Together with her three siblings, she is the beneficiary of a trust that owns a large stake in mining giant Hancock Prospecting.', 'She stayed out of bitter court battle to wrest control of trust from her mother. ', 'She has a degree in business, majoring in Spanish, from London.']
abouts: ['She once worked as a publicist at the House of Faberge in London.', "She was previously engaged to the son of the Beach Boys' Bruce Johnston."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Fertilizer tycoon Alexander Rovt has been pouring his money into New York City real estate, including several apartment buildings in Brooklyn.  ', 'His most notable holding is 14 Wall Street, a 29-story office tower in Manhattan. It has nearly doubled in value since he paid $294 million in 2012.', "Hotel X Toronto, a 404-room luxury hotel and Rovt's largest investment outside of the U.S., is scheduled to open in 2018. ", 'His IBE Trade deals in ammonium-based fertilizer, but has lost most of its value amid the conflict in Ukraine. ', 'Rovt grew up poor in Carpathia, a contested former Soviet territory, and attended the prestigious Lvov State University of Trade and Economics.']
abouts: ['He managed a high-end Hungarian resort in the U.S.S.R. before immigrating to New York, where he first ran a deli and then sold jewelry. ', 'He says he has never invested money in a stock or bond, preferring hard assets like housing.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Brazil-born, Monaco-based billionaire Lily Safra inherited most of her fortune from her fourth husband, the late Edmond J. Safra, a banker. ', "Edmond's 1999 death in a fire at his Monaco penthouse made global headlines and prompted conspiracy theories despite his nurse's admission of guilt. ", 'Edmond left most of his fortune to the Edmond J. Safra Philanthropic Foundation, but he also left Lily enough assets to make her a billionaire.', "Lily's fortune also stems from a stake in Brazilian appliance giant Ponto Frio, inherited after second husband Alfredo Monteverde's 1969 suicide.", 'She sold the stake in 2009 for $340 million to Brazilian retailer Grupo Pao de Acucar, resulting in a 2015 lawsuit she ultimately won.']
abouts: ['Safra supports the only synagogue on the ancient Greek island of Rhodes. ', "In 2012, Safra's Hope Ruby sold at a Christie's charity event for $6.7 million, a world-record price for a ruby at auction.  "]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Deniz Sahenk is the widow of Ayhan Sahenk, the founder of Dogus Holding who died of a heart attack in 2001.', 'Dogus operates in sectors ranging from tourism, real estate and media to financial services, construction and auto import and distribution.', "Most of the fortune derives from Garanti Bank. The family sold its remaining 10% of Garanti to Spain's BBVA in 2017, bringing in $900 million.", "Hotels include the Astir Palace and Athens Hilton in Greece, Capri Palace in Italy, Hotel Villa Magna in Madrid and Rome's Aldrovandi Villa Borghese.", 'Deniz Sahenk has no active role in the Dogus companies. Her son, Ferit, is president of Dogus Holding.']
abouts: ["Both Ferit and Deniz's daughter, Feliz, are also billionaires."]

name: Billionaires
title: Entrepreneur
bios: ['Karin Schick inherited a stake in Bechtle AG from her father, Gerhard, who co-founded the IT company in Heilbronn, Germany in 1983.', "Bechtle covers the IT landscape, ranging from expert strategy advice to managed services that can take over complete operation of a company's systems.", 'The company has more than 8,000 employees and revenues exceeding $3.5 billion.']
abouts: ['Having stepped down from the advisory board of Bechtle in 2017, Karin Schick is focusing on social projects.']

name: Billionaires
title: CEO and Founder
bios: ['Leonard Schleifer cofounded drugmaker Regeneron in 1988, and remains CEO of the Tarrytown, New York company.', 'Schleifer took Regeneron public in 1991; he owns about 2% of the company.', 'He attended Cornell on scholarship and dreamed of a medical career.', "Regeneron, ranked third on the Forbes list of the World's Most Innovative Companies, has developed six FDA-approved medicines. "]
abouts: ['Schleifer grew up in Queens, the son of a sweater manufacturer.', "Sales of Regeneron's blockbuster drug Eylea, a treatment for macular degeneration, reached $3.3 billion in 2016."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Dieter Schnabel owns Helm AG, a chemical marketing firm with annual revenue of around $8 billion and offices in 30 countries.', 'By its own account, Helm began in 1900 as a Hamburg-based import-export business "for merchandise of every description."', "Dieter's father, Hermann, took over from the namesake founder, Karl O. Helm, in 1950 and set a path focused on chemicals.", 'After succeeding his father as chairman of the executive board in 1984, Dieter continued to expand overseas.', "Dieter's oldest son, Stephan, who heads the Crop Protection business unit, represents the third family generation to serve on the executive board."]
abouts: ['Dieter reportedly enjoys golf and kayaking.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Bhadresh Shah founded and runs AIA Engineering, a niche metallurgical company in Ahmedabad city. \r\n', 'Shah started a small foundry in 1978 and parlayed it into a $376 million (revenue) company. ', "AIA is the world's second largest manufacturer of high chromium grinding parts for the cement, mining and power industries. ", 'Shah is a metallurgy engineer from the premier Indian Institute of Technology (Kanpur).']
abouts: ['Shah hails from a family of doctors but chose to study engineering rather than medicine.', 'Shah is a wine connoisseur.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Shao Qinxiang chairs Zhejiang Garden Bio-chemical High-tech, a supplier of pharmaceuticals and animal nutrition products.', 'Shao is the controlling shareholder of Garden, which was founded in 2000.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Eric Shen Ya is a founder and largest shareholder of Vipshop, one of China's fastest growing e-commerce businesses.", 'Shen holds an EMBA degree from Cheung Kong Graduate School of Business and an associate degree in telecommunication from Shanghai Railway College.\r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Nobutoshi Shimamura built one of Japan's leading discount retailers, publicly-traded Shimamura Co. ", 'The chain has nearly 2,000 stores, including shoe stores.', 'In 2013, the company expanded into China and has stores in Taiwan as well.', 'Nobutoshi Shimamura retired more than two decades ago.']
abouts: ['He started out with one small kimono shop. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Shum chairs Times Property, a Chinese real estate developer. ', 'Shum holds an EMBA degree from from Fudan University in 2006.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Helmut Sohmen was chairman of the shipping giant BW Group for 28 years, before he stepped down and handed the reins to son Andreas in 2014. ', 'The Austrian citizen has lived in Hong Kong for decades and is married to Anna Pui Hing Pao, the oldest daughter of the late shipping tycoon Y.K. Pao. ', 'He supports a graduate scholarship program for Chinese lawyers studying at his alma mater, Southern Methodist University in Texas. ', 'His billionaire brother-in-law, Peter Woo, controls Wheelock and Company, a Hong Kong-based real estate firm. ']
abouts: ['Sohmen was part of the Legislative Council of Hong Kong from 1985 to 1988.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Sun Qinghuan chairs MLS, one of China's largest makers of light-emitting diodes. \r\n", 'Sun, who founded MLS in 1997, became a billionaire after the company went public in February 2015 on the Shenzhen Stock Exchange. \r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Sun Yinhuan controls Yida China Holdings, a leading operator of business parks in China.', 'Sun is a vice president of the China Real Estate Association and vice chairman of the All-China Federation of Industry & Commerce.']

name: Billionaires
bios: [' Djoko Susanto, the sixth of 10 siblings, built a retail group from humble beginnings.', "At age 17 he started managing his parents' modest food stall inside a traditional market in Jakarta.", 'He added cigarettes to the lineup and began opening more stalls.', 'He partnered with clove cigarette tycoon Putera Sampoerna to open similar stalls and then a discount supermarket chain. ', 'When Putera sold his cigarette business to Phillip Morris in 2005, Susanto bought the retail business and developed it into Alfa Supermarket.']
abouts: ['His Alfamart, a minimart format, expanded to the Philippines and has 300 stores there.', 'His Alfa Group is also active in residential real estate development.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Erol Tabanca founded Polimeks Construction with $30,000, after having resigned from the company he worked for in Turkmenistan.', "Polimeks' first jobs were sidewalks and parks. Its portfolio grew to include monuments, infrastructure projects, industrial buildings and airports.", 'The company has completed more than 130 projects with a total value of $11.3 billion.', '95% of its current portfolio consists of projects in Turkmenistan.']
abouts: ['Although Tabanca is a Turkish citizen, he served as Assistant Minister of Public Works in Turkmenistan and as an architect for the city of Ashgabat.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Alexander Tedja's real estate developer Pakuwon Jati has built shopping malls in Indonesia as the middle class has grown. \r\n", 'The publicly traded company is building offices in Jakarta and Surabaya.']
abouts: ['Art lover, Tedja received the Distinguished Patron of Arts for his long-term loan of a collection of paintings to the National Gallery Singapore.', "Tedja's daughter Irene is married to the son of billionaire Murdaya Poo."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Wilma Tisch owes her fortune to her late husband Laurence (d. 2003) and his brother Bob, who started Loews Corp as a New Jersey hotel venture in 1946.', "Wilma's son James is the president and CEO of Loews, which now has interests in drilling, natural gas pipelines and insurance.", "Until her death in Nov. 2017. her sister-in law Joan Tisch was also a billionaire; Wilma's son Andrew co-chairs Loews' board with Joan's son Andrew.", 'At NYU, the Tisch family donated funds to support the Tisch School of the Arts and the Tisch Hospital at Langone Medical Center.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Ayhan Tosyali is vice chairman of steel and iron producer Tosyali Holding, which has 18 facilities spread over Turkey, Serbia and Algeria.', 'As a child, he joined his father and brothers in a small workshop in Iskenderun, where they made sheet metal out of used tin cheese cans. ', 'From sheet metal, they went on to bucket and stove production. The family began investing in Algeria in 2008.', "Including overseas operations, Tosyali is on track to become Turkey's largest iron and steel producer, with an 8.5 million ton capacity by 2019.", 'Ayhan shares ownership in the business with his brothers Fuat and Fatih Tosyali.']
abouts: ['By the end of 2019, Tosyali Holding expects to have invested in excess of $6 billion in integrated production facilities located in Oran, Algeria.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Along with his brothers Fuat and Ayhan, Fatih Tosyali presides over a steel and iron producer with 18 facilities in Turkey, Serbia and Algeria.', 'As a child, he joined his father and brothers in a small workshop in Iskenderun, where they made sheet metal out of used tin cheese cans.', 'From sheet metal, they went on to bucket and stove production. The family began investing in Algeria in 2008.', "Including overseas operations, Tosyali Holding is on track to become Turkey's top iron and steel producer, with an 8.5 million ton capacity by 2019.", 'Fatih is on the board of Tosyali Holding and shares ownership in the business with his brothers.']
abouts: ['Tosyali is the Honorary Consul for Slovenia. ', 'By the end of 2019, Tosyali Holding expects to have invested in excess of $6 billion in integrated production facilities located in Oran, Algeria. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Tran Dinh Long founded Hoa Phat Corp., an equipment and parts distributor, in Hanoi in 1992.', 'Hoa Phat is now the biggest steel maker in Vietnam, making office equipment, steel pipes and construction steel. ']
abouts: ['Tran is just the second businessman in Vietnam to buy a private plane. ', 'Hoa Phat is building a $3 billion steel factory in Dung Quat, Vietnam. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Tsai Ming-Kai is chairman and CEO of his smartphone chipmaker MediaTek, which was spun off from another company he ran.', 'Faced with escalating competition in a plateauing sector, Tsai brought in Rick Tsai (who is not related) as his co-CEO on June 1.', "Tsai studied electrical engineering first in Taiwan and later got a master's degree in electrical engineering from University of Cincinnati."]
abouts: ['Long-regarded as the father of Taiwan\'s chip design industry, Tsai was nicknamed "King of the Bandit Phones" since MediaTek mainly powered low-end mobile phones. ', "Tsai joined United Microelectronics, one of Taiwan's earliest chip companies, in 1983 and climbed the ladder to run its consumer and multimedia product business. "]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Coal, energy and real estate investor Pavel Tykac began as a computer distributor in the early 1990s, plowing profits into a small regional bank.', "He then partnered with four colleagues to found Motoinvest, which specialized in hostile takeovers during the Czech Republic's privatization program.", 'His largest assets are two Czech coal mining firms that he owns through Cyprus-based Indoverse Czech Coal Investments. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Jayshree Ullal has been president and CEO of Arista Networks, a computer networking firm, since 2008.', 'The publicly-traded company recorded revenues of $1.6 billion in 2017.', "Ullal owns about 5% of Arista's stock, some of which is earmarked for her two children, niece and nephew.", "Arista and Cisco, Ullal's former employer, have been locked in a multi-year legal battle over alleged patent infringement, which Arista denies.", "Born in London and raised in India, she is now one of America's wealthiest female executives."]
abouts: ['Ullal studied electrical engineering at San Francisco State University and engineering management at Santa Clara University.', 'Ullal joined Arista when it had no revenues and fewer than 50 employees. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Wan Long is the chairman and CEO of meat processor WH Group.', "WH acquired Virginia-based Smithfield, the world's largest pork processor and hog producer, in 2013. ", "Smithfield completed the acquisition of Clougherty Packing, California's largest processor, in 2017. ", 'WH Group was formerly known as Shuanghui International, and renamed itself in 2014.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Wang Muqing is the founder of China ZhengTong Auto Services Holdings, which has automotive dealerships throughout China. ', 'ZhengTong specializes in luxury automobiles.', 'Wang started out in the automobile trading business in 1996.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Wang Yong is chairman of the Xiwang Group, the biggest producer of starch sugar in Asia; it is also involved in steel, real estate and food.', 'Wang established Xiwang Group in 1986; it now employs 14,000 people.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Hope Welker is the third child of Australian mining billionaire Gina Rinehart.', 'Together with her three siblings, she is the beneficiary of a trust that owns a large stake in mining giant Hancock Prospecting.', 'She joined, then withdrew, from a four-year court battle to remove mother as trustee.']
abouts: ['In 2011, she told her mother she was down to her last $60,000.', "She went to boarding school at Switzerland's famous Insitut Le Rosey."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Wen Yibo, a former government engineer, leads Shenzhen-listed Sound Environmental Resources and Hong Kong-listed Sound Global.\r\n', "Wen holds a degree in environmental engineering from Langzhou Jiaotong University and a master's in the same field from Tsinghua University. \r\n"]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Stephen Winn is the founder and CEO of RealPage, a firm that provides rental management software to landlords across the nation. ', 'Its products help landlords manage finances and compliance requirements, and enable tenants to pay rent and file maintenance requests electronically. ', "An electrical engineer by training, Winn started his career working for his father's accounting software firm, Computer Language Research.", 'He eventually took over the family business as CEO, and founded RealPage in 1998.', 'Winn took the Texas company public in 2010; he owns more than a quarter of the stock.']
abouts: ["RealPage's software is used to manage over 11 million rental units in the U.S.", "RealPage's predecessor, Little Buddy, was a side venture of a tax software business Winn acquired to expand Computer Language Research. \r\n"]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Gordon Wu chairs Hopewell Holdings, one of Hong Kong's largest builders of roads, tunnels and bridges.", 'The Princeton University-educated business icon also boasts extensive interests in southern China.', 'Son Thomas Jefferson is the managing director and heir apparent.']
abouts: ['Gordon Wu has been awarded honorary doctorate degrees by eight universities, including Hong Kong Polytechnic University and the University of Strathclyde. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Wu Lanlan is the vice chairman of Shenzhen Yuto Packaging.', 'Wu holds a MBA from Tongji Unversity. She is the wife of Wang Huajun.\r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Chinese entrepreneur Xu Ziquan is the chairman of Beijing Jetsen Technology, an audio and video solutions company. \r\n', 'He shifted his business interest to video hardware after focusing on film and program distribution in the 1990s.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Yang Meirong's fortune arises from a stake in Bright Scholar Education, a China school network.", 'Bright Scholar Education went public at the New York Stock Exchange in 2017.', 'Yang was a cofounder of the predecessor of Bright Scholar.\r\n', 'Bright operates six international schools, 11 bilingual schools, and 34 kindergartens in seven provinces. ', 'Yang is an aunt of fellow Chinese billionaire Yang Huiyan.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Yang Tingdong's fortune comes from a stake in rice-wine supplier Jiangsu Yanghe Brewery.", 'Yang chaired the company from 2002 to 2012.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['You Xiaoping chairs Huafon Group, a supplier of materials to the chemical industry. ', 'Huafon Group is also involved in metals, finance, logistics and trade. ', 'One of its units, publicly traded Zhejiang Huafeng Spandex, supplies spandex products.']

name: Billionaires
bios:
['Yu Peidi chairs Shanghai-listed real estate developer Greattown Holdings. 

', 'Yu left his hometown Fuzhou in 1976 and made his early money in the home appliance trade in Indonesia.
', 'Yu began to invest in Fuzhou in the 1980s, starting with minerals and later real estate.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Yu Qibing chairs the Kibing Group, an industrial investment and real estate concern. ', 'Yu is also the director of Zhuzhou Kibing Group, a leading glass manufacturer in China.', 'Zhuzhou Kibing Group listed at the Shanghai Stock Exchange in 2011.']

name: Billionaires
title: Entrepreneur
bios: ['Yu Yunxin is the vice chairman of Neoglory, a Chinese supplier of fashion costume jewelry.\r\n', "Yu founded Neoglory in 1995 with his wife and fellow billionaire Zhou Xiaoguang. Zhou is Neoglory's chairman.\r\n"]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Zan Shengda chairs investment company Nantong Zongyi Investment. \r\n', 'Zan holds an EMBA degree from Tsinghua University.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Zhang Guiping is the chairman of Suning Universal, a property and hotel business headquartered in Nanjing, a city in eastern China.', 'Zhang has been working to diversify Shenzhen-listed Suning with investments in cosmetic surgery, hospitals and health insurance companies in 2016.', "Zhang's brother Zhang Jindong is also a billionaire. \r\n"]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Zhao Weiguo leads Tsinghua Unigroup, an affiliate of Tsinghua University, and has been a force in building up the country's semiconductor industry. \r\n", 'Zhao is a Tsinghua University alum.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Zheng Jianjiang is chairman of Ningbo Sanxing Medical Electric. ', 'Zheng began working from a bankrupt watch parts factory in 1986 with seven other people.', "Sanxing's parent company, AUX Group, also has interests in air conditioning manufacturing and real estate development."]

name: Billionaires
person: {'name': 'Hamad bin Jassim bin Jaber Al Thani', 'uri': 'hamad-bin-jassim-bin-jaber-al-thani', 'imageExists': False, 'squareImage': '//specials-images.forbesimg.com/imageserve/5a8071fc31358e4955ad284c/416x416.jpg?background=000000&cropX1=0&cropX2=720&cropY1=62&cropY2=782'}
personName: Hamad bin Jassim bin Jaber Al Thani
bios: ['Hamad bin Jassim Al Thani was prime minister of Qatar between 2007 and 2013; he also served as foreign minister from 1992 until 2013.', "His great uncle founded modern Qatar in 1971, and he's a cousin of the current Emir. ", 'Through an entity called Paramount Services Holdings, Al Thani owns 3% of Deustche Bank, his biggest publicly-traded holding.', 'In 2016, he was mentioned in the "Panama Papers"--leaked files from Panama law firm Mossack Fonseca, which set up offshore entities for clients.']
abouts: ['Al Thani, known as HBJ, has a 436-foot superyacht, called Al Mirqab, worth an estimated $300 million, according to the Panama Papers.', "He served as Qatar's spokesman in the U.S., making the rounds of talk shows in 2017 to defend his country against Saudi Arabia's charges that it supports terrorism."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Fawzi Al-Kharafi is the chairman of M.A. Al-Kharafi & Sons, a conglomerate founded by his late father Mohammed in 1956.', 'He became chairman in 2015 following the death of his brother Jassim, a former speaker of the Kuwait National Assembly.', 'The Kharafi group owns stakes in several Kuwaiti companies, including Zain, a telecom firm chaired by his brother Mohannad, also a billionaire.', "In 2016, the group sold its shares in Americana, which operates fast-food chains in the Middle East, including KFC and Hardee's, for $2.3 billion."]
abouts: ['When his brother and former Kharafi group chairman Nasser died in 2011, the Kuwaiti stock market lost nearly 1% of its value.', 'His sister Faiza Al-Kharafi is a former president of Kuwait University. An award-winning chemist, she has published work on the impact of corrosion.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Mohannad Al-Kharafi is the vice chairman of M.A. Al-Kharafi & Sons, a conglomerate founded by his late father Mohammed in 1956.', 'The Kharafi group owns stakes in several Kuwaiti companies, including Zain, a telecom firm with $3.6 billion in 2016 revenues.', 'Al-Kharafi is chairman of Zain; his nephew Bader is CEO.', "In 2016, the group sold its shares in Americana, which operates fast-food chains in the Middle East, including KFC and Hardee's, for $2.3 billion.", 'His brother Fawzi is also a billionaire.']
abouts: ['When his brother and former Kharafi group chairman Nasser died in 2011, the Kuwaiti stock market lost nearly 1% of its value.', 'His sister Faiza Al-Kharafi is a former president of Kuwait University. An award-winning trained chemist, she has published work on the impact of corrosion.']

name: Billionaires
