bios: ['Isak Andic is the founder and chairman of the $2.8 billion (2016 sales) clothing retailer Mango.', "The brand's sales outside of Spain make up about 80% of total revenue. It has some 2,217 stores in 110 countries. ", 'Andic opened his first clothing store in Barcelona in 1984, took the company international in 1992 and opened its 1,000th store in 2007. ', "His son and presumptive heir Jonathan Andic (b.1981) is the company's executive vice chairman.", "In 2017, the elder Andic sold his shares in Banco Sabadell, one of Spain's largest banking groups."]
abouts: ['The media-shy entrepreneur was born in Istanbul in 1953, but his his family moved to Barcelona in the 1960s.', 'He is an enthusiastic sailor and reportedly owns a 175-foot yacht called Nirvana Formentera.']

name: Billionaires
title: Investor
bios: ['Andreessen runs influential Silicon Valley venture capital firm Andreessen Horowitz, whose successful bets include Instagram, Oculus VR and GitHub.', 'His first claim to fame was cofounding web browser firm Netscape, which AOL bought in 1998 for $4.2 billion in stock. ', "Andreessen's biggest score was as a seed investor in Facebook.", 'He also cofounded Loudcloud, which, renamed Opsware, sold to Hewlett-Packard for $1.6 billion in 2007.', "In June 2018, a16z raised raised $300 million for its first crypto-focused fund, led by the firm's first female general partner, Katie Haun."]
abouts: ['His wife Laura is daughter of billionaire John Arrillaga, who built his fortune in Silicon Valley real estate.', 'While still at college, Andreessen co-created the highly influential Mosaic Internet browser.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Jose Maria Aristrain is the former owner of steelmaker Arcelor, which was acquired by Mittal Steel in 2006 for nearly $34 billion in cash and stock. ', "He is now believed to own a 2% stake of ArcelorMittal, the world's largest steel company.", "He owns about 10% of Spain's Tubacex, the second-largest global manufacturer of seamless stainless steel tubes."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Thomas Bailey's fortune comes from mutual fund giant Janus, which he founded in Denver in 1969.", 'Bailey sold his 12% stake in Janus to its parent, Stillwell Financial, for $1.2 billion (pretax) in 2001-2002.', 'Janus had two decades of remarkable returns, but its funds began losing money in the early 2000s.', 'He served as the CEO of Janus for 33 years until 2002 and as chairman through 2003.', 'A Michigan State graduate who worked on Wall Street before moving to Denver, he spends his time fly-fishing and breeding horses.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Originally from Chandigarh, India, Harindarpal Singh Banga, known as Harry, has lived in Hong Kong since the 1970s.', "The former vice-chairman of the Noble Group made his fortune over a 21-year career with Asia's largest commodity trader.", 'He cashed in the last of his Noble shares in 2012, and started Hong Kong based Caravel Group with sons Guneet and Angad in 2013.', 'The Caravel Group trades and ships commodities.', 'He was honored in 2011 with the Pravasi Bharatiya Samman Award, the highest distinction conferred by the Indian government to overseas Indians.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Russia's wealthiest woman, Elena Baturina, is married to Yury Luzkhkov, who was the mayor of Moscow for years. ", "In 2010, Luzhkov was removed from the mayor's post; Baturina and their daughters left the country.", 'Baturina sold almost all of her assets in Russia including a  construction company called Inteko and a cement factory in 2011. ', 'The Russian government seized land she owned in an exclusive area of Moscow. She filed a lawsuit, unsuccessfully demanding $1 billion in compensation.', 'Baturina, who now lives in London, owns hotels in cities like Vienna and Dublin, real estate in Europe and USA, and invests in renewable energy.']
abouts: ['Baturina bought two commercial properties in Brooklyn near the Barclays Center in 2015. ', "Baturina's charity fund BE OPEN supports young designers, architects, writers and scientists."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Eduardo Belmont is the owner and president of Belcorp, a door-to-door cosmetics company that operates in 14 Latin American countries and the U.S. ', 'Hundreds of thousands of "beauty consultants" sell Belcorp products from their homes and in their neighborhoods.', "Belcorp's revenues slipped to about $1.09 billion in 2016, a drop of some $100 million from the previous year. "]
abouts: ['Eduardo and his brother Fernando used to run a jointly-owned cosmetics firm called Yanbal, but in 1988 they parted ways. Each now runs his own beauty enterprise.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Tomasz Biernacki is the founder and chairman of Poland's largest grocery chain, Dino Polska.", 'Biernacki opened his first shop in 1999; today the company has 775 stores that also produce their own meat products.', 'Biernacki took Dino Polska public in 2017.']
abouts: ['Biernacki is one of the most secretive businessmen in Poland. There are no pictures of him in the public domain and he has never given a press interview.\r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['An Iraqi immigrant, Zadik Bino moved to Israel and worked his way up the chain at First International Bank of Israel.', 'Bino went on to serve as CEO of FIBI from 1978 to 1986 before buying the company two decades later; he still owns 38% of the bank. ', 'He purchased a 60% stake in Israeli company Paz Oil in 1999 for $48 million.  ', 'He has since liquidated his position in Paz Oil in transactions worth an estimated $800 million. ']
abouts: ["He purchased FIBI Holdings from Brazil's Safra brothers for $90 million in cash in 2003."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Brett Blundy is the former chairman of BB Retail, selling jewelry, lingerie and homewares. ', 'He sold his property and retail interests in three IPOs in 2016 and 2017. The Singapore resident is now building a beef cattle empire in northern Australia to feed Asian demand.', " He has joined with cattle-station owners in Australia's Northern Territory to fund water supply, enabling properties to carry larger herds.", "He owns a 40% stake in BridgeClimb, an adventure company that takes people climbing to the top of Sydney Harbor's iconic bridge. ", 'In 2010, he cofounded fast fashion jewelry retailer Lovisa, which has over 270 stores worldwide. ']
abouts: ["Blundy's interest in business started early. He grew up on a small farm near Melbourne where he and his four siblings would pick mushrooms to sell from a roadside stall for five cents a pound. ", 'His career dream was to be a pilot, but that was thwarted when he failed the final year of school.', 'At age 20, Blundy bought a run-down record store in a suburb called Packenham with a friend. The business failed, and they had to take on day jobs to support it.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['With fellow Ukrainian billionaire Ihor Kolomoysky, Henadiy Boholyubov founded PrivatBank with $1 million in capital in the early 1990s. ', "Over the years it grew to be a key bank in Ukraine, handling more than a third of private deposits and serving about half the country's population.", "In 2016, Ukraine's government nationalized the bank; an investigation indicated large-scale fraud over a period of ten years. ", 'Last December, a London High Court ordered a freeze on some $2.5 billion worth of assets held by Boholyubov and Kolomysky. They deny the charges.', 'The two men settled a lawsuit in 2016 with billionaire Viktor Pinchuk, who had sued them for damages for unfulfilled pledges on mining investments.']

name: Billionaires
title: Founder & Chairman
employment: {'name': 'Brandes Investment Partners, L.P.', 'title': 'Founder & Chairman', 'government': False, 'featuredExecutive': False}
bios: ['Charles Brandes founded Brandes Investment Partners in 1974. He left the company in February 2018 amidst proceedings of his third divorce.', 'The firm peaked at over $100 billion in assets in 2007, but since the financial crisis of 2008 assets have fallen to about $31 billion.', "He worked as a stock broker between 1968 and 1974 before founding Brandes, and is known as one of the industry's leading value investors.", 'His interest in value investing stems from a meeting with legendary value investor Ben Graham.  ']
abouts: ["Brandes is an avid collector of Ferrari's, and his house in San Diego has a garage that can fit up to 37 of them.", 'Brandes, who is getting a third divorce, is required to pay $485,000 a month in spousal support to his second-wife, Linda Brandes.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Amit Burman is vice chairman of Indian consumer goods firm Dabur, which he oversees along with cousin Anand Burman who is listed separately.  \r\n', "An MBA from Cambridge University, he started off in Dabur's industrial engineering department where he worked on mechanization and packaging. ", "He went on to lead Dabur's foray into processed foods spanning the gamut from cooking pastes to fruit juices. "]
abouts: ['He holds close to 12% in Dabur and also has stakes in other privately held businesses such as restaurant chain Lite Bite Foods. \r\n', " Amit holds a pilot's license and enjoys flying."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Cai Dongqing  turned a successful toy maker into  Alpha Group, one of China's largest animation studios.", 'Cai began his business career selling trumpets.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Chen Bo chairs Ningxia Jiaze Renewables, a wind power supplier in Ningxia.', 'Jiaze went public at the Shanghai Stock Exchange in 2017, raising money to expand capacity. ']

name: Billionaires
title: Founder and CEO
bios: ['Cheng Wei chairs CEO ride-hailing firm Didi Kuaidi.', "Didi was formed in 2015 when Cheng's company Didi Dache merged with Alibaba-backed competitor Kuaidi Dache.\r\n", "Before founding Didi Dache, Cheng worked at Alibaba and was vice president for Alibaba's online payment service Alipay."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Phongthep Chiaravanont is a cousin of Thai billionaire Dhanin Chearavanont.', "He has been a director on the board of Charoen Pokphand Foods, part of the family's Charoen Pokphand conglomerate, since 1994.", 'Phongthep studied avian sciences at the University of California, Davis.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['In 1977, Kochouseph Chittilappilly borrowed $1,500 from his father to set up a small unit to make voltage stabilizers.', 'Over four decades he built it into $335 million (revenue) V-Guard Industries.', 'Chittilappily expanded into amusement parks in 2000 with Wonderla Holidays.', 'These days, Chittilappily is busy with his property venture, Veegaland Developers.']
abouts: ['His two sons run V-Guard and Wonderla.', 'He donated one of his kidneys to a poor truck driver.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Chu Jinfu is the chairman of Shenzhen-listed Henan Senyuan Electric, a supplier of electrical power equipment and devices.', 'Chu holds an EMBA from Tsinghua University.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['After working as a stockbroker and finance executive, Eduardo Costantini founded real estate development firm Consultatio S.A. in 1991.', 'The Buenos Aires-traded firm has developments in Argentina and the U.S., including a $700 million luxury residential complex near Miami.', 'He owns nearly 70% of Consultatio S.A., his largest asset.', "He's also a majority shareholder of Consultatio Asset Management, a Buenos Aires firm with over $700 million of assets under of management."]
abouts: ["Costantini's foundation supports the Latin American Art Museum of Buenos Aires, known as MALBA, which features his art collection. "]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Sol Daurella is the chairwoman of the world's largest Coke bottling company, Coca-Cola European Partners.", "The Daurella family's ties to Coca-Cola began in 1951, when they were awarded a bottling license.", "In 2015 their Coca-Cola Iberian Partners SA merged with Germany's Coca-Cola Erfrischungsgetränke AG and Coke subsidiary Coca-Cola Enterprises.", 'Daurella owns 6% of Coca-Cola European Partners, the combined company.', "She is also a board member of Banco Santander, Spain's largest bank, and serves as Honorary Consul for Iceland in Barcelona."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["One of Britain's wealthiest high street fashion moguls, Philip Day owns Edinburgh Woollen Mill and several other UK fashion brands.", 'He decided to skip college in order to start working for a British clothing manufacturer and joined Edinburgh Woolen Mill in 2001.', 'A year later he bought the company outright; it was barely turning a profit.', 'Day turned it around, acquired other struggling retailers and expanded the company to greater heights.', "In 2012 he bought Peacocks, one of the UK's largest fashion retailers, and has worked diligently to revamp its business."]
abouts: ['A keen outdoorsman, Day owns The Scottish Deer Centre, a 55-acre wildlife sanctuary home to more than 14 species of deer that encourages environmental research.', 'Day previously sat on the board of his local soccer club, Carlisle United, despite reportedly not enjoying the sport.']

name: Billionaires
person: {'name': 'D. Leopoldo Del Pino y Calvo-Sotelo', 'uri': 'd-leopoldo-del-pino', 'imageExists': False}
personName: D. Leopoldo Del Pino y Calvo-Sotelo
bios: ["Leopoldo del Pino y Calvo Sotelo is an heir to Ferrovial S.A., Spain's largest infrastructure construction and management company.", 'His father, who founded the company in 1952, died in 2008. Leopoldo and his siblings inherited their stakes.', "Leopoldo's brother Rafael is the chairman and co-CEO of Ferrovial.", 'Leopoldo served as a board member of Ferrovial until early 2016.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Norbert Dentressangle sold his eponymous transportation and logistics company to XPO Logistics for $3.53 billion in June 2015.', 'He founded Norbert Dentressangle SA in 1979 and grew it into a European industry leader with $5.5 billion in revenues and more than 43,000 employees.', 'Now he focuses on real estate, industrial ventures and other investments through his family-owned holding company, Dentressangle Initiatives. ', 'In 2017, he was part of a group of investors who acquired 70% of Kiloutou, the fourth largest construction rental company in Europe.', 'The low-profile billionaire lives with his family in Lyon, France.']
abouts: ['Dentressangle is the author of Passion Rouge, a book about his entrepreneurial journey.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["With a 10% stake, Beda Diethelm is Swiss hearing aid manufacturer Sonova's largest individual shareholder.", 'Diethelm joined what would become Sonova in 1965, receiving a chunk of equity from the former owner in 1980. ', 'Sonova has sales of nearly $2.5 billion and is based in Stafa, Switzerland and has production facilities in Vietnam and China.', 'The publicly-traded company makes hearing aids, wireless devices and cochlear implants. ']
abouts: ['Born in the tiny village of Galgenen, Switzerland, Diethelm first dabbled in electronics as an apprentice for a radio and TV technician in Zurich.', 'By 1962, Diethelm had worked his way up to become the head of production and technical director of Bommer, a Zurich company that was a global hearing aid supplier. ']

name: Billionaires
bio: Mark Dixon is the CEO of office space rental firm IWG, known as Regus until November 2016. That month the company announced it was moving its headquarters from Luxembourg to Switzerland, citing the complexity and "uncertainty" of the European Union. Dixon founded the company in Brussels in 1989, long before a new generation of competitors, such as WeWork, came on the scene. IWG, which calls itself a "flexible workspace provider," rents out meeting rooms, office space by the hour, virtual offices and space in co-working sites; it has nearly 3,000 locations in 106 countries, serving 2.3 million customers. Dixon owns about one-third of the company, which trades on the London Stock Exchange. The son of a car mechanic, Dixon dropped out of school at age 16 to start a business delivering sandwiches by bicycle. Later he launched a service in London delivering hot dogs and hamburgers in vans. Realizing that it was hard to procure buns, he launched a company that supplied bread rolls to food vendors, then sold it in 1988 for the equivalent of $1.4 million. Today Dixon also owns the luxurious Chateau de Berne in Provence, France, with 1,500 acres of vineyards, olive trees, restaurants and a spa.
bios: ['Mark Dixon is the founder and CEO of IWG (formerly Regus), a flexible workplace provider.', 'The son of a car mechanic, Dixon dropped out of school at age 16 to start a business delivering sandwiches by bicycle.', 'He held jobs as a logger and an encyclopedia salesman before founding IWG in 1989, after spotting businesspeople meeting around coffee tables.', 'Now the company rents out meeting rooms, office space by the hour, virtual offices and space in co-working sites across 114 countries.']
abouts: ['Earlier in his career Dixon launched The Bread Roll Company to supply bread to food vendors after realizing it was hard to procure buns for hot dogs and hamburgers.', 'Dixon owns the 150-acre Kingscote Estate winery in West Sussex, an area he reportedly hopes will be "a new frontier for wine."']

name: Billionaires
title: Chief Executive Officer
bios: ['The son of a Chicago meat-packer, Henry Engelhardt aspired to be a journalist before turning to entrepreneurship. ', "His insurance company Admiral Group, founded in 1993, offers car and home insurance and created the UK's first insurance price comparison website.", 'Based in Cardiff, Wales, Admiral also has operations in Spain, France, Italy, and the U.S. ', 'Its American brands include Elephant Auto Insurance and Compare.com. ', "Engelhardt stepped down as CEO in May 2016, but he's still a part-time employee, mentoring senior managers and taking part in MBA recruitment. "]
abouts: ["Admiral's Ministry of Fun organizes events for its employees, such as dress-up days, rock band contests, and surfing trips.", 'He and his wife, Diane, started Moondance Foundation to support causes in Wales, education, healthcare, poverty, and the arts.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Fang Hongbo is the chairman of China's Midea, one of the world's largest makers of home appliances.", 'Fang was born in a 10-family village in impoverished Anhui Province in central China. ', 'He was hired by Midea in 1992 to edit the company newsletter. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Gleb Fetisov joined Mikhail Fridman's Alfa Group in 1995. He later led the group's takeover of an aluminum plant in Siberia.", 'Fetisov sold all of his business interests in 2014 including a stake in telecom outfit Vimpelcom for approximately $1.4 billion in cash.', 'Soon after cashing out, he was arrested, accused of embezzling assets of now-bankrupt My Bank in Moscow.', 'In February 2015, he paid $200 million to creditors and was soon after released from prison.']
abouts: ["Fetisov was a member of the Federation Council, the upper house of Russia's parliament, in 2001-2009 years.", 'Fetisov invested $4 million and was one of the co-producers of the Oscar nominated film Loveless.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Donald Foss is the founder and former chairman of subprime auto lender Credit Acceptance Corp.', 'He launched the company in 1972 and was one of the first to offer loan programs that help dealers sell cars to customers with poor or no credit.', 'Foss ran Credit Acceptance as CEO for three decades, taking it public in 1992.', 'In early 2017 he stepped down as director of the company and retired.']

name: Billionaires
title: Founder and Executive Chairman
employment: {'name': 'Ivanhoe Mines Ltd.', 'title': 'Founder and Executive Chairman', 'government': False}
bios: ['Robert Friedland founded and chairs Toronto-listed Ivanhoe Mines, a leader in the mining and precious metals industry.', 'Based in Singapore, Friedland is praised for finding profitable mines in remote areas like Oyu Tolgoi in Mongolia.', 'A graduate of Reed College, Friedland also funds Ivanhoe Capital Corporation, which invests in emerging markets.', 'He has a 12.7% stake in Australia-listed CleanTeQ Holdings, which supplies cobalt and nickel to lithium-ion battery producers.']
abouts: ["Friedland's son Govind is a geologist and founder of uranium mining outfit GoviEx Uranium.\r\n", 'Friedland owns Ivanhoe Pictures, a production company that merged with Sidney Kimmel Entertainment to form SK Global.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Donald Friese's fortune stems from C.R. Laurence, which manufactures or distributes more than 65,000 products for the glass industry.", 'In 2015 he sold C.R. Laurence to a big customer, Oldcastle BuildingEnvelope, a subsidiary of Irish conglomerate CRH, for $1.3 billion in cash. ', 'Friese grew up a poor orphan in rural Pennsylvania, going to work on a dairy farm at age 12 before enlisting in the Army after high school.', 'After a three-year tour, he moved to California with just $125 and landed in the warehouse of C.R. Laurence, then a small distributor of supplies.', 'He climbed the ladder, amassing equity in the company until he owned 100%, and expanded by purchasing competitors and moving into manufacturing.']
abouts: ['When Friese sold C.R. Laurence, he gave his employees $85 million. All 1,600 longtime workers got a bonus check -- some for more than $1 million.', "Despite cashing out, Friese continues to run the company's day-to-day operations. He works 12 hour days during the week, plus a half-day every Saturday."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Fu Guangming is the chairman of Fujian Sunner Development, which supplies chicken to KFC in China.\r\n', 'He shares his fortune with daughter Fu Fenfang, a company director.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Dan Gertler built a fortune through mining ventures in Africa, primarily in the Democratic Republic of Congo. ', 'In February 2017, he sold his stake in two mines in the Congo to commodities giant Glencore for $960 million; Gertler made an estimated $400 million.', 'In December 2017, the U.S. government placed Gertler on its sanctions list for his corrupt business deals in the Congo. ', " A spokesman for Gertler declined to comment on the U.S. government's allegations."]
abouts: ["Gertler's grandfather, Moshe Schnitzer, cofounded the Israel Diamond Exchange in 1947.", 'He bought his first mine in the Democratic Republic of Congo in 1997 and soon became friends with DRC President Joseph Kabila.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Dennis Gillings is the founder and former CEO and chairman of clinical research company Quintiles Transnational.', 'Gillings, a former biostatistics professor, launched Quintiles in 1982 with the goal of making clinical trials for drugs faster and more efficient.', 'Quintiles merged with healthcare data firm IMS Health in 2016 and a year later changed its name to IQVIA. ', 'Before the merger, Quintiles had annual revenues of $5.7 billion. ', 'Gillings remains on the board of IQVIA and holds a 5% stake in the company. ']
abouts: ['Gillings received a Commander of the Order of the British Empire from Queen Elizabeth in 2004 for his work in the pharmaceutical industry. ', "The University of North Carolina's school of global public health is named for Gillings. He donated $50 million to the university in 2007."]

name: Billionaires
title: Entrepreneur
bios: ['Ryan Graves was the first employee hired at ride-hailing service Uber in 2010.', 'He was CEO for a brief period in 2010, then president and most recently SVP of Global Operations, working as a "resident entrepreneur and builder."', 'He announced he was resigning from Uber in August 2017, two months after cofounder Travis Kalanick was forced to resign as CEO.', "Graves said he will remain on Uber's board of directors. "]
abouts: ['Graves got his job by tweeting at Uber cofounder Travis Kalanick: "here\'s a tip. email me :)" when Kalanick was looking for a product manager. ', 'Before Uber, Graves worked at GE and was an unpaid intern at Foursquare. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Gu Wei chairs Shenzhen MTC, an electronics design and manufacturing firm whose products are sold with the brand names of clients such as Philips.', 'Gu holds a MBA from Cheung Kong Graduate School of Business.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Alfredo Harp Helú made a fortune in finance, beginning with the cofounding of stock brokerage Acciones y Valores de Mexico, also known as Accival.', 'In 1991 Accival merged with Mexican bank Banamex to form Grupo Financiero Banamex-Accival (Banacci). Harp Helu became chairman of the group.', "Citigroup acquired Grupo Financiero Banamex-Accival for $12 billion in stock and cash in 2001, and Harp Helu joined Citigroup's board.", 'He has a minority stake in publicly-traded tile producer Internacional de Ceramica.', 'He owns two Mexican baseball teams, Los Diablos Rojos of Mexico City and Los Guerreros of Oaxaca.']
abouts: ['A baseball enthusiast, he published an autobiography in 2003 titled, "To Live and Die Playing Baseball."', 'He was kidnapped in 1994 for 106 days and released, reportedly after a payment of $30 million.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Gudrun Heine's father founded Storz GmbH & Co. KG in 1945 to manufacture ENT (Ear, Nose & Throat) instruments, headlamps and binocular loupes.", 'Karl Storz pioneered the idea of introducing into the body (via a flexible fiber-optic cable) bright light generated by an external source.', 'This "cold light illumination" innovation paved the way for modern endoscopy and laid the foundation for the company\'s future success.', 'Today, with a portfolio of 15,000+ products, Storz is a leader in endoscopy instruments for human and veterinary medicine as well as industrial use.']
abouts: ['Heine, who owns 44% of the company, serves as the president of the board of directors, while sister Sybill and nephew Karl-Christian manage day-to-day operations.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Francis Holder founded and runs Groupe Holder, a French baking conglomerate with annual revenues of $1 billion.', 'His Paul bakery-cafe chain operates 740 stores in 43 countries and its high-end macaron house Laduree has 85 shops in 50 countries. ', "His white-label firm Chateau Blanc sells more than 500 kinds of breads, pastries and macaron to more than 200 clients worldwide, including McDonald's.", "Chateau Blanc's factory in Lille, France makes more than 30,000 macaron shells an hour. ", "Holder took over his family's small bakery at 18 years old, after his father died of a heart attack at 51 years old. "]
abouts: ['Holder plans to create a baking museum in Paris with his collection of more than 18,000 paintings and books on the subject.', "Holder started apprenticing at his family's bakery at 15 years old after finishing middle school."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Hong Seok-joh heads Korea's largest convenience store company, BGF Retail.", 'Operating under the brand name CU, it has more than 8,000 stores and generated revenue of more than $30 billion. ', "His sister, Hong Ra-hee, is the wife of Samsung Group Chairman Lee Kun-hee, South Korea's richest person."]
abouts: ["The business got its start in 1989 via a franchise-licensing agreement between the Hong family's Bokwang Group and Japanese convenience store operator FamilyMart. ", "His late father was the chairman of JoongAng Ilbo, one of South Korea's largest newspapers. "]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Douglas Hsu chairs the Far Eastern Group, a conglomerate that his father started in 1940 as an underwear supplier.', 'The company moved to Taiwan in 1949 when it was split from the mainland by civil war.', "Far Eastern's businesses include Far EasTone Telecommunications, U-Ming Marine Transport, Everest Textile, Asia Cement and Oriental Union Chemical.", "Hsu, who obtained a bachelor's and masters degree at the University of Notre Dame, is an emeritus trustee. "]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Huang Jianrong made his fortune in minerals. He chairs Shanghai Haicheng Resources, which trades and invests in minerals.', 'He also chairs Tibet Summit Resources, a non-ferrous metals mining concern.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['B. Wayne Hughes Jr. was born into the self storage business; his father, B. Wayne Hughes, cofounded Public Storage in 1972.', 'Hughes Jr. worked at Public Storage for almost two decades, starting in 1983.', 'He was vice president of acquisitions from 1992 to 2002 and still serves on the board alongside his billionaire sister, Tamara Hughes Gustavson. ', 'In 2005 he launched American Commercial Equities, a real estate company that acquires and manages properties in Hawaii and California. ', 'With his wife, Wendy, he created the Cantinas Ranch Foundation in Malibu, a place for worship, leadership and the arts. ']
abouts: ['Hughes Jr. is the founder of Serving California, a nonprofit that helps military families, victims of crime and former inmates rebuild their lives.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Daisy Igel inherited a roughly 8% stake in Ultrapar, a Brazilian company engaged in fuel distribution and petrochemical production. ', "Ultrapar, also called Ultra, was founded by Daisy's late father, Ernesto Igel; its ADRs are listed on the New York Stock Exchange.", 'Over the past decade, Ultra has benefited from growing vehicle sales in Brazil. ', 'Daisy Igel, an architect who lives in Rio de Janeiro, is not involved in running Ultrapar. ']
abouts: ['Her son Fabio Igel was one of the owners of the San Francisco Deltas, a pro soccer team that won the North American Soccer League in 2017 and folded that same year.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Thomas James inherited and grew his fortune through financial services business Raymond James, which was started by his father, Robert, in 1962.', "He stepped down as Raymond James' chairman in 2017, having served for over 40 years. He was first made a board member at age 20.", 'He is a graduate of Harvard College and Harvard Business School.', 'He is an avid art collector. Part of his collection is on display at the James Museum of Western & Wildlife Art.']
abouts: ['James and his wife began collecting art while both were still students.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Jiang Ganjun co-founded and chairs Shenzhen-listed Suofeiya Home Collection, a custom-made furniture supplier.', 'It had 2,170 stores across China at the end of September 2017.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Jiang Zhaobai chairs Shanghai Pengxin Group, whose businesses include real estate, financial services and agribusiness.', 'Jiang graduated from Nanjing Institute of Architecture and Civil Engineering and the China Europe International Business School.\r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Jin Huiming chairs Shanghai-based Dahua Group, one of China's 50 largest developers.", "Dahua's predecessor company was a collective."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Ajay Kalsi is the chairman of London-listed Indus Gas, which owns natural gas blocks in Rajasthan in western India.', 'The company is planning an $85 million expansion to appraise and develop existing wells. ', "Kalsi's other interests span real estate, outsourcing and footwear. "]
abouts: ["He started out in the family's shoe business making sneakers for Reebok and still has a small stake in Reebok India.", 'He studied at the London School of Economics and Cambridge University.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Helga Kellerhals and her deceased husband Erich founded the electronics retailer Media-Saturn together with two business partners in 1979.\r\n', 'In 1988, the founders sold a 54% stake to department store chain Kaufhof, which later merged with retail giant Metro. ', 'Still holding close to 22% and maintaining veto rights, the Kellerhals family has sparred with Metro over the governance of the company.', 'In July 2017, Metro split off Media-Saturn -- which has over 1,000 stores in 15 countries -- into a separate listed company, Ceconomy.', 'Via the holding company Convergenta Invest und Beteiligungs GmbH, the Kellerhals family also invests in shopping malls and commercial real estate.']
abouts: ['The first business that Helga and Erich Kellerhals founded together, in 1963, was a shop for bikes, oil stoves, radios and TVs.', 'Helga Kellerhals is an admirer of classical music and is a regular at the annual Salzburg Festival.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['King Pak Fu leads Carnival Group International Holdings, the Chinese tourism-themed real estate developer.', 'King also controls Shanghai-listed Fujian Star Group.\r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Sergei Kolesnikov owns 50% of Technonicol, a global producer of roofing, waterproofing and thermal insulation materials.', 'He is president of Technonicol, which owns 52 companies and factories in seven countries in Europe and Asia.', 'Kolesnikov founded the company with his classmate Igor Rybakov in 1993. ']
abouts: ['Kolesnikov finances biathlon schools and built two biathlon stadiums. ', 'Together with colleagues from Technonicol, Kolesnikov participate in sailing competitions.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Veteran investment banker Hemendra Kothari chairs DSP BlackRock, which has $12.7 billion in assets under management. ', 'He has a 60% stake in the firm, which he founded a decade ago in partnership with BlackRock.', 'Kothari started his career with family firm D.S. Purbhoodas & Co before founding financial services firm DSP Financial Consultants in 1975. ', 'He partnered with Merrill Lynch in 1995 but sold his 57% stake in tranches between 2005 and 2009.']
abouts: ['A wildlife enthusiast, he founded the Wildlife Conservation Trust and has named meeting rooms at DSP BlackRock after tiger reserves.', 'His great-grandfather was one of the founders of the Bombay Stock Exchange.\r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Eiichi Kuriwada's father, Kiyoshi Sagawa, founded a package delivery firm in 1957; now called Sagawa Express, it is Japan's No. 2 parcel delivery.", 'Sagawa Express parent SG Holdings listed its shares on the Tokyo Stock Exchange in December 2017.', 'Kuriwada stepped down as president of SG Holdings in 2015 but remains chairman; he owns about 18% of the company.', 'In the early 1990s, Sagawa Express was the focus of a scandal; an executive was convicted of paying off politicians.', 'Sagawa, a billionaire in 1992, resigned that year; neither he nor Kuriwada were charged as part of the scandal. ']

name: Billionaires
title: Cofounder and CEO
bios: ['In 1984, Guy Laliberté cofounded Cirque du Soleil, which would become one of the biggest live entertainment groups in the world.', 'Laliberté started out as a street performer in Quebec, walking on stilts and breathing fire.', "His empire began with a show, funded by a $1 million contract from the Canadian government, put on for the 450th anniversary Canada's discovery. ", 'The celebration went global, and the shows have been performed for more than 180 million spectators across more than 400 cities on six continents. ', 'In 2015 he sold much of his 90% stake to U.S. private equity firm TPG Capital and Chinese investment group Fosun, keeping 10% of the company. ']
abouts: ['Guy Laliberté was the first private Canadian citizen to explore space as part of a 2009 mission to raise awareness on water issues facing humankind.', 'In 2007, Guy Laliberté founded One Drop, a foundation devoted to making clean and safe water accessible around the world.\r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Lee Hae-jin is a cofounder of Naver, South Korea's No. 1 search engine. ", "The company also boasts an instant messaging unit Line, Japan's top messaging app with 215 million global users.", "In February 2018, he stepped down from Naver's board but remains its global investment officer, focusing on the company's expansion. "]
abouts: ['He started Naver while working at Samsung SDS in the late 1990s. ', 'In July 2016 his messaging app, Line, went public and raised $1 billion during its dual listing in New York and Tokyo. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Michael Lee-Chin made a fortune investing in financial companies like National Commercial Bank Jamaica and AIC Limited.\r\n', 'The native of Jamaica acquired AIC in 1987, when it had less than $1 million in assets under management.', 'Under Lee-Chin, the Canada-based wealth management and mutual fund business managed more than $10 billion in assets by 2002. ', 'But the firm was hit hard by the 2008 recession, and Lee-Chin sold AIC to Canadian financial services group Manulife in 2009 for an undisclosed price.', 'He managed to hold onto a valuable 65% stake in National Commercial Bank Jamaica, which now makes up the majority of his wealth. ']
abouts: ['As a teenager, Lee-Chin worked landscaping at a hotel, then got a gig cleaning the engine room on the Jamaica Queen cruise ship.', "He also worked as a road engineer for the Jamaican government after studying civil engineering at Canada's McMaster University. "]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Li Guangyu chairs China Yuhua Education, whose private schools educate nearly 50,000 students in China.', 'Zhengzhou-headquartered Yuhua provides education from kindergarten to college at 16 campuses.', 'Li set up his first school in 2001 after operating a trading company.', 'Li graduated from the Changchun Institute of Optics and Fine Mechanics, majoring in laser technology, in 1983. \r\n', 'He holds an MBA from the Guanghua School of Management at Peking University.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Li Jun chairs Shenzhen-listed Leyard Optoelectronic, a maker of digital displays that he founded in 1995.', 'Li holds a doctorate in economics from Renmin University of China.', 'Li taught at the Central University of Finance & Economics from 1987-1991.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Li Rucheng chairs China's Youngor Group, which has branched out from garments into real estate and finance.", 'Li was assigned to work in a collective factory in Ningbo in 1980 and became factory chief in 1982. Youngor Group grew out of that business.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Li Xuhui was a director and vice president of Foshan Haitian Flavouring and Food before she left in 2016.', "Li managed Haitian's oyster sauce factory in 1999-2010.", 'Pang Kang and Cheng Xue, chairman and vice chairman of Haitian, are also billionaires.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Lim Wee Chai started Top Glove with his wife in 1991 and took the company public in 2001.', 'Top Glove controls 25% of the world market for rubber gloves.', 'Lim, whose parents are rubber plantation owners and traders, also holds a 10% stake in property developer Tropicana and sits on its board. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Liu Jiang controls Shanghai-listing Guizhou Gas Group, a natural gas distributor. ', 'Liu holds an undergraduate degree from East China Jiaotong University with a major in economics.', "He's also the president of Hevol Real Estate, a real estate concern, and the chairman of Guizhou Chamber of Commerce in Beijing. ", "He worked in China's Railway Ministry early in his career. "]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Liu Xuejing chairs privately held GMK Holding, which has two core businesses: chicken processing and copper smeltering.\r\n', "GMK supplies chicken to KFC and McDonald's in China and Southeast Asia.", "Liu's son Liu Zhiguang is GMK's CEO."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Liu Zhenguo is the vice chairman of Beijing Originwater Technology, a sewage treatment company listed on the Shenzhen Stock Exchange.  \r\n', 'Originwater has thrived on the surge of spending on infrastructure, urbanization and increasingly stringent environmental rules in China.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Lo Ka Shui chairs Great Eagle and also controls a commercial property REIT, Champion, and a hotel REIT, Langham Hospitality Investments.', "The group's luxury hotel chain, under the Langham and Langham Place brands, boasts more than 20 locations worldwide.", 'Elder daughter Katherine Lo works for the group in the U.S.; elder son Alexander Lo in Hong Kong.', 'He is supported by his brother Vincent Lo, also a billionaire, against their mother, Lo To Lee Kwan, in a family feud over their trust.']
abouts: ['In 1983 Lo was practicing as a cardiologist in the U.S. when his father called him back to help with the family business.']

name: Billionaires
title: Entrepreneur
bios: ['Property tycoon Lo Siu-tong founded Yu Tai Hing Co. in 1966. ', 'He started out redeveloping old buildings and today his company owns an array of offices, residences and shops.', "Its developments include the prime 100 Queen's Road Central office building in Hong Kong. ", 'Lo also owns a chain of 10 budget hotels under the Bridal Tea House brand. ', 'His youngest son, Dennis Law, runs the company and is also a movie scriptwriter, producer and director. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Tobi Lutke founded and runs Shopify, a Canadian ecommerce firm that helps companies set up and run online stores.', 'Lutke grew up in Germany, where he learned to code by age 12 and left school at 16 to enter a computer programming apprenticeship.', 'He moved to Canada in 2003 after meeting his now-wife, an Ottawa native, on a snowboarding trip to Whistler.', "He began working on an ecommerce platform after he and a friend tried to open an online snowboard shop but couldn't find decent software.", 'They soon realized their software would make a good product to sell, so they raised about $200,000 from friends and family to launch Shopify.']
abouts: ['Lutke owns a Tesla but often rides his bike to the office.', "Lutke's wife owns and operates the small, historic Opinicon resort in Ontario."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Ma Yunsheng chairs Chambroad Holding, a supplier of petrochemicals, fine chemicals and agribusiness products.', 'Ma worked as a government official before he joined Chambroad in 1982 when it was a collective.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Ziyavudin Magomedov is chairman of Summa Group, a conglomerate with interests in port logistics, engineering, construction, telecom, oil and gas.', 'He founded the company with his older brother and junior partner, Magomed Magomedov, a former member of the Federation Council.', 'Magomedeov and his brother were arrested in March 2018 for embezzling money from the state; he denies the charges. They remain in prison.']
abouts: ['Magomedov, sits on the board of Hyperloop One, in which he is an investor.   ', 'Magomedov owns 51% of the fight promotoer, Mixed Martial Arts (MMA) Fight Nights.']

name: Billionaires
title: Investor
bios: ["Ana Maria Marcondes Penido Sant'Anna is vice president of the board of directors of CCR, a Brazilian toll road builder and operator.", "CCR was founded by her late father Pelerson Soares Penido, and became one of Latin America's largest infrastructure concession companies.", 'CCR also owns a stake in STP, an electronic payment system for toll operators similar to E-Z Pass in the United States.', "The company trades on Brazil's Bovespa exchange; she owns about 10% of the shares. "]
abouts: ["The low profile billionaire lives in Sao Paulo, Brazil's largest city, and is a member of the board of ITACI, the Child Cancer Treatment Institute."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['A dual-UK Canadian citizen, Terence (Terry) Matthews made his fortune with telecom firms Mitel and Newbridge Networks.', 'Hit hard by the telecom bust, he fell out of the Forbes Billionaires ranks for more than a decade.', 'A resident of Canada, he owns many UK properties, including Celtic Manor Resort, which hosted the 2010 Ryder Cup. \r\n']
abouts: ['Matthews was knighted by Queen Elizabeth in 2001; the honor created a diplomatic incident in Canada, which does not allow its citizens to accept foreign titles.', 'Matthews is a backer of a tidal lagoon project at Swansea Bay in Wales, which will produce clean energy as water levels fluctuate.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Gail Miller and husband Larry (d. 2009) turned a single Toyota dealership into a $4.7 billion (estimated 2017 sales) operation with 64 dealerships.', 'Gail serves as owner and chairman of the board of the Larry H. Miller Management Corporation.', 'The Millers purchased the Utah Jazz NBA team in 1986 for $22 million; the team is now worth $1.2 billion, according to Forbes.', 'In early 2017, Miller transferred ownership of the Utah Jazz basketball team to a family legacy trust to deter her heirs from selling or moving it. ', 'In April 2018, she published the book "Courage To Be You: Inspiring Lessons From An Unexpected Journey."  ']
abouts: ['In 2012, Gail Miller married Salt Lake City attorney Kim Wilson. Together, they have 9 children, 30 grandchildren and a growing number of great-grandchildren.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Andrey Molchanov owns a controlling stake in LSR Group, the biggest producer of construction materials (sand, brick, broken stone) in Russia. ', 'LSR is also one of the leading real estate developers, with 3.8 million square meters of space under construction.', 'Molchanov is a native of St. Petersburg, where his stepfather worked as vice governor for 10 years.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Ni Zhaoxing chairs Zhongrong International Holdings Group, a private company active in real estate, energy and art.', "Ni bought cheaply into Shanghai's Pudong district in the 1990s and built office towers there.", "He is currently focused on promoting Chang'an No. 1, which boasts 78 European-style villas in a western Beijing mountain landscape."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Kentaro Ogawa founded fast-food outfit Zensho in 1982. ', 'Publicly-traded Zensho has a network of more than 4,800 restaurants. ', 'Its Sukiya chain serves shredded beef over rice (called gyudon or a beef bowl) at 1,970 locations across Japan. ', 'Ogawa wants to turn Zensho into the world\'s number one food company so that it "can help eradicate hunger and poverty from the world." ']
abouts: ['Ogawa is a former shipyard worker and labor union activist in Japan.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['In 1957, Erik Paulsson, then 17, and his brother Mats founded a company in the south of Sweden to service the local farmers with garbage collection.', "The company, later named PEAB, expanded to construction in 1970, the industry it's known for today.", 'PEAB, which has estimated revenues of $5 billion, has more than 14,000 employees.', 'While Mats and his family still control the company, Erik has divested into spin-offs of several PEAB property management entities.', 'His most valuable holdings are Fabage, Catena and Wihlborgs Fastigheter, all real estate companies traded on the Stockholm stock exchange.']
abouts: ['In deciding who would get what in the division of PEAB, the brothers reportedly flipped a coin.', "Paulsson was charged for bribery after winning the contract to build Sweden's new 65,000 seat national soccer arena in 2011. The court later cleared him of charges."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Peng Hao chairs Shenzhen Sunway Communication, a maker of telecommunication parts.', 'Sunway listed at the Shenzhen Stock Exchange in 2010.', 'Peng founded Sunway in his dorm in Shajin Changxing Industrial Park in Shenzhen.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Stefan Pierer is the CEO of $1.8 billion (sales) KTM Industries AG, one of the leading motorcycle manufacturers based in Austria.', 'Pierer founded Cross holding group (now KTM Industries) in 1987 and is still its majority shareholder.', 'Pierer is also a member of the Supervisory Board of auto parts company SHW AG.', 'He began his career as a sales assistant at heating and air conditioning maker Hoval.']
abouts: ["For the 17th year in a row, a motorcycle made by Pierer's KTM won its category at the Dakar Rally, one of the most popular motorsport events in the world."]

name: Billionaires
title: President
bios: ['Michael Price runs MFP Investors, a New York-based hedge fund with over $1 billion in assets.', 'Price began his career in finance as a research assistant at Heine Securities in 1975 and bought the company after Michael Heine died in 1988. ', "Price increased the value of the firm's assets under management to $17 billion before selling it to Franklin Securities for $670 million in 1996.", 'After the sale, Price stayed on at Franklin Securities as chairman and to manage the mutual funds. He left in 2001.', 'In 1997, he donated $18 million to his alma mater, the University of Oklahoma, which renamed the business school after him.']
abouts: ['In 2001, Price donated $25 million to Yeshiva University to fund the 223,000-square-foot Michael F. Price Center for Genetic and Translational Medicine. ']

name: Billionaires
title: Chairman and CEO
employment: {'name': 'Paramount Resources Ltd.', 'title': 'Chairman and CEO', 'totalEarningEst': False, 'salaryEst': False, 'government': False}
bios: ['Canadian oil baron Clayton Riddell has built an energy empire over the past five decades.', 'The son of a mailman, he spent a decade working for Chevron as a geologist before striking out on his own in the late 1960s.', 'In 1974 he launched Paramount Resources, starting with near-barren natural gas wells and growing the business into a major driller.', 'He was CEO of Paramount, which remains his largest holding, until 2015, when he handed the reins to his son, Jim.', 'Riddell holds stakes in a number of publicly-traded Canadian energy firms, many of which he has spun out of Paramount.']
abouts: ["Riddell is a part-owner of the the NHL's Calgary Flames."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Boris Rotenberg and his older brother, Arkady, are co-owners of SMP Bank.', 'The Rotenberg brothers were hit by U.S. sanctions and had assets frozen in 2014 because of their close ties to President Vladimir Putin.  ', 'The U.S. Treasury claimed that Putin had awarded the Rotenbergs billions of dollars in contracts with Gazprom and for the Sochi Olympics.']
abouts: ['Unlike Arkady, Boris was not subject to European Union sanctions because he has Finnish citizenship. \r\n', 'Boris is vice president of the Russian Judo Federation. He sponsors the SMP Racing Project, which supports young Russian drivers.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Igor Rybakov owns 50% of Technonicol, a global producer of roofing, waterproofing and thermal insulation materials.', 'Technonicol owns 52 companies and factories in seven countries in Europe and Asia.', ' With classmate Sergei Kolesnikov, Rybakov founded Technonicol at age 20 in 1993.', 'He ran the company until 2015. Two years later, he cofounded a $100 million venture capital fund to invest in IT-platforms globally.']
abouts: ['Rybakov and his wife Ekaterina started a foundation in 2015 that sets up programs to support young talents in the field of economics and innovation. ', 'Rybakov got his start selling ice-cream near one of the Moscow railway stations.\r\n ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Stephen Saad founded South Africa's largest pharmaceuticals maker, Aspen Pharmacare, in 1997.", 'Traded on the Johannesburg Stock Exchange, Aspen Pharmacare markets generic medicines in 150 countries.', "Saad is the chief executive and head of Aspen's board.", 'He became a millionaire at age 29 when he sold his share in the drug business Covan Zurich for $3 million.', 'In October 2016, Saad won the Entrepreneur of the Year award at the All Africa Business Leaders Awards gala.']
abouts: ['In 2012, Saad became chairman of The Sharks, a Durban rugby team.', 'He spends his free time at Exeter, his private game reserve at Sabi Sands, which is adjacent to Kruger National Park, the largest national park in South Africa.']

name: Billionaires
title: Entrepreneur
bios: ['K. Rai Sahi oversees a $22 billion real estate portfolio as CEO and chairman of Morguard Corp.', "His firm's 208 commercial, residential and hotel properties extend from Alberta, Canada to Illinois.", 'Sahi also heads TWC Enterprises, the largest golf club owner and operator in Canada.', "Since the housing crisis brought down Morguard's share price in early 2009, the firm's stock price has soared over 1,000%. "]
abouts: ['Sahi was born in Pakistan before India was partitioned into two countries, and his family fled to India after the split.  ', 'He immigrated to Canada in the 1970s and reportedly unloaded boxcars and sold insurance door-to-door before getting certified as an accountant. \r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Airat Shaimiev is co-owner of the TAIF Group, a large regional holding company with assets in the Republic of Tatarstan. ', 'The TAIF Group includes oil refineries, chemical factories, power plants and construction companies. ', 'Shaimiev is also CEO of Tatautodor, the government owned group that does road construction and repair in Tatarstan.']
abouts: ["Airat's father, Mintimer Shaimiev, was Tatarstan's first president; his brother, Radik is also a billionaire.", "Airat, his brother Radik and Airat's son Timur together own a small oil company, MNKT, in Tatarstan."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Radik Shaimiev is a co-owner of the TAIF Group, a large regional holding company with assets in the Republic of Tatarstan.', "TAIF became a shareholder in most of its companies during Russia's privatization in the mid '90s.", "Radik's father, Mintimer Shaimiev, was Tatarstan's first president and his brother, Airat Shaimiev, is a fellow billionaire."]
abouts: ['He is president of football club Rubin Kazan. In 2008 and 2009 Rubin Kazan won Russian Football Premier League.', 'An avid race car driver, he won a European competition called Autocross in 2003.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Shang Jiyong is the chairman of China Wanda Group, whose business interests include tires, chemicals, electronics and real estate.', 'China Wanda (no relation to the Wanda Group controlled by fellow billionaire Wang Jianlin) employs 13,000 people.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Mikhail Shelkov is the former head of the investment division of state-owned Rostec, which controlled military contractors in Russia.', "Shelkov's former boss Sergey Chemezov, CEO of Rostec, is a member of Putin's inner circle, befriending Russia's president in Germany in the 1980s. ", 'From 2012 to 2014, Shelkov and partners bought a controlling stake in VSMPO-AVISMA Corporation from Rostec and Gazprombank.', "VSMPO-AVISMA is the world's largest titanium producer for the aerospace industry, with such customers as Boeing, Airbus, Rolls-Royce and Embraer. \r\n"]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['One of 5 Infosys cofounders on the Forbes Billionaires list, S.D. Shibulal oversees his family office, Innovations Investment Management.', "While he stepped down as the company's CEO in 2014, he continues to hold a small stake in the firm. \r\n", 'Shibulal cofounded business incubator Axilor Ventures together with former Infosys colleague Senapathy Gopalakrishnan. \r\n', 'He also chairs The Tamara, a boutique resort chain that his daughter Shruti founded and runs.']
abouts: ['Along with wife, Kumari, he donates regularly to various causes through 2 family foundations.', 'From 1991 to 1996, Shibu worked with Sun Microsystems in the US.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Ron Sim is the founder of OSIM International, maker of high-end massage chairs.', 'He took the company private in 2016 when its shares had dropped steeply from their 2014 high.', 'He created V3 Group, which houses OSIM and TWG Tea, among much else, and is awaiting its Hong Kong listing.', 'Sim also owns a sizeable property portfolio that includes a stake in listed Perennial Real Estate Holdings.']
abouts: ['At age 20, he started a company that sold knife sharpeners and other household goods. ', 'Sim has founded R3 Asset Management to back fast-growing companies.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Leonid Simanovsky holds just under 2% in the gas company Novatek. ', "He met fellow billionaire Leonid Mikhelson, his partner in Novatek, in the late 1980s, when he worked at Mikhelson's construction company. ", "Since 2003 Simanovsky has been a State Duma deputy and a deputy chairman of the Duma's budget and tax committee. \r\n"]
abouts: ['Simanovsky began his career as a fitter in a factory producing space rocket technology. ', "Simanovsky worked for Mikhail Khodorkovsky's Yukos many years ago. "]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Basudeo Singh is the executive chairman of Indian generics firm Alkem Laboratories.', "His son Dhananjay Kumar Singh, Alkem's joint managing director,  has been named to succeed him as executive chairman.\r\n", "Basudeo Singh is the cousin of Alkem's billionaire founder Samprada Singh."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Chairman emeritus of Alkem Laboratories, Samprada Singh founded the pharma firm 45 years ago.', "Farmer's son, Singh worked in a chemist's store before venturing out on his own distributing pharmaceuticals.", 'Shares of the generics maker, known for its antibiotics Clavam and Taxim, have more than doubled since its November 2016 IPO.', 'For the year ended March 2017, Alkem reported a 20% rise in net earnings to $139 million on revenues of $913 million.']
abouts: ["Singh's cousin Basudeo Narain Singh, who runs Alkem as its executive chairman, is also a billionaire.", 'Alkem\'s office in Mumbai has framed photos of Singh with the quote "Yet miles to go. Yet a lot to be done."\r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Terry Snow is the executive chairman of Capital Airport Group, which operates Canberra Airport.', "He became a billionaire for the first time in 2017, thanks to a bumper increase in the value of his property around the capital city's main airport.", 'Snow worked as a property developer in the 1980s with his father, Bob, and brother George. ', 'After the family business was sold he used his share of the proceeds to buy the 99-year lease on Canberra Airport, paying just $40 million in 1998. ', 'He embarked on a $310 million revamp of the terminal, which offered new services for international flights. ']
abouts: ['Snow is a keen yachtsman and owns an $80 million stud farm. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Lynsi Snyder is the heir to beloved West Coast chain In-N-Out Burger, which her grandparents founded in 1948.', 'She became a billionaire in 2017 on her 35th birthday, when she received the final portion of her inheritance.', "Snyder's uncle and father, both previous In-N-Out presidents, died young; by 2000, Snyder, then just 18, was the last family heir. ", 'She steadily received stakes in the business for a decade as part of a complex trust created by her grandparents.', 'Snyder took on the top job of president in 2010 and has since expanded the number of In-N-Out locations by more than 80 locations.']
abouts: ['A devout Christian, Snyder sports three bible verse tattoos.', 'Snyder has competitively drag raced most of her life and was once married to a race car driver. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Sybill Storz's father founded founded Storz GmbH & Co. KG in 1945 to manufacture ENT (Ear, Nose & Throat) instruments, headlamps and binocular loupes.", 'Karl Storz pioneered the idea of introducing into the body (via a flexible fiber-optic cable) bright light generated by an external source.', 'This "cold light illumination" innovation paved the way for modern endoscopy and laid the foundation for the company\'s future success.', 'Today, with a portfolio of 15,000+ products, Storz is a leader in endoscopy instruments for human and veterinary medicine as well as industrial use.']
abouts: ['Sybill, who owns 44% of the company, serves as managing director, while her sister, Gudrun Heine, also a billionaire, is president of the board of directors.', "Sybill's son Karl-Christian is a board member. "]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['With Johannes Ferdinand Katuari, Harjo Sutanto got his start selling soap door-to-door over 60 years ago in East Java. ', "Today Wings is one of Indonesia's largest makers of soap and other household goods like toilet cleaner, laundry detergent and sanitary napkins.", "Katuari's son Eddy took over household goods maker Wings in 2004, after his father's death.", 'Its Mie Sedaap is a well-known maker of noodles, sold in dozens of countries.   \r\n', 'It also has the franchise for Japanese retailer FamilyMart.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Yoshikazu Tanaka's company Gree develops free-to-play mobile and social-network-based games. ", 'He founded the company in 2004 and took it public in 2008.', "Tanaka, the company's president and chairman, owns a 46% stake."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Mehmet Sinan Tara is chairman of one of Turkey's largest construction and energy companies, ENKA. It was cofounded by his father, Sarik Tara, in 1957.", "Turkey's leading private electricity producer, ENKA also operates in real estate, tourism, transport and trade (construction equipment and machinery).", 'In Moscow, ENKA owns a hotel, shopping malls and approximately 370,000 square meters of net rentable Class A office space.', "Sarik Tara's brother-in-law Sadi Gulcelik, with whom he founded ENKA, died in a plane accident in Saudi Arabia in 1980.", 'Sinan Tara took over management of ENKA in 1984 when he was only 26 years old. His son Agah Mehmet Tara became CEO in 2012, at age 29.']
abouts: ["36% ($887 million) of ENKA's revenue during the first nine months of 2017 came from the construction of U.S. embassy buildings in various countries."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Electrical engineer Rit Thirakomen chairs Bangkok-listed MK Restaurant Group known for its value-for-money 'sukiyaki' restaurants.", 'The restaurant chain was founded by his late mother-in-law as a small Thai eatery in 1962.', 'After co-founding a book publishing business in 1974, he took to the restaurant trade in 1987, expanding into sukiyaki with wife Yupin. ', 'Today, MK has more than 600 restaurants, including Japanese food chain Yayoi.']
abouts: ['At MK Suki Restaurants customers cook their own food in a hotpot at their table.\r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Tian Ming chairs Hefei Meiya Optoelectronic Technology, a supplier of detection equipment. \r\n', "Tian made his fortune initially from optical sorters for grains and tea leaves, profiting from China's agricultural boom."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Ion Tiriac owns a minority stake in Romanian insurance company Allianz-Tiriac.', 'The tycoon has also invested in real estate, auto dealerships and petroleum distribution.', 'His museum in Romania showcases his high-end cars, including Jaguars, Rolls Royces and Ferraris.']
abouts: ['Tiriac competed in the 1960 Olympics as an ice hockey player.', 'A former tennis player, Tiriac has managed Boris Becker, Steffi Graf and Goran Ivanisevic and owns the Madrid Open.', 'Tiriac is reportedly spending $4 million to construct an Olympic ice rink near Bucharest.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Real estate investor Ivar Tollefsen started his first company at age 14, Tollefsen Enterprises, which rented out DJ-services and event equipment.', 'With the earnings from his disco business he began building a real estate empire, now called Fredensborg AS.', 'Fredensborg owns 27,000 apartments across Scandinavia and, in 2017, bought an Oslo building that used to house the U.S. embassy.', 'Tollefsen has led several polar expeditions and has competed in the Dakar Rally.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Mustafa Latif Topbas is CEO and cofounder of BIM, Turkey's largest chain of discount stores. He owns almost 15% of its shares.", 'After BIM went public in 2005, Topbas owned around 26%.', 'At the end of the third quarter 2017, BIM had 6,000 stores in Turkey, 374 in Morocco\r\nand 261 in Egypt.', 'The company, with annual revenues exceeding $5 billion, offers a popular mobile telecom service under the brand name Bimcell.']
abouts: ["Topbas, who doesn't give interviews, has a longstanding friendship with Turkey's president, Recep Tayyip Erdogan, and his family.", 'His daughter Fatma is married to Ali Ulker, nephew of food billionaire Murat Ulker. (The families also have business ties through their companies.)']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Former film financier and founder of production company Legendary Entertainment, Thomas Tull's biggest hits came from backing blockbusters. ", "In January 2015, Tull inked a deal with Chinese billionaire Wang Jianlin's Wanda Group to buy Legendary for up to $3.5 billion in cash, stock and debt.", 'Tull stepped down as CEO of Legendary in January 2016 to concentrate on his Tull Investment Group which has invested in the likes of Magic Leap. ', 'His new investment holding company, Tulco, includes a medical apparel startup, plus stakes in a data consultancy and waste management business.', 'A sports fan, Tull owns a valuable minority stake in the Pittsburgh Steelers and a collection of baseball memorabilia.']
abouts: ['Tull was born to a single mother in Binghamton, New York and grew up poor. ', 'After attending Hamilton College on a football scholarship he started a chain of laundries.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['John Van Lieshout founded and made his fortune from the Super A-Mart furniture chain. He sold it in 2006 but retained the freehold to some stores.', 'His wealth is now underpinned by a large property portfolio that includes shopping malls and offices.', 'He also owns the Unison Projects Group, which has property interests in tourism, residential, industrial and commercial assets. ', 'He arrived in Australia in 1960 with his parents and 12 siblings, emigrating from the Netherlands.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Wang Han's wealth mainly comes from shares in Juneyao Air that he inherited from his deceased father Wang Junyao, the founder of Juneyao Group.", 'Juneyao also has business interests in retailing, education and food. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Wang Junjin chairs Juneyao Group, which controls Shanghai-listed Juneyao Airlines.', 'Wang holds an EMBA from Cheung Kong Graduate School of Business.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Wang Wenbiao chairs Elion Resources Group, a clean energy firm established in 1988.', "Elion's core businesses are Elion Ecological, Elion Clean Energy and Elion Green Finance."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Alfred West runs SEI, the $1.4 billion (revenue) financial services firm he founded in 1968.', 'SEI, which stands for Simulated Environments Inc., first developed a computer program to train loan officers by simulating a lending environment.', 'West took SEI public in 1981 and branched out into investment advisory and money management.']
abouts: ['West dreamed of becoming a fighter pilot when he was younger and studied aerospace engineering at Georgia Tech.', "He didn't qualify to fly due to poor eyesight, so he got an MBA at Wharton instead and then launched SEI."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Wu Daohong leads energy solutions provider Beijing Shenwu Environment.', 'Shenwu has two listed businesses: Shenwu Environmental and Shenwu Energy Saving.']

name: Billionaires
title: Entrepreneur
bios: ['Wu Yiling chairs Yiling Pharmaceutical, a supplier of drugs to combat heart diseases and the flu.\r\n', 'Wu, whose father was a doctor, practiced Chinese medicine for 11 years himself before he founded Yiling Pharmaceutical in 1992. \r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Xiu Laigui's privately owned Xiuzheng Pharmaceuticals is one of China's largest pharmaceutical firms. \r\n", 'Xiu in the early 1990s worked as a policeman in China. \r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Xu Xiong owns 53% of the Eastern Driving School, a Beijing-headquartered business that teaches the growing number of Chinese car owners to drive.', 'Before strapping his future to the auto business, Xu worked as a manager of a hotel supply center. \r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Xu Xudong chairs Ningbo Xusheng Auto Technology.', 'Xusheng is a supplier of gear boxes and battery protection shells to Tesla. ', 'Other customers include Chrysler, Mahler and Bosch.', "More than  50% of the company's revenue came from Tesla in 2015-2016."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Xue Hua is cofounder and chairman of Guangdong Haid Group, a supplier of animal feed and seedings. ', 'Haid employs 20,000 people.', 'Xue graduated from Huazhong Agricultural University with a major in aquaculture in 1992.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Vadim Yakunin founded Protek Center of Implementation in 1990.', 'Yakunin, who got his start importing computers and writing software, also worked in the tourist business in Hungary.', 'While in Hungary, he met reps from a large pharmaceutical firm and decided to start importing drugs. ', 'Later he founded the Rigla chain of drug stores, built a pharmaceutical factory and logistics center near Moscow.', 'Protek, which went public in 2010 and now has $4 billion in revenues, is one of the biggest drug distributors in Russia.\r\n']
abouts: ['Sister Yuliya Yakunina is economic director of Protek and a member of the Protek Board of directors since 2002.', 'Yakunin graduated from the Moscow Physical and Technical Institute (MIPT) as engineer-physicist. He holds a degree as a Doctor of Technical Sciences.\r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Yan Yude is a director of Virscend Education, a provider of K-12 private education services in China.', 'Yan obtained a certificate for postgraduate studies in criminology from the Sichuan University in July 1999.', "Yan's wife Wang Xiaoying chairs Virscend Education."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Yang Keng chairs Shanghai-listed Sichuan Languang Development, one of the largest real estate companies in western China.\r\n', 'Yang started an auto parts company in 1989 before he entered the real estate business in 1993.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Yang Shaopeng chairs SITC International Holdings, a shipping and logistics concern. ', 'Yang graduated from Asia International Open University (Macau) and studied at the China Europe International Business School in 2004.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Zhang Cheng Fei is the deputy CEO of Nine Dragons Paper of China, one of Asia's largest paper and packaging companies.", "Zhang's sister Cheung Yan, the chairlady of Nine Dragons, is also a billionaire.", "Zhang's brother-in-law Liu Ming Chung, the CEO of Nine Dragons, is also one of three billionaires in the family."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Zhang Jingzhang chairs two companies: Shanghai-listed Ningbo Haitian Precision Machinery and Hong Kong-listed Haitian International Holding.', 'Haitian International Holdings designs and manufactures plastic injection molding machines and related parts. ', 'Ningbo Haitian Precision Machinery is a maker of machining centers.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Zhang Keqiang is one of the biggest shareholders of Poly Real Estate Group,  one of China's largest real estate developers. ", 'He also owns a stake in Qinghai Salt Lake Industry Group, a potash producer.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Zhang Xuanning is the vice chairman of Yonghui Superstores, a fresh foods retailer.', 'His brother Zhang Xuansong is a Yonghui co-founder and also a billionaire. ', 'Yonghui in late 2017 said China Internet giant Tencent would purchase 5% of Yonghui from Zhang Xuansong and Zhang Xuanning for $648.6 million.', "In Jan. 2018, Yonghui bought 12% of convenience store chain Chengdu Hongqi Chain; fellow billionaire Liu Qiangdong's JD.com owns 5% of Yonghui."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Zhang Zhangsun is the chairman of Guorui Properties, a Beijing-headquartered real estate developer. \r\n', 'Before founding Guorui, Zhang worked in a government commodities bureau in the southern Chinese city of Shantou.', 'Guorui debuted on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange in July 2014.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Zhou Bajin and his daughter Zhou Xiaoping control Changzhou Xingyu Automotive Light Systems, a supplier of automotive lighting systems.', "Xingyu's customers include BMW.", "Daughter Xiaoping is Xingyu's chairman."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Zhou Wenyu chairs Wenyi Group, headquartered in Hefei, the provincial capital of Anhui Province.', "Wenyi Group's revenue in 2016 neared $4 billion, according to a company financial statement."]

name: Billionaires
title: Founder, CEO
employment: {'name': 'Pershing Square Capital Management, L.P.', 'title': 'Founder, CEO', 'government': False, 'employees': 47, 'employeesYear': 2012}
bios: ['Bill Ackman founded and runs Pershing Square Capital Management.', "Mired in one of Wall Street's most brutal slumps, the $8.8 billion hedge fund has underperformed the S&P 500 by 20% for three straight years.", 'Ackman created Pershing Square in 2004 and rose to fame for his short of bond insurer MBIA and his rescue of mall operator General Growth.', 'Coming out of the crisis, he at times topped Wall Street with activist wins on Canadian Pacific, Fortune Brands and Allergan.', 'His orchestration of a merger between Valeant Pharmaceuticals of Allergan drew allegations of insider trading (and a $290 million settlement in 2017).']
abouts: ['Ackman is an avid tennis player. ', "Ackman's Pershing Square Foundation has committed some $400 million to causes like the Innocence Project, Human Rights Watch and Teach For America."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Soegiarto Adikoesoemo founded AKR Corporindo as chemicals trader in 1960 and listed it on the Indonesian Stock Exchange in 1994.', 'AKR Corporindo is now engaged in petroleum trading and distribution, logistics services and chemical manufacturing.', 'In November 2016, AKR Corporindo and British oil and gas firm BP announced plans to launch an aviation fuel joint venture.']
abouts: ['His son Haryanto Adikoesoemo started collecting art over 25 years ago and has accumulated 800 pieces, including works by Andy Warhol and Mark Rothko.', 'Haryanto opened a museum dedicated entirely to modern and contemporary art, Museum\r\nMACAN, in early November.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["One of Turkey's largest real estate developers, Ali Ibrahim Agaoglu rode a boom in the Turkish construction sector after the 2008 financial crisis.", 'Over the last decade or so, Agaoglu-branded projects have resulted in more than 30,000 new housing, office and commercial units.', "Agaoglu Construction has become active in renewable energy, building wind power plants with turbines sourced from Germany's Nordex.", 'Agaoglu has announced plans to invest more than $1 billion in energy by 2020.', "He owns valuable land in Turkey's most important tourism region, Milas (at the crossroads of the Mediterranean and Aegean Sea)."]
abouts: ['In Turkey, he is called the "Turkish Trump." ', 'He has a passion for luxury cars.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Hamdi Akin owns Afken Holding, a conglomerate with investments in airports, energy, tourism and infrastructure.', "During college, he produced heating boilers and water and fuel tanks in his father's workshop. After graduating, he founded Akfen as a contractor.", 'Winning tenders for operating the Istanbul Ataturk Airport and Ankara Esenboga Airport led him to establish TAV Airports Holding.', 'In 2012, he sold 38% of TAV to Aeroports de Paris Group for $874 million. In 2017, he sold his remaining 8% to Aeroports de Paris for $160 million.', 'Now Afken is mainly focused on renewable energy, building hospitals and developing and renting apartments to students.']
abouts: ["Akin's daughter Pelin Akin and son Selim Akin serve on the board of Akfen Holding.", 'In December 2015, he donated six flats he owned in a compound in Istanbul Beylikduzu to Syrian refugees.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Pharma tycoon Chirayu Amin's Alembic Pharmaceuticals is one of India's oldest pharma companies.", "Alembic was founded by Amin's grandfather in 1907 to make tincture and alcohol. \r\n", 'Today, Alembic gets half of its $470 million revenue from the domestic market selling generic drugs, including popular cough syrup Glycodin. ', 'While Amin is chairman and chief executive, his 3 sons work in different parts of the business.']
abouts: ['Amin is the brother-in-law of consumer goods billionaire Harsh Mariwala.', 'Amin was head of the Indian Premier League for 17 months after its founder Lalit Modi was sacked in 2010. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Mehmet Ali Aydinlar leads Turkey's largest chain of private hospitals, the Acibadem Healthcare Group.", 'He build the company after starting out as a consultant in the same field, took it public in 2000, and brought in a partner, Abraaj Capital, in 2008. ', "The company was delisted in 2012, after Aydinlar struck a deal with Malaysia's sovereign wealth fund and Kuala Lumpur-based IHH Healthcare Berhad.", 'Aydinlar exchanged Acibadem shares for cash and stock in IHH; he now owns 25% of Acibadem Holding and 3.5% of IHH.', 'Acibadem has been expanding into the Netherlands, Bulgaria, Macedonia, Serbia and Iraq.']
abouts: ['Aydinlar has been buying real estate since his days as a consultant for hire.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Emanuella Barilla is a fourth-generation heir to the Barilla pasta fortune, which she shares with her three billionaire brothers. ', 'Emanuella currently serves as a director of Barilla Holdings. ', 'Barilla is the largest pasta company in the world with an estimated $4 billion in annual revenue. ', 'Barilla has grown by acquiring companies in France, Turkey and Greece and has two pasta plants in the U.S.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Guido Barilla is the chairman of Barilla, and the fourth-generation heir to the pasta fortune that he shares with his three billionaire siblings. ', 'Barilla is the largest pasta company in the world with an estimated $4 billion in annual revenue. ', 'Barilla has grown by acquiring companies in France, Turkey and Greece; it also has two pasta plants in the U.S.', 'The business was founded in 1877 in Parma, Italy.', "The family sold out to American firm W.R. Grace in 1971 but Pietro Barilla, Guido's father, bought it back eight years later."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Luca Barilla is a fourth-generation heir to the Barilla pasta fortune, which he shares with his three billionaire brothers. ', 'Luca currently serves as the chairman of Barilla Holdings. ', 'Barilla is the largest pasta company in the world with an estimated $4 billion in annual revenue. ', 'Barilla has grown by acquiring companies in France, Turkey and Greece and has two pasta plants in the U.S.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Paolo Barilla is a fourth-generation heir to the Barilla pasta fortune, which he shares with his three billionaire siblings. ', 'He currently serves as vice chairman of Barilla Holdings. ', 'Barilla is the largest pasta company in the world with an estimated $4 billion in annual revenue. ', 'Barilla has grown by acquiring companies in France, Turkey and Greece and has two pasta plants in the U.S.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Mehmet Rustu Basaran heads a conglomerate that got its start producing industrial and medical gases and later diversified into iron and steel.', 'Founded in 1956 by his father, Hamdi, in Istanbul, it was originally known as Hamdi Basaran Topkapi Oxygen Plant.', 'Today, the group is known as Habas (short for Habas Industrial and Medical Gases Production).', 'Besides being a major steel producer, Habas is active in Liquefied Petroleum Gas (LPG), Liquefied Natural Gas (LNG) and Compressed Natural Gas (CNG).', 'It also owns LPG storage and filling stations, offers sea transportation services and operates port facilities.']
abouts: ["Basaran seldom if ever appears in public and doesn't talk to the press. His companies are known for being conservative, in terms of borrowing and cash management.", "He's passionate about fancy cars. His collection includes a Ferrari 288 GTO, Ferrari F40, Ferrari Superamerica, McLaren F1, Porsche Carrera GT and Hennessey Venom GT."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['J. Hyatt Brown chairs New York Stock Exchange-traded Brown & Brown, the sixth largest insurance brokerage in the U.S.', 'His father, J. Adrian Brown, cofounded the company in Daytona Beach in 1939, and Hyatt became CEO in 1961. ', 'Under Hyatt, Brown & Brown grew from a local, family-owned business to a national    firm with over 7,000 employees and 200 offices.', "Hyatt's son, J.
