Powell Brown, took over as CEO in 2007; the elder Brown remains chairman. ", 'J. Hyatt Brown owns 15% of Brown & Brown. ']
abouts: ['Brown was elected to the Florida House of Representatives in 1972 and served as the Speaker of the House in Florida from 1978 to 1980. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Long-time Suning executive Bu Yang's wealth comes from a stake in Suning Commerce Group, one of China's largest appliance retailers.", 'Suning Chairman Zhang Jindong is also a member of the Forbes China Rich List, ranking No. 36.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Hideyuki Busujima is the son of Sankyo founder Kunio Busujima, who died in October 2016. ', 'Hideyuki has been chairman and CEO of pachinko-machine maker Sankyo since 2008.', 'Kunio transferred his shares of publicly-traded Sankyo to Hideyuki in 2014. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Cai Rongjun chairs Shenzhen O-film Tech, a supplier of precision optical thin-film products including flat panel touch screens. ', 'Cai holds an undergraduate degree from Shantou University.', 'O-film was founded in 2002. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Cai Xiaoru chairs Tatwah Smartech, a supplier of radio-frequency identification products.', 'Tatwah Smartech was founded in 1993 and went public in December 2010.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Educated as a lawyer, Delfin Jorge Ezequiel Carballo started at Banco Macro in 1988 and accumulated a 19% equity stake over the years.', 'Banco Macro stock trades on the New York Stock Exchange and in Buenos Aires.', 'Carballo took over as interim chairman in November 2017 after the previous chairman, Jorge Brito, took a leave of absence.']
abouts: ["Carballo's sister Marcela is married to his business partner Jorge Brito. "]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Chen Jinshi chairs Zhongnan Holding Group, whose interests include construction, investment and agriculture.', 'Chen took the plunge as an entrepreneur with 28 workers in 1988. ', 'Chen holds an EMBA from Fudan University.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Chen Qixing is the chairman of Shenzhen Everwin Precision Technology, a Shenzhen-listed electronics component manufacturer. \r\n', 'Chen was a government official in Anhui Province before becoming an entrepreneur.\r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Chen Shiliang is the chairman of Tongkun Group, a supplier of textile products under the "Golden Cock" brand.', "Tongkun Group's predecessor business was a county-owned chemical fiber plant.", 'Chen took charge of the small collective chemical fiber business in 1991 when it went into bankruptcy. ', 'Chen and other managers were granted shares of Tongkun in 1999 when the company reorganized.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Chen Xiaxin is the chairman of Shanghai-listed department company Baida Group and a director of Shenzhen-listed Hangzhou Boiler Group.', 'Chen holds an EMBA from Cheung Kong Graduate School of Business.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Manas Chiaravanond is part of the clan behind Thai conglomerate Charoen Pokphand Group.', 'He debuts on the Forbes Billionaires List based on his 3.62% stake in holding outfit CP Group.', "Manas has been chief operating officer of the family's food outfit Chia Tai.", "He's a cousin of CP group head, Dhanin Chearavanont."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Yupa Chiaravanond is part of the clan behind Thai conglomerate Charoen Pokphand Group.\r\n', 'She debuts on the Forbes Billionaires List based on her 3.62% stake in holding outfit CP Group.', "CP's interests include food, retailing, real estate and insurance."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Prathip Chiravanond is part of the clan behind Thai conglomerate Charoen Pokphand Group.', 'He debuts on the Forbes Billionaires List based on his 3.62% stake in holding outfit CP Group.', 'Prathip studied at the University of California, Davis from where he earned degrees in plant sciences, including a doctorate in plant physiology.', 'He sits on the board of trustees of the International School Bangkok.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Gustavo Cisneros owns the Cisneros Group, a conglomerate with interests in Venezuelan television, telecom, a brewery, real estate and a baseball team.', 'In 2007 Cisneros and his partners sold Spanish-language TV network Univision to a group of private equity firms for $12.3 billion (excluding debt). ', "Cisneros's daughter, Adriana, became CEO in 2013 and restructured the group into 4 branches: media, interactive, real estate and products & services. ", 'In October 2016, Gustavo and wife Patricia gave more than 100 pieces from their Latin American art collection to the Museum of Modern Art in New York.', 'Cisneros, who is of Cuban heritage, has been a vocal proponent for the normalization of relations between the United States and Cuba.']
abouts: ['In 2000, the Cisneros Group moved its headquarters from Caracas to South Florida. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Sandor Csanyi is Hungary's first billionaire.", "Csanyi turned the country's largest retail bank into one of the biggest financial services firms in Central and Eastern Europe.", 'His OTP Bank acquired four banks in the Balkan region in 2017.', 'He owns Bonafarm Group, now the largest vertically integrated agricultural and food conglomerate in Hungary.', 'His Granit Development sold the Arena Centar Zagreb, the biggest shopping center in the capital of Croatia.']

name: Billionaires
title: Entrepreneur
bios: ['Cui Lijie owns the majority of Imperial Pacific International Holdings.', 'The company has been granted an exclusive casino license for Saipan in the Commonwealth of Northern Marianas Islands, a U.S. Pacific territory. ', 'Imperial Pacific ran a temporary casino in a local shopping mall until the gaming section of its $600 million beachfront hotel opened in July 2017.', "Cui's son Ji Xiaobo, formerly an executive with Macau junket promoter Hengsheng Group, has been dubbed 'mastermind' of the Saipan project. ", "Cui has been majority owner of Imperial Pacific since its 2013 listing but only joined the company's board of directors in May 2017."]
abouts: ["In addition to its hotel, Imperial Pacific has proposed developing a multibillion casino district similar to Macau's Cotai Strip.", 'Cui worked as a so-called barefoot doctor in mainland China. ', 'Prior to Imperial Pacific, Cui was a real estate investor and jewelry collector.']

name: Billionaires
bios:
['Dang Yanbao chairs Ningxia Baofeng Energy Group, a supplier of coal chemical products.

', 'Ningxia Baofeng Energy Group applied to list at the Shanghai Stock Exchange in Dec. 2017.
', 'Dang holds a MBA from Peking University.

']

name: Billionaires
title: Chairman and Co-founder
bios: ['Bharat Desai founded IT consulting and outsourcing company Syntel with his wife Neerja Sethi from their apartment in Troy, Michigan.  ', 'In July 2018, French IT firm Atos SE agreed to buy Syntel for $3.4 billion. The deal is expected to close by the end of 2018.', 'In its first year, Syntel generated just $30,000 in sales; today the company has more than $900 million in revenue.', "Desai, who is Syntel's chairman, was born in Kenya, raised in India and came to the U.S. in 1976 as a programmer for Tata."]
abouts: ['Desai and Sethi started the company with just $2,000. ', 'The couple met in the U.S. while working for pioneering IT firm, Tata Consulting Services, the company they went on to emulate. ']

name: Billionaires
title: Investor
bios: ['Joseph Edelman is CEO and portfolio manager of Perceptive Advisors, a New York-based hedge fund firm with $3.8 billion under management. ', 'Edelman founded Perceptive Advisors in 1999 and focuses on investing in biotechnology stocks. ', 'The Perceptive Life Sciences hedge fund returned 41% net of fees in 2017 as Edelman continued his streak of red-hot performance. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Wolfgang Egger is founder and CEO of publicly traded real estate company Patrizia AG.', 'The Augsburg, Germany-based company employs around 700 people across 15 countries and manages around $50 billion in real estate assets.', "Egger started Patrizia in 1984 and took it public in 2006. With more than 50%, he's still the biggest shareholder.", "Patrizia's portfolio comprises approximately 700 properties with more than 200 institutional investors."]
abouts: ['After starting out as a dental laboratory technician, Egger quickly realized his love for real estate and founded Patrizia at the age of 19.', 'He supports charitable social projects around the world through his Patrizia Kinderhaus-Stiftung.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Andrei Filatov made his first money selling imported goods while taking part in international chess tournaments.', 'In 1996 together with Konstantin Nikolaev and Nikita Mishin, he founded a transport joint venture with Alexei Mordashov. They later bought him.', 'Today the trio own a 34.5% stake in Globaltrans, the biggest private rail transport operator in Russia.', 'In December of 2017 all three withdrew from port business, selling their stakes in Global Ports.']
abouts: ['Filatov is the president of Russian Chess Federation.', 'Filatov owns wine production farm La Grace Dieu Des Prieurs in France,  founded in 1885. The vineyard produces 35,000 bottles of wine a year.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Paul Fireman bought the US distribution rights for a British company in 1979, turned it into Reebok and rode the sneakers & aerobics craze in the 80s.', 'Nike pulled ahead in the early 1990s, and shareholders demanded that Fireman step down in 1996, which he eventually did.', 'Fireman returned in 1999 and revived the business before selling it to Adidas for $3.8 billion in 2005, a deal that earned him $600 million.', 'He now chairs Fireman Capital Partners out of Boston, founded by his son Dan in 2008.', 'Fireman owns Liberty National Golf Course, a $250 million country club built on a New Jersey landfill overlooking the Statue of Liberty.']
abouts: ['Liberty National Golf club is one of the most exclusive courses in the world, with members reportedly paying $500,000 to join.', 'Before creating Reebok, Fireman was an officer in an outdoor sports distributorship.']

name: Billionaires
title: Founder and Managing Director
employment: {'name': 'J.C. Flowers & Co. LLC', 'title': 'Founder and Managing Director', 'government': False}
bios: ['J. Christopher Flowers runs private equity firm J.C. Flowers & Co., which focuses on the financial services sector.', 'Flowers studied math at Harvard and then joined Goldman Sachs in 1979, becoming a partner in 1988.  ', 'He struck out on his own a decade later and in 2000 bought a beleaguered Japanese bank, Long Term Credit Bank, which had been nationalized in 1998. ', 'He resold the business to the public under the moniker Shinsei Bank in 2004; the partners reaped $2.3 billion.', 'In 2008, he helped advise Bank of America and Merrill Lynch on their merger. ']
abouts: ['Flowers joined board of directors for the Kasparov Chess Foundation, named for legendary chess grandmaster Garry Kasparov, in 2015. ', 'During his college years, Flowers wrote for the Harvard Crimson.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["A successful son of China's Hunan Province, Fu Kwan leads the diversified Macrolink Group.", 'Fu holds a MBA from Hunan University and an EMBA from Tsinghua University.', 'Fu enjoys wine.', 'Fu started Macrolink with $1,000 after leaving a job in government.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Born in a family of diplomats, Sheela Gautam set up Sheela Foam in 1971, best known known for its Sleepwell brand of mattresses.', 'The $270 million (revenue) company was listed in 2016.', 'Her son Rahul runs Sheela Foam as chairman and managing director.']
abouts: ['Sheela Foam owns Joyce Foam in Australia.', 'A member of the ruling Bharatiya Janata Party, she was elected to parliament for four consecutive terms from 1991.']

name: Billionaires
title: Cofounder and CEO
bios: ['Drew Houston is the CEO of Dropbox, a file sharing service that has more than 500 million users.', 'Houston cofounded the company in 2007, when he was 24, with MIT classmate Arash Ferdowsi.', 'The cloud storage provider went public in March 2018, with shares jumping more than 35% on its first day.', "Houston, who owns 25% of the company, is Dropbox's largest individual shareholder."]
abouts: ['He worked at a industrial robotics startup when he was 15.', 'Former U.S. Secretary of State Condoleezza Rice and former HP CEO Meg Whitman serve as Dropbox board members.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Huang Shilin is vice chairman of Contemporary Amperex Technology (CATL), one of China's largest battery suppliers for the electric vehicle industry.", "CATL's customers include BMW, Volkswagen and Geely. ", 'Huang is a graduate of Hefei University of Technology.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Huang Wen Tsai chairs Star River Group, a luxury residential property developer in China.', 'Star River had nearly 10,000 employees as of mid-2016.', 'Huang founded a wood company, the predecessor of Star River, in Guangzhou in 1995.']

name: Billionaires
title: Founder
bios: ['Mohammed "Mo" Ibrahim founded Celtel International in 1998, one of the first mobile phone companies serving Africa and the Middle East.', "He sold it to Kuwait's Mobile Telecommunications Company for $3.4 billion in 2005 and pocketed $1.4 billion. ", "Since then, he's focused on fighting corrupt leadership in Africa through the Mo Ibrahim Foundation, directed by his daughter, Hadeel."]
abouts: ['Ibrahim also owns the majority of assets in Satya Capital, a private equity fund that invests in African businesses, education and healthcare. ', 'He was born in Sudan.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Hiroshi Ishibashi is a grandson of the founder of Bridgestone, the world's largest tire maker.", 'He owns just under 3% of the Tokyo-listed company. \r\n', "Hiroshi heads the Ishibashi Foundation, which operates Tokyo's Bridgestone Museum of Art."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Bent Jensen is the owner and CEO of Linak, a $600 million (sales) Danish company that manufactures and sells linear actuators.', 'Linear actuators are devices that convert power into linear motion and are used in industrial equipment, furniture and hospital beds.', "Jensen's grandfather founded the company in 1907; it originally made pulleys, grinding mills and forges.", 'Jensen, who received a mechanical engineering degree, joined the firm in 1976 -- with an idea for a new product: the linear actuator.', 'Today the company has factories in Denmark, the U.S., China and Slovakia.']
abouts: ['Jensen came up with the idea for linear actuators while talking with a friend from school, who had a disability, about ways to improve his wheelchair.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Along with family, Chatchai Kaewbootta owns 47% of finance firm Srisawad, one of Thailand's largest providers of loans against motorcycles and cars.", 'Srisawad has close to 2,500 branches and a fast-expanding business of providing nano-finance loans of under $2,800. ', 'Son of a tractor distributor, he joined the family trade then went on to become a dealer for Honda motorcycles.\r\n', 'Chatchai started the business in 1984, sold to AIG in 2007, but got back into into the same business with a new name in 2009.\r\n']
abouts: ['Srisawad\'s service slogan is "Mee Baan Mee Rod Ngern Sod Than Jai," which translates to "Your car and/or your home can bring you instant cash."', 'Chatchai named the company after his mother.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Son of Ikea's late founder Ingvar Kamprad, Jonas and his brothers Mathias and Peter own Ikano Group, a real estate and financial service company.", 'Today Ikano Group, which was spun out of Ikea in 1988, has $9.3 billion in sales.', 'Jonas, the middle child, studied industrial and furniture design in Switzerland and applied his skills in Ikea-run subsidiary Habitat.', "His father transferred the bulk of his Ikea empire to foundations in the 80's, but gave  his sons Ikano Group, which made them billionaires.", 'He is a board member of Netherlands-based Ikea parent Stichting INGKA Foundation and Ikano Group.']
abouts: ["Ikea's founder, Ingvar Kamprad, who died in 2018, once ranked among the top 10 richest people."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Son of Ikea's late founder Ingvar Kamprad, Mathias and his brothers Jonas and Peter own Ikano Group, a real estate and financial service company. ", 'Today Ikano Group, which was spun out of Ikea in 1988, has $9.3 billion in sales.', 'Today Ikano Group is a $9.3 billion (sales) company that operates across Europe and Asia with interest in banking, real estate and shopping centers.', 'Mathias, the youngest brother, is a board member of Inter Ikea Holding, the owner of the intellectual property assets.', 'He sits on the board of Ikano Group, and on the supervisory board of Interogo, a Liechtenstein-based foundation that is the ultimate owner of Ikea.']
abouts: ["Mathias put in two years as assistant to Ikea's founder, Ingvar Kamprad, ranked among the top 10 richest people in the world for five years."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Peter Kampard, together with brothers Mathias and Jonas, own Ikano Group, Ikea's real estate and financial service businesses, which was spun in 1988.", "Ingvar Kamprad, who died in 2018, transferred the bulk of his Ikea empire to foundations in the 80's, but kept enough to make his sons billionaires.", 'Today Ikano Group is a $9.3 billion (sales) company that operates across Europe and Asia with interest in banking, real estate and shopping centers.', "Peter, the eldest brother, ran Ikea's Belgian operations for 12 years;  he now chairs the Ikano Group.", 'Early in his career, Peter worked three years at a different Swedish retail giant, fast-fashion company H&M.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Newcomer Madhu Kapur gets her fortune from a 9.3% stake in Bombay Stock Exchange-listed Yes Bank.\r\n', 'She inherited the shares from her late husband Ashok Kapur, who cofounded the bank with Rana Kapoor, who is also a billionaire.', 'Her husband was killed in the terror attacks in Mumbai in 2008.', 'Since 2013, she has been embroiled in a court battle with the bank and its board to secure certain legal rights.']
abouts: ['Her sister Bindu is married to Yes Bank cofounder Rana Kapoor.', 'Her daughter Shagun founded and runs investment firm Tuscan Ventures in Mumbai.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Richard Kayne cofounded alternative asset manager Kayne Anderson Capital Advisors.', 'The $26 billion (assets under management) company is the largest investor in energy pipelines in the United States.', 'Kayne began his career as an analyst in New York in the mid 1960s then managed money at financials services firm Cantor Fitzgerald. ', 'He launched Kayne Anderson in 1984 and remains its co-chairman. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Vladimir Kogan owns Uralsib bank, which he manages with his sons Efim and Evgeny. ', 'Kogan also owns Afipskiy refinery, located in the South of Russia, which he bought from billionaire Oleg Deripaska.', 'Kogan apparently met Putin in Saint Petersburg decades ago and is considered to be close to the president.', 'In 2005 Kogan and his partner sold Promstroybank to state-owned VTB for nearly $600 million.']
abouts: ["He oversaw the multi-billion-dollar construction of an abandoned Soviet-era dam in St Petersburg to protect it from floods. Finished in 2011, it's called Putin's dam"]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Hotelier and property magnate Koh Wee Meng controls Singapore-listed Fragrance Group with interests extending to Australia and the U.K.', "Son of a jeweler and school teacher, Koh broke away from Aspial, his family's jewelry business to start his own property venture in the 1990s.", "He was once known as the Geylang King for Fragrance's beginnings in Singapore's red light district. ", 'His younger sibling Koh Wee Seng runs Aspial and has his own property interests. ', 'Koh also has a majority stake in education provider TMC Education.']
abouts: [' In the early years, he named his hotels after precious stones, such as Ruby, Sapphire and Emerald, inspired by his days as a jeweler.', 'In early 2017 Fragrance Group entered the UK hotel property market, where it has since made half a dozen acquisitions.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Koo Bon-joon is the vice chairman of LG Electronics and second oldest of the Koo brothers of the LG Group. ', "He led the LG International joint venture with Philips, which became LG Display in 2008 and eventually the world's leading LCD manufacturer. ", "He's now also the vice chairman of the LG Group."]
abouts: ['He started his career with AT&T.', "He is largely credited with turning around what was once LG's money-losing cellphone business. "]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Lam Lung On is the chairman of Yuzhou Properties, a real estate developer headquartered in Xiamen.', 'Lam founded Yuzhou in December 1994. ', 'Before founding the company, Lam worked for Xiamen Land Development, a state-owned enterprise.', "Lam graduated from the University of Science and Technology of China with a master's degree in engineering in 1996. "]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Isaac Larian, founder of toymaker MGA Entertainment, began making dolls after picking up a talking one that Mattel passed on. ', 'Today MGA Entertainment makes Little Tikes, Bratz dolls, and Lalaloopsy dolls. ', 'When Larian first saw the Bratz dolls in 2001, he thought they looked like aliens.', "MGA started importing electronics like Nintendo's early handheld videogame systems before eventually designing toys."]
abouts: ['Larian left Iran in 1971 on a one-way ticket, then put himself through Cal State, Los Angeles, as a waiter.', 'With his brother, Larian started an import-export business shipping brass lawn ornaments.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Frank Laukien is the chairman and CEO of Bruker Corp., a scientific instruments manufacturer headquartered in Billerica, Massachusetts. ', 'His father, physics professor Gunther Laukien, founded the company in 1960.', 'The firm initially specialized in magnets and power supplies; now it produces a variety of imaging machines and microscopes, among others.', 'The company is publicly traded; Frank Laukien owns a 23% stake. ', "Laukien's brother, Joerg Laukien, also serves on Bruker's board. "]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Lee Joon-ho is a cofounder of the South Korea's largest internet portal, Naver. ", "He now chairs NHN Entertainment, which was Naver's online-games business until the two split in 2013.", 'He sold $225 million worth of Naver shares in 2014 and another $115 million worth in 2016, but the company is still his biggest holding.\r\n']
abouts: ['He was an associate professor at Soongsil University,  a private Christian University in Seoul.', 'He is credited for developing the natural language search solution for Naver.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Lee Sang-hyuk is the founder of the country's second-biggest unicorn, Yello Mobile. ", 'Launched in 2012, Yello operates as a tech incubator by growing and investing in young mobile-based startups. ', 'His company has been valued at $4 billion by investors; his ownership is just over 26%. ']
abouts: ['Lee worked as an executive for Korean search engine Daum for a year-and-a-half before leaving in 2013.', 'Yello Mobile has a portfolio of more than 80 companies across shopping, media, advertising and travel.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Nancy Lerner owes her fortune to her billionaire dad, Al Lerner, who died in 2002, and to his banking fortune.', 'Al started his career as a furniture salesman, invested in Cleveland-area real estate and bought control of Equitable Bancorp in 1981.', 'Equitable Bancorp and Maryland National formed the credit card giant MBNA, whose 2005 merger with Bank of America created a $ 35 billion enterprise.', 'Lerners bought Cleveland Browns in 1999 but later sold the team to billionaire Jimmy Haslam for about $1 billion in 2012.', 'The family sold the English football club Aston Villa in 2016 after a decade of ownership.']
abouts: ['Nancy, her mother Norma and brother Randy all share the ownership of the family mansion in the Hamptons worth $40 million.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Norma Lerner is the widow of Al Lerner (d. 2002), who made a fortune as founder of credit card giant MBNA.', 'Al started his career as a furniture salesman, invested in Cleveland-area real estate and bought control of Equitable Bancorp in 1981.', 'Equitable Bancorp and Maryland National formed the credit card giant MBNA, which was acquired by Bank of America for $35 billion in 2005.']
abouts: ['The family sold the English football club Aston Villa for $88 million to Chinese businessman Tony Xia in 2016 after a decade of ownership.', 'They bought the Cleveland Browns in 1999 and brought pro football back to the city, but sold the team to billionaire Jimmy Haslam for about $1 billion in 2012.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Randy Lerner owes his fortune to his billionaire dad, Al Lerner (d. 2002), who made a fortune in credit cards.', 'His father got his start as a furniture salesman then invested in Cleveland-area real estate. He later bought control of Equitable Bancorp in 1981.', 'Equitable Bancorp merged with Maryland National to form credit card giant MBNA, which was acquired by Bank of America for $35 billion in 2005.']
abouts: ['The Lerners bought the Cleveland Browns in 1999, bringing pro football back to the city. They sold the team to billionaire Jimmy Haslam for about $1 billion in 2012. ', 'Lerner and his family sold the English football club Aston Villa for $88 million to Chinese businessman Tony Xia in 2016 after a decade of ownership.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['David Li is chairman and co-founder of YY, a Nasdaq-listed live streaming and social media platform in China. ', 'Before co-founding YY,  Li was chief editor at Chinese portal Netease.com.', 'Earlier in his career, Li founded CFP.cn, a copyright trading platform for journalists and amateur photographers.\r\n', 'Li received an undergraduate degree in philosophy from Renmin University of China in 1997.\r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Li Tan, with Li Li, is part of the husband-wife billionaire duo that leads Shenzhen Hepalink Pharmaceutical, a supplier of heparin sodium. \r\n', "She graduated from Sichuan University -- the same school as her husband -- in July 1987 with a bachelor's degree in chemistry.", 'Li worked as a bureaucrat in Anhui Province in 1987-92 before joining her husband at Chongqing Tongda, a heparin sodium supplier. \r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Li Weiguo is a cofounder and chairman of Beijing Oriental Yuhong Waterproof Technology, a supplier of waterproof systems for construction projects.', 'Li worked for a provincial statistics bureau in China before he founded the predecessor of Yuhong in 1995.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Liang Feng is a co-founder and the chairman of Shanghai Putailai New Energy Technology, a supplier to the lithium-ion battery industry.\r\n', "Putailai's clients include Samsung and LG. \r\n", 'Liang holds an undergraduate degree in automation from South China University of Technology.', " He also holds a master's degree in economics from Zhejiang University."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Liang Guangwei chairs conglomerate Shenzhen Huaqiang Holdings.', "He served in the People's Liberation Army before he received a degree from Shenzhen University."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Liang Shezeng's fortune stems from his holding in real estate developer Guangdong Shirongzhaoye.", 'Son Liang Jiarong is the chairman and president of Guangdong Shirongzhaoye.', 'Shirongzhaoye is headquartered in the southern Chinese city of Zhuhai, which is next door to Macau.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Liao Chang chairs privately held rice wine maker Site.\r\n', 'Site is headquartered in Jiangxi Province.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Jenny Lindén Urnes is the chairman and owner of $1.9 billion (sales) company Lindéngruppen, which she inherited from her father in 2009.', 'The industrial group owns 50% of Höganäs AB, a leading maker of powdered metal, and Beckers, which produces industrial coatings.', 'Her father, Ulf G. Lindén, a former Volvo executive, built up a private stake in Höganäs AB, and took it private in 1987.', "Beckers, a former subsidiary of Volvo, came into the family's hands in 1985, when Ulf bought the company from his employer.", "In 2013, under Jenny's command, Lindéngruppen, together with a foundation linked to the Wallenberg family, took Höganäs AB private once again."]
abouts: ["Höganäs AB has a 33% market share of the world's powdered metals, a product used in construction of metal parts and to remove contaminants from drinking water.", 'Lindén Urnes earned a B.A. with a major in philosophy from Heythrop College, University of London; she breeds horses in her free time.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Liu Zhendong chairs the Beijing-headquartered Liando Group, which operates industrial parks and makes financial investments.', 'Liando has developed more than 60 industrial projects in some 20 cities including Shanghai, Chengdu and Nanjing.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Liu Zhiqiang is chairman and wife Zhai Meiqing is president of Heung Kong Group, a real estate developer based in Guangzhou.', 'Wife Zhai is also the chairwoman of listed-company Shenzhen Heungkong Holding.', 'They cofounded the business in 1990 and also profited from growth in retailing, finance and health care.', 'Zhai received a Carnegie  Philanthropy Medal  in New York in 2017.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Jonathan Lu has held numerous posts in the Alibaba Group over the years, most recently vice chairman. \r\n', 'Before joining Alibaba Group, Jonathan was co-founder of a network communications company.', 'He holds a graduate certificate in hotel management from Guangzhou University and an MBA from China Europe International Business School.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['William Macaulay cofounded private equity firm First Reserve, which deals primarily in the energy industry, in 1983.', "Macaulay grew up in the Bronx, studied economics at the City University of New York and spent the 1970s in Oppenheimer's private equity business.", "He stepped down as co-CEO of First Reserve in July 2017 and now serves as the company's executive chairman.", 'He also chairs oil and gas company Weatherford International and retired from the board of Swiss mining and trading giant Glencore in April 2017.']
abouts: ["His wife is a professional ornithologist; Macaulay will often carry his wife's recording equipment when they track birds in the wild."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['John Martin led biotech firm Gilead Sciences for two decades as CEO through March 2016, he now serves as executive chairman. ', 'His fortune comes from his shares of Gilead; he has sold most of his shares over the years and owns less than a 1% stake.', ' Martin, who has a PhD in organic chemistry, worked at Bristol Myers Squibb and Syntex before joining Gilead in 1990 as chief scientist.', 'Gilead made its mark with several antiviral drugs to treat HIV. It launched a Hepatitis C drug in 2014 that, while pricey, became a blockbuster.', 'Gilead acquired cancer drug firm Kite Pharma for $11.9 billion in October 2017. \r\n']
abouts: ['Gilead was struggling and had 35 employees when Martin joined the company in 1990; it now has over 9,000 employees and $26 billion in revenues.\r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Yves-Loic Martin is the former chief technology officer of Eurofins Scientific, a  laboratory testing company listed on the French stock exchange. ', 'The company went public in 1997 IPO and Martin owns about 11% of stock. ', 'He joined Eurofins in 1992 and became chief technology officer in 1998. He stepped down in 2015 but remains a board member.', 'Eurofins has 400 labs in 41 countries and is prominent in food and pharmaceutical products testing. ', "Martin's billionaire brother, Gilles, founded the lab in 1987 and remains CEO."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Pharma distributor's son Satish Mehta founded and runs privately held generics maker Emcure Pharmaceuticals.", 'He started Emcure in Pune city as a contract manufacturer for multinationals in 1981 then went on to sell his own branded generics.\r\n', 'Private equity firm Bain Capital is a key investor in Emcure, with a 13% stake.']
abouts: ["Mehta's 2 U.S.-educated children, son-in-law and nephew work with him. "]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Nikita Mishin and partners Konstantin Nikolaev and Andrei Filatov share a 34.5% stake in Globaltrans, Russia's biggest private rail operator.", 'In December of 2017 the partners withdrew from port business, selling their  stakes in Global Ports. ', 'He and his partners worked together at a railroad freight company.']
abouts: ['He is the founder of charity fund Dar, which helps talented children, including ones from low-income families.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Konstantin Nikolaev and his partners Nikita Mishin & Andrei Filatov own a 34% stake in Globaltrans, Russia's biggest private rail transport operator.", 'The trio sold their stakes in Global Ports, exiting the port business in December 2017. ', 'He and his partners worked together at a railroad freight company.', 'Nikolaev is one of the co-founders of Moscow management school Skolkovo, the first business school in Russia.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Simon Nixon earned the bulk of his fortune from his price-comparison website MoneySuperMarket.', 'He cofounded the company in 1993, took it public in 2007, and when he fully divested in 2016, he became a billionaire.', 'Now, Nixon has his own private hedge fund, which he uses to invest in different businesses across the world, such as online startups.', 'He also owns luxury homes around the globe, including in Malibu and Barbados, which he lists for private holiday rentals on his site, SimonEscapes. ']
abouts: ['In 2013, he moved from Chester, England, to tax haven Jersey, where he owns a multimillion-dollar home. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Michael O'Leary is the longtime CEO of European no-frills airline Ryanair based in Dublin, Ireland. ", "After studying at Trinity College in Dublin, O'Leary's first job was as an accountant at KPMG. ", 'He later worked as a financial advisor to Ryanair founder Tony Ryan before joining the budget airline in 1988 as deputy chief executive. ', 'He became CEO in 1994 and has held the role ever since. ', 'Ryanair runs over 2,000 flights daily and operates in 33 countries in Europe, Africa and the Middle East. ']
abouts: ["O'Leary reportedly bought a taxi license for his personal car so he can get around busy Dublin traffic quicker.  ", 'He reportedly owns a collection of racehorses. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Liora Ofer chairs and owns a controlling stake of Ofer Investments which was founded by her father and uncle, Yuli and Sammy Ofer (both are deceased).', 'In 2015, Liora won a years-long court battle with her brother Doron Ofer over their inheritance, which left her with 52% of Ofer Investments.', 'She owns stakes in publicly-traded Mizrahi Tefahot Bank and real estate company Melisron. ', 'Her cousins Eyal and Idan Ofer, sons of her late uncle Sammy Ofer, are also billionaires.', 'She is one of just two female billionaires in Israel; the other is Shari Arison. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Roberto Ongpin chairs Alphaland, his high-end property developer that delisted in 2014 after a messy split with a U.K. investment group.', 'Ongpin, who has been building luxury villas on Balesin Island and an international airport on nearby Patnanungan Island, plans to relist it soon.', 'As the former Philippine trade minister, Ongpin was accused of insider trading in  2009. He was cleared of the charges in 2017.', 'Ongpin worked at  Procter & Gamble for two years and then got his M.B.A. from Harvard before returning to the Philippines. ']
abouts: ['In August 2016, Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte vowed on TV to destroy oligarchs and singled out Ongpin. ', 'Ongpin owns Tabacalera cigar maker and 14 homes around the world, including in Tuscany, London, Paris, Salzburg and Saint-Tropez.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Niti Osathanugrah holds an estimated 25% stake in Osotspa, the privately-held maker of popular energy drink M-150.', 'The company is run by his cousin Petch, who is an avid art collector.', "Niti also has valuable stakes in fellow billionaire William Heinecke's Minor International, Central Plaza Hotel and Home Product Center."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Frank Otto owns a stake in Otto Group and its more than 40 companies in retail (including Crate and Barrel), real estate and financial services.', 'He is the second-oldest son of Werner Otto, who started the empire by founding a mail-order business in Hamburg in 1949.', 'Unlike his siblings who are active in the family businesses, Frank focuses on his own media company. ', 'Frank Otto Medien (Fomedien) encompasses about two dozen radio ventures, including a majority stake in KISS FM Berlin.', "His older brother Michael is chairman of Otto Group and his younger half-brother Alexander runs family's real estate developer ECE."]
abouts: ['In 2016, Frank told German newspaper Hamburg Morning Post that his late father Werner did not allow his kids to listen to music at home.\r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Gretel Packer is the elder sister of fellow billionaire James Packer. ', 'She became a billionaire after James split their family estate 10 years after the 2005 death of their father, media mogul Kerry Packer.', 'Famously low-profile, she was the driving force behind the establishment of the $160 million National Philanthropic Fund in 2014.', "The fund is supported by the family's half-owned Crown Resorts and the Packer Family Foundation, which she chairs.", 'She is also an arts patron, who sits on the boards of the Art Gallery of New South Wales and the Sydney Theatre Company.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Alberto Palatchi transformed a store he inherited from his parents in 1964 into Pronovias, one of the largest wedding dress companies in the world.', 'In late 2017, Palatchi sold 90% of Pronovias to British private equity firm BC Partners for an estimated $550 million.', 'Pronovias wedding dresses are sold in 44 of its own stores and at thousands of retailers around the world.\r\n', 'Palatchi also has more than $600 million invested in two Spanish Sicav funds, which are similar to mutual funds.  ']
abouts: ["Palatchi's father fled Turkey during World War I and moved to Barcelona.", "In 1922 Palatchi's parents opened a store in Barcelona called El Suizo that sold lace and embroidery for wedding dresses."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Peng Jianhu's fortune comes from his stake in Giant Network Group.", 'Giant changed its name from Chongqing New Century, a travel concern, after a backdoor listing of online game business Giant Interactive.', 'Peng graduated from Sichuan International Studies University as an English major.']

name: Billionaires
title: CEO, Ant Financial Services
bios: ['Lucy Peng is the executive chairman of Ant Financial Services, the online finance arm of Alibaba Group. \r\n', 'Peng has previously been, among other positions in Alibaba Group, its chief people officer. \r\n', "Peng graduated from Hangzhou Institute of Commerce of Zhejiang Gongshang University in 1994 with a bachelor's degree in business administration."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Andrei Rappoport worked for two billionaires, Michael Fridman and Michail Khodorkovsky, before becoming one himself. ', "Rappoport worked at Fridman's Alfa-Bank for four years, then joined Khodorkovsky's YUKOS-Rosprom before moving to RAO Unified Energy System.", 'After RAO UES, he bought Georgian Global Utilities and a Georgian water and power company that he then sold to BGEO Group in 2016.', 'These days he has cashed out of nearly all his investments. ']
abouts: ['Rappoport is a master of sports in high-speed pistol shooting.', 'Rappoport decided to start a bank when he was 28 years old, but had no money. Instead he joined Alfa Bank after seeing an ad in the newspaper.   ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Andrea Reimann-Ciardelli is a descendant of German chemist Ludwig Reimann, and an heir to the Reimann family fortune.', "Now a U.S. citizen, she sold her stake in the family's Luxembourg-based investment firm, JAB, to other family members for close to $1 billion in 2003.", 'In 1828, Ludwig Reimann joined with Johann Adam Benckiser, who five years earlier had founded the Benckiser chemical company.', "Ludwig's great-grandson Albert Reimann Jr., Andrea's father, took the reins after his father died in 1952, and added consumer products.", "Today, JAB's holdings include Peet's Coffee, Krispy Kreme and Panera Bread, plus a stake in hygiene and home products giant Reckitt Benckiser."]
abouts: ["Andrea's Emily Landecker Foundation supports scientific, literary and educational projects in the upper Connecticut river valley of New Hampshire and Vermont.", "Four of Andrea's siblings -- Wolfgang, Matthias, Stefan and Renate -- have retained ownership of JAB and are also billionaires."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Igor Rotenberg is the son of billionaire Arkady Rotenberg, a close friend of Russia's President Vladimir Putin.", "Rotenberg was a junior partner in Rotenberg's business.", 'He now controls drilling company Gazprom Bureniye.', 'He is also a shareholder in Platon Electronic Toll Collection system, which processes the collections of tolls for vehicles over 12 tons. ']
abouts: ["After US Treasury Department imposed sanctions against his father in 2014, Rotenberg bought his father's stakes in some assets.", 'Rotenberg was once a top-manager of state-owned Russian Railways.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Alan Rydge is chairman and lead shareholder of cinema, hotel and ski-resort group Event Hospitality & Entertainment, formerly Amalgamated Holdings.', 'He inherited the Greater Union cinema chain after his father died in 1980. ', "He's also chairman and the major shareholder of equities investment company Carlton Investments."]

name: Billionaires
title: Investor
bios: ['Chris Sacca made early bets investing in Twitter and Uber through his venture capital firm Lowercase Capital.', 'Sacca also invested in Twilio, a cloud software company, which went public in 2016.', 'In April 2017, Sacca announced he was retiring from venture capital to launch a podcast, act on TV shows and raise his young children.', 'Sacca also proclaimed himself an active opponent of the Trump administration.']
abouts: ['He is known for wearing cowboy shirts - a sharp detour from the Silicon Valley tech investor uniform. ', 'He had a regular gig on the business pitch show Shark Tank; he stopped his appearances when he retired.']

name: Billionaires
title: Entrepreneur
bios: ['Alexander Samwer and his brothers Oliver and Marc founded Berlin-based tech incubator Rocket Internet in 2007 and took it public in October 2014.', 'The youngest of the brothers, Alexander does not take part in day-to-day management of the company, leaving that to Oliver.', 'Together, the brothers own around 37% of Rocket, which was valued at more than $8 billion at the time of its IPO.', 'Inspired by the dot-com boom, the brothers created a German auction site, Alando, in 1999 and sold it to eBay for $43 million after a few months', 'That was followed by the creation of mobile phone content provider Jamba!, which was sold to Verisign in 2004 for $273 million.']
abouts: ['Alexander is on the board of directors of Zalando, a German e-commerce company founded by Rocket Internet and modeled after Zappos in the U.S.', 'He graduated from Oxford University and from Harvard University with an MBA.']

name: Billionaires
title: Entrepreneur
bios: ['Marc Samwer and his brothers Alexander and Oliver founded Berlin-based tech incubator Rocket Internet in 2007 and took it public in October 2014.', 'Together, they own around 37% of Rocket, which was valued at more than $8 billion at the time of its IPO.', 'Inspired by the dot-com boom, the Samwers created a German auction site, Alando, in 1999 and sold it to eBay for $43 million after a few months.', 'That was followed by the creation of mobile phone content provider Jamba!, which was sold to Verisign in 2004 for $273 million. ']
abouts: ['Marc studied law at the University of Cologne.']

name: Billionaires
title: Entrepreneur
bios: ['Oliver Samwer and his brothers Alexander and Marc founded Berlin-based tech incubator Rocket Internet in 2007 and took it public in October 2014.', 'Often characterized as ruthless and pugnacious, Oliver is the middle brother and CEO.', 'Together, the Samwers own around 37% of Rocket, which was valued at more than $8 billion at the time of its IPO.', 'Inspired by the dot-com boom, they created a German auction site, Alando, in 1999 and sold it to eBay for $43 million after a few months.', 'That was followed by the creation of mobile phone content provider Jamba!, which was sold to Verisign in 2004 for $273 million. ']
abouts: ['Oliver Samwer has been known to say that he\'ll do "whatever it takes" to win.']

name: Billionaires
title: Entrepreneur, Investor
bios: ['Neil Shen is the founding and managing partner of Sequoia Capital China.  ', "Shen reached the top position on the Midas List of the world's best venture capital investors in 2018 after Ppdai Group went public in November 2017.", 'Shen cut his teeth early in his career as a successful entrepreneur himself as co-founder and CFO at travel site Ctrip.com.', 'Shen had previously worked as an investment banker at Deutsche Bank Hong Kong, Chemical Bank, Lehman Brothers and Citibank.', 'Shen made Forbes list of the world\'s "100 Greatest Living Business Minds" in 2017.']
investments: [{'name': 'AutoNavi Holdings Ltd', 'type': 'investment', 'imageExists': False}, {'name': 'Dianping.com', 'type': 'investment', 'imageExists': False}, {'name': 'JD.com', 'type': 'investment', 'imageExists': False}, {'name': 'Le Gaga Holdings Ltd', 'type': 'investment', 'imageExists': False}, {'name': 'QIHOO 360 Technology Co. Ltd.', 'type': 'investment', 'imageExists': False}, {'name': 'Renhe Commercial Holdings Co Ltd', 'type': 'investment', 'imageExists': False}]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Albert Shigaboutdinov is a co-owner of the TAIF Group, a large regional holding company with assets in the Republic of Tatarstan. ', 'The TAIF Group includes oil refineries, chemical factories, power plants and construction companies. ', "The TAIF Group is controlled by managers including Shigaboutdinov and billionaires Radik and Airat Shaimiev, sons of Tartarstan's first president."]
abouts: ['Shigaboutdinov was a member of regional parliament, The State Council of the Republic Tatarstan, for five years until 2014.', "Son Ruslan is chairman of the board of Kazanorgsintez, Russia's largest producer of ethylene polymers and copolymers.\r\n"]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Shin Dong-joo is the eldest son of Shin Kyuk-Ho, who founded Lotte Group, South Korea's fifth largest conglomerate. ", "Lotte Group is South Korea's largest retailer and has interests ranging from food and beverages to chemicals, construction and professional baseball. ", 'In early 2015 Shin Dong-joo was dismissed from his executive positions in the group after a bitter feud with his brother Dong-Bin. ', 'In February 2018 Dong-bin was sentenced to 30 months in prison surrounding a bribery case that involved former president Park Geun-hye who is now jail']
abouts: ['Lotte started as a confectionery manufacturer in Japan in 1948 and expanded into South Korea in 1967. ', 'At the start of his career he worked for Mitsubishi in Japan in 1978.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Yoshiko Shinohara became Japan's first self-made female billionaire in early 2017.", 'She founded Temp Holdings, a temporary staffing company, in 1973 after a stint as a secretary. ', 'Shinohara, who owns an 11% stake in the firm, retired from her longtime position as chairman in April 2016.', 'The company had $5.2 billion in revenues in 2017. ']
abouts: ['Shinohara founded the company in her Tokyo apartment. ', 'Her foundation endows scholarships to help students who are training to become nurses, daycare staff and social workers.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Analjit Singh is the youngest son of Bhai Mohan Singh, founder of pharma firm Ranbaxy Laboratories.', 'Today he controls the $2 billion (revenue) Max Group, with interests in healthcare, insurance and specialty packaging film. \r\n', 'In 2016, he split Max into three listed companies but the merger of his insurance arm Max Life with HDFC Life fell through.', 'In recent years, Singh has invested in South Africa where he owns a vineyard and two boutique resorts. \r\n']
abouts: ["The Boston University grad made an early investment in India's telecom sector and made a pile when he sold his stake in that business to Li Ka-shing.", 'His daughter founded Antara, a senior living community in North India.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Stephen Smith is the founder, chairman and CEO of Canadian mortgage lender First National Financial.', 'Smith launched the company in 1988, just four years after being personally bankrupt, and took it public in 2006.', 'He also owns about half of Canada Guaranty Mortgage Insurance Company and a stake in publicly-traded Canadian bank Equitable Group.', 'In 2015 he donated $50 million to Queens University, where the business school is named after him.']
abouts: ["Smith has passed his love of heli-skiing and travelling onto his three adult children, and Smith's wife cooks for the tight-knit family every Sunday night.", "An electrical engineer by education, Smith programmed code that is still used today by First National's mortgage approval and tracking system, Merlin."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['A pioneer of the modern hedge fund, Michael Steinhardt closed his fund in 1995 after making a fortune in the 1990s from stellar returns.', 'He came out of retirement a decade later to help run WisdomTree Investments, where he is the chairman and a leading shareholder.', 'WisdomTree is a publicly traded asset manager that focuses on ETF investing.', 'Steinhardt cofounded Birthright Israel, a foundation that provides funding for young Jewish Americans to take heritage trips to Israel.']
abouts: ['He maintains a zoo at his 57-acre Bedford, N.Y. estate -- complete with 90-year-old land tortoises, rare zonkies, camels and "oodles and oodles of berries."']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Former business journalist Svein Støle is the owner of Pareto Group, a financial services conglomerate.', 'The company provides financing, research and asset-management services to such clients as foundations, pension funds and high-net-worth individuals.', "Through Pareto's shipping arm it also deals in tankers, dry bulk shipping and drilling rigs.", 'Støle worked as a journalist for Norwegian business publication Kapital before taking a job as an analyst at an investment bank in 1987.', 'In 1992 he and a group of investors bought Pareto, then a small project finance and securities outfit of bankrupt Oslobanken.']
abouts: ['He reportedly bought his first bond in high school.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Rustem Sulteev co-owns the TAIF Group, a large regional holding company with assets in the Republic of Tatarstan. ', "TAIF Group's interests include an oil refinery, a chain of gas stations, chemical factories and power plants. ", "TAIF became a shareholder in most of its companies during Russia's privatization in the mid 1990s. "]
abouts: ["Son Timur is a member of the board of TAIF and deputy general director for commerce of Kazanorgsintez, Russia's largest producer of ethylene polymers.", 'Sulteev and other stakeholders of the TAIF Group, Radik Shaimiev and Albert Shigaboutdinov, also own Avers Bank.  ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Julio Patricio Supervielle is chairman and CEO of Argentine banking outfit Grupo Supervielle, which trades on the NYSE and in Buenos Aires.', 'His great grandfather came from France and founded Banco Supervielle in 1887 in Buenos Aires. In 1964 the company was acquired by Societè Générale. ', "In 1943 Julio's father bought Exprinter, a travel agency, and later founded another bank, Banex.", 'Patricio later took over at Banex and in 2005 Banex bought the Argentine operations of Societè Générale for an undisclosed amount. ', 'He then changed the name of the group to Grupo Supervielle. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Min-Liang Tan gave up a law career in Singapore to start gaming devices company Razer in 2005.', 'The company has acquired a huge global following and sold millions of gaming laptops, mice, fitness bands and tablets.', "Razers backers include IDG-Accel, Temasek Holdings, Intel and Li Ka-shing's Horizon Ventures.", "Following the launch of Razer's first smartphone, Tan listed the firm in Hong Kong in November 2017, raising $529 million.", "Tan is expanding Razer in Asia with the acquisition of Malaysian virtual currency firm MOL Global, and tie-ups with SingTel, Lazada and China's JD.com."]
abouts: ["Die-hard Razer fans sport tattoos of the brand's logo. ", 'Razer acquired THX, the audio company founded by George Lucas, in October 2016 and Android smartphone maker Nextbit in January 2017.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Hary Tanoesoedibjo got his start building a media business soon after college; he still owns more than 60 TV stations, radio stations and a newspaper.', 'He stepped down as CEO of his Media Nusantara Citra (MNC), which owns 4 national TV stations, in 2016, to focus on politics.', 'His oldest child, Angela Herliani Tanoesoedibjo, serves as a director at Global TV.']
abouts: ["Hary, who attended Donald Trump's inauguration, is building a six-star luxury Trump Hotel resort in Bali.", 'Hary is now actively involved in his political party Perindo, which he founded in 2014 after a brief run as VP. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Sukanto Tanoto is owner of Royal Golden Eagle with business in pulp & paper, palm oil, and energy.', "He privatized Bracell, one of the world's largest producers of specialty cellulose, used in everything from baby wipes to ice cream, in 2016.", 'Roots of business date back 50 years ago when Tanoto opened up a humble spare parts supply shop known as Toko Motor.', 'His Tanoto Foundation donates to healthcare.', "The government brought up concerns regarding environmental compliance at one of its pulp and paper units, which Tanoto's reps say they are addressing."]
abouts: ['The eldest of 7 boys, Tanoto dropped out of school at age 17 to start his own business.', "Tanoto says he taught himself English by reading Readers' Digest, Life and Newsweek."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Tiong Hiew King holds forestry concessions in 16 countries as well as property, oil-and-gas, and palm-oil interests.', 'He runs print and digital media business for Chinese-speaking consumers in Malaysia.', "His four daily newspapers comprise 70% of Malaysia's Chinese newspaper business.", 'He is the owner of Oregon Group, based in New Zealand, which builds houses and hotels, harvests salmon and manufactures plastic containers.']
abouts: ['He is an avid practitioner of Tai Chi.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Laurie Tisch's late father Bob (d. 2005) started Loews Corporation with his brother Laurence as a New Jersey hotel venture in 1946.", 'Today, Loews is active in insurance, drilling rigs, natural gas pipelines, and hotels.', "Laurie's mother Joan Tisch (d. 2017) was the largest individual Loews shareholder with 6%. Laurie and her two siblings inherited her mother's stake.", 'In 1991, her father Bob bought a 50% stake in the New York Giants football team for $75 million.', "Laurie's brother Steve Tisch is chairman and executive vice president of the New York Giants NFL team, which FORBES values at $3.3 billion."]
abouts: ['An avid art collector, Laurie Tisch is a trustee at the Whitney Museum of American Art in New York City.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Steven Tisch is chairman and executive vice president of NFL's NY Giants. His late father Bob paid $75 million in 1991 for a 50% stake in the team.", "Steven's father Bob Tisch (d. 2005) cofounded Loews Corp. with his brother Laurence as a New Jersey hotel venture in 1946.", 'Today, Loews Corp., a publicly traded company, is active in insurance, drilling rigs, natural gas pipelines and hotels.', "Steven's mother Joan (d. 2017) was the largest individual shareholder (with 6%) of Loews, where his brother Jonathan is co-chairman.", "Steven and his two siblings, Jonathan and Laurie, inherited their mother's fortune."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['James Truchard cofounded National Instruments, a supplier of testing and measurement equipment and software for scientists and engineers, in 1976.', 'A Texas native, he got a PhD in electrical engineering from the University of Texas, Austin in 1974.', "He launched National Instruments while working as managing director of the acoustical measurements division at the university's applied research lab.", 'The company produces both hardware and software for governments, colleges and companies, including Subaru and Airbus.', " In January 2017 Truchard retired as the company's president and CEO; he remains its chairman."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Vardis J. Vardinoyannis co-founded Motor Oil Hellas, a petroleum company based in Greece, with his late brother in 1970. ', "It went public on the Athens stock exchange in August 2001. Saudi Arabia's Aramco was a major investor before divesting in 2005.", "Vardis's oldest son, John, is vice chairman while nephew, Nikos, also a major shareholder, is on the board.", 'Apart from Motor Oil, the family also invests in shipping, finance and soccer teams.\r\n']
abouts: ['Vardinoyannis served a number of years in the Greek Naval Forces before being discharged with the grade of Vice-Admiral.  ', 'Vardis and wife Marianna Vardionoyannis are reportedly good friends with the Kennedys. They are members of the Robert F. Kennedy Human Rights Leadership Council.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Founder of Turkey's largest provider of mobile service, Murat Vargi has diversified into real estate and hotels, tech startups and renewable energy.", 'Although having divested most all of his Turkcell stake, he has 79% of KVK, a mobile phone distributor supplying a retail network with 1,000+ outlets.', " Dost Energy, of which Vargi's owns 51%, has found success by focusing exclusively on producing power from wind.", "Vargi is an active venture investor. In 2015, Gedik Yatırım and Vargi's MV Holding opened a startup hub in Istanbul, StartersHub.", 'One of his venture investments is a 20% stake in Cardtek, focused on payment systems services and solutions, plus fraud detection and prevention.']
abouts: ["Vargi started his career working as an export representative with Koc Holdings, founded by one of Turkey's leading business families.", "KVK is one of Turkey's most recognized brands."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Wan Lianbu chairs Kingenta Ecological Engineering Group, a supplier of chemical fertilizers. ', 'Kingenta was founded in 1998.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Wang Miaotong is the chairman of Zhejiang Century Huatong Group, a supplier of auto parts that has diversified into the mobile game business.', 'His son Wang Yifeng is vice chairman of Zhejiang Century Huatong Group.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Wang Zhenghua is president of Spring Airlines of China, one of the world's largest budget carriers. ", 'Wang was a district government official in Shanghai before he set up his first company, Shanghai Spring Tour, in 1981.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Wen Jianping chairs Beijing Originwater Technology, which designs and builds sewage treatment and water treatment plants.', 'Wen founded the company with classmates from the University of New South Wales in 2001.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Myron Wentz is founder and chairman of USANA, a multilevel marketing company that sells nutritional supplements and skincare products.', 'Wentz owns 49% of USANA, which trades on NASDAQ and has $1 billion in net sales. He took it public in 1996.', 'Wentz founded Gull Laboratories in 1974 to sell diagnostic tests to hospitals and labs. He sold his stake to a German firm in 1994 for $22 million.', 'He renounced his American citizenship in the mid-1990s. He now claims citizenship in tax haven St. Kitts & Nevis.']
abouts: ['He spends most of his time at Sanoviv Medical Institute, a holistic care center he founded in 1998 in Rosarito, Mexico.', 'He enjoys snorkeling and watching coral reef videos on YouTube.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Xia Zuoquan is a director of electrified transportation supplier BYD. \r\n', 'Xia studied computer science in University of Science & Technology of Beijing from 1985 to 1987.', 'He graduated from Guanghua School of Management of Peking University with an MBA in 2007.', "Xia worked in the Hubei branch of The People's Insurance Company before he joined BYD in 1997.", "BYD is also one of the world's largest suppliers of rechargeable batteries used in mobile phones."]

name: Billionaires
title: Entrepreneur
bios: ["Swift Xie heads up marketing at Dajiang Innovation Technology Co. (DJI), the world's largest consumer drone manufacturer. \r\n", 'The high school best friend of founder and CEO Frank Wang, Xie, nicknamed "fat-headed fish" by Wang, owns an estimated 14% stake in DJI.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Yao Jinbo is the founder and chairman and CEO of 58.com, the operator of one of the largest online marketplaces in China.', 'Before setting up the New York Stock Exchange traded firm, Yao founded domain.cn, a domain name transaction and value-added service website in China. ', "Yao holds bachelor's degrees in computer science and chemistry from Ocean University of China in 1999.\r\n"]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Fatma Tuba Yazici and her three sons became the largest shareholders in Diler Holding when her husband, Recep Sami Yazici, died suddenly in 2009.', "She's CEO of Diler and Yazici Iron and Steel, among Turkey's largest iron and steel producers, and owns shares of publicly traded Asil Steel Company.", 'She lives in Beylerbeyi, one of the most beautiful areas of the Bosporus in Istanbul.', "She's a member of the professional committee council for Iron Steel and Hot Mill Products Industry at the Istanbul Chamber of Commerce."]
abouts: ["Fatma Tuba Yazici is Turkey's only woman billionaire industrialist.", "She doesn't grant interviews or provide photographs to the media, because she doesn't want to be recognized on the street."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Zhang Zhirong's ambition to turn a previously formidable private shipbuilder, China Rongsheng, into a global giant ran aground starting in 2014. \r\n", 'He received his MBA degree from Asia Macau International Open University in 2002.', 'His holdings  in Hong Kong-listed real estate developer, Glorious Property Holdings, have helped to buoy his fortune.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Zhao Yan chairs Hong Kong-listed Bloomage BioTechnology, as well as the Bloomage International Investments Group.', 'Besides biotech businesses, Zhao has interests in real estate, finance and sports.', 'She holds an undergraduate degree with a major in biology from East China Normal University and a MBA from Fordham University in New York.\r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Zhou Zongwen chairs Chow Tai Seng Jewelry, which listed on the Shenzhen Stock Exchange in 2017.', 'Zhou is a graduate of the China University of Geosciences.', 'Zhou opened the first Chow Tai Seng jewelry store in Beijing in 1999.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Raamdeo Agrawal cofounded Motilal Oswal Financial Services as a small securities firm with his pal Motilal Oswal in 1987.', 'The company, which saw its shares more than double in the past year, now offers a range of services including investment banking and mutual funds.', 'Agrawal grew up in a village in Chattisgarh in central India and came to Mumbai for his accountancy studies.']
abouts: ['Agrawal and Oswal lived in the same hostel in Mumbai while studying accountancy but became friends much later.\r\n', "An ardent Warren Buffet fan, he has been attending Berkshire Hathaway's annual general meetings since 1995.\r\n "]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Maurizio Billi is president of Eurofarma, a Brazil-based pharmaceutical firm that sells generic versions of drugs such as Viagra.', 'Eurofarma was founded by his father in 1972 and became one of the largest pharmaceutical companies in Brazil, with over $1 billion in revenues.', 'Eurofarma expanded to Central and South America by acquiring medical suppliers, labs, and other pharmaceutical companies. ']
abouts: ['Maurizio Billi is an avid car racer. \r\n\r\nSeveral times his Eurofarma team has won the Brazil circuit of Stock Car Brasil, the Brazilian equivalent of Nascar. ']

name: Billionaires
title: Founder
bios: ['A onetime door-to-door fax machine salesperson, Sara Blakely invested $5,000 to come up with something to wear under white slacks. ', 'She initially shilled her new invention, which became shapewear brand Spanx, on the sales floor at various Neiman Marcus stores.', 'Today Spanx sells its undergarments, leggings, and maternity wear in 65 countries. Mother-of-four Blakely runs it day to day.', "A guest judge on Shark Tank, she invests in startups, often with female founders, including Biena Snacks and Alice's Table.\r\n"]
abouts: ['After scoring poorly on the LSATs, she auditioned for jobs at Walt Disney World. Too short for the Goofy costume, she buckled visitors into rides.\r\n', "Blakely remains America's youngest self-made female billionaire."]

name: Billionaires
bios:
["Telecom magnate Pete Bodharamik controls Jasmine International, Thailand's second- largest broadband service provider.
", 'The company was started by his father in 1982 but got thrown into bankruptcy after the 1997 financial crisis.
', 'He took over Jasmine in 2008, reviving the company with a broadband push into underserved provinces.
', "In 2017, Pete increased his stake to 68% with a $491 million tender offer for Jasmine's shares sparking speculation of a possible sale."]
abouts: ['In 2015 he bid a record $2 billion for 4G spectrum but failed to to secure funds to pay for it.', "A fitness buff, Bodharamik posts his weight and that of Jasmine's top executives in a corner of the company dining room for all to see."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Cao Kejian chairs Zhejiang Kaishan Compressor, China's biggest manufacturer of air compressors and rock drilling equipment. \r\n", 'Cao owns 52% of Zhejiang Kaishan, which went public in 2011 and whose customers  include giant GE.', 'Cao holds a degree from Zhejiang University of Technology, where he majored in chemical machinery.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Morris Chang chairs Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing, one of the world's largest manufacturers of semiconductors. ", "Chang has a bachelor's degree and a master's degree in mechanical engineering from MIT and a PhD in electrical engineering from Stanford University.", 'Chang worked for a quarter century at Texas Instruments and then joined the Taiwan research body that spun off TSMC.', 'TSMC customers include Apple, Nvidia and Qualcomm.']
abouts: ['Chang founded TSMC in 1987; a decade later, the company became the first Taiwanese firm to trade on the New York Stock Exchange.\r\n \r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Richard Chang is vice chairman of Advanced Semiconductor Engineering.', "ASE is reportedly the world's largest provider of independent semiconductor assembling and test manufacturing services", 'He and his brother Jason are the main investors in Chinese real estate developer, Sino Horizon.']

name: Billionaires
bios:
["Chen Jianming chairs San Sheng Hong Ye, a holding company for Chen's diversified businesses. 

", "Chen founded the predecessor of San Sheng in China's Zhejiang Province in 1993 as a shipper.", 'He moved its headquarters to Shanghai in 2002.', "San Sheng's businesses currently include real estate, big data, finance and tourism.
", 'Chen completed a backdoor listing of his shipping business Zhongchang Marine in 2010, and changed its name to Zhongchang Big Data in 2016.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Cho Yang-rai chairs Hankook Tire Worldwide, whose affiliate, Hankook Tire, is the world's 7th-biggest tire manufacturer.", "It has broken into the high-end market by supplying Mercedes-Benz since 2013 and BMW's new 7-series sedans in 2016.", 'In October 2017, Hankook Tire opened its first U.S. manufacturing plant, in Tennessee. ', 'The new plant is expected to bring 1,800 jobs to the state. ']
abouts: ['Cho inherited the business from his father, Cho Hong-hai, who took over a ruined tire shop during the 1950s shortly after the end of the Korean War.', 'His older brother Cho Seok-rae, who chaired industrial conglomerate Hyosung, was sentenced to three years in prison for tax evasion and accounting fraud.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Yvon Chouinard is founder of outdoor wear maker Patagonia, based in Ventura, California.', 'Since Patagonia was founded in 1984, it has has an open office plan - not even Chouinard, the owner, has his own office.', 'His apparel business took off in the 1970s when Chouinard imported rugby shirts from England and sold them to climbers.', 'Since 1985, Patagonia has set aside 1% of sales to finance grassroots environmental groups in the U.S. and abroad. Revenues hit $800 million in 2017.', 'In May 2013 Patagonia launched Tin Shed Ventures which provides seed funding to environmentally and socially responsible start-ups.\r\n']
abouts: ['On Black Friday 2011, Patagonia ran a full-page ad in The New York Times encouraging customers not to buy its products, but to reuse or repair items instead.', "An avid climber, Chouinard taught himself blacksmithing in 1957 to make reusable climbing tools that wouldn't pollute the environment."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Eduard Chukhlebov has ties to the powerful owner of UGMK Iskander Makhmudov.', 'When Makhmudov reorganized his business, he gave Chukhlebov, one of his managers, a 7.5% stake in UGMK.', 'Chukhlebov also got 5% in Kuzbassrazrezugol and nearly 7% in transportation company UGMK- Trans.', 'UGMK, which is the biggest zinc, copper and coal producer in Russia, operates more than 300 companies in nine regions of Russia.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['A South African native and trained accountant, Jack Cockwell is a famed dealmaker in Canada.', "From the 1970s through the early 1990s he built the Bronfmans' Edper conglomerate, acquiring massive holdings in real estate, forestry and mining.", "Now known as Brookfield Asset Management, one of the world's biggest money managers, he handed the reins to fellow billionaire Bruce Flatt in 2002.", 'His wealth comes from a large holding in Brookfield shares, much of it in a partnership shared with other board directors and management.', "Cockwell is a member of Ryerson University's board of governors and governor of the Royal Ontario Museum."]

name: Billionaires
title: Entrepreneur
bios: ['John Collison is cofounder and president of Stripe, a company that lets businesses and individuals accept payments over the internet.', 'In November 2016 Stripe closed a $150 million funding round that valued the business at $9.2 billion.', 'He and his brother Patrick hatched the idea for Stripe while both were in college in Boston. ', "The company's first payment was processed while both were on vacation in South America.", 'John was born and raised in the countryside near Limerick, Ireland, where his parents ran a lakeside hotel.']
abouts: ['John and Patrick Collison took up coding as kids, competing against each other to master the craft.', 'The Collison brothers became teenage millionaires in 2008 when they sold their company Auctomatic to Live Current Media for $5 million.']

name: Billionaires
title: Entrepreneur
bios: ['Patrick Collison is the cofounder and CEO of Stripe, a company that lets businesses and individuals accept payments over the internet.', 'In November 2016 Stripe closed a $150 million funding round that valued the business at $9.2 billion.', 'He and his brother John hatched the idea for Stripe while both were in college in Boston at MIT.', "Stripe's first payment was processed while the Collison brothers were on vacation in South America.", "Stripe's big-name investors include Elon Musk and Peter Thiel. "]
abouts: ['The Collison brothers became teenage millionaires in 2008 when they sold their company Auctomatic to Live Current Media for $5 million.', 'Patrick and John took up coding as kids, competing against each other to master the craft.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Henry Davis is a third-generation beef supplier who owns $1.7 billion (annual revenues) Greater Omaha Packing.', "His beef is now eaten in 69 countries, including some of the world's top restaurants from Napa Valley's French Laundry to New York's Marea. ", 'His Greater Omaha is the fifth-largest beef producer in the U.S., after giants Tyson, Cargill, JBS and National Beef. \r\n', "Davis' grandfather started in 1920, butchering a single steer every day and selling the beef himself. Davis inherited it in 1987 and grew it 10-fold."]
abouts: ['Davis races cars on the side. He owns the first American race car to win at the legendary Le Mans course, a 1966 Ford GT40. \r\n', "The computer science major wrote Greater Omaha's first billing and operations software in 1980, which the company still uses today. \r\n"]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Francois Feuillet became a billionaire after shares of French motorhome manufacturing company Trigano reached an all-time high in January 2018.', 'Started in 1935, Trigano first made camping equipment and then branched out to become a leader in European leisure vehicles. ', 'Feuillet joined in 1981 and has been the head ever since, taking the company public in 1998. He currently owns 58% of the business.', 'He previously worked in finance and had an auditing job at KPMG. ']
abouts: ["Feuillet's wife helps run the company as its general manager. His two daughters serve on the supervisor's board. "]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Susumu Fujita founded website and blog host platform CyberAgent in 1998.', 'He owns about 21% of the Tokyo-listed company. ', 'The company also has an internet and mobile phone advertising agency. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Filaret Galchev got his start in coal, but made the bulk of his fortune in cement, buying plants from Stern Cement and from Inteko. ', "His Eurocement Group is now Russia's largest cement producer.", "In February 2016, Galchev lost his 6.2% stake in the world's largest cement producer, LafargeHolcim, as a result of margin call. ", 'The companies of Eurocement Group have a combined production capacity of more than 60 million tons of cement and more than 11 million m3 of concrete.', 'Galchev is also a citizen of Greece.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Yuri Gushchin gets the bulk of his fortune from United Confectioners, the biggest candy company in Russia.', 'During the Soviet era, Yuri Gushchin was an underground producer of consumer goods, particularly candy.', 'During Perestroika he became one of the first businessmen to legalize those operations.', "After the 1998 Russian financial crisis, he bought a controlling stake in Moscow's biggest confectionary factories and created United Confectioners.", 'Gushchin leases out buildings near the Kremlin including Red October that used to belong to the candy company.']
abouts: ['He lives in Seychelles where he owns a luxury hotel called Savoy Resort and Spa. He also owns the Savoy Hotel in Moscow.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["David Hall is at the forefront of the self-driving car revolution with his LiDAR sensors that allow vehicles to see what's around them.", 'He first patented a LiDAR sensor in 2006 as part of a race for autonomous vehicles sponsored by the U.S. Department of Defense.', 'Hall, an engineer, founded Velodyne in 1983 as an audio equipment company, selling speakers with a patented sub-woofer starting at $2,000.']
abouts: ['Hall made a robot for a TV show called "Robot Wars" that finished second-place in the 2001 world championship.', "Hall's father was also an engineer and his grandfather was a physicist."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['He Simo is the chairman of Guangdong East Power, a supplier to the power industry.\r\n', "Wife Zhang Ye is the director of the company's international trade department. "]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Hon Kwok Lung chairs the Citychamp Watch and Jewellery Group.', 'Hon is active in social groups, including the All-China Federation of Returned Overseas Chinese Committee.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Elie Horn moved to Brazil from Syria at the age of 11. He and his two brothers started a low-money down real estate investing business when he was 19.', "In 1978, Horn ventured out on his own, and founded Cyrela, now one of Brazil's largest residential developers. ", 'Horn also owns shares in listed Cyrela Commercial Properties, which acquires, develops and rents shopping centers and corporate buildings in Brazil.', 'In 2014, Horn announced he would step down as CEO of Cyrela. His two sons, Raphael and Efraim Horn, became co-CEOs. Elie Horn remains on the board. ']
abouts: ['He was the first Brazilian to sign the Giving Pledge, a promise to give the majority of his wealth to philanthropy; it was started by Warren Buffett and Bill Gates.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Huang Bingwen is the founder of Shantou Dongfeng Printing, a manufacturer of paper packaging for tobacco and other industries in China.', 'Shantou Dongfeng went public in Shanghai in 2012. ', 'He stepped down as chairman in 2010; his son Huang Jiaer currently chairs Dongfeng.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Huang Xiaofen is a major shareholder and a director of Shenzhen Kinwong Electronics.', 'Her husband, Liu Shaobo, heads the company. He previously worked for a state-owned company in Shenzhen early in his career.', 'Kinwong grew out of a joint venture backed by that government business. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Masayuki Ishihara and his immediate family own about 45% of Tokyo-listed pachinko machine maker Heiwa.', 'Ishihara is not involved in running Heiwa.', 'He founded another pachinko firm, Olympia, which Heiwa acquired in a stock swap in 2007.', "Heiwa subsidiary PGM is one of Japan's largest golf course operators."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Newcomer Tarang Jain enters the ranks based on his 86% stake in auto components maker Varroc Engineering.', 'The Aurangabad company, which listed in July 2018, makes exterior lighting systems as well as two and three-wheeler parts.\r\n', 'Varroc has 37 factories across the globe and is looking to add new ones in Morocco, the Czech Republic and Brazil.', 'Son Arjun has a board seat, while father Naresh Chandra chairs the company.\r\n']
abouts: ['His twin brother Anurang Jain runs his separate listed auto parts firm.', "The name Varroc was coined from the names of the siblings' wives, Varsha and Rochana."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Jiang Wei chairs Shenzhen-listed Guizhou Bailing Group Pharmaceutical, a drug supplier based in southwestern China.', "Jiang graduated from Guiyang College of Traditional Chinese Medicine with a bachelor's degree in 1982. \r\n"]

name: Billionaires
title: Actor
bios: ["Jiang Xuefei is the chairman of Shenzhen Suntak Circuit Technology, one of China's largest makers of printed circuit boards.\r\n", 'Jiang holds an EMBA from Xiamen University.\r\n']

name: Billionaires
