bios: ['David Kabiller is one of the founders of AQR, a private hedge fund firm based in Greenwich, Connecticut.', 'The firm focuses on traditional and alternative investment strategies and has $224 billion in assets under management.', 'The firm operates globally with 900 employees and offices in London, Sydney and Hong Kong.', 'Before AQR, he was a vice president at Goldman Sachs, working with chief investment officers of large pension and endowment funds in North America.']
abouts: ['Kabiller founded the Kabiller Prize and the Kabiller Young Investigator Award for researchers in nanoscience and nanomedicine at Northwestern University.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Morris Kahn cofounded Amdocs, a customer-relationship management-and-billing software firm for large telecom outfits. ', 'He sold nearly $1 billion worth of shares after Admocs went public in 1998.', 'A South African native, he lives on the Israeli coast and spends most of his time on a 100-foot yacht.', 'Through his Aurum Ventures, Morris invests in life sciences and clean-tech companies that he hopes will contribute to the wellbeing of the planet.', 'He cofounded Coral World International, which had built aquariums in locations such as the Bahamas and Australia. ']
abouts: ['An avid diver, Kahn started building aquariums after a diving accident that gave him a burst eardrum, forcing him to stay on land for months. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Anton Kathrein, Jr. owns 75% of Kathrein-Werke, which makes equipment (cables, antennas and receivers) that enables transmission of cell phone signals.', 'The company was founded by his grandfather in a cellar in Rosenheim, Germany, shortly after World War I, and became a pioneer in automotive antennas. ', 'Anton Jr. assumed leadership in 2012, at age 28, after the death of his father, who had run the company since 1972.']
abouts: ['Like his father was, Anton Jr. is active in a number of professional and trade organizations.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Kim Dae-il is the founder of Pearl Abyss, an online gaming company that went public in Seoul in September 2017. ', "His company's role-playing game Black Desert has over 8.5 million registered users and amassed nearly $400 million in revenue since its 2015 debut. ", "About 80% Black Desert's revenue comes from overseas. "]
abouts: ["Kim is a college drop out who says he's dreamed of becoming a gaming developer since middle school. ", "As of June 2018, Black Desert is the company's only game. "]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Michael Kim helped start MBK Partners, the private-equity firm that bears his initials and manages more than $15 billion in assets. ', 'His ING Insurance Korea, which went public in 2017, was the first company wholly owned by a private equity firm to list on the Korean exchange. ', "In September 2016 his firm's $6.1 billion takeover of Tesco's Korean operation, Homeplus, marked the country's biggest private-equity deal to date. "]
abouts: ['He is married to Park Kyung-Ah, daughter of the late Prime Minister Park Tae-Joon who was part of the inner circle of former President Park Chung-Hee.', 'Kim is a former executive of Caryle Group, where he led Asia operations for six years. He cofounded MBK in 2005 with five executives from Carlyle. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['With fellow Ukrainian billionaire Henadiy Boholyubov, Ihor Kolomoyskyy founded PrivatBank in the early 1990s. ', "It grew to be a key bank in Ukraine, handling more than a third of private deposits and serving approximately half the country's population. ", "In 2016, Ukraine's government nationalized the bank; an investigation suggested large-scale fraud over a period of ten years. ", 'In Dec 2017, the High Court of London ordered a freeze on some $2.5 billion worth of assets held by Kolomoyskyy and Boholyubov. They deny the charges.', 'Kolomoyskyy was forced to step down as governor of the Dnipropetrovsk region in March 2015. ']
abouts: ['Kolomoyskyy holds triple Ukrainian-Israeli-Cyprus citizenship.', 'In 2016 Kolomoyskyy and Bolholyubov settled with billionaire Viktor Pinchuk, who had sued them for damages for unfulfilled pledges on mining investments.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Koo Bon-sik runs LG affiliate Heesung Electronics with his brother Koo Bon-Neung, who is also a billionaire. ', 'He is the youngest of the four Koo brothers of the LG Group. ', "Heesung is LG's largest supplier of backlights to illuminate LCD displays."]
abouts: ['More than 50% of his fortune comes from his stake in LG Corp. ', 'In 1947 his grandfather, the late Koo In-hwoi, cofounded LG, then called, Lak Hui Chemical Industrial Corp., with a popular face cream. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Igor Kudryashkin is the commerce director of Iskander Makhmudov's UGMK, a top Russian producer of commodities such as copper, zinc, coal and gold.", 'Kudryashkin got shares in UGMK when Makhmudov reorganized the business in 2013. ', 'UGMK has interests in more than 300 companies in nine regions of Russia. \r\n']
abouts: ['Kudryashkin\'s daughter sings under the name Nastya Kudri; in 2015, she recorded a song called "Father."']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Lev Kvetnoi has invested in airports, airport services, banking and cement.', "Kvetnoi was the largest shareholder in Moscow's Vnukovo Airport, owning 30% of the project, until he sold out in 2013 and quit its board. ", "In 2011 he expanded his cement holdings by acquiring one of billionaire Elena Baturina's factories in southern Russia."]
abouts: ["For a time Kvetnoi served as chief executive of a company in billionaire Alisher Usmanov's metals group, but he sold out his interests to Usmanov in 2006. ", 'In the early 1990s, Kvetnoi traded computers with an army friend Andrei Skoch, who is now also billionaire.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Theodore 'Ted' Leonsis is founder, majority owner and CEO of Monumental Sports,  which owns several teams and arenas in Washington, D.C.", "Subsidiaries include the NBA's Wizards, the NHL's Capitals, the WNBA's Washington Mystics, two Australian football teams and Capital One Arena.", 'Born to Greek immigrants, Leonsis initially built his fortune as a senior executive at AOL, where he worked for nearly 14 years.', 'He reportedly bought the Capitals in 1999 for $85 million and the Wizards in 2010 for $550 million.', 'In 2017 Laurene Powell Jobs reportedly bought 20% of Monumental Sports for hundreds of millions of dollars, making her the second largest shareholder.']
abouts: ["Leonsis runs a blog called Ted's Take, where he posts commentary on business and sports.", 'He lives in a house in Potomac, MD that Franklin Roosevelt, and later Joe Kennedy (the father of President John F. Kennedy), used to rent out over the summer.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Known as the "King of Diamonds," Lev Leviev owns an integrated diamond outfit with mines in places like South Africa & a jewelry boutique in New York.', 'He made his name undercutting the DeBeers diamond cartel, striking his own deals with diamond-producing countries like Russia and Angola.', 'Leviev is also the controlling shareholder of Africa Israel Investments, a real estate and construction company listed on the Tel Aviv Stock Exchange.', 'Leviev was born in Uzbekistan. His Lubavitcher Jewish family fled to Israel in 1971.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Liang Zhaoxian is president of Galanz Group, one of China's largest suppliers of microwave ovens, air conditioners and household appliances.\r\n", 'The company traces its roots to 1978 when it was founded as a feather product plant.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['John Liew is one of the founders of AQR, a private hedge fund firm based in Greenwich, Connecticut.', 'The firm focuses on traditional and alternative investment strategies and has $224 billion assets under management.', 'AQR operates globally with 900 employees and offices in London, Sydney and Hong Kong.', 'Before cofounding AQR, Liew worked at Goldman Sachs as a portfolio manager, where he developed and managed quantitative trading strategies.', "He created the Liew College Fellows Fund to finance undergraduates who have unpaid research opportunities with the University of Chicago's faculty."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Paul Little founded and chairs the Little Group, which has interests in property, investments, philanthropy, aviation and lifestyle. ', 'He ran logistics firm Toll Holdings for 26 years and then got a boost in his wealth when Japan Post bought Toll. ', "Now he's focused on Melbourne apartment developments through his Little Projects. ", 'He built a corporate jet base and is competing with Australian billionaire Lindsay Fox for customers.']
abouts: ['He is a former chairman of the Essendon Football Club. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Liu Fuhai chairs the Shandong Dahai Group, whose interests include textiles, energy and new materials.', 'Liu has interests beyond business: he is president of the Shandong Shanglian Calligraphy and Painting Academy.\r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Liu Jincheng chairs EVE Energy, a supplier of lithium batteries. ', 'Liu holds degrees from Wuhan University, South China University of Technology and the China Europe International Business School.\r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Liu Shaoxi chairs Guangdong Yihua Timber of China, a publicly traded furniture supplier. \r\n', 'Liu also controls publicly traded Yihua Real Estate which changed its name to Yihua Healthcare in February 2015.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Lu Weiding is the CEO of Wanxiang Group, one of China's largest diversified non-government businesses. \r\n", 'Lu Weiding is the son of Lu Guanqiu, who founded the predecessor of Wanxiang Group in 1969; Guanqiu died in 2017.', "Wanxiang has yet to disclose the distribution of Lu Guanqiu's assets among the beneficiaries of his will.", 'Lu Weiding chairs China Wanxiang, whose business includes insurance and fintech. \r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Duncan MacMillan cofounded financial data and media company Bloomberg LP in 1981 with Mike Bloomberg, Thomas Secunda and Charles Zegar.', 'MacMillan left a job at investment bank Salomon Brothers to help Bloomberg with what was then called Innovative Market Systems. ', "He is credited with designing many of Bloomberg LP's computer systems.", 'Bloomberg LP, where MacMillan still works in the engineering department, has revenues estimated at $9.6 billion and 19,000 global employees.']
abouts: ['An active philanthropist, MacMillan has signed the Giving Pledge, a promise to give at least half of his fortune to charitable causes. ', 'MacMillan served four years in the Marine Corps after graduating from high school. He graduated from Rutgers University in 1966. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['San Francisco Bay Area real estate broker George Marcus has been in the business for over 40 years. ', 'Most of his fortune lies in a 54% stake in Marcus & Millichap, the publicly-traded real estate brokerage he founded in 1971. ', 'Marcus & Millichap specializes in commercial real estate in the U.S. and Canada, closing nearly 9,000 transactions valued at $42.3 billion in 2016. ', 'Marcus also controls a 2.4% stake in Essex Property Trust, a REIT he founded that owns 59,000 apartments along the West Coast. ', 'Marcus also has a stake in several private real-estate and investment companies, including SummerHill Housing Group and Pacific Urban Residential. ']
abouts: ['He graduated with a B.A. in economics from San Francisco State University and served on the Board of Regents of the University of California from 2000 to 2012. ', 'Marcus was born on a Greek island, northeast of Athens, and immigrated to the United States when he was four with his poor parents.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Bernardo Matte Larrain inherited what is today Chile's largest pulp and paper producer, Empresas CMPC, from his father, Eliodoro Matte Ossa.", 'His siblings, Patricia Matte and Eliodoro Matte, also inherited a stake. ', 'They also own stakes in telecom, banking and shipping firms.', "Bernardo oversees the family's other assets, including its stake in financial firm Bicecorp, of which he is president, and electric utility Colbun.", 'In 2014, Bernardo left his position on the board of Colbun to focus on CMPC and Entel, a telecom company in which his family also holds an interest.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Eliodoro Matte inherited a stake in CMPC, a Chilean forestry and paper products company, from his father, Eliodoro Matte Ossa, who died in 2000.', "Until May 2011, Eliodoro was president of five of Grupo CMPC's holdings.", 'Despite having stepped down, he maintains leadership over Empresas CMPC, the primary holding company.', 'The siblings also have stakes in telecom, banking and shipping firms. ', 'Eliodoro served as president of conservative Chilean think tank Public Studies Center until 2015.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Mi Enhua is the president of Xinjiang Hualing Industry and Trade Group, which was established in 1988. \r\n', 'Mi attended the inauguration of Philippines President Rodrigo Duterte in June 2016.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Lowell Milken is the younger brother and the former right-hand man of former financier Michael Milken.', 'Mike Milken expanded the market for high-yield junk bonds while at investment bank Drexel Burnham Lambert in the 1980s. \r\n', 'Lowell is the chairman and partial owner of Heron International, a London-based real estate firm that develops, invests in and manages properties.', 'He cofounded education firm Knowledge Universe in the mid 1990s.', 'In 2015, Knowledge Universe sold its early childhood education business to private equity firm Partners Group for an undisclosed sum.\r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Nirmal Minda chairs $860 million (revenue) Minda industries, which makes a range of auto parts for cars and two-wheelers.', 'The business was started by his late father in 1958, initially to make electric parts for motorcycles.', 'Minda joined the family business in 1977 in the marketing division but eventually separated from his brother in 1996.', 'From one small workshop in Delhi, the company today has 58 factories worldwide.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Martin Naughton is the owner of Glen Dimplex, a manufacturer of consumer appliances like washing machines, hair dryers and space heaters.', 'As a student, Naughton spent months in hands-on aeronautical and mechanical engineering training.', 'He founded Glen Electric with a handful of people in 1973 and started off selling oil-filled radiators.', 'Four years later he acquired the much larger British heating company Dimplex, renaming it Glen Dimplex.', 'Naughton stepped down as president in April 2016 and his youngest son Fergal took over as CEO. ']
abouts: ['Naughton is a trustee emeritus at the University of Notre Dame where he funds a student exchange fellowship between the university and leading Irish universities. ', 'Naughton is the co-owner of Patrick Guilbaud, the only restaurant in Ireland with two Michelin stars.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Vadim Novinsky returns to the Forbes billionaires list after a four year hiatus. ', "With partner, Andrei Klyamko, Novinsky owns Ukraine's Smart Holding Group, which has a 24% stake in Rinat Akhmetov's iron ore producer Metinvest.", 'Novinsky started working in Ukraine in the mid-1990s with oil producer Lukoil and began buying Ukrainian metallurgy companies.', "He united his companies in 2006 into Smart Holding Group and in 2007, he exchanged them for a stake in Akhmetov's Metinvest. "]
abouts: ["The Russian native got his Ukrainian citizenship in 2012, and became member of parliament in ex-prime minister Yanukovich's Party of Regions.", 'His wife and four children are all Russian citizens and live in St. Petersburg, Russia.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Sergei Petrov is the founder and owner of Rolf Group of Companies, the biggest seller of foreign cars in Russia (Mitsubishi, Chrysler, Jeep, Ford). ', 'A former military pilot, Petrov was discharged from the army due to his participation in anti-soviet meetings.', 'In 1982 he started his civilian career as a mechanic. In the 1990s, he became a director of a car leasing joint venture called Rozek.']
abouts: ['He was the only Russian billionaire of 16 world leading businessmen including Richard Branson who signed a resolution for peace to the recent Russia-Ukraine conflict']

name: Billionaires
bios:
["Carolyn Rafaelian is America's richest jeweler thanks to her majority stake in bangle brand, Alex and Ani, which she founded in 2004.
", 'The Rhode Island-born founder and CEO has made a fortune by turning what women wear on their wrists into affinity statements.   
', 'Alex and Ani, named after her two older daughters, has over 100 company-owned locations.   
', 'Granddaughter of Armenian immigrants, her father made American flag pins and costume jewelry in a Rhode Island factory where she now makes pieces.', 'Rafaelian has bought up more than 30 properties, most of which are in her native Rhode Island including a castle and vineyard.
']
abouts: ["Rafaelian's a big believer in the power of positive energy. She has a priest and shaman bless her inventory before it goes on sale.\r\n", "Rafaelian owns Belcourt, a 56,000-square foot Gilded Age mansion in Newport, R.I. once inhabited by suffragist Alva Vanderbilt, which she's renovating as a museum.\r\n"]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Larry Rossy made his fortune one dollar at a time.', "Rossy inherited his father's 20-store discount retailer in 1973 and rebranded it as Dollarama in 1992.", "Now Canada's largest dollar store chain, he handed the reins to son Neil in 2016, after 43 years of running the company.", 'He sold 80% of the business to Bain Capital in 2004, netting more than $500 million after taxes, and took the company public in 2009.', 'Dollarama operates more than 1,000 stores in Canada and has implemented five new price points since 2009: $1.25, $1.50, $2.00, $2.50 and $3.00.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['With $720 in savings, Alice Schwartz and her husband David launched Bio-Rad Laboratories in a Berkeley Quonset hut in 1952.', 'Early products included ion exchange resins, which are substances used to facilitate pharmaceutical manufacturing and lab research.', 'Bio-Rad now sells 10,000 life science research and clinical diagnostics products. Revenues total $2 billion. ', 'Schwartz, who was widowed in 2012, remains on the board of Bio-Rad; her son Norman is chairman and CEO. ']
abouts: ['Schwartz studied biochemistry at UC Berkeley where she met her husband David. ', "Bio-Rad's products include screening kit for cancerous genetic mutations and an HIV test that analyzes antibodies and antigens for early virus detection. "]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Martin Selig is one of the biggest property developers in Seattle.', 'Selig owns more than 4 million square feet of office space across the city and has another at least one million under development.', 'He started his real estate business in 1958 by building shopping malls. ', 'One of his daughters is a film producer.']
abouts: ['Martin fled Nazi Germany with his family when he was age 3 and traveled through Poland, Russia and Korea until arriving by boat in Seattle. ', 'Martin is a painter and an art collector; he enjoys bicycling, riding his Harley motorcycle and skiing.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Sathien Sethhasit runs Carabao Group, maker of Thailand's hugely popular Carabao Dang energy drink. ", 'Sathien founded the company in 2002 with his folk singer pal Aed Carabao and took it public in 2014.', 'Aiming to become a global brand and win over Europeans, Carabao has sponsored English Premier League football club Chelsea.']
abouts: ['Carabao outsells Red Bull in Thailand with a 24% share of the energy drinks market.', 'Carabao is the title sponsor of the English Football League. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Evan Sharp is cofounder and chief creative officer of visual bookmarking site Pinterest. ', "Sharp met Ben Silbermann, Pinterest CEO and fellow cofounder, through a mutual friend while in Columbia University's architecture program. ", 'Each month, 175 million people use Pinterest to collect and post images related to fashion, travel, cooking and other interests. ', 'Pinterest raised $150 million in venture funding in June 2017, with investors valuing the company at $12.3 billion. ']
abouts: ['Sharp was an avid ultimate frisbee player during his time at the University of Chicago. ', 'Over the years, Sharp has collected rocks, coins, pencils, stickers and, as an architecture student, images, renderings and photographs. ']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Ravindra Kishore Sinha founded Security & Intelligence Services (SIS) in 1985 and built it into India's second-largest security services firm.\r\n", 'SIS gets more than half of its $716 million revenue from Australia.\r\n', "SIS has a joint venture with Spain's PROSEGUR to provide cash logistics services.", 'Sinha started his career as a journalist and covered the 1971 war between India and Pakistan.']
abouts: ['His war reporting experience gave him the idea of starting a business to hire retired servicemen. ', 'A member of the ruling Bharatiya Janata Party, Sinha was nominated in 2014 to the upper house of parliament.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Real estate billionaire Axel Stawski founded Stawski Partners in 1973. ', 'The company owns six office buildings and three condos in Manhattan.', "He is developing two luxury residential towers in Queens' Long Island City, his first developments in about a decade.", 'Stawski was born in post-war Germany to Jewish parents who both survived the Holocaust.', 'He immigrated to America in 1971 to attend New York University.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Diamond tycoon Beny Steinmetz is owner of BSGR, an embattled mining company with a presence in Guinea and Sierra Leone.', 'BSGR is under investigation in several countries, including the U.S. for violating the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act. The company denies the claims.', "In 2010, BSGR sold 51% of its mining rights in Guinea to Brazil's multinational Vale for $2.5 billion. As of 2016 it had only collected $500 million.", 'After determining that BSGR had obtained rights to Guinean iron mines illegally, in 2014 the Guinean government denied BSGR access to mines there. ', 'In April 2017, he sued billionaire George Soros for $10 billion, accusing Soros of perpetrating a smear campaign. Soros denies the allegations. ']
abouts: ['Born and raised in Israel, Steinmetz moved to Belgium in 1978 to start Steinmetz Diamond Group with his brother.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Dirk Stroeer is the son of Heinz W. Stroeer, who laid the foundation for Stroeer SE & Co. KGaA setting up billboards in Germany back in 1963.\r\n', "In 1990 Heinz joined forces with competitor Udo Mueller, now CEO of Stroeer SE, to create one of Germany's biggest out-of-home media providers.", " It went public in 2010. Dirk inherited a 50% stake from his father and is still the company's biggest shareholder, with more than 20%.", 'Headquartered in Cologne, Stroeer SE employs more than 4,500 people and generates annual revenue of over $1 billion.', "Dirk Stroeer is a member of the company's supervisory board."]
abouts: ['Stroeer is a managing partner at Media Ventures GmbH, a private venture capital company in Cologne.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Sun Shangchuan chairs Shenzhen Tat Fook Technology, an electronics components maker. \r\n', "Tat Fook's customers include Huawei, Ericsson, Alcatel-Lucent and Bosch. ", 'Sun is a part-time marketing professor at Renmin University.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Sam Tarascio owns a portfolio of real estate across Melbourne, including a business park, two distribution sites, a large shopping mall and a market.', 'Tarascio, who emigrated from Italy in the 1950s, also owns several inner-city apartment developments. ', 'He started out in property development in the 1960s by building a warehouse for German pharmaceutical company Hoechst, where he had worked in sales.', 'That led him to establish logistics and industrial-development business Salta Properties, now run by his son Sam. ']
abouts: [' Tarascio imported an olive press in 2014 for his Taralinga Estate on the Mornington Peninsula, near Melbourne.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Robert Toll is chairman on the board of Toll Brothers, a publicly-traded luxury homebuilder.', "He cofounded the firm with his younger brother Bruce in 1967. The company's first project was a new community of 171 homes in Chester County, PA.", ' Robert served as CEO of Toll Brothers until 2010; he is the largest individual shareholder in the company, with a 7% stake.', 'Though the company is based in Pennsylvania, the brothers live in Miami with their children (Robert has five kids, Bruce has four) and grandchildren.']
abouts: [' At 18, Toll was a counselor at Camp Powhatan in Maine. The organization is now known as Seeds of Peace, and brings Arabs and Israelis together for summer sessions.', "Robert's father was a multimillionaire investor who lost it all in the 1929 stock market crash. To support his family through the Depression he delivered laundry. "]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Low-profile tycoon Surin Upatkoon made his fortune across sectors ranging from telecom to gaming to insurance.', 'Majority of his fortune comes from the cash that he got after selling a 10% stake in Thai telecom company InTouch in 2013. ', 'A third of his wealth comes from stakes in listed gaming company Magnum Corp, textile firm MWE and insurance and property company MPHB Capital.', 'He started his career as a manager at MWE Weaving in 1971 and rose through the ranks. He came to Penang for school and stayed to work. ', 'His son Krian is on the board of the textile company while Ivevei (the older of his two daughters) is on the board of the financial services company.']
abouts: ['Upatkoon has been a Malaysia resident for more than half a century even though he is a Thai national.', 'He loves playing golf.']

name: Billionaires
title: Investor
bios: ['Alexander Vik comes from a wealthy family of fur merchants and has dabbled in everything from closed-end country funds to insurance and tech startups.', 'He remains locked in a contentious legal battle with Deutsche Bank, which in late 2013 obtained a $250 million judgment against his trading operation.', "Deutsche had sued the trading operation, based largely out of Vik's Connecticut home, over a margin call that went unpaid during the financial crisis.", "So far Vik is not paying and has appealed the London court's judgment.", "Meanwhile Deutsche has started legal proceedings in New York, Connecticut, Delaware and Oslo to investigate Vik's assets."]
abouts: ['A Norwegian who was raised in Sweden and schooled in the Canary Islands, Vik was a former golf champion at Harvard University.', 'During the first Internet bubble, Vik was behind Xcelera.com, one of the biggest dot.com boom and bust stocks of the era.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Peter-Alexander Wacker owns around 10% of chemical company Wacker Chemie AG, founded by his great-grandfather Alexander Wacker in 1914.', 'He worked for BMW for ten years before joining Wacker Chemie in 1993 as a member of the board, when it was still a privately owned company.', 'When Wacker went public in November 2005, Peter-Alexander became CEO. In 2008, he stepped down and became chairman of the supervisory board.', 'Wacker Chemie has an annual revenue of more than $6 billion and sells its products in over 100 countries.', 'In 2016, the company began producing polysilicon (used for solar cells and semiconductors) at a new facility in Bradley County, Tennessee.']
abouts: ['Peter-Alexander Wacker was named family business man of the year in Germany in 2006.', 'He collects elephant figures from around the world, as elephants symbolize strength to him. His holding company is named Blue Elephant.']

name: Billionaires
title: Entrepreneur
bios: ['Wang Jianyi is the founder and chairman of Futong Group, a supplier of fiber optic cable products.  ', 'Futong, founded in 1987, is headquartered in the eastern Chinese city of Hangzhou. ', "Futong's customers include China Mobile, China Unicom, and China Telecom. "]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Prem Watsa founded Toronto-based financial services firm Fairfax Financial Holdings in 1985 and remains its chairman and CEO.', "Born in Hyderabad, India, Watsa later joined his brother in Canada, and then enrolled in the University of Western Ontario's MBA program.", 'He paid his way through school by selling appliances door-to-door and, after a stint as an investment analyst, struck out on his own in 1984.', 'He began acquiring insurance companies, modeling his business after the success of his idol, Warren Buffett.', 'Fairfax now has property and casualty insurance and reinsurance interests across the world plus stakes in companies that include IBM and BlackBerry.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Sanford "Sandy" Weill spent decades in financial services, culminating with Travelers and Citicorp merging to form Citigroup in 1998.', "Weill's first job was a Bear Stearns runner in 1955, earning $150 a week. ", 'He formed a brokerage firm with partners, built it into Shearson Loeb Rhoads, and sold it to American Express for nearly $1 billion in 1981. ', 'Weill was CEO of Citigroup until 2003 and chairman until 2006.', ' He is still an active investor, president of the board of trustees at Carnegie Hall and on the executive council at UC San Francisco. ']
abouts: ['When Weill first got married, he and his wife lived with her parents.', "Weill's protege at Travelers and Citigroup was Jamie Dimon, who left in 2000 to be CEO of Bank One (now JP Morgan Chase). \r\n"]

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Wen Pengcheng chairs Guangdong Wen's Foodstuffs Group of China, which sells and breeds chicken. \r\n", 'More than 50,000  family farms work with Wen.\r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Wu Chung-Yi is the chairman of central Taiwan auto parts maker Fine Blanking.\r\n ', 'Most of his fortune comes from the 2007 sale of a stake he owned in Hong Kong-listed beverage and instant noodle maker Tingyi.', 'Also known as Tony.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Yang Jianxin chairs Global Top E-Commerce, a supplier of women's and men's pants, including jeans.", 'The company made an online push in 2015 by acquiring Globalegrow E-Commerce for $166 million.', 'Since 2015, GTE has invested in five other cross-border e-commerce businesses.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Yao Xinyi is chairman of DunAn Group which controls Zhejiang DunAn Artificial Environment and Anhui Jiangnan Chemical Industry. ', "In 1987, Yao started the predecessor company of DunAn Group -- a spring factory in China's Zhejiang Province."]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Zhao Xiaoqiang made his early money in garments in Zhejiang Province, a textile industry hub, before expanding into TV production and entertainment. \r\n', 'Meisheng Cultural, his main listed business, went public at the Shenzhen Stock Exchange in 2012 and employs 2,000 staff.\r\n']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Zhou Liangzhang chairs Hexing Electrical, a supplier of electrical equipment to power utilities.', 'Zhou worked in a state-owned business early in his career before founding Hexing. ', "Hexing's products are used in more than 80 countries around the world. \r\n"]

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Zhu Xingming co-founded and chairs Shenzhen Inovance Technology, a supplier of industrial automation control product.', 'Inovance went public at the Shenzhen Stock Exchange in 2010.', 'Zhu holds a graduate degree from Yanshan University.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ['Zhuo Jun took over 37.26% of Shenzhen Kinwong Electronics in November 2013 when her husband, Shen Jitang, passed away. ', 'Her brother, Zhuo Yong, was promoted from the CFO to vice chairman of the Shenzhen electronics manufacturing giant.', 'She was a clerk at Heung Yee Kuk, a statutory advisory body representing interests in the New Territories, Hong Kong, for 4 years after high school.']

name: Billionaires
bios: ["Olgun Zorlu, his father Zeki and his uncle Ahmet are the largest shareholders in one of Turkey's biggest conglomerates.", "Olgun's grandfather Haci Mehmet Zorlu laid the foundation for Zorlu Holding in 1953 by starting a business weaving bed sheets on a homemade loom.", 'In the 1960s, brothers Ahmet and Zeki grew the retail side of the business, initiated contract manufacturing and launched the home textiles brand TAC.', "Zorlu entered the energy business in 1993 to power its textile production, then diversified further and became Turkey's leading exporter.", 'It also operates in mining, real estate and consumer durables (Vestel-branded electronics and appliances, and the domestic Venus smart phone).']
abouts: ["Most of Olgun's managerial duties have been in Zorlu's textile and energy businesses.", "Zorlu Center -- comprising a hotel, shopping mall, residences and offices -- is situated in one of Istanbul's most valuable areas, Zincirlikuyu."]
